description: Fresh and fruity, this is full of red cherry flavors and crisp acidity. It has some age, hinting at a more toasty future. For the moment, it's at its best after eight years aging on the lees in the bottle.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2006 Vértice Pinot Noir (Douro)

description: Wood fermentation and aging have given this fine wine a strong, toasty character, complementing its natural perfume. It's rich, with layers of acidity, needing time to develop. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2015 Cerceal (Beira Atlantico)

description: Celebrating the Portuguese discovery of the spice route, this blend from different regions is smooth, rich and ripe. It has tannins that enhance the ripe black fruits and bring out the spicy edge to the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Sogrape 2014 Silk & Spice Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Celebrating the Portuguese discovery of the spice route, this blend from different regions is smooth, rich and ripe. It has tannins that enhance the ripe black fruits and bring out the spicy edge to the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Sogrape 2014 Silk & Spice Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A field blend from vines grown at 1290 feet, Aged in wood, the toast shows without masking the ripe yellow and pineapple fruits. Full-bodied and with rich fruitiness and acidity, the wine is now ready to drink.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Crooked Vines Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A field blend from vines grown at 1290 feet, Aged in wood, the toast shows without masking the ripe yellow and pineapple fruits. Full-bodied and with rich fruitiness and acidity, the wine is now ready to drink.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Crooked Vines Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This mature wine that has 50% Touriga Nacional in its blend, is firm and structured, with a smooth edge of wood aging that makes it very drinkable now. A black plum skin texture gives the wine extra concentration. Drink until 2025.
title: Seacampo 2011 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This rich wine has a firm structure as well as ripe fruit. Foot trodden in stone troughs. It has a generous Port-like texture that is balanced by the black currant acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Pacheca Superior Red (Douro)

description: This rich wine has a firm structure as well as ripe fruit. Foot trodden in stone troughs. It has a generous Port-like texture that is balanced by the black currant acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Pacheca Superior Red (Douro)

description: The grape that is more commonly found in the Douro shows itself in a finely structured wine that has layers of wood as well as black fruits. A dark chocolate flavor stands out. Wait until 2018 to drink this dense and complex wine.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Touriga Franca (Alentejano)

description: Vineyards on the western slopes of the Serra da Estrela, Portugal's highest mountain range, give this fine expression of the local star white grape. With a creamy texture, apricot and citrus fruits and a tangy lemon zest texture, this is a delicious, balanced wine, ready to drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2015 Somontes Encruzado (Dão)

description: Vineyards on the western slopes of the Serra da Estrela, Portugal's highest mountain range, give this fine expression of the local star white grape. With a creamy texture, apricot and citrus fruits and a tangy lemon zest texture, this is a delicious, balanced wine, ready to drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2015 Somontes Encruzado (Dão)

description: Old vines in a field blend give a rich structured wine that has dark tannins and powerful black fruits. It is firm, very concentrated with dense fruit as much as dense tannins. This wine could still age another few months, so drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Two classic Dão grapes, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz are blended in this powerful wine. It has dark tannins that still give dryness at the heart of the wine. Alongside that are the beautiful black fruits, dense structure and balanced acidity. The wine will be better from 2018 as the tannins soften further.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Dona Georgina Red (Dão)

description: This fruity wine boasts flavors of mango, pineapple and apricot. It is full and ripe, with bright fruitiness and ample acidity. Some wood aging adds an attractive toasty accent to this warm wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: With 35% Chardonnay in the blend and some wood aging, this is a ripe wine with its rich soft texture brightened by a cut of acidity. It is beautifully balanced, with great yellow and citrus fruit. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Catarina White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This crisp, clean and ripe wine is finely balanced. The toastiness from wood aging in new barrels is balanced with the rich citrus and sliced apple and a tight, mineral character. This is a full-bodied wine needing a few more months to age. Drink from 2018.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Rich and finely balanced, this wine combines spice notes with rich tannins and blackberry tones. While it is dense and complex, it is still young and needs time to age. Drink after 2015.
title: Campolargo 2010 Diga? Tinto Red (Bairrada)

description: A ripe and elegant wine, full of sweet fruits, laced with tannins. It has an attractive tar and plum set of flavors, firmly anchored in its central core of dryness.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2007 Reserva Red (Alenquer)

description: Full-bodied, spicy wine. It has a ripe, toast and apple flavor and a smooth texture, with light acidity. The wine is dry while also soft.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Bual is the grape that creates the medium-sweet style of Madeira, and this wine fits the bill perfectly. It is a great wine, with its honey, its citrus to balance, its dark, nutty flavors, its merest hint of sweetness. To finish, there is a long, ripe caramel taste, balanced with layers of acidity.
title: Cossart Gordon 1995 Colheita Bual (Madeira)

description: This is a ripe, tangy wine. Skin contact before and during fermentation gives an extra richness while also preserving the crisp creaminess of the grape. The extra aging has produced a ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Santiago 2014 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Both grapes in this blend have gathered the natural freshness of the region, close to the ocean. This crisp wine is tightly textured with a ripe yellow and white fruit flavor. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Part of a series that aims to express the character of a grape, this is a convincing interpretation of a fickle variety. It has red berry fruits, lit with acidity and with gentle tannins. Touches of spice from wood aging add interest without masking the fruit. Drink the wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Grand'Arte Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: This is a lightly textured wine with acidity and some firm tannins. It has a fruity character, red berry flavors and attractive acidity. The wine, balanced and generous, is ready to drink.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2013 São Matias Red (Dão)

description: This is a lightly textured wine with acidity and some firm tannins. It has a fruity character, red berry flavors and attractive acidity. The wine, balanced and generous, is ready to drink.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2013 São Matias Red (Dão)

description: Paxis is a warm, earthy wine, packed with ripe, soft and forward fruit. It does have a structure that could allow the wine to age, but there is no need as its fruitiness makes it ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Paxis Red (Alentejano)

description: A dry style of tawny, bringing out wood aging as well as rich mellow fruit. The wine has an old gold feel to it, with butter toffee, butterscotch and final acidity.
title: Croft NV Ten Year Old Aged Tawny  (Port)

description: Just touched by oak, this is a smooth and ripe wine. Tropical fruits, apricots and mango give it a rich character while the acidity holds it all together. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a soft ready-to-drink wine. It has light tannins, a mineral edge and stalky black-currant fruits. It is attractively accessible now.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Red (Douro)

description: This is a crisp, spicy wine with a touch of pepper as well as fruit. It is lively, bright, touched by both acidity and red currants. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Touriga Nacional Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a crisp, spicy wine with a touch of pepper as well as fruit. It is lively, bright, touched by both acidity and red currants. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Touriga Nacional Rosé (Tejo)

description: While the wine is young, it is made in a style that makes it very ready to drink. The tannins are so soft, with rounded black fruits just crispened by acidity. Drink now.
title: Tapada de Villar 2016 Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: As is often the case with 100% Touriga Nacional, the wine is one-dimensional. It has perfumed fruit and tannins, but seems to have a hollow core. That's why blending can be a good idea.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: A pale colored rosé, light and attractively crisp. Soft red fruits come through the gentle texture to give a wine that is ripe, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Lab Rosé (Lisboa)

description: The Moscatel in this blend is what gives this soft wine its perfumed character. It is fruity, bright and open with light acidity and a gentle texture. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Lab Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Douro white grape mix is joined by the Arinto in this attractive, soft wine. It is warm, fruity and with gentle acidity. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Casa de Cambres 2016 Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A soft and ripe wine with juicy Alicante Bouschet dominating the open fruity blend. It is immediately drinkable with just enough acidity to give the wine a crisp (although still rich) aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Coudel Mor Classico Red (Tejo)

description: A soft and ripe wine with juicy Alicante Bouschet dominating the open fruity blend. It is immediately drinkable with just enough acidity to give the wine a crisp (although still rich) aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Coudel Mor Classico Red (Tejo)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine is beautifully creamy as well as crisply fruity. It has a touch of spice and honey from the wood as well as fine acidity and citrus juiciness. It is a young wine, one that is ready to drink now but will be better as it rounds out from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Faloaria Vinhas Velhas Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine is beautifully creamy as well as crisply fruity. It has a touch of spice and honey from the wood as well as fine acidity and citrus juiciness. It is a young wine, one that is ready to drink now but will be better as it rounds out from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Faloaria Vinhas Velhas Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: With its green-fruit aromas and ripe citrus flavors, this is a wine that moves generously from cool and crisp to rich and full. Its citrus is balanced by white peach and green-plum flavors. The finish adds an orange-zest tang that is both refreshing and gives a tight texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Paços 2015 Casa de Capitão-mor Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Produced in Estremoz by the Serrano Mira family, this rich wine is dense with dark tannins and a powerful structure. This concentration is surrounded by bold ripe berry fruits and acidity that give the wine its richness aided by the wood aging. Drink this finely structured wine from late 2018.
title: Herdade das Servas 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced in Estremoz by the Serrano Mira family, this rich wine is dense with dark tannins and a powerful structure. This concentration is surrounded by bold ripe berry fruits and acidity that give the wine its richness aided by the wood aging. Drink this finely structured wine from late 2018.
title: Herdade das Servas 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A satisfying marriage between Chardonnay and Arinto has produced a rich wood-aged wine. With its spice, creamy texture and plentiful acidity, the wine is full and rich from lees aging in the barrel. This is a young wine, dry and crisp and worth aging. Drink from late 2018.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 Esperança Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: A satisfying marriage between Chardonnay and Arinto has produced a rich wood-aged wine. With its spice, creamy texture and plentiful acidity, the wine is full and rich from lees aging in the barrel. This is a young wine, dry and crisp and worth aging. Drink from late 2018.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 Esperança Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: From organically grown grapes, this rich wine has a smooth texture and balanced acidity. The producer specializes in Rhône-style wines and this rich blend, that includes Viognier and Marsanne, has fine yellow fruits as well as ripe plum and citrus flavors. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2016 Lybra Viognier-Arinto-Marsanne White (Lisboa)

description: This generous smooth wine is packed with ripe tannins and vibrant red fruits. There is the typical mineral texture of many Dão wines along with solid spice and dark chocolate flavors from wood aging. This is an impressive wine that deserves to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Opta 2014 Opta Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This generous smooth wine is packed with ripe tannins and vibrant red fruits. There is the typical mineral texture of many Dão wines along with solid spice and dark chocolate flavors from wood aging. This is an impressive wine that deserves to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Opta 2014 Opta Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This Port, still young to taste, is a dry style of LBV giving structure as much as fruit at this stage. It does have floral black fruits from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. It also has a firm core that will certainly soften. So although this wine can be drunk now, it will be so much better from 2019.
title: Offley 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a young fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and gentle tannins that are surrounded by the comfortable full-bodied texture. It's a wine to drink now.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte
title: Santos & Santos 2016 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a young fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and gentle tannins that are surrounded by the comfortable full-bodied texture. It's a wine to drink now.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte
title: Santos & Santos 2016 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Red (Alentejano)

description: This popular brand's white version is soft and smooth. There are some citrus flavors to give the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of the wine is more towards apricot and perfumed green plums. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: With no concession to fashionably pale rosés, this is a boldly colored wine. It has red-berry fruits, a soft caramel texture and crisp acidity to balance. Of course, it is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Aragonez-Syrah Rosé (Alentejano)

description: With no concession to fashionably pale rosés, this is a boldly colored wine. It has red-berry fruits, a soft caramel texture and crisp acidity to balance. Of course, it is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Aragonez-Syrah Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This simple fruity wine is perfumed and attractively fragrant. With a blend that includes the unusual Perrum grape (also known as Pedro Ximenez in the Sherry region of Spain), it is smooth, refreshingly creamy and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Ripe and smooth, with mature velvet texture, figs, milk chocolate and ripe plums. Hints of wood aging are there, but they blend easily with the rich fruit.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2005 Marquês de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A black, solid wine, spiced heavily with wood but still showing blackberry flavors, textured with plum skins. The wine feels warm and ripe, finishing with black cherries and lingering softness.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2006 Grand'Arte Trincadeira (Ribatejano)

description: Ripe lime aromas and a full richly fruity palate give a rounded character to this wine. Apricot juice and tangerine brighten up the palate, fitting well with the wood and fruit structure. Keep for another few months for the whole wine to fill out even more.
title: Muxagat 2008 Branco White (Douro)

description: Named after João Maria, born in 2004, this Cabernet/Syrah blend is a dark, solid wine, a powerhouse of new wood, dry tannins and a burst of juicy, black, intense fruits. It has a touch of pepper as well as perfumed, polished wood and final spice. Produced in half bottles and magnums.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2007 Peqeuno João Red (Alentejano)

description: Herbal aromas lead to a fresh, green and white fruit wine that sips easily with a definite herbaceous character. The wood aging adds a good nutmeg character, but it is the freshness that makes this wine so delicious. Age for another year.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2008 Conceito Branco White (Douro)

description: Fresh, ripe and fruity, this has bright acidity and a tangy, lemon and orange zest texture. Attractive strawberry flavors come along with a touch of vanilla. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Brazileiro Rosé (Dão)

description: Perfumed and lightly aromatic, this is a smooth and rounded wine. Touches of acidity freshen the apricot flavors, leaving a wine that's easy to drink and quite ready.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bastardô! White (Tejo)

description: This limited release wine is complex, dense and structured on the palate. It offers a lively contrast between perfumed black fruit and structured tannins, which should integrate well with further aging. Drink this serious wine from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Cabeça de Toiro Special Selection Red (Tejo)

description: Released after the 2011 vintage, this elegant wine has great presence. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, if offers vibrant, structured fruit while still reserving its full glory for several more years. Ripe fruits blend with intense acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Grande Reserva represents the very best selection from a vintage. This concentrated, dark wine has a brooding quality that shows both its quality and its aging ability. It is packed with plum and berry fruits that are still integrating with the solid tannins. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Grande Reserva represents the very best selection from a vintage. This concentrated, dark wine has a brooding quality that shows both its quality and its aging ability. It is packed with plum and berry fruits that are still integrating with the solid tannins. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a new wine from Vinha Paz. It is right up to the standards of the vineyard's reds: a beautifully perfumed, ripe wine that has Encruzado in the blend. Rich, full of yellow and spicy fruits, it is both structured, toasty and intense. Drinkable now.
title: Vinha Paz 2014 Colheita White (Dão)

description: This is a full, ripe wine. The rich red berry fruits contrast well with the crisp acidity and bright aftertaste. The wine is packed with fruit and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2015 Sagrado Rosé (Douro)

description: This wine comes from one of the grand aristocratic estates that line the eastern bank of the Tagus (Tejo) river. With ripe berry fruits, it shows signs of generous tannins as well as plenty of acidity. The wine is fruity, likely to age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from one of the grand aristocratic estates that line the eastern bank of the Tagus (Tejo) river. With ripe berry fruits, it shows signs of generous tannins as well as plenty of acidity. The wine is fruity, likely to age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: A ripe, soft wine that is packed with strawberry fruits. It is smooth with a creamy caramel texture that contrasts with the fruity acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: With some wood aging in French oak, the wine seems to have smoothed out the fruitiness. It is soft with a light spice and hints of green apple. The wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Scancio Branco Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: With some wood aging in French oak, the wine seems to have smoothed out the fruitiness. It is soft with a light spice and hints of green apple. The wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Scancio Branco Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine from the heart of the Alentejo. Perfumed, full of red berry flavored fruits and with a rich, soft texture, it is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Monte Alentejano Red (Alentejano)

description: This is soft and juicy with just a hint of a more tannic structure in the background. It is designed as an immediate easy-drinking wine, full of fruit and blackberry fruits.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Casa do Lago Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: This is soft and juicy with just a hint of a more tannic structure in the background. It is designed as an immediate easy-drinking wine, full of fruit and blackberry fruits.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Casa do Lago Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: This is a rich wine, full of rounded black fruits and soft tannins. It is a young style of wine with no wood aging, just the ripe fruits. Drink this wine now.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2014 Versátil Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A bright, lightly fizzy wine that is off dry and crisp. There are sweet apple and lime fruit flavors with a tang of mandarin orange. The wine is clean, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma White (Vinho Verde)

description: A bright, lightly fizzy wine that is off dry and crisp. There are sweet apple and lime fruit flavors with a tang of mandarin orange. The wine is clean, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma White (Vinho Verde)

description: The three castas (grapes) in the blend are Chardonnay, Arinto and Vital. It is a clean, fresh wine that is soft and round. The Chardonnay acidity lifts the two Portuguese grapes. This lightly textured wine is ready to drink now.
title: Fiuza 2015 3 Castas White (Tejo)

description: The heavy bottle is the giveaway here—it shouts important wine. It does live up to its billing, with black, brooding fruits and tannins, and a dense core of dusty tannins, brightened with acidity. There is a final firm and spicy aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2007 Passadouro Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A structured, finely balanced wine that has intense acidity, blackberry fruits and soft, well-integrated tannins. It is ripe while remaining fresh, stylish and poised. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Mural Red (Douro)

description: With ripe fruit and a light layer of tannins, this is a fruity wine, packed with red fruits and black cherry flavors. It has a dusty background that will allow it to age for a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Convento do Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is an attractively fruity, soft wine. Balanced between acidity and a lightly crisp texture, it has a touch of yeast although it's the fresh citrus fruit that dominates.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Monge Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine, full of citrus and white fruit flavors. Lemons and fresh grapefruit play with sliced apples and crisp Rocha pears to create a bright, lively wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Branco Fernão Pires (Lisboa)

description: This is a young-colored wine that has been wood aged to smooth out the natural fruitiness of the Merlot. That gives the wine a smoky character with juicy acidity balanced by wood and toast flavors. The black plum flavors are rich, full in the mouth with a dry underlay of tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Tinto Merlot (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh although ripe wine. It has an attractive floral aroma that shows also on the palate with the ripe yellow and white stone fruits. The acidity is well balanced to give a fresh, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Branco Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) give this wine a fine balance between structure and fruitiness. While the alcohol suggests power, in fact it's the freshness and attractive red berry fruits that dominate. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Arco do Esporão Red (Alentejo)

description: A soft and creamy wine, freshened with a little citrus. It has only light acidity, the main focus being pear and red apple flavors. It rolls easily around the palate, finishing freshly. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This wine is rich and packed with black fruits. The soft texture and ripe fruitiness mean the tannins will soon fully integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Mariana Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe, spicy wine with concentrated white and citrus fruits. It is richly textured and tangy, with an intense, crisp aftertaste. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Espaço Rural 2016 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This open, fruity wine is named after Cape Bojador in the western Sahara, which Portuguese sailors rounded in the 15th century on their way around Africa. The wine's red fruits and acidity are easy, ripe and with a juicy aftertaste.
title: Espaço Rural 2016 Bojador Red (Alentejano)

description: Passion-fruit aromas are mingled with a strongly perfumed character that comes from Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. It is ripe with some firm structure, powered with dark tannins as well as this hugely perfumed fruit. Drink from 2026.
title: Duorum 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: Six months in wood have changed the naturally crisp character of the Arinto grape for something altogether much richer. It offers spice as well as ripe red apples and peppered pears. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This smooth, rich wine exudes southern warmth. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet gives a ripe, dark-colored wine dominated by black fruits. Tannins and acidity provide happy support. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: Intensely crisp and perfumed, this is a green-fruit flavored wine. Its tangy character is reinforced by a mineral texture. The wine needs another six months, so drink from 2018.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 Private Collection Verdelho (Tejo)

description: This is a limited-production, food-friendly wine, spicy and slightly oxidative. That gives the wine character as well as a toasty edge that contributes to its complexity. Drink this wine now.
title: Campolargo 2015 Verdelho (Bairrada)

description: This is a limited-production, food-friendly wine, spicy and slightly oxidative. That gives the wine character as well as a toasty edge that contributes to its complexity. Drink this wine now.
title: Campolargo 2015 Verdelho (Bairrada)

description: A strongly wood-aged wine, it is packed with toast and vanilla, but has a hard time remembering the fruit. At the moment, the wine has weight, the lightest hints of ripe tropical flavors and acidity. It needs more aging to broaden out and allow the fruit to sing. Drink from 2016.
designation: Casa de Santar Condessa de Santar
title: Dão Sul 2011 Casa de Santar Condessa de Santar White (Dão)

description: This is a well-balanced blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Syrah. With its straight line in black fruits, dark tannins and lively acidity, it shows a fine structure and a good future. Touches of leather, chocolate and the wood aging all add interest. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: With aromas of wood aging, this is a tropical fruit and spice flavored wine. It displays a strong sense of texture and freshness. It is already showing richness as well as a good sense of style. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2012 Guadalupe Selection Branco Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: Smooth, rich, wood-aged Chardonnay dominates this ripe, complex blend. Soft and rounded, it provides the yellow fruit flavors and toastiness. The Arinto in the blend supplies the freshness. Together, they make wine a for aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: An awkward geranium aroma mars this firm and concentrated wine. It's dry and tannic, with a solid edge akin to black currant skin. The fruit is well hidden at this stage.
title: Quevedo 2010 Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine from vineyard close to the Atlantic coast is crisp, herbal and already refreshing. It has a touch of spice along with crisp lemon and warmer pear fruits. Tangy and juicy, it has a fresh, almost salty aftertaste. Drink from early 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: The color is a cross between violet and brick red. The nose is muddled, bordering on dull. The palate feel is on the heavy side. It seems a bit clumsy and chunky. The nutty, warm finish helps, but overall it lacks sophistication and its parts aren't in full unity.
title: Ferreira NV Dona Antonia Personal Reserve  (Port)

description: The color is a cross between violet and brick red. The nose is muddled, bordering on dull. The palate feel is on the heavy side. It seems a bit clumsy and chunky. The nutty, warm finish helps, but overall it lacks sophistication and its parts aren't in full unity.
title: Ferreira NV Dona Antonia Personal Reserve  (Port)

description: As the name suggests, only 10 barrels of this rich expression of Alvarinho were produced. It has crisp acidity, ripe apple and apricot flavors and just a hint of the wood. An ageworthy white that will be better from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Nostalgia 10 Barricas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This perfumed old-vine field blend is rich and stylish. It has weight without power, a fine combination of lively red fruit and firm tannins, and will age well for years. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Forgoing wood aging, this wine is attractively fruity and crisp. Ripe apple and pear flavors fill out its frame of lemon fruit and bright acidity. Pineapple and white peach notes complete the picture. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: With its intense acidity, refreshing citrus fruit and lime zest-like texture, this is a lively, bright and crisp wine. It's balanced with a firm backbone of acidity to keep everything brisk and delicious. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Encontro Q do E Blanco Bical (Bairrada)

description: Ripe, juicy and spicy, this is already surprisingly delicious considering its solid, dark structure. Black fruits burst out, along with a sweet-and-sour character from acidity and ripe fruit flavor. It is also a good wine for aging, so drink through 2022.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a finely perfumed wine that has plenty of juicy black currant flavors. Fresh initially, it then develops ripe tannins and a character that emphasizes fruit and a dense aftertaste. It is ready to drink, although because it is unfiltered it will also age well and can be drunk until 2020.
title: Fonseca 2009 Late Bottled Vintage Unfiltered  (Port)

description: The Warre's style is for unfiltered Late Bottled Vintages, which means they are can age in bottle. This wine, now released at 12 years is a case in point. In richness and in structure it is more like a fast aging Vintage Port. It is full of dark fruits, dense tannins and great concentration. A very fine wine, it is ready to drink.
title: Warre's 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: While the wine has considerable power and richness, it is the fresh character that's most noticeable. The firm tannins and dark structure are shot through with black currant acidity and fresh berry fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2012 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Concentrated and powerful, this wine comes from one of the grandest estates in the Douro, now owned by the Symington family. Full of rich fruit along with layers of firm tannins, it is solid, dark and will age well, giving an impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2014 Red (Douro)

description: This powerful ripe wine is full bodied and concentrated, with young tannins and rich berry fruits. It comes from a single vineyard high on the hill above the estate house. With its structure still intact, it will take time to develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2013 Monte Meão Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto offers lime and orange-peel fruitiness. It is smooth and rounded, with touches of caramel and vanilla to give extra richness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Bridão Clássico Branco White (Tejo)

description: This wine is soft and creamy, with the apricot flavor that is characteristic of Viognier. It is a ripe wine, although with a light and spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Senses Viognier (Alentejano)

description: A dry style of Vinho Verde, this is crisp and cool. Slight petillance adds a lift, brightening the citrus flavors and acidity. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Vital grape in the blend gives crisp acidity to this soft wine. Light and lively, it's packed with fruit and has a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Fiuza NV 3 Castas Nature Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This broad, soft wine has hints of spice as well as ripe apricot flavors. The texture is easy and attractive. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2016 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This producer is the only grower of Caladoc grapes in Portugal, and one of the few in the world. Blended here with Tinta Roriz, the grape gives a ripe, soft and perfumed wine. It has a generous character, all fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Aragonez, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp wine, full of raspberry fruits and a soft texture. It is attractive with its balance of acidity and fruit, and is very ready to drink.
title: Ciconia 2016 Ciconia Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This soft, medium-sweet wine comes from one of the oldest producers in the Vinho Verde region, established in 1790. The wine is fruity and crisp, with a light sparkle. Bright lemon acidity comes through strongly at the end.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: The red-juice grape Alicante Bouschet gives a fine performance here. It has produced a firm, structured wine with fine tannins as well as generous black fruit. It comes from a hot year in the region, producing great ripe, sweet fruit as well as intense acidity. The wine is just now ready to drink and will still mature further, at least until 2022.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)

description: A selection of the best parcels of Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is dense and powerful. The wood aging is still showing strongly among the concentrated tannins and firm structure. The fruit weight and the general richness of this impressive wine will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2013 2 Tintos Petit Verdot-Alicante Bouschet Red (Alentejano)

description: One of a series of four wines featuring the major red grapes of the Dão, this wine concentrates on the least familiar. The Jaen gives a tight, structured wine that is still firm after six years. Blackberry fruits and spice fill out the dry core and leave an impressive wine that is likely to live long. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Jaen (Dão)

description: On the stalky side, this is all red berry fruits, with just a touch of wood to underpin the wine's fruit-forward character. Screwcap.
title: Fiuza 2010 Native Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Full-bodied, rounded and soft wine. It has plenty of ripe plum and spice flavors along with an edge of toast. Attractive, juicy wine for drinking now.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Romeira Red (Alentejano)

description: Classic fresh, extremely tangy wine, all apple, citrus and crispness. It's lively, although also with some fruit richness. Drink now, with shellfish. Screwcap.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2010 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Juicy Castelão fruit propels this wine, giving spice, soft tannins and ripe red cherries. It is full, very accessible, its acidity adding an attractive edge of freshness. Drink now, or age a year.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Meia Pipa Red (Setubal)

description: Juicy Castelão fruit propels this wine, giving spice, soft tannins and ripe red cherries. It is full, very accessible, its acidity adding an attractive edge of freshness. Drink now, or age a year.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Meia Pipa Red (Setubal)

description: An easygoing ripe red, with the minerality of the Dão rounded into sweeter damson and red berry fruits. There's an attractive layer of acidity for freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 Aliança Particular Red (Dão)

description: Perfumed, floral wine, dominated by Moscatel grapes. The white fruits, pear and vivid acidity give the wine a fine, fruity balanced character.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 JP Azeitão Branco White (Setubal)

description: Perfumed, floral wine, dominated by Moscatel grapes. The white fruits, pear and vivid acidity give the wine a fine, fruity balanced character.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 JP Azeitão Branco White (Setubal)

description: Great swathes of black fruit, coffee and sweet tannins give this ripe and juicy wine plenty of character and attractiveness. For immediate drinking.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Periquita Reserva Red (Setubal)

description: Great swathes of black fruit, coffee and sweet tannins give this ripe and juicy wine plenty of character and attractiveness. For immediate drinking.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Periquita Reserva Red (Setubal)

description: The wine is crisp and as light as a feather. The fruitiness brings with it apple and pink grapefruit as well as warmer golden plums and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The wine is crisp and as light as a feather. The fruitiness brings with it apple and pink grapefruit as well as warmer golden plums and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The smooth flavors of Fernão Pires make this wine. They give a ripe character of whisked cream and apples. The wine is totally ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The smooth flavors of Fernão Pires make this wine. They give a ripe character of whisked cream and apples. The wine is totally ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Loureiro, two of the most emblematic grapes of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is crisp, attractively fruity and light and poised. Drink now.
title: Casa da Torre 2014 Sousa Lopes Unfiltered White (Vinho Verde)

description: A typical off-dry wine, lightly spritzy and with just enough acidity to balance. The fruit is the thing. The low alcohol makes it a fine summer wine. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Salsus White (Vinho Verde)

description: Finely tannic, this is a solid wine, full of dark fruit skins, dry, dense and impressive in structure. It shows every sign of aging potential, from its solid tannins to its tight, red berry fruits and black fig flavors.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: Cool and tight, this is a firmly tannic wine, showing its mineral, primal rock character. The structure is dry, solid, the fruit a layer of cranberry and black fig among all this firmness. It should age, but is ready now.
designation: Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo Red (Beira Interior)

description: Cool and tight, this is a firmly tannic wine, showing its mineral, primal rock character. The structure is dry, solid, the fruit a layer of cranberry and black fig among all this firmness. It should age, but is ready now.
designation: Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo Red (Beira Interior)

description: The partner to Aveleda's pure Touriga Nacional Follies, this is a finer wine, with its complexity of flavors coming from the blend. It has red berry and black plum fruit flavors, sweetened by dried prunes and held together by rich, dry tannins.
title: Aveleda 2005 Follies Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Bairrada)

description: Pisca vineyard is a recent purchase by Niepoort, although the company has bought fruit there for many years. This is a first as a single quinta wine, softer than the Niepoort vintage, immediately attractive, finely balanced. It has structure and sweet fruit.
title: Niepoort 2007 Pisca Vintage  (Port)

description: A brooding, powerful wine, concentrating perfumed fruit with black berry juice and dark tannins. It does have acidity to balance all the power and richness, but this is a big, solid wine with density of flavor.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Quinta de Pancas Reserva Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: Made by Niepoort for importer Broadbent Selections, this is a structured wine, showing dry tannins and density. The fruit is all there as well, offering fresh acidity, crushed raspberries and red plums. Alongside the ripeness, there is a dry core of tannin.
title: Broadbent 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: Made by Niepoort for importer Broadbent Selections, this is a structured wine, showing dry tannins and density. The fruit is all there as well, offering fresh acidity, crushed raspberries and red plums. Alongside the ripeness, there is a dry core of tannin.
title: Broadbent 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: The flagship white from Bacalhôa is a full-bodied blend of Fernão Pires and Chardonnay. There is both freshness and richness here, with a tight texture of lime zest and apple skins giving lively acidity. The finish is more tropical, with smooth creamy flavors.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2007 Catarina White (Terras do Sado)

description: The flagship white from Bacalhôa is a full-bodied blend of Fernão Pires and Chardonnay. There is both freshness and richness here, with a tight texture of lime zest and apple skins giving lively acidity. The finish is more tropical, with smooth creamy flavors.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2007 Catarina White (Terras do Sado)

description: This LBV could be aged. It has a real youthful feel, and its ripe black-fruit flavors are full of complex sweetness and edged with tannins. It has weight, richness and a generous mouthfeel.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2008 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A big, juicy wine with balancing acidity and bright red fruit flavors. This is full of freshness and fruit flavors, with only soft tannins to hold the flavors together.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 Vila Santa Trincadeira Trincadeira (Alentejano)

description: Almost a baby in Colheita Port terms, this is a bright, ripe and fruity wine. It does have some touches of wood aging although they are left behind by the honey and orange marmalade flavors that have a light sprinkling of ginger. Drink now.
title: Kopke 2003 Colheita White  (Port)

description: Almost a baby in Colheita Port terms, this is a bright, ripe and fruity wine. It does have some touches of wood aging although they are left behind by the honey and orange marmalade flavors that have a light sprinkling of ginger. Drink now.
title: Kopke 2003 Colheita White  (Port)

description: A ripe blend of Touriga Nacional and Castelão, the wine is balanced with considerable acidity from the Castelão and structure from the Touriga. It is only just beginning to mature while red berry and red currant fruit flavors still shine out. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Campolargo 2010 Termão Red (Bairrada)

description: Still with almost all its fruitiness intact, this is a red plum as well as sultana flavored. It's on the cusp between all fruit and older wood flavors, poised and balanced as a style of tawny that can be drunk either before or after a meal. Drink now.
title: Cálem 2000 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: Produced from a selection of old vines, the wine is structured and dense. It has powerful tannins that are integrated with the dark black fruits and mineral acidity. This is a serious, concentrated wine, solid with its firm structure and with a good future. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2012 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, smooth and ripe wine. It has plenty of lemon acidity that contrasts with the mineral texture and the melon and pear fruit flavors. The wine is full, refreshing and also likely to age for a few more months. Best to drink this wine from 2017.
title: Provam 2014 Contradição Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A fine and elegant wine, flavors of blackberry and spice to go with the bright acidity. It has a fine layer of dusty, dry tannins that flesh out the fruit, along with a great final swathe of fresh fruit.
title: Douro Family Estates 2006 Bajancas Red (Douro)

description: The Algarve, in Portugal's south, is less known for its wines than as a holiday destination. This wine, with its blend of the familiar varieties (also found elsewhere in the country), is structured with red-berry flavors and tannins. The smooth texture and balanced acidity show it is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Al-Ria Red (Algarve)

description: With a slight prickle on the tongue, this off-dry wine is crisp, fruity, packed with citrus and with fine acidity. It is zesty, tangy and a pleasure to drink with its bright flavors and texture. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an off-dry, crisp and fruity wine with lively acidity and an attractive prickle on the tongue. It's a bright wine, as light and bright as possible with citrus flavors bursting from the glass. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Toucas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, with an off-dry fruitiness and soft, raspberry flavors. It is light and crisp with just a touch of caramel. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a typical, fresh, off-dry Vinho Verde. It has citrus and apple flavors, a light, crisp prickle on the tongue and a candied aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2015 Anjos de Portugal White (Vinho Verde)

description: This crisp, lemon-scented wine has a light texture and the freshest fruit. It comes with apricot and apple flavors. It is lively and bright and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 White (Tejo)

description: This light wine has crisp raspberry fruits, and lively acidity. It is all fruit with only the lightest texture and very ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft wine with its ripe fruits and lightly tropical flavors right at the fore. It has some richness along with spice, a citrus tang and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Terraços do Tejo Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a soft wine with its ripe fruits and lightly tropical flavors right at the fore. It has some richness along with spice, a citrus tang and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Terraços do Tejo Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a wide-ranging blend of local grapes which is lemon scented, fresh and light. It has pineapple and apricots as well as the cut of citrus. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Versátil Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a wide-ranging blend of local grapes which is lemon scented, fresh and light. It has pineapple and apricots as well as the cut of citrus. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Versátil Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This offeing is a clean, fruity wine with pear and white peach flavors. It is soft, lightly tangy with orange zest and attractively ready to drink.
designation: Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada Branco
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2015 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Bairrada)

description: Lab (or Labrador Retriever) is the preferred dog of the Santos Lima family. The wine is fresh, citrus flavored and crisply attractive. Acidity, lemon zest and green apples keep the wine really fresh. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Lab (or Labrador Retriever) is the preferred dog of the Santos Lima family. The wine is fresh, citrus flavored and crisply attractive. Acidity, lemon zest and green apples keep the wine really fresh. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This one is a typical, off-dry Vinho Verde with a light prickle and the crispest fruit. The wine is very light, very bright and clean with attractive acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2015 Vinhas Altas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This one is a typical, off-dry Vinho Verde with a light prickle and the crispest fruit. The wine is very light, very bright and clean with attractive acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2015 Vinhas Altas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This very ripe interpretation of Touriga Nacional brings out a dark black-plum flavor, which hides the grape's natural tannins. It is chunky, with powerful, forward fruit.
title: Terra d'Alter 2010 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This very ripe interpretation of Touriga Nacional brings out a dark black-plum flavor, which hides the grape's natural tannins. It is chunky, with powerful, forward fruit.
title: Terra d'Alter 2010 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Named for the air currents that allow birds to float above the Douro, this wine is ripe, full and soft. The wood shows quite strongly at this stage, and another year's aging will bring out the black currant note further.
title: Symington Family Estates 2010 Altano Red (Douro)

description: Very ripe and rich, this has a smooth, oily texture, with a perfumed fruit character and just a hint of acidity. The wine feels fat and is not for aging.
title: Granadeiro 2011 Tapada do Barão Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very ripe and rich, this has a smooth, oily texture, with a perfumed fruit character and just a hint of acidity. The wine feels fat and is not for aging.
title: Granadeiro 2011 Tapada do Barão Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Red fruits are what drive this easy, fragrant wine. The tannins play a supporting role, which gives the berry flavors structure. A blend from two Douro estates, this attractive selection will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2010 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: Red fruits are what drive this easy, fragrant wine. The tannins play a supporting role, which gives the berry flavors structure. A blend from two Douro estates, this attractive selection will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2010 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: This has flavors that are reminiscent of the Moscatels from Setúbal. It's a rich wine that shows a hint of the spirit element, but the ripe flavors of toffee and raisin ice cream are more prominent. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho NV Sellium Moscatel (Portugal)

description: The wine has acidity and a rustic flavor that gives character. With a lemon streak, it is a fruity, juicy wine, always with an earthy aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Sobreiró de Cima 2012 Santa Valha Fresh White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: The wine is very dry and hard edged. It has an extracted, tough structure that seems to miss out on fruit. As it develops, it's likely to remain dry.
title: Messias 2011 Messias Selection Red (Douro)

description: Still very young, this wine is full of acidity, lemon flavors and with a candy shop character. The wine needs to time to settle down.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 White (Tejo)

description: Aromatic with white flowers, it's rounded, soft and gentle. It misses out on acidity, giving the wine a fat feel. Drink now.
title: Monte Largo 2013 White (Tejo)

description: Lightly spicy, this is a soft, off-dry wine. Fresh citrus and apple fruit flavors are perfumed and fruity in the mouth. Not for any aging, it's already a rounded, soft, still fruity wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The wine displays plenty of the warmth of Alentejo while keeping a streak of fresh black currant fruitiness. It's soft, generous and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Vega Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine displays plenty of the warmth of Alentejo while keeping a streak of fresh black currant fruitiness. It's soft, generous and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Vega Red (Alentejano)

description: Spicy and fruity, this soft-edged wine has delicious, warm blackberry jelly flavors that are lightly touched by tannins and acidity. An easy wine, ready to drink now.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2011 Murta Red (Lisboa)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Arinto is bright and herbaceous. There is also a more tropical character with pineapple and mango adding their riper notes. The end has a mineral edge. The wine will improve by holding until 2015 in bottle.
title: Casal do Conde 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This rich, full-bodied wine has some acidity, although the palate is dominated by creamy yellow fruits and a yeasty character at the end.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Maria Mora White (Alentejano)

description: High in acidity, this wine seems unbalanced. The fruit is distinct from the structure, leaving crispness contrasted with firm tannins.
title: Félix Rocha 2012 Quinta de São Cristóvão Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is firm with acidity and spice in tandem. It has a juicy character, although the acidity seems unbalanced with the rest of the wine.
title: Julia Kemper Wines 2010 Julia Kemper Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: A soft and easy white wine that has a lightly perfumed touch from the Moscatel in the blend. Acidity cuts the pear and peach flavors to give a fresh lift at the end.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita White White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A tight and textured wine that has layers of citrus as well as fresh apples. A bitter edge of sulphur spoils this otherwise lightly fruity wine.
title: Ideal Drinks 2013 Royal Palmeira Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A tight and textured wine that has layers of citrus as well as fresh apples. A bitter edge of sulphur spoils this otherwise lightly fruity wine.
title: Ideal Drinks 2013 Royal Palmeira Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: With a dominance of Chardonnay (70%), this is a smooth and creamy wine. It is ripe, lightly citrus with stronger apricot flavors and a smoky character. The aging on the wine's lees has given it extra richness. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Reserva Chardonnay-Arinto White (Lisboa)

description: Named after the convent of Tomar, a home to the medieval Knights Templar (now a national monument), this is a ripe structured wine that benefits from the Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional in the blend. Full and rich and with the ability to age, the wine is serious and full of fruit. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 Convento Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is now mature with firm tannins and spicy wood and fruit flavors. The edge of Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional in the blend has given the wine its shape and concentration. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This bone-dry wine made from 85% Arinto has crisp freshness and texture. It's lively with a strong mousse and lemon and green apple fruitiness. Sophisticated and wearing its bottle age well, it finishes with a toasty aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Marquês de Marialva Extra Bruto Cuvée
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2011 Marquês de Marialva Extra Bruto Cuvée Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This elegant, structured wine has layers of intense acidity surmounted by firm tannins and red currant fruit. It's a real food wine, that acidity ready for rich meats. It's also likely to age well. Drink now and until 2024.
title: Vadio Wines 2012 Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: This elegant, structured wine has layers of intense acidity surmounted by firm tannins and red currant fruit. It's a real food wine, that acidity ready for rich meats. It's also likely to age well. Drink now and until 2024.
title: Vadio Wines 2012 Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: This dense, black-colored wine throws great weight around. It's firmly concentrated, with stylish elegance from perfectly ripe black-currant fruits. Dark and lush, it finishes with soft acidity. It could benefit from several years aging, so drink from 2017.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This is a solid and dark wine, full of black fruits and dense tannins. It has weight and richness, as well as a leather and smoke character that comes from the wood aging. A powerful wine for aging, drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2011 Estate Collection Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of northern and southern Portuguese grapes, this is a seriously firm wine that's structured and dense. Spiced black plums are layered with big, drying tannins and acidity, which promise long aging for this impressive wine. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Francos Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This juicy, fruity wine also brings a firm structure to bear. It is rich, friendly and ready to drink soon. Keep for a few months for the tannins to fill out.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 Periquita Original Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A popular brand in Portugal, Monte Velho is an easy, fresh and fragrant wine. It has a touch of almonds with rounded apple and spiced pear flavors. It's a wine to drink now, very fruity and ready to go.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2012 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of classic Douro white grapes, this is a perfumed, textured wine. Still young, it shows green fruits, sliced apples and a lemon-zest aftertaste. With all its acidity, the wine needs to calm down a little, so drink from late 2017.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe White (Douro)

description: A blend of classic Douro white grapes, this is a perfumed, textured wine. Still young, it shows green fruits, sliced apples and a lemon-zest aftertaste. With all its acidity, the wine needs to calm down a little, so drink from late 2017.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe White (Douro)

description: Full of tannins and with the potential of ripe fruit, this wine is young, concentrated and powerful. The alcohol does show as a burn of pepper at the end, spoiling an otherwise well-balanced wine. Produced from a 200-acre vineyard in the Douro Superior, the wine should be ready from 2019.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2014 Passagem Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, rich and smooth, this wine has structure under the generous, opulent black fruits that will allow it to age further. But with its succulent character laced with acidity, it is surprisingly ready to drink for such a young wine.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2013 Madalena Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, rich and smooth, this wine has structure under the generous, opulent black fruits that will allow it to age further. But with its succulent character laced with acidity, it is surprisingly ready to drink for such a young wine.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2013 Madalena Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: A fine, ripe wine, fully structured with its tannins supported by delicious red fruits. It has concentration and a generous feel to it, showing warmth as well as a strong line in acidity. The wine finishes with spice, fruit, and tannins in the background.
title: Casaleiro 2012 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Castelão-Trincadeira Red (Tejo)

description: An unusual blend of Semillon, Alvarinho and Sauvignon Blanc, all aimed at keeping freshness in the warm climate of Setúbal. This ripe, smooth wine is deliciously cut with acidity to give a lightly wood-aged wine that could age for another 2–3 years.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Quinta da Bacalhôa Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Like wines from many vineyards that look across the Minho river to Spain, this Alvarinho is typically rich, deliciously ripe with pear and peach flavors, and brisk with a streak of acidity. The wine is textured, ripe and perfumed. Keep for six months at least.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2012 QM Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Perfumed wine, initially soft, then showing some mineral character to go with the spice and acidity. That puts it on the dry side, with a smoky character coming through the juicy fruit. For aging.
title: W. & J. Graham's 2008 Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage  (Port)

description: Rich, rounded, smooth, with cocoa and espresso flavors giving a touch of bitterness. It is a wine with power that is still young. Impressive, with its broad black fruits. Keep for 4–5 years.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2007 Private Collection Red (Alentejano)

description: Fruity, big, ripe wine, its tannins enveloped in the ripe forward fruit. There is sweetness here from black figs and berries, while red berries give acidity. Will it age? Yes, there are tannins to put it on the long road.
title: Fonseca 2008 Quinta do Panascal Vintage  (Port)

description: Fruity, big, ripe wine, its tannins enveloped in the ripe forward fruit. There is sweetness here from black figs and berries, while red berries give acidity. Will it age? Yes, there are tannins to put it on the long road.
title: Fonseca 2008 Quinta do Panascal Vintage  (Port)

description: In Latin, “Amantis” means a lover. The Quinta do Carmo estate was given by a king of Portugal to his lover, Dona Maria. This hugely tannic wine has impressive, rich fruits based around Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Touriga Nacional.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2006 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Toffee sweetness on the nose introduces a rich wine with plenty of sweet flavors. Intense in its structured character, solid, this is a wine with good potential.
title: Churchill's 2008 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)

description: Created to celebrate the 500th anniversary of the birth of Saint Theresa of Avila, this wine made from a special selection of fruit. Richly structured, it displays great style as well as intensity. Black fruits are beautifully integrated into the ripe body of the wine, backed by acidity and with tannins and wood-aging flavors in the background. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Santa Teresa d'Avila Homenagem Red (Tejo)

description: Created to celebrate the 500th anniversary of the birth of Saint Theresa of Avila, this wine made from a special selection of fruit. Richly structured, it displays great style as well as intensity. Black fruits are beautifully integrated into the ripe body of the wine, backed by acidity and with tannins and wood-aging flavors in the background. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Santa Teresa d'Avila Homenagem Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is concentrated and structured. With dark tannins and bitter-chocolate flavors, it is dense with a ripe texture as well as big black fruits. It comes from a vineyard selection, yielding a powerful wine that needs another year to be ready. Wait until 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: If you haven't tried Portuguese wines before, this impressively rich wine is a good place to start. Aging for three years, with 12 months in wood, gives it a smooth, ripe black-fruit character. The acidity and the fruit are a seamless part of the texture of the tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: If you haven't tried Portuguese wines before, this impressively rich wine is a good place to start. Aging for three years, with 12 months in wood, gives it a smooth, ripe black-fruit character. The acidity and the fruit are a seamless part of the texture of the tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A straw-colored wine, this was aged in wood and is full of spice as well as fruit. Centered on Antão Vaz and Verdelho, it has acidity, apricot and citrus flavors and good acidity. Beautifully structured, it's rich while still firm and restrained. Drink from 2018.
title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rubrica Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Aged in wood for up to 14 months, this wine is rich and smooth. Produced from low-yielding old vines, it's a field blend of many different varieties. It is ripe with layers of black currant and spice flavors along with acidity. The wine has weight but remains stylish. Drink from 2018.
designation: Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: With its highly perfumed character, this wine is intense with ripe tannins and delicious acidity. It almost needs to hold back on its ebullient aromas and fruitiness to balance out. The tannic structure could help, with a dry aftertaste that hints at the fruit to come. Drink from 2026.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: This tastes much younger than 10 years, showing freshness, with white fruit flavors. It's unbalanced, with the spirit showing rather than any maturity.
title: Quinta Santa Eufemia NV 10 Anos White  (Port)

description: Smooth-textured Port, with sweet red fruits under the brown sugar, nut and spirit flavors. This is certainly on the sweet side, with a velvet feel to it.
title: Poças NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: Initially this seems to be a delicious, mature wine, relatively dry but happily flavored with honey and spice. But there is a curious candy shop perfume that spoils the aftertaste.
title: Borges NV White  (Port)

description: The reserve version of this wine has extra richness and concentration. Solid tannins are filled out with ripe juicy blackberry fruits and perfumed acidity. The wine is concentrated and could age for a few more months. Drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, raisin- and perfumed black fruit-flavored wine shows dusty tannin character as well as intriguingly old-fashioned leather and high acidity. In a traditional mold, this works deliciously, making it a fine food wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2004 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the follies that were built in past centuries on the Aveleda estate, this range of wines brings together some intriguing combinations. This ripe, full wine has acidity, white pear and spice and a smooth texture.
title: Aveleda 2006 Follies Chardonnay Maria Gomes White (Bairrada)

description: Pinot Noir and Portugal don't normally go together, but DFJ seem to have made a specialty of growing this variety in the cooler Estremadura region. This has more Portuguese than Burgundian character, with its spice, juicy red berry and dried fruits, finishing with blackberry and acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2006 Grand' Arte Pinot Noir (Estremadura)

description: A dark, brooding style of tannic Douro wine. It is lean initially, with a strong mineral character and firm black plum-skin flavors plus leather and tight acidity. When it opens out, this becomes a great value from the Douro.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Vega Red (Douro)

description: From a vineyard situated in a forested area of northern Tejo comes this is a structured version of Merlot. It is ripe and rich with black fruits, as well as dark tannins and firm concentration. It could benefit from further aging, so drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Merlot (Tejo)

description: Situated close to the picturesque hilltop town of Obidos, this quinta has produced a ripe full-bodied wine. With bold red fruits, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins, the wine is both generous and fruity. It will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)

description: This is in transtion. When young, it was impressive for its rich fruit and texture, but now it's showing hints of green bean on the nose and a lener, more compact profile. Give it another few years to see if it turns around.
title: Ramos-Pinto 1997 Duas Quintas Reserva Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine that is great as an apéritif. With yellow fruits that are cut with acidity, it is a fresh, bright wine that is ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a rustic, soft wine. It has red fruits and acidity along with light tannins and a barnyard character that is not unpleasant. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: This is a rustic, soft wine. It has red fruits and acidity along with light tannins and a barnyard character that is not unpleasant. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: A fresh, off-dry wine with a year's aging is unusual for a Vinho Verde in this style. The result is that although the wine has lost some of its startling fruit and acidity, it has smoothed out, giving more room for the apple flavors. Drink now.
title: Vidigal 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an aromatic, lightly sweet wine. It has ripe strawberry fruits that have just enough acidity to keep the wine crisp. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2015 Vinhas Altas Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Named “new world” to recognize Portugal's great contribution to discovery, the wine itself is more traditional. It is a ripe blend of local varieties, fully integrated with black currant fruits and just a hint of a dry core of tannins. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2014 Novo Mondo Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is a cool, light wine. It has stalky black fruits and tannins that come from the fruit skins. It is a wine to drink almost as an apéritif: light and fruity at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Coreto Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is gentle and soft with red berry fruits and some (possibly not enough) acidity. It's rounded and smooth, touched by caramel from short wood aging. Drink now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2012 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada Red (Bairrada)

description: Named after a local aristocrat, this wine is soft, fruity and fresh. Red berry fruits are light and crisp. Behind them, gentle tannins give a hint of structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2014 Visconde de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: The wine is dark and dense although with a sense of freshness provided by the blackberry fruit. There are spices from the wood aging and firm dry tannins. It is a concentrated wine that will be better to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Winemaker Mario Pinheiro lived in South Africa and grew to appreciate Chenin Blanc. Returning to Portugal, he planted a vineyard. This wine is full of the most intense and beautiful fruit and acidity. It has a great tangy character that is balanced with apple and sweet pear fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2015 Connections Chenin Blanc (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Dark in color, the wine has plenty of tangy tawny character. It is ripe, full and rich with caramel and spice flavors as well as acidity that is finely balanced. This is an attractive wine, ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Noval NV Noval Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: Aged for six months in wood, this is a rich rosé. The wood aging shows in a toasty edge, although the wine is just as much about crisp red fruits. It has a tight texture and structure, a mineral edge and citrus fresh aftertaste.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 MR Premium Rosé (Alentejano)

description: From the producer's own vineyards in the Douro, this is a rich wine with plenty of firm tannins and a strongly mineral character. It has juicy red fruits that are balanced by acidity. The structure and dense tannins promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Domini Red (Douro)

description: From the producer's own vineyards in the Douro, this is a rich wine with plenty of firm tannins and a strongly mineral character. It has juicy red fruits that are balanced by acidity. The structure and dense tannins promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, impressive, age-worthy wine. With firm tannins and sumptuous juicy black fruits, it shows no sign of its high alcohol. It blends structure and fruit easily. The wine is named to celebrate the second Lança generation in charge at the estate. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Named CH (the initials for Switzerland) in honor of the Swiss origins of owner Alice Tavares da Silva, this wine is made from old vines. The wine has concentration and generous tannins that are as bold as the black fruits. It is still very young, still with its young licorice flavors. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 CH by Chocapalha Red (Lisboa)

description: The rarely found red Moscatel grape has produced a beautiful golden-colored wine that is very much in the tradition of fortified Muscats from Setúbal. This has ripe orange and rich dried fig that are balanced by fine acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2006 Domingos Soares Franco Private Collection Moscatel Roxo (Península de Setúbal)

description: This 100% Syrah Duriense regional wine comes from a vineyard in the Douro Superior. It has dark tannins and the same mineral structure as a Douro wine made from Portuguese grapes. Black fruits are contrasted with immense acidity and tannins. The wine is still young, and will be best from 2018.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2013 Superior Syrah (Duriense)

description: They say red Vinho Verde is an acquired taste, and with its very tight tannins and acidity, this wine fits the billing. Think of it with sardines or fatty meats.
title: Campelo 2009 Tinto Red (Vinho Verde)

description: Get past the pharmacy aromas and this is a pleasant, if rather fat, wine. It has some pear juice flavors along with a final light acidity.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Cister da Ribeira Branco White (Douro)

description: Get past the pharmacy aromas and this is a pleasant, if rather fat, wine. It has some pear juice flavors along with a final light acidity.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Cister da Ribeira Branco White (Douro)

description: An attractive strawberry-flavored wine with light sweetness and a caramel edge. Acidity keeps it lively in a fine apéritif style.
title: Borges 2008 Lello Rosé Rosé (Douro)

description: Crushed strawberry aromas, followed by flavors that are fresh, sweet and a palate that has the delicious prickle of a young wine. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2009 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Crushed strawberry aromas, followed by flavors that are fresh, sweet and a palate that has the delicious prickle of a young wine. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2009 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A broad wine, but with flavors of ripe melon, kiwi and an edge of lime. It is rounded and warm, although with a good final crisp edge of acidity.
title: Poças 2010 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A broad wine, but with flavors of ripe melon, kiwi and an edge of lime. It is rounded and warm, although with a good final crisp edge of acidity.
title: Poças 2010 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A soft, open wine, with flavors of wood aging to go with the sweet caramel and red fruit tastes. The wine has just a hint of tannin to hold it all together.
title: Kopke NV Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: A soft, open wine, with flavors of wood aging to go with the sweet caramel and red fruit tastes. The wine has just a hint of tannin to hold it all together.
title: Kopke NV Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: From a small sub-region of Lisboa, this stylish, structured wine is firm and tannic. It has plenty of ripe berry fruit to balance the tannins as well as acidity that cuts through the richness of the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: This blend of the two classic grapes of Vinho Verde, Loureiro and Alvarinho, is packed with fruit. Apples, lemons and a touch of ripe pear just fill the palate. It is a dry wine, refreshing and crisp with a mineral aftertaste.
title: Aveleda 2015 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)
