description: This is a fruity, immediately drinkable wine. It has red berry flavors and bright acidity that gives the wine freshness and a light, juicy touch. Light tannins add structure to the bright aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Foz 2013 Vinha da Foz Red (Douro)

description: Named after the entry to the luxury Calçada hotel in Amarante in southern Vinho Verde, this fragrant, fresh and fruity wine is just off dry. It has a good balance of fruit, tangy texture and acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2014 Portal da Calçada White (Vinho Verde)

description: This fruity wine has crisp acidity and lemon flavors. It is tangy, zesty and lightly perfumed from the Verdelho in the blend. The Sauvignon Blanc adds its own tropical fruit note. Drink the wine now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2016 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is the entry-level red from this family-owned estate. It is soft and juicy with some attractive red-berry fruits. The tannins are really gentle just giving a structure to the warm fruits and acidity. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Chaminé Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is the producer's most popular wine in Portugal. A touch of oak aging adds spice to the easygoing tannin and red-berry fruit flavors. It's easy to drink and ready now.
title: Borges 2015 Meia Encosta Red (Dão)

description: This is the producer's most popular wine in Portugal. A touch of oak aging adds spice to the easygoing tannin and red-berry fruit flavors. It's easy to drink and ready now.
title: Borges 2015 Meia Encosta Red (Dão)

description: The perfume of the Moscatel in this wine lingers satisfactorily, adding an exotic feel to what is otherwise a bright fruity wine. It is delicious to drink now as an apéritif.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 JP Azeitão Moscatel Graudo-Fernão Pires White (Península de Setúbal)

description: The perfume of the Moscatel in this wine lingers satisfactorily, adding an exotic feel to what is otherwise a bright fruity wine. It is delicious to drink now as an apéritif.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 JP Azeitão Moscatel Graudo-Fernão Pires White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A crisp blend of Fernão Pires, Arinto and some herbal Sauvignon Blanc, this light and fruity wine is tangy, zingy and packed with lemon and ripe pear flavors. Its acidity shines through to produce a wine that is bright and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro White (Tejo)

description: An impressive single varietal wine, this shows notes of spice, black currant and wood, along with dark tannins and a firm, dry core. With its acidity and tannins, this will likely age over several years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2009 Touriga Franca (Douro)

description: This is deeply colored and rich, showing both the juicy fruit character of Alicante Bouschet and a more serious, concentrated element. It's solid and densely tannic, with wood flavors layered on its black plum fruit. This is worth aging for another two years.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: Cortes de Cima was one of the earliest producers of Syrah in Alentejo. The style is full of ripe fruit, structure and a fine juiciness. Touches of spice are a reminder of the natural flavors of the grape. With its tannins, it will age and can be drunk now– 2018.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Rich, dense and full of black fruits, this wine conveys a dusty tannic character as well as mint, spice and blackberry fruitiness. Eight months of wood aging softened the structure and deepened the density of the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Premium Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: Made from a field blend, this Port is rich and packed with fruit. The tannins and juicy black plums are balanced by prune, spice and a hint of wood aging. Drink this wine from now and until 2022.
title: Duorum 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Full of dark tannins, this has bold black fruits, with acidity to balance. The wine is impressive with its weight, concentration, dense texture and spicy aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe Red (Douro)

description: Full of dark tannins, this has bold black fruits, with acidity to balance. The wine is impressive with its weight, concentration, dense texture and spicy aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, perfumed wine is an opulent blend of Touriga Nacional with smaller proportions of Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro. It is juicy, ripe, concentrated and dense, with abundant black fruits. This harmonious wine could age a little longer and will be at its best from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Ribeiro Santo Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Spicy and perfumed, this has a rich yellow-fruit flavor that's contrasted with a crisp pink-grapefruit edge. It's rounded and smooth, with a taut, herbal burst on the finish.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Portal Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: With structured and ripe dark-berry fruits, this is a warm wine that has a good mineral edge. Fine tannins give a sense of shape to the rich fruit flavors. Drink now or age for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2010 Red (Douro)

description: Rich and soft, this has a creamy smooth texture, with notes of toast, ripe apple and quince. There is a good touch of acidity to this attractive, ready to drink wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2011 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: A sweet, raisin-flavored vintage Port with a hugely dark color. Despite the attractive fruit, the wine lacks real intensity of structure. True, there are firm tannins but they are not anchored to the fruit, which misses concentration.
title: Barros 2005 Vintage  (Port)

description: A rich wine that is made by the Abreu Callado charity foundation. It has dark black currant fruits, big tannins and an elegant feel. With its structure, minerality and ripe, juicy fruitiness, it is finely structured and ageworthy. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Abreu Callado Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich, sophisticated wood-aged wine has complex fruits, structure and tannins. Ripe, juicy black fruits are intertwined with a solidly dry texture, powerful but still elegant. It will repay aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Monte da Baía Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: With a significant proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a solid, tannic wine. It is also rich, complex and fruity. Fermentation in open lagares gives extra fruitiness, soft extract and great acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2011 Mythos Red (Tejo)

description: With a significant proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a solid, tannic wine. It is also rich, complex and fruity. Fermentation in open lagares gives extra fruitiness, soft extract and great acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2011 Mythos Red (Tejo)

description: At this stage, this wine is dominated by wood. The black fruits underneath will take their time to bring together a wine that will show great perfumes, flavors of mushroom and truffles, and a dense texture. The aftertaste already has some of the right juicy acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Ciconia Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Tannins give a dark, mineral structure. The black fruits, slowly coming through, are still part of this serious purpose, with wood flavors and dry fruits prominent. It still needs aging, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Dão Sul 2009 Casa de Santar Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A very rounded, wood-aged wine, this is rich and admittedly delicious, although the wood smothers the fruit. It has hints of ripe yellow fruits, a touch of quince and a fine line of citrus to finish it off. Give it until 2015 for the wood to balance out.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Olho de Mocho Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine fully expresses the ripe fruit that comes from the Alentejo plains. It is dense with concentrated tannins and powerful black fruits. With its licorice, toast and powerful fruitiness, it needs some more aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2010 Poento Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine fully expresses the ripe fruit that comes from the Alentejo plains. It is dense with concentrated tannins and powerful black fruits. With its licorice, toast and powerful fruitiness, it needs some more aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2010 Poento Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is undeniably rich, but it wears its richness easily, allowing the fruitiness to show through. With hints of wood aging, spice as well as peach and ripe apricot fruits, it is full of potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade das Servas 2012 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: The magnificent Tomar convent complex was once home to the Knights Templar. This wine, with its firm tannins and dense fruit, brings out the structure of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Spice, wood aging and rich berry fruits all promise medium-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2011 Convento do Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A touch of wood aging brings spice and vanilla to this ripe, citrus and pineapple flavored wine. Very fruity, and with sophistication from the toast flavors, it finishes with almonds and the freshest acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2013 Vale de Lobos Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: A touch of wood aging brings spice and vanilla to this ripe, citrus and pineapple flavored wine. Very fruity, and with sophistication from the toast flavors, it finishes with almonds and the freshest acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2013 Vale de Lobos Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: Auru is a play on the word Ouro, gold, from the Rio Douro, or river of gold. The wine is only made in the best years. It is a complete wine, with its spice and wood character just one element in the mix of sweet fruits, tight tannins and layers of acidity. It could well age over the next 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Auru Red (Douro)

description: Inky black in color, this is the top wine from Apegadas, a big, chunky wine that is characterized by dark tannins, bold berry fruits, sweet plums, but also a serious, more austere character to allow it to age. The final fruit is richly juicy. Age 3–4 years.
title: Apegadas Quinta Velha 2007 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Earthy yet fruity, this second wine from Romaneira is delicately textured, full of red fruit and soft tannins, and ready to drink. There's a fine flourish of acidity on the finish.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Sino da Romaneira Red (Douro)

description: This cool, crisp wine shows its bright character right from the go. Very fruity, fresh, clean and with a fine aromatic character, it's a wine to drink now or age a year. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Espirito Branco White (Tejo)

description: Very young, herbal wine, it has a surprising green element to its otherwise ripe, succulent fruit. It's very juicy, fruity, layered with a hard set of tannins, a tight acidity. A year or two should help soften this firm wine.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Quinta da Viçosa T.C. Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Alentejano)

description: It's obvious there has been some oak aging here, because the wine is packed with spiciness and toast. That rather diminishes the fruit. Made to be drunk young, it may miss the target.
title: Ribafreixo 2014 Barrancôa Red (Alentejano)

description: While the wine is dry, there is a fruitiness to it coupled with a caramel flavor that certainly makes it seem sweeter. With a crisp aftertaste, the raspberry flavored wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A candy-pink-colored wine, this is crisp, fruity and off dry. There is a touch of caramel that fills out the otherwise acidic and red-currant-flavored palate. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: With its light prickle, this crisp strawberry-flavored wine is medium sweet but with acidity to balance. It's easy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Padeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a simple fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits, giving it a light and bright character. The wine is rounded and smooth, with an attractive lift of acidity at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Coreto Rosé (Lisboa)

description: The wine is full of the taste of superripe fruit. That gives a juicy character as well as the softest tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Sanguinhal 2014 Peninsula de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is full of the taste of superripe fruit. That gives a juicy character as well as the softest tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Sanguinhal 2014 Peninsula de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: An off-dry lightly fizzy Vinho Verde, this is crisp, clean and fruity. With its citrus kick, it needs to be drunk this summer.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Anjos de Portugal White (Vinho Verde)

description: An off-dry lightly fizzy Vinho Verde, this is crisp, clean and fruity. With its citrus kick, it needs to be drunk this summer.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Anjos de Portugal White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine feels lean, the fruit fading behind the bare bones of a wine. The tannins show through dry and solid, and the finish has attractive acidity.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2009 Terras d'El Rei Red (Alentejano)

description: This sweet and ripe tawny is touched by flavors of raisin, rich red fruit and spice. It has a smooth, toffee texture that's attractively leavened with acidity. Like all tawny Ports, it is ready to drink.
title: Barão de Vilar NV PV Tawny Port Collections  (Port)

description: This sweet and ripe tawny is touched by flavors of raisin, rich red fruit and spice. It has a smooth, toffee texture that's attractively leavened with acidity. Like all tawny Ports, it is ready to drink.
title: Barão de Vilar NV PV Tawny Port Collections  (Port)

description: Ripe, soft fruits give this wine a rich and open character. It is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, with added complexity from black plum, spice and herb.
title: Terra d'Alter 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: There is an attractive floral and fragrant quality about this wine, along with a light herbaceousness. It is light, though with a good intensity of fruit and a tang of citrus. For drinking now or over the next 2–3 years.
title: Symington Family Estates 2011 Altano Branco White (Douro)

description: There is an attractive floral and fragrant quality about this wine, along with a light herbaceousness. It is light, though with a good intensity of fruit and a tang of citrus. For drinking now or over the next 2–3 years.
title: Symington Family Estates 2011 Altano Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Shiraz and Touriga Nacional, this pink-colored selection is bright, crisp and full of red fruit flavors. It is soft and a touch sweet, though it finishes with crisp acidity. Screwcap.
title: Falua 2011 Tagus Creek Rosé (Tejo)

description: This wine is very soft, rounded and gentle. A touch of light pepper accompanies melon and creamed pear flavors. It's a good apéritif wine and it can be paired with amuse-bouche.
title: Borges 2011 Meia Encosta White (Dão)

description: With touches of wood and spice, this is round, soft and ready to drink. It has a core of red fruit flavor and an attractive touch of cool-climate acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Tâmara Red (Tejo)

description: This lively, fruity wine has fine acidity that's smoothed by creamy pear and green plum flavors. There is a touch of sweetness—perhaps some residual sugar—from grapes that were harvested when very ripe. Drink over the next few months.
title: Monte da Penha 2011 Montefino Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This fruity selection has light fizz and soft, gently sweet flavors of citrus and grapefruit. With its crisp apple edge, this makes for a great apéritif.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Xadrez White (Vinho Verde)

description: This was a Vintage Port year for many producers and the quality of the year shines through in this rich, still-young wine. It is solid with tannins that are brightened by red plum and bitter cherry; the solid structure promises potential. It will age a few years in bottle, so will drink at its best from 2016.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a full, ripe and rounded wine, with spice and red berry fruits. Its flavor has little connection with Pinot Noir, but it is certainly a rich wine with plenty of structure and an earthy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campolargo 2009 Pinot Noir (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A blend of Malvasia Fina and the great local grape Encruzado, this rich, wood-aged wine is perfumed and offers great fruitiness. Citrus and green plum fruits mingle with pineapple. The texture and the light toast give weight and add another dimension. The wine can be drunk now, but will be better from 2015.
title: Pedra Cancela 2012 White (Dão)

description: The style may be sweet and rich, but this mature tawny also delivers all the right old gold and wood-aged flavors. It does taste a young 20 years, having retained fruitiness and a round structure, a fine moment between youth and age.
title: Barros NV 20-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: An old gold-colored wine, this presents a dry, more aged view of 10-Year-Old tawny than usual. The result is a strong sense of spirit without losing the old wood flavors and the reminder of fruitiness. It's balanced and delicious. The sons of founder Mário Braga now run the quinta and farms nearby producing both Port and dry red wines. This is a private blend for Schlossadler Imports in California.
title: Quinta do Mourão NV 10-Years-Old Tawny Unreported  (Port)

description: This wine is structured and dense, benefiting from two years in oak to offer a balanced, round palate that's rich in spice and black fruit tones. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Escada Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: This finely wood-aged wine is rich and packed with ripe toast and generous fruit flavors. Its balanced combination of intense acidity, tangy citrus and apple flavors are supported by the spice from the wood aging. It is a generous wine, still young and best from 2016.
title: Vinha Paz 2015 Reserva White (Dão)

description: A structured blend of a selection of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is perfumed, ripe and firm. It has a dark core and rich, exuberant black fruits. With a few more months aging, this will develop further into a generous, smooth wine. Drink from late 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Entre Nós Red (Lisboa)

description: A structured blend of a selection of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is perfumed, ripe and firm. It has a dark core and rich, exuberant black fruits. With a few more months aging, this will develop further into a generous, smooth wine. Drink from late 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Entre Nós Red (Lisboa)

description: As a partner to the red wine from this estate, with its Bordeaux blend, this wine brings together the Bordeaux white grapes of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. The addition of Alvarinho rather spoils the Bordeaux moment, although for the wine it it's a plus, adding crisp taste and brightness to this rich wood-aged blend. Drink this tropical, fruity and pear-flavored wine from 2018.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Quinta da Bacalhôa Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Juicy Alicante Bouschet shines in this smooth, rich wine. Dark tannins are cushioned by the ripe berry fruits and opulent texture. Wood-aging has given extra richness to this powerful and complex wine that needs time. Drink from 2017.
title: Luis Duarte 2012 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is ripe, with some firm tannins and a dense structure. It is full of red-berry and spice flavors that are underscored by the dry tannins. Drink this balanced wine now.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Atlântico Red (Alentejano)

description: This comes from one of the new waves of wines from Alentejo that are fermented in clay amphoras. A fruity wine with lots of acidity and gentle tannins, it's ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Amphora Vinho de Talha Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the crickets whose sound is heard in the Dão region in summer, this soft wine has a ripe texture and generous black fruits. Its acidity is balanced to give the wine weight. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Grilos Red (Dão)

description: This well-structured, ripe wine has spice, as well as juicy black-currant fruits. With a crisp edge as well as a mineral character, the wine should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Santos & Seixo 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine is still young. It has plenty of bright fruits and a smooth texture from the dominant Chardonnay in the blend. A mineral edge to the apple and peach fruits shows along with crisp acidity at the end. It will become a rich, smooth wine as it ages. Drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This wood-aged wine is still young. It has plenty of bright fruits and a smooth texture from the dominant Chardonnay in the blend. A mineral edge to the apple and peach fruits shows along with crisp acidity at the end. It will become a rich, smooth wine as it ages. Drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a perfumed wine, attractive with floral aromas and generous black fruits. It has plenty of tannins as well as concentration, and looks set for a rich, structured future. Drink from 2018.
title: Maritávora 2014 4 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From vineyards in the eastern Douro Superior region, this perfumed white is soft, smooth and finely balanced. The acidity is just right, giving the rich pear fruit a crisp edge and refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Verdelho (Douro)

description: This is a fully structured, Alicante Bouschet-dominated wine from the Redondo region in the heart of Alentejo. Its juicy black fruit is firmly anchored by tannins and acidity. Concentrated and still likely to age, it will be best from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade da Pimenta Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fully structured, Alicante Bouschet-dominated wine from the Redondo region in the heart of Alentejo. Its juicy black fruit is firmly anchored by tannins and acidity. Concentrated and still likely to age, it will be best from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade da Pimenta Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Castelão and Touriga Nacional is well balanced. Spice from wood aging for nine months mingles with the ripe black-currant fruits. A firm wine with rich fruitiness, it's ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This blend of Castelão and Touriga Nacional is well balanced. Spice from wood aging for nine months mingles with the ripe black-currant fruits. A firm wine with rich fruitiness, it's ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Aged in barrel for 12 months, this is a rich wine. Supple tannins are integrated with the spice, toast and the black-currant fruit that are typical of the Baga grape. It is developing well, with its ripe fruits and crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca Reserva Baga (Bairrada)

description: This is a sumptuous wine from Viosinho, a grape winemakers almost gave up on due to low yields. With its lees stirred for 18 months, the wine has intensity and a lightly oxidative character. Now maturing well, its citrus fruit is becoming almost toasty, certainly nutty. Great acidity keeps this rich wine full of crispness. Drink now.
designation: Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines
title: Casca Wines 2013 Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines White (Douro)

description: This is a sumptuous wine from Viosinho, a grape winemakers almost gave up on due to low yields. With its lees stirred for 18 months, the wine has intensity and a lightly oxidative character. Now maturing well, its citrus fruit is becoming almost toasty, certainly nutty. Great acidity keeps this rich wine full of crispness. Drink now.
designation: Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines
title: Casca Wines 2013 Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines White (Douro)

description: Aged for three months on its lees in small clay amphoras, this wine has a juicy, fruity character. The red fruits and crisp acidity are impressive and fascinating. Its texture and tannins suggest further aging, so drink from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Aged for three months on its lees in small clay amphoras, this wine has a juicy, fruity character. The red fruits and crisp acidity are impressive and fascinating. Its texture and tannins suggest further aging, so drink from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Pale gold in color, this was made in clay amphoras, giving a dry wine but one that has a honeyed edge. It is aromatic, ripe, and spicy, with an herbal character as well as good finishing acidity. Drink this limited-production wine from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Branco
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Branco Arinto (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and textured, this is a juicy, black-fruit-flavored wine. Power behind the fruit gives firmness and concentration. Acidity and berry fruits contrast with pepper and a bitter edge that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Segredos de São Miguel Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This powerful wine has big ideas, as indicated by the weight of the bottle. The wine itself is dense, showing some signs of extraction that give a dry and firm aspect to the wine. A juicy, black-plum aftertaste adds lift.
title: Cartuxa 2013 Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This wine comes from vineyards high on the hill above Pinhão, in the heart of the Douro vineyards. With solid tannins and dark fruits, it is still developing. Powerful and ripe, it shows its wood aging in the spice and toast flavors. It needs to wait a little, so drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Baton Casal de Loivos Red (Douro)

description: This wine comes from vineyards high on the hill above Pinhão, in the heart of the Douro vineyards. With solid tannins and dark fruits, it is still developing. Powerful and ripe, it shows its wood aging in the spice and toast flavors. It needs to wait a little, so drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Baton Casal de Loivos Red (Douro)

description: Sweet citrus-flavored wine, with a good intensity of flavor from the ripe Malvasia grapes. There's a delicious perfumed character, pineapple and tangerine. The acidity is a fine part of this rich wine.
title: Rozes 2005 Terras do Grifo Selected Harvest Malvasia Fina (Douro)

description: Sweet citrus-flavored wine, with a good intensity of flavor from the ripe Malvasia grapes. There's a delicious perfumed character, pineapple and tangerine. The acidity is a fine part of this rich wine.
title: Rozes 2005 Terras do Grifo Selected Harvest Malvasia Fina (Douro)

description: Ripe, smooth, velvet textured wine, layering dark chocolate, black plum skins, dense tannins and a big, solid structure. It tastes powerful from the ripe tannins and big fruit, finishing with fresh acidity.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2003 Quinta do Cardo Special Selection Touriga Nacional (Beira Interior)

description: This is all about rich, tarry red fruit flavors, layered with some dense fruit tannins. It's a warm wine from a hot place, concentrated and full. With flavors of superripe black fruits, this could be aged, but is definitely ready to drink now.
title: Poças 2004 Novus Red (Douro)

description: Soft and rich, this is powerful stuff. The texture is velvety smooth, the dark tannins very much second fiddle to the superripe fruit. Raisins and red fruits bring in some acidity, but even this fruit flavor is almost sweet in its richness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2005 Falcoaria Reserva Red (Ribatejo)

description: Soft and rich, this is powerful stuff. The texture is velvety smooth, the dark tannins very much second fiddle to the superripe fruit. Raisins and red fruits bring in some acidity, but even this fruit flavor is almost sweet in its richness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2005 Falcoaria Reserva Red (Ribatejo)

description: Delicious, attractive perfumed wine with sweet plum fruits edged with more stalky black currants. It has some weight and richness to go with the firmer tannins. The wine is rich and well balanced.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo NV Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: Delicious, attractive perfumed wine with sweet plum fruits edged with more stalky black currants. It has some weight and richness to go with the firmer tannins. The wine is rich and well balanced.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo NV Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: This ripe and juicy wine holds good acidity and tannins that give it a dry core. Already balanced, it's fruity with black currants and plenty of spice. Along with its structure, it has plenty more to give in the future. The name comes from the number of barrels used for the wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Poeira 2013 39 Barricas Red (Douro)

description: Creamy apple and pear flavors give this wine a bright, while full-bodied style. Wood tastes and taut acidity combine easily with the fruit. Drink now.
title: Burmester 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This beautifully perfumed wine has all the tannins that will allow it to age over many decades. It also offers the rich blackberry, dark plum and great structure that will support that aging. As so often, Noval has released a vintage when other major producers have held back. But this powerful wine fully justifies the decision. Drink from 2025 for the fruit, 2030 for the complexity.
title: Quinta do Noval 2014 Vintage  (Port)

description: Nacional Vintage Port comes from a small parcel of ungrafted vines on a series of terraces at the Noval estate. It is a legendary wine, produced only occasionally. This wine is still impressively young and shows that it will age for decades. With its dark black fruits and succulent tannins, it is powerful and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2021 and for many years.
title: Quinta do Noval 2001 Nacional Vintage  (Port)

description: Nacional Vintage Port comes from a small parcel of ungrafted vines on a series of terraces at the Noval estate. It is a legendary wine, produced only occasionally. This wine is still impressively young and shows that it will age for decades. With its dark black fruits and succulent tannins, it is powerful and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2021 and for many years.
title: Quinta do Noval 2001 Nacional Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a rare dessert wine from the Vinho Verde region. It's packed with flavors of currant, lemon honey and orange peel. With its great sense of acidity, it is both sweet and deliciously refreshing.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2010 Ameal S.H. White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A powerful—possibly too powerful—wine that pushes forward with its superconcentrated black-fruit flavors. It fills the palate with richness and juiciness; this is a wine for lovers of blockbusters.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2008 Vertice Grand Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A solid, chunky wine whose tannins are still dominant. It has ripe black fruit flavors and a hint ofspice from wood aging. This is a wine that will develop well over the next 3–5 years.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2010 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: An elegant wine that slides easily over the palate. Its red berry flavors have a firm edge that stiffens the initial softness. Its tannins and acidity make this a serious, food-friendly wine that could age.
title: Alente 2009 Trincadeira-Aragonez Red (Alentejo)

description: This youthful, soft wine has juicy acidity and a green, herbal character. It offers red berry fruits and enough crispness to cut through any steak. It's not for aging.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Meet & Meat Red (Tejo)

description: A smooth and rounded blend of Trincadeira and Aragonez, this is rich, soft and full in the mouth. Red berry fruits dominate this wood-aged wine, allowing spice and acidity to give a generous aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Alente 2013 Red (Alentejo)

description: This vineyard, characterized by its cypress trees (aciprestes), is north facing across the Douro river. This attractive wine is ripe and balanced with smoky tannins and generous red fruits. Dense and with touches of spice, it will be ready from 2017.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta dos Aciprestes Red (Douro)

description: This vineyard, characterized by its cypress trees (aciprestes), is north facing across the Douro river. This attractive wine is ripe and balanced with smoky tannins and generous red fruits. Dense and with touches of spice, it will be ready from 2017.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta dos Aciprestes Red (Douro)

description: Disgorged in 2014, this pale rosé wine definitely has bottle age. You can taste it in the toasty character and in the acidity that has matured along with the wine. It is fresh rather than ripe—a wine that is now very ready to drink.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2006 Vértice Bruto Pinot Noir (Douro)

description: This fruity, soft wine is ready to drink. With apple and pear flavors, just the right amount of crisp acidity and a bright aftertaste, it's made for this summer.
title: Moura Basto 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This fruity, soft wine is ready to drink. With apple and pear flavors, just the right amount of crisp acidity and a bright aftertaste, it's made for this summer.
title: Moura Basto 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This is a fine, simple wine for this summer. With acidity, fresh apple and pear flavors, it's attractive and aromatic.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Dona Helena Colheita White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Full and round, this is a ripe blackberry-flavored wine. It has a touch of licorice, followed by juicy fruitiness and some acidity. The aftertaste, with its flavors of wood aging, suggests it could mature through 2015.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Full and round, this is a ripe blackberry-flavored wine. It has a touch of licorice, followed by juicy fruitiness and some acidity. The aftertaste, with its flavors of wood aging, suggests it could mature through 2015.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Burned wood aromas reveal the smoky nature of this wine. Wood aging and a bitter chocolate character dominate. There is a question as to whether it can soften. Wait until 2017 at least.
title: Casal do Conde 2011 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Burned wood aromas reveal the smoky nature of this wine. Wood aging and a bitter chocolate character dominate. There is a question as to whether it can soften. Wait until 2017 at least.
title: Casal do Conde 2011 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: An aromatic and fruity wine with bright lemon and apple flavors. Light and fresh, it needs to let its fruitiness calm down. Wait until the end of 2014.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This is a rich, very rich wine that is packed with tropical fruits, generous apricot and peach flavors and spice. It is full in the mouth, showing some pepper from the alcohol that spoils the otherwise fruity character. The aftertaste does introduce some freshness.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Antão Vaz (Lisboa)

description: From a high-altitude vineyard in the heart of the Douro, this is a fruity while well textured wine. With a strong mineral character that comes from the lees stirring during fermentation, it has both bright citrus fruits with acidity and a more tropical character. Drink now.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Tom de Baton Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an open juicy and fruity wine. It has soft tannins and perfumed acidity that is already integrated into the structure of the wine. With blackberry and red plum flavors, it is easy and generous, ready to drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 José de Sousa Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a firmly structured wine, solidly tannic and still developing. Big black-fruit flavors have set their mark on the texture while the dry core brings out the schist soil of the Douro vineyards, giving a tough sensation that needs to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Borges 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A 10 month stint in oak has given this rich wine a seriously spicy character supported by dark chocolate and black fruit flavors. Syrah, Castelão and Cabernet Sauvignon give this young wine tannins and a dark texture that needs to soften. Drink after 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 JP Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Firm and dense, this is a fine example of the Baga grape. It gives both juicy blackberry and red berry notes, with a solid layer of firm tannins. It has the power, the structure and the acidity to see sometime in the cellar. Drink after 2016.
title: Campolargo 2011 Baga (Bairrada)

description: Firm and dense, this is a fine example of the Baga grape. It gives both juicy blackberry and red berry notes, with a solid layer of firm tannins. It has the power, the structure and the acidity to see sometime in the cellar. Drink after 2016.
title: Campolargo 2011 Baga (Bairrada)

description: Using Ripanço, an old technique of destemming the grapes after harvest with wooden rods, the wine has intense color and a smooth, rich character. It is rounded and soft, with a light layer of tannins offering backbone to the generous fruitiness. Drink after 2015.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Ripanço Private Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: The sweetest of the Madeira single-variety wines, this Bual is still laced with intense acidity. That brightness is contrasted by the toffee and caramel flavors, yielding a wine that is superrich while remaining so fresh at the end. This fine wine is ready to drink.
title: Blandy's 2002 Colheita Bual (Madeira)

description: The sweetest of the Madeira single-variety wines, this Bual is still laced with intense acidity. That brightness is contrasted by the toffee and caramel flavors, yielding a wine that is superrich while remaining so fresh at the end. This fine wine is ready to drink.
title: Blandy's 2002 Colheita Bual (Madeira)

description: This soft, almost tasteless wine just hints at caramel and red fruits. It lacks character.
title: Wine with Spirit 2012 Bastardô! Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a light, fruity and off-dry wine. It has splashes of lemon and sweet citrus, with a crisp finish.
title: Mapreco 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a light, fruity and off-dry wine. It has splashes of lemon and sweet citrus, with a crisp finish.
title: Mapreco 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Spice notes from wood aging gives this wine a rounded character. Ripe berry fruits show strongly so drink soon while its fruitiness lasts. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Spice notes from wood aging gives this wine a rounded character. Ripe berry fruits show strongly so drink soon while its fruitiness lasts. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Fragrant and fruity, this is a bright, crisp and clean wine that's totally ready to drink. Lively, with a cool feeling like the nearby ocean's breezes, it finishes with light acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a fruity, wood-aged wine, showing spice and coffee flavors that complement ripe blackberry fruit. It's smooth in texture and has just the right touch of acidity. The wine is ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Fiuza 2012 Native Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Almost black in color, this is a hugely dense, dark wine. It brings out the tannic side of the grape with hints of black coffee and dark chocolate. Under all this concentration, there is some fruit that is still waiting to get out: black plum and black currants with fresh acidity. Just wait until 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: This pure Arinto from its home territory is fresh, fruity, citrus-driven and with apple and textured zesty orange flavors. The wine has structure, intense acidity and a tangy, mineral character that will allow it to mature a few more months. Drink now, but better from late 2016.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2013 Morgado de Santa Catherina Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: The wine is ripe, still young with its fresh fruits and acidity. The elements are all there to produce a dark and dense wine that has fine structure. It's a complex blend of Alfrocheiro, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, all of which will allow the wine to age over a good few years. Drink this impressive wine from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: It's rare to find a Sémillon in Portugal, let along the Alentejo. And yet the wine works beautifully. Wood aging has given it sophistication while the natural creamy texture of the grape is enhanced by the ripe yellow fruits that are lightly lifted by a herbal, citrus aftertaste. This wine could well age, so drink now or, better, keep until 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Esporão Private Selection White White (Alentejano)

description: Powerfully structured and concentrated, this is a rich, tarry and tannic wine. The dense texture doesn't lose sight of the jammy black currant and berry fruits that are just underneath. For the moment, even after four years, the wine is very young, firm and dry. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)

description: With its concentration and dark tannins, this is a wine that will need many years of aging. It is a serious combination of great style and great power. From one of the top Douro vineyards, this is a wine with an impressive, long-lasting sense of presence.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2009 Red (Douro)

description: A huge wine, as indicated by the alcohol, this is dark, dense and extracted. It has bitter chocolate and sweet licorice flavors, strong signs of the wood aging, along with juicy blackberry fruit. Powerful and concentrated, it needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Vinha Paz 2011 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This new baby from Crasto is an easygoing wine, full of berry fruits, gentle tannins. It is ready to drink, finishing softly and freshly.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2008 Flor de Crasto Red (Douro)

description: This aged Moscatel is showing a deep gold color from its time in wood. It is as smooth and rich as velvet, with wood, syrup, honey and marmalade. Ripe and opulent, it's delicious both before and after a meal.
title: Adega de Favaios NV 10-Years-Old  (Moscatel do Douro)

description: This has intense pink color with attractive acidity, plenty of sweet strawberry flavors and the merest hint of spirit. Light and bright, it's attractive, clean and fruity. Pink and rosé Ports—Ruby blends with limited exposure to the grape skins—are best served chilled and in cocktails.
title: Messias NV Rosé  (Port)

description: This has intense pink color with attractive acidity, plenty of sweet strawberry flavors and the merest hint of spirit. Light and bright, it's attractive, clean and fruity. Pink and rosé Ports—Ruby blends with limited exposure to the grape skins—are best served chilled and in cocktails.
title: Messias NV Rosé  (Port)

description: This is an attractive, soft and ripe wine. It has just enough acidity to give this blend that has 40% Chardonnay a crisp aftertaste. The wine with its melon and pear flavors is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Winemaker Selection White (Lisboa)

description: This is an attractive, soft and ripe wine. It has just enough acidity to give this blend that has 40% Chardonnay a crisp aftertaste. The wine with its melon and pear flavors is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Winemaker Selection White (Lisboa)

description: This rosé is almost as rich as a red wine, the difference being a fresher, red-fruit character. It has vanilla flavors, a dry texture and a touch of pepper.
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: This rosé is almost as rich as a red wine, the difference being a fresher, red-fruit character. It has vanilla flavors, a dry texture and a touch of pepper.
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: This fruity, perfumed wine (the Moscatel Roxo in the blend sees to that), is ripe and full bodied, with some light sweetness giving a soft, gentle aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2012 JP Azeitão Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Despite its alcohol and potential richness, this has as much green, herbal character as fruitiness. It's structured and juicy, and shows considerable acidity.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Má Partilha Merlot (Península de Setúbal)

description: A new joint venture between winemaker Jorge Moreira and owner the Bergqvist family, both of Quinta de la Rosa. The vineyard is in the remote Douro Superior. You can certainly smell the dry heat in this young wine. To taste it has a Port-like smoothness overlying its dry tannins. The fruit is sweet, succulent, layered with blackberry jam and dark berries.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2005 Passagem Red (Douro)

description: Herbal, almost medicinal aromas set a complex scene for this densely structured wine. The flavors throughout, while rich, are also severe, a wrinkle on the otherwise ripe façade. That certainly suggests aging, and the dry tannins support this. In the meantime, it is a winter wine, its concentration needing rich meat dishes.
title: Dão Sul 2005 Monte da Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Aged in steel, this is a bright, fruit-driven wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. It has a crisp touch of acidity at the end. Ready to drink now.
title: Sanguinhal 2015 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Aged in steel, this is a bright, fruit-driven wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. It has a crisp touch of acidity at the end. Ready to drink now.
title: Sanguinhal 2015 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe perfumed wine has yellow fruits and soft melon flavors. It comes from the cooler north of the Alentejo, preserving crispness at the end with attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Cal Monte da Cal White (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractively fruity wine with its ripe apple and crisp pear flavors. Lined with acidity and refreshing, it is a clean, lightly herbaceous wine. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2015 Arinto (Tejo)

description: On the basis that anything goes in Setúbal, here is another grape from Bordeaux in a new setting. The wine certainly has the dark color of the grape and dark black-plum fruits. It is full and rich, but the finish has a lingering astringency.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Petit Verdot (Península de Setúbal)

description: An elegant wine, its red fruits laced with firm yet subtle tannins. It is finished with acidity, a balanced layer of wood. The wine, with its serious structure, needs 2–3 years aging.
title: Terra d'Alter 2009 Special Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Red fruits dominate a wine that is rich, full-bodied with a firm, tight structure. Round the firm texture there is a richer, ripe fruit character, dense and juicy. The wine can be aged, but it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Porca de Murça Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A rich, ripe, warm wine, smoothed with soft tannins. The open, generous fruit character is given an extra edge with textured wood and acidity. A black, tarry aftertaste adds further complexity.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Vallado Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A rich, ripe, warm wine, smoothed with soft tannins. The open, generous fruit character is given an extra edge with textured wood and acidity. A black, tarry aftertaste adds further complexity.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Vallado Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A wine that lacks balance. Its strawberry fruits are shot through with shocking acidity and then sweetened, none of the elements hanging together. Drink seriously chilled.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Although this rosé smells of wild strawberries, the aroma is better than the palate, which tastes chemical with a bitter almond aftertaste. Serve very cold.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Dona Helena Colheita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: An earthy, ripe and fruity wine, it has a solid base of tannins and a rough-edged structure. The black fruits are submerged in the more rustic nature of the wine's aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Bojador Red (Alentejano)

description: An earthy, ripe and fruity wine, it has a solid base of tannins and a rough-edged structure. The black fruits are submerged in the more rustic nature of the wine's aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Bojador Red (Alentejano)

description: Almost colourless, it tastes like sugar water with some acidity thrown in. Gently fruity, the sweetness comes along with flavors of green grapes.
title: Vinhas Altas 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is as light as Vinho Verde can be. Off dry, fresh, clean and crisp with sweet apple juice, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Lagosta White (Vinho Verde)

description: With its light prickle, this off-dry wine has a candied flavor, a tangy texture and a crisp, light aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Lagosta Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A rustic wine with barnyard aromas and some firm tannins. Beneath this surface there are red fruits and acidity. This is a wine to be drunk young.
title: Vidigal 2013 Red (Lisboa)

description: A bright, candy pink colored blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this has plenty of acidity although its weight and ripe fruit give the wine a heavy feel. It is ready to drink.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is so rustic that it has lost its fruit. What you do find are tannins, some acidity and a soft texture.
title: Herdade da Capela 2013 Monte de Capela Red (Alentejo)

description: This open, perfumed and fruity wine is crisp and bright. It also has a warm, apricot and ripe pear fruitiness that balances the citrus acidity. It's attractive now and ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This open, perfumed and fruity wine is crisp and bright. It also has a warm, apricot and ripe pear fruitiness that balances the citrus acidity. It's attractive now and ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: After aging in bottle, this wood-aged wine has smoothed out to produce a rich wine with balanced fruit, acidity and toastiness. The wine does have plenty of spice from the wood, but it also has layers of citrus and pear-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.
title: Ribafreixo 2014 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: A wood-aged wine from the heart of the Dão, it has tannins, a tense mineral structure and layer after layer of black currant fruit and acidity. Dark and brooding at this stage, it needs to age for several years. Drink from 2016.
title: Sogrape 2010 Quinta dos Carvalhais Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This richly fruity wine has poise and elegance as well as a powerful structure. A light herbal character brings out the juicy fruits as well as a mint flavor. The wine is ripe although with its serious tannic element, it does need to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2011 Malhadinha Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Touriga Nacional is as much, maybe more, at home in the Dão as in the Douro. That's shown by this ripe and powerful wine that is still so young. The dark structure of tannins and wood flavors has a great mineral texture along with the potential for delicious blackberry fruits. It needs several years aging, wait until 2018.
title: Sogrape 2011 Quinta dos Carvalhais Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Touriga Nacional is as much, maybe more, at home in the Dão as in the Douro. That's shown by this ripe and powerful wine that is still so young. The dark structure of tannins and wood flavors has a great mineral texture along with the potential for delicious blackberry fruits. It needs several years aging, wait until 2018.
title: Sogrape 2011 Quinta dos Carvalhais Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Complex, ripe and fruity, this is an impressive wine with an impressive future. Its structure is still dominant, although the ripe damson and blueberry fruits are rich and concentrated. With strong wood aging flavors, it's powerful and still needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2008 Dona Matilde Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Powerful and tannic, this is a dense and complex wine. Made from selected barrels, it is structured as well as rich in fruit. Blackberry flavors come through the dry tannins and give acidity as well as ripeness. It's a wine that will need time; don't drink before 2017.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 La Rosa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Almost black in color, this is a powerful and concentrated wine. Named after the barn owl that is found in the woods around the vines, it is packed with dense and dry tannins. Acidity comes from the black currant fruit while perfumes come from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. Drink this complex wine from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Red (Tejo)

description: Big, black and juicy, it manages to be both dense and structured and freshly fruity at the same time. With this combination promising great things, the wine is ripe and fragrant. The dark color from the Petit Verdot in the blend follows through to the firm texture while allowing room for refreshing juiciness. Drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta de Pancas Grande Escolha Red (Lisboa)

description: Sweet rosé from the Vinho Verde region, this has some fresh raspberry and a light prickle to make it just that extra bit refreshing.
title: Lagosta 2010 Vinho Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Sweet rosé from the Vinho Verde region, this has some fresh raspberry and a light prickle to make it just that extra bit refreshing.
title: Lagosta 2010 Vinho Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Described as medium sweet, this is soft and sugary, its tannins at an awkward angle to the soft surroundings. This style works better with the rosé and white versions of Portada.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Caramel and strawberry aromas lead to a ripe, while still, crisp crushed red berry wine. Good acidity, a light just off-dry texture.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Azul Portugal Rosé (Setubal)

description: Concentrated, dark-fruited wine, with a severe, mineral edge that cuts through the black currant fruits. It is a wine for aging, potentially rich although always with a dry core of tannins. Keep for 3–4 years.
designation: Quinta Picos do Couto Vale do Viso
title: Castro Pena Alba 2008 Quinta Picos do Couto Vale do Viso Red (Douro)

description: Concentrated, dark-fruited wine, with a severe, mineral edge that cuts through the black currant fruits. It is a wine for aging, potentially rich although always with a dry core of tannins. Keep for 3–4 years.
designation: Quinta Picos do Couto Vale do Viso
title: Castro Pena Alba 2008 Quinta Picos do Couto Vale do Viso Red (Douro)

description: There isn't much Sémillon in Portugal, but what there is can be easily affected by botrytis. This one has intense sweetness, balanced by dryness and lemon acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Grandjó Late Harvest Sémillon (Douro)

description: Warm, rich wine with tropical flavors of mango, peach and with a ripe feel. It has weight, although the fruit does hint at crispness. There is a toast and nuts character that broadens out the interest.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2008 Branco Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: The crisp Vital grape, local to the Lisboa region, is obvious in this light and bright wine. It has a wonderful tangy character, with delicious acidity. Full of citrus and green plums, it offers a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Vale da Mata White (Lisboa)

description: Vineyard redevelopment and a new winery contributed to this fine expression of ripe Alicante Bouschet wine under the direction of Catarina Vieira. It's rich and structured, reflecting the grape. The dark color and powerful spice and black-fruit flavors are right up front to give a dense wine that will always be firm. The wine comes in a very heavy bottle.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Grande Rocim Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)

description: This is a successful blend of Chardonnay and Arinto that blends a creamy texture with crisp fruit flavors. Wood aged, the wine has a toasty edge that fills out the fruit and gives spice to the citrus and apple flavors. The wine is still young; give it until late 2018.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a successful blend of Chardonnay and Arinto that blends a creamy texture with crisp fruit flavors. Wood aged, the wine has a toasty edge that fills out the fruit and gives spice to the citrus and apple flavors. The wine is still young; give it until late 2018.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: The Syrah in this blend gives an extra perfume and spice to this rich wine. Its tannins and firm structure are balanced by the black fruits, acidity and Douro minerality. This wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 R de Romaneira Red (Duriense)

description: The Syrah in this blend gives an extra perfume and spice to this rich wine. Its tannins and firm structure are balanced by the black fruits, acidity and Douro minerality. This wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 R de Romaneira Red (Duriense)

description: Produced from old vines, this generous wine is ripe with black fruits, with a juicy, dense texture as well as ripe tannins. The structure is comfortably cushioned within the rich fruitiness, giving way to a crisp, lingering aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Tom de Baton Red (Douro)

description: This gold-colored wine has been aged for an average of 10 years in wood. It balances between ripe yellow fruits and dried fruits that are backed by a spicy touch from the brandy used to fortify the wine. Drink now.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Ten Years Old White  (Port)

description: This gold-colored wine has been aged for an average of 10 years in wood. It balances between ripe yellow fruits and dried fruits that are backed by a spicy touch from the brandy used to fortify the wine. Drink now.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Ten Years Old White  (Port)

description: Pure Alvarinho from the north of the Vinho Verde region makes this a smooth, ripe wine. It is perfumed, stylish and with a good balance between acidity and refreshing green and white fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Toucas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: With minty wood flavors, this wine is smooth and polished. It offers berry fruits from the blend of 10 varieties in this old-vine vineyard. With spice and some firm tannins in the background, it is ready to drink.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine with great potential is produced by the husband-and-wife team of Jorge Serôdio Borges and Sandra Tavares da Silva. it is structured, although the fruit is already rich enough to indicate its ripe character. Drink this smoky, wood-aged wine from 2020.
title: Wine & Soul 2014 Pintas Red (Douro)

description: Rich and concentrated, this wine is produced from vines on hills above the Pinhão valley. It offers firm tannins and ripe black-plum fruits. Full bodied and ripe, it is also young with new wood flavors and a dark structure. This wine will repay aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This rare survival comes from Ramisco grapes planted on their own rootstock on sandy soil close to the Atlantic Ocean. Considering its great age, the wine is remarkably fruity and fresh. With a tarry texture and firm tannins it also has layers of red-cherry fruit and acidity. The wine is impressive, and not just a relic. Drink immediately after opening; it does fade quickly.
title: Adega Viuva Gomes 1934 Reserva Velho Red (Colares)

description: This rare survival comes from Ramisco grapes planted on their own rootstock on sandy soil close to the Atlantic Ocean. Considering its great age, the wine is remarkably fruity and fresh. With a tarry texture and firm tannins it also has layers of red-cherry fruit and acidity. The wine is impressive, and not just a relic. Drink immediately after opening; it does fade quickly.
title: Adega Viuva Gomes 1934 Reserva Velho Red (Colares)

description: A blend of Castelão and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a soft and smooth wine. Red berry fruits are balanced by spice and tannins from a short time in oak. The wine is ready to drink, although waiting until late 2016 would make it even more enjoyable.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Capoeira Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is attractive, ripe and finely perfumed. With the spicy Moscatel flavors in the blend, it brings yellow fruit tones balanced by lively acidity. There is a great tangy character which yields a lifted, smooth aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: This is an initially austere wine. A fine blend of fresh acidity and concentrated black plum fruits give the wine elegance. The finish is balanced by a brisk final acidity.
designation: Quinta do Ventozelo Late Bottled Vintage
title: Gran Cruz 2011 Quinta do Ventozelo Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A ripe, mineral and richly fruity wine, this is crisp while also having a creamy texture. It is a blend of four of the Douro white grapes, rich and finished with acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Poças 2016 Poças Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a bright sparkling wine from a region which specializes in this style. The Bical and Baga grapes allow the wine to sing with perfumed apples and citrus fruits. Chardonnay adds a fuller side. Drink now.
title: Messias 2013 Grande Cuvée Brut Millésime Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a bright sparkling wine from a region which specializes in this style. The Bical and Baga grapes allow the wine to sing with perfumed apples and citrus fruits. Chardonnay adds a fuller side. Drink now.
title: Messias 2013 Grande Cuvée Brut Millésime Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Celebrating the creation of the Douro demarcated region in 1756 by the King of Portugal, this wine comes from vineyards at the heart of the historic region. It is structured and dark, dense with both tannins and black fruits. At three years old, it is still young, so wait until 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Vinha do Reino Reserva Red (Douro)

description: When planted south of its home in the northern Vinho Verde region, Alvarinho reveals a softer side. The acidity in this wine is balanced by the warm yellow fruits and open texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: A crisp, caramel- and red-fruit-flavored blend of Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this is ready to drink. Produced at Casa Ermelinda Freitas winery, it has a salty edge from the nearby ocean, finishing with plenty of acidity.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This unoaked, fruity wine is crisp, full of green fruits and lively acidity. It is light and bright, with a touch of Douro minerality to lift the texture. Drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Branco White (Douro)

description: This soft and smooth wine offers a creamy texture over youthful acidity. The blend contains Trincadeira das Pratas as well as Fernão Pires and Arinto, giving a crisp, tangy character that will mellow into a softer character in a few months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: This soft and smooth wine offers a creamy texture over youthful acidity. The blend contains Trincadeira das Pratas as well as Fernão Pires and Arinto, giving a crisp, tangy character that will mellow into a softer character in a few months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: With perfumed black-currant and damson fruitiness, this is a juicy wine. That freshness contrasts with a firm texture, chocolate and smoky flavors and a tannic aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: This is a soft, open wine showing a few tannins and some of the perfumed character of the grape. The palate is rounded and shows attractive red fruits.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: The tannins and the fruit are well balanced in this open, fruity wine. A blend from several vineyards, it has a dusty texture, ripe red fruits and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Douro)

description: The tannins and the fruit are well balanced in this open, fruity wine. A blend from several vineyards, it has a dusty texture, ripe red fruits and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Douro)

description: This lively, fruity wine has soft apple flavors and refreshing acidity. A zesty backdrop to the fruitiness gives a light texture. The wine, which comes from one of the cooler regions of Alentejo, is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2016 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)

description: The first fruits of the renaissance of this grand Douro quinta (which now also houses a luxury hotel). It is huge, revealing up-front, modern, polished black fruits that would not be out of place in Australia. Maybe the typicity is lacking, but the wine certainly has grandeur, power and rich, extracted fruits. The pepper finish reveals the alcohol.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2004 Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, soft wine that has good dense fruit flavors as well as richness. There is some new wood, but the wine remains elusive, perhaps still young. On the palate, the wood spice is still dominant, with only the acidity hinting at the fruit.
title: Casa de Santar 2006 Reserva White (Dão)

description: Somewhat tough initially, with the tannins coming before the fruit, and a distinctly lean character. But this is deceptive, because there is certainly enough fruit there to give richness after two years' aging, when the blackberry and licorice flavors will come up through all that dryness.
title: Casa de Santar 2004 Red (Dão)

description: This rare blend of Cabernet, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Touriga Nacional works surprisingly well, emphasizing tannic structure rather than fruit. The acidity of the Cab is what keeps it from being heavy, while the dense color and herbal flavors show its southern warmth and richness. Dried plums and fresh acidity to finish.
title: Dona Maria 2004 Amantis Red (Alentejano)

description: This rare blend of Cabernet, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Touriga Nacional works surprisingly well, emphasizing tannic structure rather than fruit. The acidity of the Cab is what keeps it from being heavy, while the dense color and herbal flavors show its southern warmth and richness. Dried plums and fresh acidity to finish.
title: Dona Maria 2004 Amantis Red (Alentejano)

description: A wine that has become something of a cult in Portugal, perhaps because of its mystery name (referring to a time when Syrah was not permitted in Portugal). This 2005 keeps the open, ripe blackberry jam fruit, with dark chocolate and herbal flavors. It has a generous, earthy character.
title: Cortes de Cima 2005 Incógnito Red (Alentejano)

description: A wine that has become something of a cult in Portugal, perhaps because of its mystery name (referring to a time when Syrah was not permitted in Portugal). This 2005 keeps the open, ripe blackberry jam fruit, with dark chocolate and herbal flavors. It has a generous, earthy character.
title: Cortes de Cima 2005 Incógnito Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a delicious wine full of ripe fruit tones. It is richly textured while keeping plenty of freshness from the Antão Vaz that dominates the blend. It has a firm mineral background that gives structure. The finish brings a zippy orange zest note.
title: Espaço Rural 2013 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named after the vultures which fly in the Douro, this solid, structured wine is full of tannins as well as ripe fruit. It comes from a good red wine vintage, allowing the structure to develop richly with a good concentration. The wine still needs time, so drink from 2017.
title: Rozes 2012 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)

description: Named after the vultures which fly in the Douro, this solid, structured wine is full of tannins as well as ripe fruit. It comes from a good red wine vintage, allowing the structure to develop richly with a good concentration. The wine still needs time, so drink from 2017.
title: Rozes 2012 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)

description: This oak-fermented wine may have little connection to the Douro, but it is a full, ripe and tropical-fruit flavored. The toast is only perceptible in the smooth creaminess of the texture while acidity and a crisp lemon edge give the wine an attractive final lift. Drink from late 2016.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta de Cidrô Chardonnay (Duriense)

description: Bacon aromas lead to a wine that is spicy, dry and meaty in character. There is a stalky element at first, yet turns to fresh, ripe fruit balanced by lively acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine is fruity, supported by firm tannins that integrate well with the acidity. While there is a delicious black currant and berry fruit character, this wine needs to develop richness as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This wine is fruity, supported by firm tannins that integrate well with the acidity. While there is a delicious black currant and berry fruit character, this wine needs to develop richness as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: A young and fruity wine that is already balanced. So the tannins give a structure to the forward blackberry fruits and acidity. It's a juicy, full-bodied wine, the Alicante Bouschet in the blend giving the richness and also the structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade da Pimenta Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: A young and fruity wine that is already balanced. So the tannins give a structure to the forward blackberry fruits and acidity. It's a juicy, full-bodied wine, the Alicante Bouschet in the blend giving the richness and also the structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade da Pimenta Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a young, fruity wine that has been produced to be drunk young. Light tannins and pure black currant flavors give the wine plenty of freshness and acidity. The wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Art Terra Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is all fruit, fresh red berries and refreshing acidity. The tannins are soft, rounded and generous, just supporting the fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Campolargo 2012 Vinha do Putto Red (Bairrada)

description: The Dão's great white grape has produced a deliciously perfumed wine. It is fresh with pink grapefruit and crisp apples that are filled out with spice and toast from the wood aging. It is tight and mineral in texture and will benefit from a few more months before drinking. Wait until late 2016.
title: Caminhos Cruzados 2014 Titular Encruzado (Dão)

description: Now at peak maturity, this wine is generously rich as well as sophisticated and stylish. Firm tannins interweave with the juicy black fruit character. A dry background gives a leathery texture while still having room for fruit. Drink now.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2007 Quinta do Alqueve Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Strongly tannic, this is a firmly structured, wood-aged wine. The wood shows as dark toast that dominates the rich fruit that still needs time to show strongly. It's a complex wine, full of spice, acidity, and with a dry, dense core. Drink from 2018.
title: Perescuma 2011 Orquestra Special Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Strongly tannic, this is a firmly structured, wood-aged wine. The wood shows as dark toast that dominates the rich fruit that still needs time to show strongly. It's a complex wine, full of spice, acidity, and with a dry, dense core. Drink from 2018.
title: Perescuma 2011 Orquestra Special Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a firmly structured wine that's powerful and rich. A dark, brooding quality powers the complex balance between fruit and tannins. It has the potential to be a beautiful, ripe, impressive wine with a strong sense of minerality. Drink from 2018.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2012 VZ Van Zellers Red (Douro)

description: This is a firmly structured wine that's powerful and rich. A dark, brooding quality powers the complex balance between fruit and tannins. It has the potential to be a beautiful, ripe, impressive wine with a strong sense of minerality. Drink from 2018.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2012 VZ Van Zellers Red (Douro)

description: This comes from 30-year-old vines in the Quinta da Manoella, the family vineyard of Jorge Borges, one of the winemaking husband-and-wife team at Wine & Soul. This bottling shows the fruit-driven side of this vineyard, which also has 100-year-old vines. It's dense and solid, with powerful tannins that are beautifully integrated into the big plum fruits. The aftertaste is smooth, rich and concentrated.
title: Wine & Soul 2012 Manoella Red (Douro)

description: Rustic, farmyard aromas follow through to a wine that has let the Baga tannins dominate. It is tough, chewy, offering few concessions to fruit.
title: Quinta de Baixo 2008 Colheita Red (Bairrada)

description: Lightweight, attractive, very juicy wine. It is a great pizza wine, with its edge of tannins and lively acidity. Drink this year.
title: Castello d'Alba 2009 Tuga Red (Douro)

description: This is not a shy wine—it is concentrated and powerful, with ripe tannins and dense black fruits. Coming from vineyards in the Douro Superior, this shows the region's the heat and harsh growing conditions, giving a compact, firm wine with a mineral texture to balance the juicy fruits. It will need several years, so drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Quinta da Fronteira Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is intensely perfumed, with soft tannins that are followed by a dry, concentrated character. From the iconic Vesúvio Vineyard, where wines for vintage production are still foot trodden, this has a ripe feel, with tannins that are suitable for medium-term aging.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2010 Vintage  (Port)

description: A firm and structured wine, this shows complex tannins as well as contrasting acidity. It feels complete, the tannins supporting red cherry and spice flavors. It is probably not for long-term aging but will start to taste delicious in 6–7 years.
title: Dow's 2010 Quinta do Bomfim Vintage  (Port)

description: Bright and fruity, this dayglo pink wine is dominated by acidity, though the strawberry flavors offer a riper core. It's for drinking this summer.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Monte Mayor Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is a juicy soft blend of Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet. Ripe red fruits dominate with balanced tannins and generous fruit. The acidity and the final burst of fruit show this easy wine is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2013 Pato Frio Red Edition Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a juicy soft blend of Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet. Ripe red fruits dominate with balanced tannins and generous fruit. The acidity and the final burst of fruit show this easy wine is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2013 Pato Frio Red Edition Red (Alentejano)

description: In terms of price, this wine can be considered the entry-level wine for the increasing range of Douro wines form this famed Port estate. This wine is all about fruit—bright red fruits—and just a touch of spice and toast from the wood aging. Drink the wine from early 2018.
title: Quinta do Noval 2015 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

description: This is a classic crisp apple-driven and fruity wine. With delicious acidity and a lively aftertaste, the wine is tangy and zesty and a great summer drink.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a classic dry Vinho Verde. It has delicious fruit and crisp acidity giving lemon flavors, a lively texture and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: From a field blend of old vines, this is a beautifully ripe, rounded, wood-aged wine that still preserves an internal structure. With its stone-fruit and mineral character, it is both fruity and textured. It's a wine for aging over 4–5 years.
title: Alvaro Castro 2009 Quinta da Pellada Branco White (Dão)
