description: This is a gorgeous wine that's driven by notes of spice and new wood. The wood is supported by ripe flavors of plum, damson and blackberry juice, with tight acidity. The Alentejo's dry climate is certainly suited to Syrah, producing fine structure. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2009 S Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This is a gorgeous wine that's driven by notes of spice and new wood. The wood is supported by ripe flavors of plum, damson and blackberry juice, with tight acidity. The Alentejo's dry climate is certainly suited to Syrah, producing fine structure. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2009 S Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Using a blend of grapes sourced from old vines, this is powerful, dense and very concentrated. At the same time, an elegance lightens the wine's weight and integrates all of its elements. This serious, structured offering should be aged for 4–5 years.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2010 Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: Rounded style of Vinho Verde with some weight to go with the extreme citrus and bright grapefruit flavors. It has a little softness round the edges, but the core is taut, mineral, tangy.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Azul Portugal Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A wine with some density of flavor to go with its intense green apple character. It has some ripe green berries, laced with pink grapefruit.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2010 Azal Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: A wine with some density of flavor to go with its intense green apple character. It has some ripe green berries, laced with pink grapefruit.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2010 Azal Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: This rich wine is touched by botrytis, although its main character is ultraripe, sweet fruit. Mango, honey and an edge of toast come together easily.
title: Rozes 2009 Noble Late Harvest Malvasia Fina (Douro)

description: This rich wine is touched by botrytis, although its main character is ultraripe, sweet fruit. Mango, honey and an edge of toast come together easily.
title: Rozes 2009 Noble Late Harvest Malvasia Fina (Douro)

description: Everything is overpowering with this wine, from the weight of the bottle, to the alcohol, to the intense flavors. It is an impressive one-glass-only wine, packed with concentrated juicy fruity, spice and wood flavors. Drink now.
title: Castro Pena Alba 2007 Duvalley Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Everything is overpowering with this wine, from the weight of the bottle, to the alcohol, to the intense flavors. It is an impressive one-glass-only wine, packed with concentrated juicy fruity, spice and wood flavors. Drink now.
title: Castro Pena Alba 2007 Duvalley Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a field blend from old white vines. It has a tight, tangy texture to go with its rich fruits. The concentration and intense minerality are part and parcel of the old vines and the schist soil. It has a cool feeling, crisp and tight at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: This is a field blend from old white vines. It has a tight, tangy texture to go with its rich fruits. The concentration and intense minerality are part and parcel of the old vines and the schist soil. It has a cool feeling, crisp and tight at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: The Códega de Larinho grape produces a crisp style of wine that shows up well in the warm conditions of the region. With its delicious fresh character and blend of apple and grapefruit flavors, this light wine is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Andreza Códega do Larinho (Douro)

description: This ripe blend of four grapes was aged in wood for nine months. Filled by rich blackberry fruits, the generous texture is cut by acidity. Drink this smooth wine now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This firmly tannic wine is a selection made for aging. It has structure and a dry core. Set against this are the blackberry fruits, the acidity and the juicy aftertaste. It will be ready from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This firmly tannic wine is a selection made for aging. It has structure and a dry core. Set against this are the blackberry fruits, the acidity and the juicy aftertaste. It will be ready from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich wine in a dry style for Port, bringing out the red fruits as well as dried fruits and acidity. It's structured and firm while also fruity. Because it has been bottled unfiltered, it will age further and will be at its best from 2019.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a rich wine in a dry style for Port, bringing out the red fruits as well as dried fruits and acidity. It's structured and firm while also fruity. Because it has been bottled unfiltered, it will age further and will be at its best from 2019.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Named after the pine-tree aromas that come from the trees around the Dão vineyards, this wine is perfumed with structured black-currant fruits and wild-berry flavors. Its tannins and balanced concentration are just right. Drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Pinha Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: Named after the pine-tree aromas that come from the trees around the Dão vineyards, this wine is perfumed with structured black-currant fruits and wild-berry flavors. Its tannins and balanced concentration are just right. Drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Pinha Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: This wine has a juicy black-currant character that is bright, with just the right amount of balanced sweetness. It is more fruity than rich and packs a welcome balance of final acidity,
title: Sogevinus 2009 Rocha Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: The chalk soil of the Cova da Ursa vineyard, high up on the Azeitão mountains, yields this rich, tropical-fruited Chardonnay. It is ripe with apricot and mango flavors that are smoothed out by the wood aging. Toast and fresh acidity are still balancing out, so this impressive wine needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Cova da Ursa Chardonnay (Península de Setúbal)

description: The chalk soil of the Cova da Ursa vineyard, high up on the Azeitão mountains, yields this rich, tropical-fruited Chardonnay. It is ripe with apricot and mango flavors that are smoothed out by the wood aging. Toast and fresh acidity are still balancing out, so this impressive wine needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Cova da Ursa Chardonnay (Península de Setúbal)

description: Offley, established in 1737, is a famous old Port house. This 30-year-old tawny, aged in the cellars at Vila Nova de Gaia at the mouth of the Douro river, has a strong sense of wood aging that gives acidity and a golden glow to the palate. Like any aged tawny, it can be drunk now.
title: Sogrape NV Offley 30 Years Tawny  (Port)

description: Selected fruit has been barrel-fermented to give this rich and toasty wine. It has great structure, a concentrated texture that brings out both acidity and delicious acidity. A good layer of spice from the wood blends well with pear and peach fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: Big damson fruits dominate this rich wine. The wood aging has smoothed out some of the dense tannins although the wine remains firm and solid. There's a sense of power behind the juicy dark fruits and the dry core. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Valle da Fonte 2012 Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This big, rich wine is packed with dark fruit. After eight years, it is now showing maturity with leather tannins, dense structure and juicy black plum-skin flavors. Despite its age, it still shows well, with proper final wood notes, tannins and acidity. Drink now.
title: Julian Reynolds 2006 Reynolds Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This big, rich wine is packed with dark fruit. After eight years, it is now showing maturity with leather tannins, dense structure and juicy black plum-skin flavors. Despite its age, it still shows well, with proper final wood notes, tannins and acidity. Drink now.
title: Julian Reynolds 2006 Reynolds Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich wine is soft, with generous tannins and ripe fruit. It has a fine, open balance between black fruits and light spice, resulting in a rich wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Adega Mayor 2014 Caiado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich wine is soft, with generous tannins and ripe fruit. It has a fine, open balance between black fruits and light spice, resulting in a rich wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Adega Mayor 2014 Caiado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, balanced blend of Aragon and Touriga Nacional. It has a a bright, fruity character that is both fresh and warm. It's a delicious wine to drink with food.
title: Monte Branco 2014 Alento Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich wine, soft and juicy. Superripe—perhaps overripe—fruit gives a jammy character to the wine. The core woody flavor from aging in French and American oak is prominent and needs to round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Herdade dos Templários Grande Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional, Merlot and Syrah, giving fruit, fresh berry flavors and acidity. It has some structure, showing a dry background to the forward juicy flavors. It should be better in a year, so drink from 2016.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: This is a rich, dry wine that has ripe flavors of yellow fruits and baked apples. It has a mineral texture, tangy acidity and a smooth yet fresh finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2014 Pouco-Comum White (Minho)

description: This is a young, soft and fruity wine, with ripe black fruits that are lightly textured by the dry, spicy core. With some wood aging, the wine has a toasty accent and a smooth character that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: This just off-dry wine is fresh, young and fruity. It leads with a lemony scent and crisp acidity that is partnered by a light prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine tastes old before its years. It has a leathery character and prominent acidity rather than fruit. It has interest, with its dried fruits and tannins that are just on the point of drying out. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2009 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Attractive, just off-dry wine, very fresh, packed with apples, tangy citrus and a lively prickle on the tongue.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2010 Adamado White (Vinho Verde)

description: Attractive, just off-dry wine, very fresh, packed with apples, tangy citrus and a lively prickle on the tongue.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2010 Adamado White (Vinho Verde)

description: Juicy, fruity wine, all red berries and freshness. The wine feels warm, just right for a hot dish on a cold day. The acidty gives some shape without losing the ripeness.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2009 Xairel Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Full honey- and melon-flavored wine, with a soft-textured character. It is full of ripe red apples, well made, if internationally anonymous.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: Full honey- and melon-flavored wine, with a soft-textured character. It is full of ripe red apples, well made, if internationally anonymous.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: Vargellas is always associated with violet aromas as well as the strength and power of its wines inside a velvet glove. The 2012 is concentrated yet soft and smooth on the surface. It's fruity and fresh, while brooding with inner strength. Drink now for its fruit; wait until 2021 for its power and longevity.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2012 Quinta de Vargellas Vintage  (Port)

description: This dry Moscatel has intense floral perfumes along with equally intense acidity. It is a combination that works because of the flavors of spice and lychee that give the wine richness as well. It is crisp at the end, always fragrant and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Vallado Prima Branco Moscatel (Douro)

description: This delicious ripe wine is made with a high proportion (40%) of Encruzado and it is this grape that gives the wine its richness. It also adds to the smooth texture while the fine perfumed character comes from Cerceal. This is a refreshing wine that is ready to drink.
title: Global Wines 2016 Casa de Santar Branco White (Dão)

description: This is the white version of the winemaker's red-white DJ selection. The wine is a blend of four grapes giving a soft rich taste. It has just enough acidity to bring a crisp contrast. Otherwise it is warm, full of apricot as well as citrus fruits. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Escolha da Enóloga White (Alentejano)

description: This rich, spicy blend of Alfrocheiro, Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Jaen from winemaker Carlos Lucas offers rich black-plum fruits with layers of wood flavors. It is generous, juicy with some firm tannins and plenty of toasty wood flavors. Everything needs some time to soften, so wait to drink until 2019.
title: Quinta do Sobral 2014 Santar Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A short stay (just eight months) in wood has produced a fine, rich and ripe wine. With its toast and butter flavors, touch of honey and opulent character, the wine is rounded and complex. Acidity plays just the right part to make the wine complete. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named in remembrance of the lost love of Portuguese king João V, this concentrated and rich wine is impressive. Its firm tannins are surrounded by the richest black fruits. They, in turn, are balanced with acidity and with a dry core that will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2019.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Amantis Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This spicy wood-aged wine has nutmeg and ripe fruit flavors. Its perfumed fruits bring in apple, green plum and great acidity that is balanced by the judicious wood aging. This is a rich wine, full of intense acidity and fruitiness that needs to age further. Drink from late 2018.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Conceito Branco White (Douro)

description: Light and fruity, this has the softest structure. Red berry fruits give the wine a bright, jammy character with acidity offering some freshness. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cape Roca Boat Red (Douro)

description: Light and fruity, this has the softest structure. Red berry fruits give the wine a bright, jammy character with acidity offering some freshness. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cape Roca Boat Red (Douro)

description: An off-dry wine, with crisp apple fruits and a light, bright texture. It's tangy, full of lemony acidity with a light prickle. It's for drinking immediately.
title: Pátria 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Showing freshness as well as structure, this intense wine is certainly fruity, while also having a dense texture, wood elements, ripe and friendly juiciness. Age for 2–3 years and more.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: As an addition to the Cape Roca range, this is impressive. It has weight and richness, accompanied with firm tannins, a solid core of dryness and blackberry fruits.
title: Casca Wines 2007 Cape Roca Boat Red (Douro)

description: A brute of a wine, both in its immense flavors and its excessively weighty bottle. It has richness, full of concentrated sweet plum juice and dense tannins—very rich, very in your face.
designation: Monte da Cal Vinha de Saturno
title: Dão Sul 2007 Monte da Cal Vinha de Saturno Red (Alentejano)

description: Always an elegant wine, the Aragonez shows its beautiful smooth fruit, flavors of blueberries with leathery tannins and fine acidity. With its structure it could age, but there's no need to wait.
title: Cortes de Cima 2007 Aragonez Red (Alentejano)

description: Tightly tannic and very firm at this stage, but you can feel the ripe fruit underneath, giving great structure and power. Black currants layered with acidity, while the center, a dry core.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Very rich and deliciously smooth, but with a bite of acidity and stalky black-currant fruit to give it structure. This wine is dry, ripe and dense, showing its tannins while promising longevity.
title: Poças 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a firm, tannic wine, with juicy fruit and black-currant-like acidity that lends freshness. Wood influence shows subtly through the forward fruitiness. Age this three years or more.
title: Casal do Conde 2011 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a particularly successful white Monte Velho. It is rich and creamy, full of ripe apple and refreshing acidity in equal measure. Fruity and fragrant, it is ready to drink and will be delicious this summer.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a particularly successful white Monte Velho. It is rich and creamy, full of ripe apple and refreshing acidity in equal measure. Fruity and fragrant, it is ready to drink and will be delicious this summer.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a full-bodied, fruity selection that's packed with a red berry flavor, soft tannins and a delicious, forward and bright character. It is already ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a full-bodied, fruity selection that's packed with a red berry flavor, soft tannins and a delicious, forward and bright character. It is already ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A classic fruity blend of local Dão grapes including Encruzado and Malvasia, this is a perfumed, ripe wine that is full of pear, melon and citrus flavors. Its tangy texture suggests minerality. Drink now.
title: Seacampo 2014 Casa Américo White (Dão)

description: Fermentation on the grape skins has given this wine a pale gold color. The result is a smooth, oxidative wine with a lightly tannic structure, dominated by apple and citrus fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Roquevale 2015 Branco de Curtimenta White (Alentejo)

description: Fermentation on the grape skins has given this wine a pale gold color. The result is a smooth, oxidative wine with a lightly tannic structure, dominated by apple and citrus fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Roquevale 2015 Branco de Curtimenta White (Alentejo)

description: Grown at 1,800 feet, the vines for this wine benefit from the cool conditions needed to develop aromatic intensity. With crisp acidity combined with spiced pear and nutmeg flavors, it's both tightly textured and very fruity. Drink now.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine has spicy aromas. On the palate, it's creamy and toasty, its ripe fruit and tangy texture giving it richness. Acidity keeps it crisp and fruity. Drink from late 2017.
title: Boas Quintas 2015 Quinta da Fonte do OuroTinto Encruzado (Dão)

description: This wine shows the local Baga grape richly, full of black fruits as well as the more typical dark tannins. The structure is firm, balancing the ripe black plum and spice flavors. This wood-aged wine is now ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2012 Baga (Bairrada)

description: Fermented in open top lagares, this wine shows the smooth and fruity side of Portugal's flagship grape. The tannins are present but muted by ripe black fruit and generous texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Dona Maria Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Lightly aged in oak for four months, this is a fruity wine, with its blackberries and attractive acidity. The tannins and the hints of wood are really a fine supporting act that give the wine shape. Drink this accessible wine now.
title: Sanguinhal 2015 Casabel Red (Lisboa)

description: With 50% of Arinto in the blend, this is rounder and richer in taste than many Vinhos Verdes. It does also have a crisp edge that comes from the citrus tang. The general effect is bright while full in the mouth from the delicious fruit. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Raza Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: With 50% of Arinto in the blend, this is rounder and richer in taste than many Vinhos Verdes. It does also have a crisp edge that comes from the citrus tang. The general effect is bright while full in the mouth from the delicious fruit. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Raza Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Portal's vineyards high above the Douro Valley produce wines that are fresh and poised. This is structured while also fruity wine is firm with tannins and ripe with blackberry fruits. It has acidity, spice from wood aging and a dry aftertaste. The wine can be drunk soon, from late 2016.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Portal's vineyards high above the Douro Valley produce wines that are fresh and poised. This is structured while also fruity wine is firm with tannins and ripe with blackberry fruits. It has acidity, spice from wood aging and a dry aftertaste. The wine can be drunk soon, from late 2016.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Winemaker Francisco Olazabal, from Quinta do Vale Meão is behind this ripe, fruity and stylishly fresh wine. It's a classic blend of Douro grapes with the addition of Sousão (apparent from the dark color and high acidity). It's a wine that would be worth aging a few months, so wait until late 2016 to drink.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Lab Premium Red (Douro)

description: Winemaker Francisco Olazabal, from Quinta do Vale Meão is behind this ripe, fruity and stylishly fresh wine. It's a classic blend of Douro grapes with the addition of Sousão (apparent from the dark color and high acidity). It's a wine that would be worth aging a few months, so wait until late 2016 to drink.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Lab Premium Red (Douro)

description: A success in the sweeter Vinho Verde category. There is pleasant softness, flavors of green berries, grapefruit with sugar and freshness.
title: Messias 2006 Santola White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light and fragrant, a perfumed wine, with flavors of almond and refreshing acidity. It feels warm, with pear and lime flavors combining well.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2009 Branco White (Alenquer)

description: Soft, easy drinking. This red has berry fruits, just the right amount of dusty and juicy flavors. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 What's for Dinner? Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The lightest feeling wine, attractive in its acidity, its slight sweetness and its creamed apple flavor. A perfect summer apéritif.
title: Broadbent 2010 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The lightest feeling wine, attractive in its acidity, its slight sweetness and its creamed apple flavor. A perfect summer apéritif.
title: Broadbent 2010 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A bright, red cherry flavored wine that has fresh fruitiness and a light, if dry, structure. With Trincadeira and Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) dominant, it's a naturally rich with a velvety texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2011 Guadalupe Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A bright, red cherry flavored wine that has fresh fruitiness and a light, if dry, structure. With Trincadeira and Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) dominant, it's a naturally rich with a velvety texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2011 Guadalupe Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A smattering of oak flavors rounds out this naturally warm and tropical fruit flavored wine. It is rich, smooth and opulent in texture, delicious already, but really needing until 2015 to age.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Falcoaria Viognier (Tejo)

description: A smattering of oak flavors rounds out this naturally warm and tropical fruit flavored wine. It is rich, smooth and opulent in texture, delicious already, but really needing until 2015 to age.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Falcoaria Viognier (Tejo)

description: An impressive and elegant wine. It has a delicious line of juicy red and black berry fruits, powered with a fine balance of acidity and firm, chunky tannins. With good potential, give the wine 3–4 years.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Grand'Arte Special Selection Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: An impressive and elegant wine. It has a delicious line of juicy red and black berry fruits, powered with a fine balance of acidity and firm, chunky tannins. With good potential, give the wine 3–4 years.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Grand'Arte Special Selection Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Continuing the succession of fine wines from Aveleda's Quinta da Agueira in Bairrada, this is a powerful, firmly tannic but ultimately smooth wine. It has big ripe swathes of dark plums, figs and refreshing sweet acidity.
title: Aveleda 2007 Follies Touriga Nacional (Bairrada)

description: A selection of grapes and year's wood aging give this wine structure, depth of flavor and aging potential. It has weight, but the acidity is a definite element here, giving a vibrant edge and definition to the rich berry and plum fruits.
title: Apegadas Quinta Velha 2007 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Still young, this is a complex wine. It has layers of dusty tannins, spiced fruits, ripe blackberries and a dark structure. Black chocolate and licorice feed extra richness into the wine. Very smooth aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2007 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A concentrated wine, still just beginning its journey. The fruits are packed into a firm and tannic structure that shows edges of wood. Berry and plum fruits dominate this powerful but well-balanced wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2007 Duas Quintas Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: A concentrated wine, still just beginning its journey. The fruits are packed into a firm and tannic structure that shows edges of wood. Berry and plum fruits dominate this powerful but well-balanced wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2007 Duas Quintas Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: The sweetest style of Madeira still has that wonderful burnt acidity that keeps it from being cloying. So while there is an initial toffee character, the wine then tightens up with orange marmalade and an intense acidity. Drink this beautiful wine now.
title: Cossart Gordon 2008 Colheita Single Harvest Bual (Madeira)

description: The top red from Chocapalha, this comes from a single parcel. It has concentrated tannins, along with the minty flavors that come from new wood. Balancing that combination are the rich fruits: blackberry, damson along with a touch of licorice. It's a powerful wine that needs aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Vinha Mãe Red (Lisboa)

description: Sercial produces the driest style of Madeira. This is certainly a dry wine that gets its richness from concentration and the wood aging. It has spice and old-wood taste as well as wonderfully perfumed spirits and candied lemon. Drink now.
title: Blandy's 2002 Colheita Single Harvest Sercial (Madeira)

description: A smooth, creamy wine that is Burgundian in style, with its judicious use of wood and great structure. The fruits—lemon, yellow and green plum—are beautifully balanced with the tension of the minerality. This wine will develop more complexity with age; drink from 2015.
title: Poeira 2011 Pó de Poeira White (Douro)

description: Powerful and complex, this is solid and impressive, made from a selection of wines. It is dark, dense, full of blackberry fruit and dry tannins. The wood aging still shows in the spiciness, while the tight fruit flavors bring out the acidity. Drink this wine from 2016.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta de Pancas Selecção Enólogo Red (Lisboa)

description: Youthful wine, full of rich berry and black plum flavors. It is concentrated while bursting with exuberant fruits, balanced with acidity. This is a true second wine of Malhadinha Nova, ready to drink now.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2009 Monte da Peceguina Red (Alentejano)

description: This estate is right in the south of the Vinho Verde. That gives the wine extra weight, with added richness from the Avesso grape. The aftertaste brings in crispness.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2009 Avesso White (Vinho Verde)

description: An attractive, fresh wine, the tannins and bright acidity giving a firm support to the lively berry fruits and dry tannin core. The aftertaste continues freshness.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 DFJ Touriga Nacional-Touriga Franca Red (Lisboa)

description: Here in the maritime climate north of Lisbon, Alfrocheiro works well to produce a rich, smooth and velvet textured wine, with a beautiful layer of acidity over the wood.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 DFJ Pinot Noir-Alfrocheiro Red (Lisboa)

description: A fragrant, peach and pineapple flavored wine, it's soft, ripe and creamy with just a touch of smoky toast. Worth aging a few months, but delicious now.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Bucellas Arinto (Bucelas)

description: A fragrant, peach and pineapple flavored wine, it's soft, ripe and creamy with just a touch of smoky toast. Worth aging a few months, but delicious now.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Bucellas Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Castelão is the grape of the Setúbal peninsula, which includes Palmela. This big, chunky, fruity wine gives a rich, maturing character, perfumed with layers of wood. Smoky and meaty, it is ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 JP Private Selection Castelão (Palmela)

description: Floral and fresh, this deliciously fragrant wine bursts with apricots and pineapple as well as lemon zest. Crisp and just plain attractive, it can be drunk now.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selectionada White (Tejo)

description: The Chardonnay and Alvarinho complement each other well, the one bringing a rounded texture, the other adding a fresh and mineral character. Together, they produce a refreshing, ripe wine that has attractive citrus and yellow fruits. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Soft and rounded, the wine is fresh as well as full in the mouth. There is a creamy character to this full and citrusy wine that makes it good as an apéritif.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2012 Quinta da Murta Classico Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Gold in color, this is a mature wine. A tight mousse gives just the right prickle, but its fruitiness is now changing to toastiness bringing a ripe, full aftertaste.
designation: Quinta da Murta Espumante Brut Nature
title: Coteaux da Murta 2011 Quinta da Murta Espumante Brut Nature Arinto (Bucelas)

description: A bold, fruity and juicy wine that is softly ripe. The tannins are well integrated into the black fruits and acidity. It's not a wine that needs to age.
designation: Herdade do Peso Vinhha do Monte
title: Sogrape 2012 Herdade do Peso Vinhha do Monte Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a crisp, fresh and fruity rosé, made from Touriga Nacional in the same region where Vinho Verde is produced. It's vivid acidity is bright, with raspberry flavors and low alcohol.
title: Quinta de Santa Maria 2010 Rosé (Minho)

description: This is a crisp, fresh and fruity rosé, made from Touriga Nacional in the same region where Vinho Verde is produced. It's vivid acidity is bright, with raspberry flavors and low alcohol.
title: Quinta de Santa Maria 2010 Rosé (Minho)

description: A smooth and soft wine that shows some weight to its ripe apricot and lime flavors. It is rounded, with a slight apple-skin texture, and is ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Cape Roca Fish Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A light, bright and breezy wine with an attractive citrus character and tight acidity. Great for an apéritif or with shellfish.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a fine wine, dominated by Alicante Bouschet and packed with black fruits and juicy acidity. It is rich, full while still keeping a great sense of balance and style. The wine can be drunk now, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A wine that is all about crispness, with its green apple slices, pink grapefruit and lime flavors. The sweet acidity gives it shape.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Portada White (Estremadura)

description: Fruity and ripe, this is a spicy wine, with red cherry and berry flavors, livened by dried raisins. There is a rustic edge that puts it simply in its place, but the acidity is fine and so is the dry tannic core.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2006 Farizoa Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe, spicy wine, with attractive, easy black fruits. It is soft and full, with forward fruitiness and sweet tannins. Very ready, very drinkable.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The aromas are on the rustic side for this simple, fresh wine. To taste, the juicy fruit offers a good barbecue wine, with its soft but dry tannins and bright red berry fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2006 Condado das Vinhas Red (Alentejano)

description: Fresh fruits, flavors of bright red berries, with juicy plums and a wild acidity. This is a wine for drinking now, approachable with a sweet, soft aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2007 Monte Velho Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft and on the fat side, this is an easy wine, with its pear and melon flavors, spiced up by some pepper and lime. An attractive, ripe mouthful.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Casa do Lago Fernão Pires (Estremadura)

description: This is a blend of Encruzado, Malvasia and Bical (more commonly found in the coastal vineyards west of the Dão). Smooth and creamy textured, it offers a perfumed mix of mangos and crisp mandarin zest. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2016 Ribeiro Santo Pinha White (Dão)

description: Made from the Moreto grape, this light and fruity wine is a perfect summer rosé. It is crisp with red currant and raspberry fruits, with a delicious layer of acidity. Drink now.
title: Luis Duarte 2016 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Vineyards north of the Douro River deliver an attractive, fruity wine with bright red fruits and a generous core of tannins. The light wood-aging character has smoothed and filled out the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Vineyards north of the Douro River deliver an attractive, fruity wine with bright red fruits and a generous core of tannins. The light wood-aging character has smoothed and filled out the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Wood aging has given this wine a decidedly spicy character. The balance comes from the ripe berry fruit, acidity and general brightness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2015 Pernalta Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Wood aging has given this wine a decidedly spicy character. The balance comes from the ripe berry fruit, acidity and general brightness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2015 Pernalta Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is ripe in red-berry flavors. It is well structured, its tannins integrated into a broad, soft texture. Acidity and fruitiness dominate the finish.
title: Poças 2015 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)

description: Almost black in color, this is a wine with a tarry feel, its tannins soft. It is dense, spicy and smoky, with prune and tangy wood flavors. A tight layer of acidity emerges at the end.
title: Paxá Wines 2008 Quinta do Outeiro Tinto Red (Algarve)

description: A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon as well as Portuguese grapes, this is mineral, with a leathery texture. The red berry fruits are restrained, juicy, laced with light tannins. Ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2007 Dona Maria Red (Alentejano)

description: On the drier side of aged tawnys, this is a wine with wood, dried raisin and noticeable spirit. It has reviving acidity from the wood, just showing rich sweetness on the finish.
title: Cálem NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: On the drier side of aged tawnys, this is a wine with wood, dried raisin and noticeable spirit. It has reviving acidity from the wood, just showing rich sweetness on the finish.
title: Cálem NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: One of the most popular Portuguese brands, made since 1850, this latest vintage is fresh and fruity. It has attractive red berry fruits and a light structure of tannins. This wine is fresh and ready to drink.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita Original Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a pale colored, attractively perfumed wine. With red berry fruit flavors, bright acidity and a lively orange zest texture, it is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a pale colored, attractively perfumed wine. With red berry fruit flavors, bright acidity and a lively orange zest texture, it is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Rosé (Lisboa)

description: While there are some herbal, green flavors here, this wine is more about rich tropical flavors. So peach and pineapple dominate the soft texture and ripe acidity. The aftertaste brings out more minerality and a touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2015 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: While there are some herbal, green flavors here, this wine is more about rich tropical flavors. So peach and pineapple dominate the soft texture and ripe acidity. The aftertaste brings out more minerality and a touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2015 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: Lemon, spice and pepper flavors are the keys to this easy, accessible wine. It is full of fresh fruit that has bitter almond and ripe pear flavors. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2014 Dona Ermelinda White (Palmela)

description: This is a soft, ripe wine, full of fresh fruit. It is a warm blend of Aragonez and Cabernet Sauvignon, balancing tannins and black currant flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Caves da Montanha 2013 Monte do Enforcado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, ripe wine, full of fresh fruit. It is a warm blend of Aragonez and Cabernet Sauvignon, balancing tannins and black currant flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Caves da Montanha 2013 Monte do Enforcado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The 50% Malvasia in the blend gives this wine its perfumed character. It is ripe, touched by honey and spice. The wine has a fine, fresh streak at the end. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection White (Douro)

description: Medium dry, this is a lightly fruity wine. It has sweet apple and light citrus flavors along with a zesty texture. It is soft and bright at the end.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Branco Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A soft wine with red-currant fruits and gentle tannins. It is very ready to drink with a smooth texture, just a hint of dryness and plenty of final acidity.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 Vale das Donas Red (Tejo)

description: Light in color and soft, this is a caramel-flavored wine that is all fruit. It is open and generous, with just a light tang of acidity at the end.
title: Porto Reccua Vinhos NV Réccua Reserva Especial  (Port)

description: This is a fruity, crisp wine. Red currant and candied red-berry fruits fit into a balanced, just off-dry character. The wine is bright with a light sparkle at the end.
title: Obrigado 2015 Nortico Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Showing the warmth of an Alentejo wine, this is ripe and full in the mouth, offering red berry fruits cut with juicy acidity. It's a rich wine tinged with spice, finishing with a fresh aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Showing the warmth of an Alentejo wine, this is ripe and full in the mouth, offering red berry fruits cut with juicy acidity. It's a rich wine tinged with spice, finishing with a fresh aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine shows the characteristic granitic texture of the region. Berry fruits smother the firm tannins to give a rich, juicy wine that's bold, ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Red (Dão)

description: This wine shows the characteristic granitic texture of the region. Berry fruits smother the firm tannins to give a rich, juicy wine that's bold, ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Red (Dão)

description: While the wine is rich, it does show a more austere side, with tight acidity balancing superripe fruit tones. Big berry flavors are contrasted by ripe tannins and a chalky, firm texture. This wine might need to age, so drink after 2015.
title: Monte Branco 2012 Alento Red (Alentejano)

description: While the wine is rich, it does show a more austere side, with tight acidity balancing superripe fruit tones. Big berry flavors are contrasted by ripe tannins and a chalky, firm texture. This wine might need to age, so drink after 2015.
title: Monte Branco 2012 Alento Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine, full of red berry fruits, soft spiciness and attractive acidity. Big, rich and bold, it is a full-bodied and immediately attractive wine that will easily charge through spicy foods.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Azul Portugal Castelão (Palmela)

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine, full of red berry fruits, soft spiciness and attractive acidity. Big, rich and bold, it is a full-bodied and immediately attractive wine that will easily charge through spicy foods.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Azul Portugal Castelão (Palmela)

description: This is a floral, mineral, textured wine, crisp while also full and rounded. Citrus and crisp apple notes are dominant, the wine fragrantly fruity and ripe. A great food wine, with brilliant acidity at the end. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Cape Roca Fish Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This is a floral, mineral, textured wine, crisp while also full and rounded. Citrus and crisp apple notes are dominant, the wine fragrantly fruity and ripe. A great food wine, with brilliant acidity at the end. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Cape Roca Fish Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Bucelas is the home of Arinto and this impressive wood-aged wine from 40-year-old vines brings out the freshness of the grape while adding complexity with toast flavors. It is rich, creamy and smooth, full of green fruits and a layer of citrus. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Boição 2013 Special Selection Old Vineyards Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Soft and rich wine, its perfumes and sweet tannins part of a powerful concentration of rich fruit and wood. Chocolate, black fruits and dry spice are additions to the dense, opaque texture.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2009 Senses Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Warm, soft and fruity, this has notes of spices, soft tannins and a light touch of acidity. Reflecting the warm vineyards of the Alentejo, it is ready to drink now.
title: Conde Villar 2010 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is soft, young and fruity, with a dominating red-plum flavor. It makes for a fine apéritif, with its open, warm and ready-to-drink character.
title: Barão de Vilar NV PV Ruby Port Collections  (Port)

description: This is classic Vinho Verde from the Quinta das Arcas estate. It balances crispness with light sweetness and sparkle. Acidity and an apple-skin texture give it a dancing quality. Screwcap.
title: Conde Villar 2011 Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Spicy toast and wood aromas are the prelude to a wine that is extra soft, velvet almost, only hinting at tannins. The acidity is what gives structure to this wine, the berry and fig flavors rounding it out.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2007 Sexy Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Spicy wine from the wood and from the ripe berry fruits. The acidity is light, a sideshow to the juicy fruit, flavors of nutmeg and red cherries and a fine kick of dry tannin.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Monte Altentejano Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced from 60-year-old vines, this wine has a great balance between crisp acidity and ripe yellow and white stone fruit flavors. It is rich with a touch of toast and spice from wood fermentation and aging. The wine is still young and will be better from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Falcoaria Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a serious blend of Alfrocheiro, Syrah and Touriga Nacional from the Lagoalva estate. Spice and wood go with dark tannins and firm red fruits. It is still a young wine with fine potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: These two great grape varieties make interesting partners. The rich Alvarinho with its apples and cream character balances the perfumed, spicy Viognier to give a harmonious whole. It is a delicious wine, ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Reserva Alvarinho-Viognier White (Tejo)

description: This is an easygoing, ripe and spicy wine. Red-berry fruits and ripe tannins combine to give a rounded wine that is ready to drink.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Maria Mora Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is rich and spicy, with red fruits and soft tannins. Made to drink young, it is full of fruitiness with a layer of acidity. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Encostas do Douro Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, smooth wine is juicy with attractive red fruits. A barnyard character at the back spoils the natural fruitiness. Tannins and blackberry flavors provide a happier finish.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Casaleiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This ripe, smooth wine is juicy with attractive red fruits. A barnyard character at the back spoils the natural fruitiness. Tannins and blackberry flavors provide a happier finish.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Casaleiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Old vines in a field blend are the basis of this dense and concentrated wine. It is powered both by its tannins and by dark black fruits. This is solid, dark and powerful but still young needing plenty of time for the rich fruits to broaden out and mature. Drink starting from 2019.
title: Churchill's 2013 Churchill's Estates Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Acidity cuts through strongly, leaving a wave of freshness. The fruit is less obvious, none the less still delicious and well flavored. It's a balanced wine, the acidity keeping it dry.
title: Borges NV Quinta da Soalheira 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This is an attractive, soft and fruity wine. Described as Extra Bruto—extra dry—it does in fact have a soft and gentle aftertaste that comes from creamed apple and ripe pear flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Loridos Vintage Extra Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: This is an attractive, soft and fruity wine. Described as Extra Bruto—extra dry—it does in fact have a soft and gentle aftertaste that comes from creamed apple and ripe pear flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Loridos Vintage Extra Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: There is a delicious amount of wood aging to this wine, partnering its natural fruitiness with a smoky, toasty character that goes so well with the spirit. It is rich with sweetness as well as acidity, leaving a bitter marmalade aftertaste.
title: Kopke NV Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: There is a delicious amount of wood aging to this wine, partnering its natural fruitiness with a smoky, toasty character that goes so well with the spirit. It is rich with sweetness as well as acidity, leaving a bitter marmalade aftertaste.
title: Kopke NV Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: This ripe wine has currant aromas and a soft texture offering perfumed pears and ripe apricots. It's richly endowed, rounded with a layer of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: This is a tight, tangy wine that has been rounded out by some wood aging (35%). Crisp apples and grapefruit flavors are lifted by tight acidity and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2014 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a tight, tangy wine that has been rounded out by some wood aging (35%). Crisp apples and grapefruit flavors are lifted by tight acidity and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2014 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: This pink-colored wine is attractively fruity with crisp acidity and fresh red currant fruits. It's light, bright and soft with a lightly creamy texture.
title: Dão Sul NV Encontro Brut Rosé Touriga Nacional (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: This pink-colored wine is attractively fruity with crisp acidity and fresh red currant fruits. It's light, bright and soft with a lightly creamy texture.
title: Dão Sul NV Encontro Brut Rosé Touriga Nacional (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: With Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a strongly structured wine. It is dark and tannic, acidity laced with dark plum flavors. This firm wine is still young and should be aged for at least a year, so drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Portuga Red (Lisboa)

description: The Jaen grape, local to the Dão, has produced a perfumed juicy wine that is ripe and intensely full of acidity at the same time. It has only light tannins and red berry flavors that are right up front. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Enxertia Jaen (Dão)

description: Red fruits and spice along with mineral acidity give this wine interest as well as freshness. Juiciness dominates, with subdued tannins behind the wall of fruit. Age maybe for 1–2 years.
title: Castello d'Alba 2009 Red (Douro)

description: Attractive oily, fruity and fresh wine, mineral with green plum flavors touched with lemon. For drinking now to preserve its bright, ripe character.
title: Castello d'Alba 2009 Branco White (Douro)

description: A full, round wine that tastes of the hot, dry climate of the Alentejo, with its ripe fruits, light structure and low acidity. It is a wine for food, its simple textures a great accompaniment to spicy dishes.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marquès de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: The aromas are attractively fresh, while the palate is more towards full, fat fruits. So the green perfume gives way to melon and pear only just touched by citrus acidity. Treat this as a food wine, not an apèritif. This wine was formerly sold under the Cockburn Port brand.
title: Symington Family Estates 2007 Tuella White (Douro)

description: Great depth of flavor with fruit and a layer of mature almond nuttiness. The wine shows some wood, but also dried figs, prunes and some mature acidity. Not quite dry, but edging in that direction.
title: Rozes NV White Reserva  (Port)

description: Great depth of flavor with fruit and a layer of mature almond nuttiness. The wine shows some wood, but also dried figs, prunes and some mature acidity. Not quite dry, but edging in that direction.
title: Rozes NV White Reserva  (Port)

description: With its proper tawny red color, this is an attractively balanced 10-year old, with plenty of fresh fruits as well as wood and almonds. It's delicate, fruity and tastes even better lightly chilled.
title: Poças NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Old vines of Tinta Francisca have produced a generous, full and concentrated wine. It is packed with forward berry fruits and as well as soft tannins that are finely integrated. The end is fresh, and always fruity.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2011 Carvalhas Tinta Francisca (Douro)

description: This is a herbal, earthy wine with as many tannins as fruit at this stage. That gives it a dense, dusty texture that seeps into the ripe, sweet plum flavors. With the wood giving an extra push of richness as well as spice, it needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 D. Fuas Reserva Red (Terras do Dão)

description: This is a serious, wood-aged wine whose ripe fruits are dominated at the moment by heavy toast flavors. The fruit does offer weight and good potential, making it a structured, dark wine that is beginning to suggest a juicy future. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2011 Alma Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This bright pink wine is lightly sweet and full of strawberry flavor. It is crisp, clean and fragrant—delicious as an apéritif. Screwcap.
title: Conde Villar 2011 Rosé Espadeiro (Vinho Verde)

description: The Vinhão's red juice gives this rosé its orange-pink color. It also produces the high acidity that marks this as a wine from the cool north. Light and fruity, it's ready to drink now.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2011 Aphros Rosé Vinhão (Vinho Verde)

description: This pretty, warm wine is touched with caramel and yellow fruit flavors. It gets a kick from crisp lemon zest. Drink in the coming months.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Branco White (Douro)

description: This pretty, warm wine is touched with caramel and yellow fruit flavors. It gets a kick from crisp lemon zest. Drink in the coming months.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Branco White (Douro)

description: Orange-pink in color, this is a warm style of rosé. Its richness is contrasted with the tangy, orange-zest-like acidity. A blend of Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional, it will be ready to drink this winter.
title: Valle Pradinhos 2011 Rosé (Trás-os-Montes)

description: This jammy, fruity offering tastes as though it were made from overripe fruit. Its light structure offers acidity and a Port-like character. Not for aging.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 QV Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Pôpa was the family's nickname for grandpa. The winery, run by grandson Stéphane Ferreira, is the grandkids' tribute. This richly perfumed wine, by consultant Luis Pato, comes from a field blend of 21 grape varieties. Old vines with an average age of 82-years-old in a single parcel have given the wine huge concentration and rich swathes of tannins and black plum and damson fruit. The wine has power while also retaining plenty of elegance. It is an impressive wine, just approaching its peak and ready from 2018.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2013 Pôpa VV Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Pôpa was the family's nickname for grandpa. The winery, run by grandson Stéphane Ferreira, is the grandkids' tribute. This richly perfumed wine, by consultant Luis Pato, comes from a field blend of 21 grape varieties. Old vines with an average age of 82-years-old in a single parcel have given the wine huge concentration and rich swathes of tannins and black plum and damson fruit. The wine has power while also retaining plenty of elegance. It is an impressive wine, just approaching its peak and ready from 2018.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2013 Pôpa VV Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: The top wine from Romaneira shows the power and the richness that can come from this property. Aging for 14 months in wood has just enhanced the opulent black fruits, ripe tannins and acidity. It is an impressive wine, made for aging and not likely to be ready until 2020.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The vineyards of this producer in the heart of Dão, close to Viseu, the capital of the region. This generous wine with its powerful structure and rich texture from the fermentation in stone lagars, is shot through with ripe black plum and damson fruits as well as acidity. It should age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Vinha Paz 2014 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Dominated by Alvarinho, this is a spicy, fruity and tangy wine. It is still young with a tight mineral edge that will soften to bring out a more creamy character. The after-taste, with its fresh citrus, should remain. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Alvarinho-Trajadura Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is still young. Made from old vines and produced in a traditional way with indigenous yeasts, it is a wine that needs to age. It has a rich, concentrated fruitiness along with intense acidity and lemon flavor. The wine is ripe and full. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Nostalgia Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Bringing out the herbaceous side of Alvarinho, this is a freshly crisp wine. It has grapefruit and green apple flavors, with the acidity brightening the texture on the finish.
title: Aveleda 2011 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Rarely used on its own, Alicante Bouschet from the cooler Lisboa region can obviously produce an impressively structured wine. Naturally juicy, the wine also has firmer tannins, damson fruit flavors and balancing acidity. Drink now, or keep until 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Aluado Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: Wood-aged Arinto in the right hands, as here, gives an opulently ripe wine that hints at the richness of Chardonnay. Yellow fruit, pear skin and a touch of toast are beautifully combined to give a full and complex wine that can age. Drink from 2014.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Morgado de Santa Catherina Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: A big, bold and rich Port that is smooth and very plush with a velvet feel. The style is ripe and rounded, a delicious medley of jammy fruits and soft tannins.
title: Fonseca NV Ruby  (Port)

description: This enjoyable blend of wood-aged Chardonnay and Fernão Pires is rich; the two grapes together lend a smooth and creamy wine.
title: Exquisite Wines 2010 Hobby White (Tejo)

description: Initially tannic, this concentrated wine shows itself to be young, with its structure still waiting to open. A dry texture lies over the big berry flavors that will develop over the next year.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2010 Monsaraz Red (Alentejo)

description: Ripe and jammy, with black-fruit, herb and licorice flavors, this wood-aged wine is superrich. It's heavy and full bodied, with dark tannins and a juicy fruit element.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a very fruity, very ripe wine, its tannins smothered by richness. There is powerful structure and perfumed fruit, making for great tension, minerality and total pleasure. Opulent and ripe.
title: Alves de Sousa 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a very fruity, very ripe wine, its tannins smothered by richness. There is powerful structure and perfumed fruit, making for great tension, minerality and total pleasure. Opulent and ripe.
title: Alves de Sousa 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A solid, chunky wine, its tannins giving a tight edge of dryness. Acidity and really juicy fruit make the wine accessible, with great dried raisins coming through strongly and deliciously.
title: Quinta do Noval 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A full-bodied wine, showing the richness and super-ripe grapes of 2003. It is soft, with dusty tannins showing through the ripe damsons and almost jammy character. It's all well in balance.
title: Poças 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: One of a series of releases of single harvest wines, this smooth, wood-aged Port is rich and still full of fruit. Ripe date and raisin flavors are lifted by acidity, with flavors from the wood aging giving great balance. Tawny in character, this beautiful wine is complex and ready to drink.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1966 Single Harvest  (Port)

description: From a 50-year-old vineyard, this blend of mostly Douro white grapes has serious wood-aged aromas, layers of toast and spice along with lightly oxidized white-stone fruits. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and ready to drink.
title: Wine & Soul 2014 Guru White (Douro)

description: From a 50-year-old vineyard, this blend of mostly Douro white grapes has serious wood-aged aromas, layers of toast and spice along with lightly oxidized white-stone fruits. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and ready to drink.
title: Wine & Soul 2014 Guru White (Douro)

description: The land of wolves, Terra de Lobos, is a dense, balanced wine that brings together acidity and fresh red berry fruits. The tannins are not aggressive, but are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: The land of wolves, Terra de Lobos, is a dense, balanced wine that brings together acidity and fresh red berry fruits. The tannins are not aggressive, but are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and with hints of licorice and dark chocolate. The spice from the wood aging still shows strongly although that will integrate over the next few months. Drink this ripe wine from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine has a rustic character that contrasts with the ripe tannins and red berry fruits. At three years, the wine is ready to drink with structure and fruitiness shadowed by the earthy aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)

description: Light and fruity, the wine has a smooth edge that is cut with acidity. It is an immediately accessible wine with a lzesty lemon finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Light and fruity, the wine has a smooth edge that is cut with acidity. It is an immediately accessible wine with a lzesty lemon finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is the entry-level red from this estate in the heart of the Dão region. Its red-berry fruits are bright, bursting from the glass, bringing a firmer tannic core and a mineral texture. The wine is a typical blend of the region with Touriga Nacional, Alfrocheiro and Jaen. The oak aging has given the wine a smooth ripe aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Boas Quintas 2016 Fonte do Ouro Red (Dão)

description: The estate around the former royal palace of Carmo is in the heart of Alentejo. Its white wine is a easygoing blend of Roupeiro, Antão Vaz and Arinto, giving ripeness, yellow and white-fruit flavors and a vibrant bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Quinta do Carmo White (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich oak-aged wine. Its black-fruit flavors are surrounded by firm still-young tannins. It has weight, richness from ripe black plum and berry fruits. It could do with some further aging and will be better from 2019.
title: Adega Vila Real 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The wine has blackberry fruits that give attractive acidity and add to the light structure. It is fruity, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Capitão Rayeo Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine has blackberry fruits that give attractive acidity and add to the light structure. It is fruity, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Capitão Rayeo Red (Alentejano)

description: Aged for six months in wood, this juicy wine with its red-berry fruits is stylish and full bodied. It has tannins that act as a support to the bold fruits and firm structure. That suggests the wine, although ready to drink now, will also age. Drink now or keep until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Capitão Rayeo Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Aged for six months in wood, this juicy wine with its red-berry fruits is stylish and full bodied. It has tannins that act as a support to the bold fruits and firm structure. That suggests the wine, although ready to drink now, will also age. Drink now or keep until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Capitão Rayeo Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This fragrant wine is a an unusual blend of Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Malvasia. That combination of northern and southern Europe works to give a crisp wine that is also intensely perfumed as well as full of acidity. It is an attractive wine that is already drinkable.
title: Valle Pradinhos 2016 Reserva White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: This fragrant wine is a an unusual blend of Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Malvasia. That combination of northern and southern Europe works to give a crisp wine that is also intensely perfumed as well as full of acidity. It is an attractive wine that is already drinkable.
title: Valle Pradinhos 2016 Reserva White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: This wine is crisp in lemon acidity while also having a strong, tight mineral texture. Produced from Arinto and Antão Vaz, it has bright grapefruit and apple flavors, with hints of exotic apricot and pineapple. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 White (Península de Setúbal)

description: The blend of Chardonnay and Fernão Pires gives this wine an attractive, textured character. It is full of ripe and creamy yellow fruit and citrus, with a streak of crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Branco White (Tejo)

description: Eighteen months in wood plus long bottle aging have produced a serious, dense and rich wine. It is perfumed and dark, certainly ready to drink, full of black fruits and hints of wood. There is a dark core of solid tannins surrounded by the generous fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2008 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: With six months of oak aging, this wine has both richness and spicy concentration. It is densely structured and solid with tannins. The black fruits are spreading through the wine, giving another element of richness. Dark and dense, the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: With 50% new oak aging, this is a rich and spicy wine that also has layers of dense toastiness. Black currants and blackberries come together with the structure and fine acidity to give a rich, concentrated wine that should still age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Maçanita Vinhos 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: With 50% new oak aging, this is a rich and spicy wine that also has layers of dense toastiness. Black currants and blackberries come together with the structure and fine acidity to give a rich, concentrated wine that should still age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Maçanita Vinhos 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This eight-year old wine, based on Touriga Nacional, is ripe, now mature with the tannins fully integrated into the rich black fruit. It is firm with a structure that gives concentration and perfumed acidity. The wine is still dark and dense although ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2008 Dona Georgina Red (Dão)

description: This eight-year old wine, based on Touriga Nacional, is ripe, now mature with the tannins fully integrated into the rich black fruit. It is firm with a structure that gives concentration and perfumed acidity. The wine is still dark and dense although ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2008 Dona Georgina Red (Dão)

description: Attractive, clean and fruity, this has pear and peach flavors; its aromatic intensity comes from the 30% Viognier in the blend. This is smooth, with just a bite of citrusy acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Periquita Branco White (Setubal)

description: An easy, fruity wine, this is full of blackberry and red currant flavors. Its fruitiness is tempered with a firm tannic core that gives a light structure.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is ripe and fresh, with stalky fruit and balanced acidity. It tastes young, perfumed and very fruity. Black plums and blackberry flavors are integrated with the firm tannins at the end. The wine will develop well, so drink now for the fruit or age until 2018 for the maturity.
title: Barros 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Packed with ripe blackberry fruits, this is a dense, concentrated wine. It has a powerful structure that is filled out with delicious jammy fruits. The wine is perfumed and fresh with acidity while keeping its solid, dark character that is at its heart. Drink now, although the wine will be even better from 2018.
title: Barão de Vilar 2011 Statement  (Port)

description: A warm, sunny blend of local grapes, this is ripe while still having a fresh, fruity character. The acidity at the end reinforces this contrast between richness and crispness. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: An attractively perfumed wine, it is lively with bright acidity, yello fruits and crisp citrus. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 EA Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Aged for four months in wood, this is a spicy wine that has ripe red berry fruits and dark color from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend. Rich and full, it is a warm wine, ready for winter drinking.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Rebelde Red (Alentejano)

description: Aged for four months in wood, this is a spicy wine that has ripe red berry fruits and dark color from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend. Rich and full, it is a warm wine, ready for winter drinking.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Rebelde Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an orange wine, fermented in open tanks. Flavors of oranges and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. The wine has a tight texture as well as spice and hints of its wood aging. Drink from 2017.
designation: Herdade São Miguel Art. Terra Curtimenta
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade São Miguel Art. Terra Curtimenta White (Alentejano)

description: This is Sauvignon Blanc with a cool, herbal twist to it. It is crisp, full of green stone fruits, along with a lively lemon juicy acidity. Perfumed and packed with fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

description: From a group of estates that has properties in the Douro, Lisboa and Beira, this wine is finely structured and richly textured. It has layers of tannins supporting its dense berry fruit. With its juicy acidity and black currant flavor, it's likely to age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This smooth, rich and ripe wine conveys a strong feeling of power. Weight and concentration from black plum fruit and dark tannins are freshened by acidity. Solidly textured, this big, beefy number will be ready to drink by the end of 2015.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is heavily wood dominated. Toast and juice come from wood as much as fruit at this stage. Behind this, generous yellow fruits and a ripe, full-bodied character will lead to a ripe and complex wine. It needs aging, so don't drink before 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Secretum
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Secretum White (Douro)

description: Deep, dusty wine, tannins dominating the fruit, giving a tough feel. There are some black currant flavors, but only just a hint. This definitely needs time to soften and broaden; give it 4–5 years.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2006 Post Scriptum Red (Douro)

description: Deep, dusty wine, tannins dominating the fruit, giving a tough feel. There are some black currant flavors, but only just a hint. This definitely needs time to soften and broaden; give it 4–5 years.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2006 Post Scriptum Red (Douro)

description: This is a wood-aged wine, with a spicy character, that's rich with both generous tannins and black fruits. It has a ripe fruity character with plenty of balancing acidity and a warm full-bodied aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Solo Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: The low-yield old vines of the quinta have produced a dense wine with firm tannins. Young and with good potential, the wine is a blend of four Douro grapes, dominated by Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. Unoaked, it is rich and firm, all ripe blackberry fruits with a cut of acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Borges 2015 Quinta da Soalheira Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez, this is open, generous and easy. It has attractive red fruits that are balanced by acidity and a soft tannic backbone. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: Rather lean, with high acidity, the wine has red currant fruits, a taut texture and a light spice character.
title: Roquevale 2007 Tinto da Talha Red (Alentejo)

description: A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional , this has a vivid pink color, and a soft, aromatic character. It is ripe and crisp, packed with strawberry juice fruit.
title: Falua 2009 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional , this has a vivid pink color, and a soft, aromatic character. It is ripe and crisp, packed with strawberry juice fruit.
title: Falua 2009 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a light, fresh and crisply fruity wine. It is dominated by lime and ripe lemon flavors that come from the bright blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto. Not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a light, fresh and crisply fruity wine. It is dominated by lime and ripe lemon flavors that come from the bright blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto. Not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is an intensely fruity wine that is lemon scented, crisp and very fresh. It has a strong citrus flavor, with touches of orange zest and red apples. Not for aging, this light, bright wine is ready to drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo)

description: On the nose, this is rough and rustic. If the palate is less obviously barnyard, it still carries something of that character, with blackberry and wood flavors along with spicy accents. The wine is still young, so the rough edges could smooth out. Drink from 2015.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft, fruity wine that shows sweet berry aromas and gentle tannins to taste. The Trincadeira gives delicious juiciness and ripe, generous flavors. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2009 Vinhas Velhas Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: A soft style of Vinho Verde that is open and rounded. There is, of course, plenty of crisp citrus fruits, but these are accompanied by riper yellow fruits and a gentle texture. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Vera 2012 White (Vinho Licoroso)

description: A powerful blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez, rich and mellow, sweet fruits tempered by tight tannins and spice. The wine has a fine, juicy aftertaste to enhance the freshness.
title: Parras Vinhos 2008 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This single vineyard Vinho Verde is complex and powerful. The texture is creamy, rich, with hints of pineapple as well as grapefruit. There is an edgy texture, balanced with the crispest final acidity.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta de Simaens White (Vinho Verde)

description: A soft, rounded melon and pear flavored wine. Very fruity, it is rich, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Monte da Cal Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fruit dominates this bright, ripe wine. Cherries, red berries and a sprig of rosemary give freshness and fruitiness. The structure comes through with firm tannins that lie behind all this deliciousness.
title: Monte Branco 2011 Alento Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Fruit dominates this bright, ripe wine. Cherries, red berries and a sprig of rosemary give freshness and fruitiness. The structure comes through with firm tannins that lie behind all this deliciousness.
title: Monte Branco 2011 Alento Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: From vines in the Douro Superior, a soft, rich wine, polished with black cherry and wood. It is finely concentrated, flavored with spice, tarragon and a final solid, chunky structure.
title: Sogevinus 2007 Curva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: An elegant, finely rounded wine, with firm tannins as well as fresh acidity. There is a solid, dark structured edge, the damson fruit flavors richly integrated into the texture.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2008 Red (Douro)

description: A smooth, ripe and accessible Port that balances its raisins and other dried fruits with a drier, denser character. This well-made, generous wine can be drunk now.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria NV Sarzedinho Reserve  (Port)

description: The aroma profile shows typical Pinot Noir red cherries while the palate has a juicy character that brings out soft tannins and cool-climate acidity. Although it is a fruity wine with gentle structure, it does need to age until 2015.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Pinot Noir (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: The aroma profile shows typical Pinot Noir red cherries while the palate has a juicy character that brings out soft tannins and cool-climate acidity. Although it is a fruity wine with gentle structure, it does need to age until 2015.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Pinot Noir (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This wine veers between richness and austerity. Ripe berry fruits contrast with a tough core and dry tannins. It comes from the mountain region in northeast of Portugal, which explains the structured aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Arcossó 2010 Padrão dos Povos Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: Normally used to provide dark color to blended wines, 100% Sousão rarely appears outside its home in Vinho Verde. This example from Vallado, almost black in color, shows the high acidity of the grape. It also shows an unexpectedly richly tannic character that gives structure and releases black plum flavors. It needs to age until 2017.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2012 Sousão (Douro)

description: Oddly packed in what could be a gin bottle, the wine inside is anything but peculiar. It's a serious wine with firm tannins and a dense structure. Black plum and berry fruits are powered by minerality and a solid structure. This is a wine to age for a few more years; drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pessegueiro 2011 Red (Douro)
