description: This new wine is produced at Quinta de Pancas in the Lisboa region. It is soft, fruity and created to be drunk young. Bright red fruits and attractive acidity give a crisp wine ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Azulado Red (Lisboa)

description: This fruity blend shows spice from oak aging and black-currant flavors. Soft and only lightly textured, it is a wine to drink young to benefit from the fruitiness.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Paseo of Portugal Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an attractive blend of grapes from different regions of Portugal. It is light, with crisp acidity and refreshing lemon fruit. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This is an attractive blend of grapes from different regions of Portugal. It is light, with crisp acidity and refreshing lemon fruit. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Produced in central Alentejo in the warm region of Redondo, this is a surprisingly cool, crisp wine. Its blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto give plenty of acidity and citrus flavors. Green plum adds an extra richness. Drink this wine now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Produced in central Alentejo in the warm region of Redondo, this is a surprisingly cool, crisp wine. Its blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto give plenty of acidity and citrus flavors. Green plum adds an extra richness. Drink this wine now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Produced at the Quinta do Gradil estate, this is a crisp, stalky and fruity wine. Black currants and hedgerow berry fruits are pushed forward by acidity. A hint of light wood aging helps smooth out the otherwise mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2014 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: More often found in the central Dão region, this version from the Alentejo shows a ripe red fruit and blackberry richness. Surrounded by balanced spice and wood, the wine is young and fruity. It will be better from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: This is a hugely dense wine, still firm with its dusty tannins and solid with concentrated black fruits. Despite all this power, the wine has style and a sense of elegance that will stand it in good stead as it matures. It is certainly not yet ready and should be aged until 2019.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2012 Talentus Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: The Moscatel in this blend shows strongly, bringing out perfumed aromas. The wine has spice, light acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Gâmbia 2012 White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Still close to ruby in color and flavor, it also tastes young. That gives it freshness, red berry fruits and some tight acidity. Dried sultanas hint at the tawny wood aging. Like all tawnies it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Still close to ruby in color and flavor, it also tastes young. That gives it freshness, red berry fruits and some tight acidity. Dried sultanas hint at the tawny wood aging. Like all tawnies it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Made in a richer style, it is bone dry and with a creamy texture, apricot fruit flavors as well as the right, crisp acidity. The wine is fresh, fruity and, of course, needs to be drunk now.
title: LIV 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A 100% Petit Verdot is a rare event. Here in Bairrada, close to the ocean, the grape produces a structured, dense wine with serious blackberry fruits and dark tannins. It is deeply colored, ripe with bold fruitiness as well as acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Campolargo 2009 Diga? Tinto Petit Verdot (Bairrada)

description: Red plum flavors are spiced with wood aging and enlivened by zesty acidity. It is a fruity, lightly structured wine showing rich fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2014 Merlot (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh and fruity wine that has ripe berry fruits that are shot through with acidity. This wine is developing fast and will be ready to drink from the end of 2016.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Vinha da Defesa Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fresh, fruity and juicy wine. Shot through with citrus flavors, it is light and crisp. The wine has a nervy texture that gives a great lift on the finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Espaço Rural 2014 Bojador Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a big, jammy wine that is rich in fruit while also full of tannin. It has a ripe, jelly character that sits uncomfortably with the acidity and dry structure. It needs to balance out, so drink from 2018.
title: Barão de Vilar 2011 Maynard's Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine, packed with red berry fruits, strawberries and fresh raspberries. While fresh and crisp, there is decent roundness to the palate. Drink now.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2014 Assobio Red (Douro)

description: This wine is made to be enjoyed young and fruity—it is a ripe, generous and full-bodied blend of Douro red grapes. There is a dry edge of tannins which are cushioned by the rich black fruits and lifted by final acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)

description: From the range of single-varietal bottlings from Alorna, this wine is perfumed and crisp, with bright lemon and tangy citrus flavors. It is a delicious, young, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Verdelho (Tejo)

description: A hugely structured and powerful wine, this wine comes from old vines at Herdade do Espoão's Douro vineyard. It is rich in black fruits and firm tannins and is still young. There is strength and virility in this sinewy wine with its dark structure and density. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2012 VV 47 Red (Douro)

description: This is a field blend from the steep Quinta da Foz vineyard at the mouth of the Pinhão River. Aged from two years in new wood, this impressive, structured wine is just setting out on its aging process. Big tannins and big fruit are all there, packed into dense tannins and a mineral texture. It will age well, don't drink before 2019.
title: Quinta da Foz 2012 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is an astonishing wine for its age. It shines with fruit and with rich toffee flavors that are balanced by acidity. It's a warm, ripe wine, intense and concentrated. The dryness of such a long wood aging (the wine was only bottled in 2015) is really only a background to the richness.
title: Burmester 1952 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: This wine is dominated by Touriga Nacional, which offers a backbone of dark tannins that gives it a firm structure and will allow it to age for many years. Produced in open stone lagares, it has richness and impressive opulence in black fruit tones that are cut by juicy acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2013 Red (Douro)

description: Richly fruity, quite sweet with red berry fruits and light acidity. There is a soft character and an attractive, easy finish.
title: Quevedo NV Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: A wine that is beginning to show its age, with yeast and toast dominating the fresh acidity and the broad, creamy character. It has a light texture, with a bite of steel to give the wine a final shape.
title: Raposeira 1999 Velha Reserva Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Firmly dry wine but unfocused, the tannins dominating the fruit to a give a very dry character. It could just be a young bottling that needs time to soften and open.
title: Poças NV Special Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: Firmly dry wine but unfocused, the tannins dominating the fruit to a give a very dry character. It could just be a young bottling that needs time to soften and open.
title: Poças NV Special Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: This fruity red wine is one of Portugal's best sellers. Along with its red fruit and attractive acidity it is soft with just an edge of tannins. Drink this young wine now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)

description: This fruity red wine is one of Portugal's best sellers. Along with its red fruit and attractive acidity it is soft with just an edge of tannins. Drink this young wine now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is dry, and firm with tannins still masking the fruit. With its dark coffee flavor it has been heavily extracted and this needs to soften before the wine will be ready. Look for the berry fruits and acidity as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Solar de Cambres 2011 Casa de Cambres Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This mint and red-berry-flavored wine is still firm with tannins. The juicy black-currant character is lifted by acidity, but the dry core is persistent and likely to remain. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2010 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This structured wine is firm, with still-young tannins. Perfumed black fruits—a blend of Castelão, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional—are crisp, with plenty of acidity. With its dry core, the wine will age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Falcoaria Clássico Red (Tejo)

description: This structured wine is firm, with still-young tannins. Perfumed black fruits—a blend of Castelão, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional—are crisp, with plenty of acidity. With its dry core, the wine will age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Falcoaria Clássico Red (Tejo)

description: This structured wine shows firm tannins as well as plenty of black fruit. At the same time, it has a sense of balance and elegance, as well as crispness that counteracts the ripe, juicy fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Red (Alentejano)

description: With six months in wood, this wine shows a strongly spicy character that gives a toast taste. The fruit is still developing, although it shows promise with its rich tannins and black-currant flavors. Wait until 2018 before drinking to let it live up to its potential.
title: Global Wines 2015 Grilos Reserva Red (Dão)

description: The wood is showing strongly in this young wine. But then so is the bold ripe black fruit. Put the two together as they integrate and this will be a rich full wine with juicy acidity as well as plenty of spice. Drink from 2018.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich wine, a reminder of the warmth of the Alentejo. That's reinforced by the cork label made from the other major product of the region. It is perfumed, smooth and with hints of apricots as well as brighter pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 São Miguel do Sul White (Alentejano)

description: The second wine of Jorge Moreira's Poeira is rich and smooth, the bright berry fruits sinking into a cushiony texture. The acidity and smoky wood provide a counterpoint to its firm, youthful tannins.
title: Poeira 2008 Pó de Poeira Red (Douro)

description: Licorice and dark chocolate flavors emerge with firm tannins cutting through the balanced fruit and acidity. Flavors are also of black cherry, damson and perhaps mineral. The wine needs decanting.
title: Casa Cadaval 2008 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: Based on Cercial, here is a rounded, smooth wine with a delicious perfume. Warm, ripe and delicious, this shows wood hints, peaches and green herbs. Keep for a year.
title: Campolargo 2009 Branco White (Bairrada)

description: Certainly rich, but also finely structured, it keeps its exuberant fruit firmly in check with dry tannins, dense texture and a fresh edge of acidity. With this structure, this is a great, rich, meat-friendly wine.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Quinta do Encontro Encontro I Red (Bairrada)

description: Certainly rich, but also finely structured, it keeps its exuberant fruit firmly in check with dry tannins, dense texture and a fresh edge of acidity. With this structure, this is a great, rich, meat-friendly wine.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Quinta do Encontro Encontro I Red (Bairrada)

description: A wine that balances mature acidity with ripe apples, dried prunes and marmalade flavors. It neatly sits between freshness and maturity, a delicious balance.
title: Quinta do Infantado NV White  (Port)

description: A wine that balances mature acidity with ripe apples, dried prunes and marmalade flavors. It neatly sits between freshness and maturity, a delicious balance.
title: Quinta do Infantado NV White  (Port)

description: The Madeira regulations say that 10-years old is the age of the youngest part of the blend. So this richly sweet Malmsey contains many older wines. These are shown in the old gold color, the proper citrus acidity and the dryness that goes with wood aging. At the end, though, the liquid honey flavors are dominant.
title: Broadbent NV Malmsey 10 Years Old Madeira (Madeira)

description: The Madeira regulations say that 10-years old is the age of the youngest part of the blend. So this richly sweet Malmsey contains many older wines. These are shown in the old gold color, the proper citrus acidity and the dryness that goes with wood aging. At the end, though, the liquid honey flavors are dominant.
title: Broadbent NV Malmsey 10 Years Old Madeira (Madeira)

description: Toffee, caramel and good maturity on this sophisticated wine. There is a spirit edge, but it works because the fruit is subservient to the maturity, ripeness and richness. The aftertaste is just perfumed.
title: Wiese & Krohn NV Lagrima  (Port)

description: Very light, actually nearly translucent. Aromatics of caramel and butter lead into a super-sweet palate with plenty of vanilla and caramel flavors. The texture is creamy and there's ample woody character along with toasted nuts on the finish. It's quite sweet, yet structured.
title: Osborne NV Special Reserve Master of Port Port (Douro)

description: A light and gently fruity perfumed wine, this has easy flavors of spice, pears and soft acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Branco White (Tejo)

description: A light and gently fruity perfumed wine, this has easy flavors of spice, pears and soft acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Branco White (Tejo)

description: Almost bubbly with a lively mousse, this is a tangy citrus and apple flavored wine that is unfortunately unbalanced with an artificial sweetness at the end.
title: Campelo 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is soft, light and stalky. It is made to be drunk young with its fresh red berry fruits, acidity and only a minimum of tannins. Drink now.
title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A fruity, young and crisp wine that is all about raspberry and red currant fruits. It is fresh with just a hint of caramel and with bright acidity at the end.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monta da Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: The wine is soft, lightly textured and perfumed. It has yellow fruits and ripe pear flavors along with a touch of ginger and spice. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2014 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada White (Bairrada)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, this is a soft wine, fruity with ripe red and white fruit flavors. It is a light wine with only a hint of tannin, much more in the way of gentle fruitiness.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Rosé (Alentejano)

description: The initial shock is of intense acidity. Only after a while, do the structure and the fruit show. It makes this an unbalanced wine, the structure out of kilter with the fruit.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2011 Vargosa Red (Douro)

description: The estate wine from Casal Branco is impressive and structured, with dried berry fruits, dark, dry tannins and a solid structure. The acidity is very present, helping to keep the wine fresh, but the complex dark flavors and spice are certainly there to allow the wine to age over the next 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 Red (Ribatejo)

description: Dark fruits are the backbone of this fine wine, with flavors of blueberries, black cherry and figs along with smooth, polished wood. It is certainly big and dense, the tannins soft but concentrated. The finish is juicy and fruity, but dry.
title: CARM 2004 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This pure Touriga Nacional is perfumed, firmly tannic and packed with the tight, mineral character typical of the region. Richly fruity with juicy black currant flavor, it's still developing and will be best from 2019.
designation: Quinta da Fonte do Ouro Reserva Especial
title: Boas Quintas 2014 Quinta da Fonte do Ouro Reserva Especial Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: This pure Touriga Nacional is perfumed, firmly tannic and packed with the tight, mineral character typical of the region. Richly fruity with juicy black currant flavor, it's still developing and will be best from 2019.
designation: Quinta da Fonte do Ouro Reserva Especial
title: Boas Quintas 2014 Quinta da Fonte do Ouro Reserva Especial Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Who can resist a wine called the Lovers' Vineyard? Finely aged in wood, it comes from the highest point of the Santar estate and is rich in yellow fruit and toasty spice. Creamy, smooth and lightly tangy, it needs another few months to mature. Drink from 2018.
designation: Casa de Santar Vinha dos Amores
title: Global Wines 2014 Casa de Santar Vinha dos Amores Encruzado (Dão)

description: A fat, soft wine that isn't fresh enough. There are some sweet strawberry flavors, a touch of caramel and a metallic edge.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2013 Vila Jardim Rosé (Tejo)

description: Very juicy and full of acidity, it has an unpleasant metallic edge that gives a bitter aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Portuga Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is rustic, full of barnyard flavors and tannins. The fruit doesn't come through at all.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2012 Monte da Peceguina Red (Alentejano)

description: A bright pink colored rosé, this blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, has strawberry flavors and a touch of sweetness from the ripe fruits that is balanced with an attractive acidity. Enjoy with food rather than as an aperitif.
title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: Light and fresh with soft tannins, this is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine. It has layers of acidity over red fruits.
title: Borges 2009 Meia Encosta Red (Dão)

description: Fresh and fruity rosé, full of wild strawberry flavors cut through with acidity. There is a light touch of tannin to give an extra texture.
title: Terra d'Alter 2010 Fado Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This wine offers berries, black currants and just a hint of greenness. It has fruitiness and a dry structure, just not the weight of the vintage.
title: Smith Woodhouse 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: While the year is not one of the great Port vintages, it has produced some finely structured wines like this that will mature relatively quickly. It comes with great fruit that was teased out of the grapes in traditional open stone lagars. It is, of course, dense and full of tannins as well as fruit. It will develop well and could be drinkable soon (say by 2018) for its fruit although it will then age for many years until 2030 and beyond.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2013 Vintage  (Port)

description: While the year is not one of the great Port vintages, it has produced some finely structured wines like this that will mature relatively quickly. It comes with great fruit that was teased out of the grapes in traditional open stone lagars. It is, of course, dense and full of tannins as well as fruit. It will develop well and could be drinkable soon (say by 2018) for its fruit although it will then age for many years until 2030 and beyond.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2013 Vintage  (Port)

description: Due to its location near the western end of the Douro vineyards, this vineyard makes very fine white wines. This one is at the top, with wood fermentation and aging giving richness, intense flavors and a fine structure. It's a wine that demands serious aging—ripe and full of zesty acidity as well as toast and spice flavors. Start drinking this impressive wine from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Rede 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Due to its location near the western end of the Douro vineyards, this vineyard makes very fine white wines. This one is at the top, with wood fermentation and aging giving richness, intense flavors and a fine structure. It's a wine that demands serious aging—ripe and full of zesty acidity as well as toast and spice flavors. Start drinking this impressive wine from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Rede 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Blending Aragonez with Touriga Nacional has produced a magnificently structured wine, big and bold and packed with dark fruits. The wood aging and the firm tannins show strongly even after four years and the wine obviously needs aging. There is a fine, juicy backdrop that will develop to give a serious, complex and impressive wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Dark gold in color, rich and on the dry side, this is a very fine wine from a family-owned quinta close to Régua. The long wood aging has introduced great concentration to the dried fruits and burnt toffee flavors. Marmalade and surprising freshness give the wine a lift. It is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Devesa NV 30 Years Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a limited production wine—a selection of the winemakers. It is still very young, structured and rich. The tannins are firm and solid at this stage giving the basis for a ripe and fruity wine to develop. It's an impressive wine that can be drunk soon, although which will also age well. Drink from late 2016 and until 2024.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Escolha dos Enólogos
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Escolha dos Enólogos Red (Alentejano)

description: This dry, mature wine tastes older than a 10-Year-Old, with complex wood aging, spirit and acidity that have taken over from the fruitiness. It is serious and structured.
title: Burmester NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: A perfumed Moscatel, it features spice, honeyed fruitiness and a strong spirit character. When it was bottled, it had just begun to exhibit the old-wood aging flavors and resulting acidity.it offers a delicious orange-peel aftertaste.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2002 Colheita  (Moscatel de Setúbal)

description: Smoky aromas reveal the essence of this wood-aged wine. The wood is well integrated, balanced with the fruitiness that is characteristic of a 10-Year-Old tawny. Ripe sultanas and great acidity at the end bring this wine to a balanced, delicious close.
title: Messias NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Subtle wood-aging flavors ally with rich, tropical fruits. The rounded texture is suffused with acidity as well as a warm, broad character. From the Dão's premier white grape, it is already delicious although it will improve through 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Ribeiro Santo Encruzado (Dão)

description: The latest vintage of one of the original wine brands in the Douro, this bold wine offers great tannins and structure along with the ripe black fruits. Balanced and generous, it is developing quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: The latest vintage of one of the original wine brands in the Douro, this bold wine offers great tannins and structure along with the ripe black fruits. Balanced and generous, it is developing quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: This is a fruity, attractive wine from a venture started in 2000 by Abilio Tavares da Silva. With well-integrated tannins, bold black fruit and a spicy character that comes through strongly, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta Foz Torto 2013 Foz Torto Red (Douro)

description: This blend includes the Rhône varietal Roussanne among the Portuguese grapes. The wine has a lightly honeyed character as well as rich yellow and stewed-pear flavors. A touch of toastiness and almonds comes through the rich fruits and acidity. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2015 Estate Collection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe wine, very balanced and integrated. It conveys yellow fruits along with tangerine and juicy pear. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from mid-2017.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2015 Lybra Viognier-Arinto-Marsanne White (Lisboa)

description: This is a smooth, richly fruity wine. Spice from wood aging and soft tannins give balance and concentration. Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2013 Lybra Syrah (Lisboa)

description: This is a smooth, ripe take on the often-wild Baga grape. It has some tannins and layers of acidity over the red-berry fruits. Bright and textured with minerality, this impressive wine is balanced and ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2013 Baga (Bairrada)

description: The Ataíde estate in the Alto Douro is one of the rare Douro vineyards to be relatively flat. From old vines, it produces a solid, structured and rich wine, with ripe swathes of plum and berry fruits that are structured by firm tannins. Young and fruity, this will age well, although it is drinkable now.
designation: Altano Quinta do Ataíde Made With Organic Grapes
title: Symington Family Estates 2012 Altano Quinta do Ataíde Made With Organic Grapes Red (Douro)

description: Spicy wood-aging flavors dominate this wine. It is rich, almost too rich and pushy for its own good, seeming to be more opulent than previous vintages. Nutmeg dominates more than the pineapple and apricot fruit flavors. It could settle down, although it will always be larger than life.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Mirabilis Grand Reserva White (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Spicy wood-aging flavors dominate this wine. It is rich, almost too rich and pushy for its own good, seeming to be more opulent than previous vintages. Nutmeg dominates more than the pineapple and apricot fruit flavors. It could settle down, although it will always be larger than life.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Mirabilis Grand Reserva White (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This is the entry-level wine at Vallado, one of the Douro's top quintas. Full of berry fruits, it also has layers of tannins and acidity, but is rich and soft enough now not to need much aging. Although it could be drunk now, it will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2012 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: This is the entry-level wine at Vallado, one of the Douro's top quintas. Full of berry fruits, it also has layers of tannins and acidity, but is rich and soft enough now not to need much aging. Although it could be drunk now, it will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2012 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: From vineyards in the southern Minho, close to the Douro Valley, this blend of Loureiro and Arinto is rich and full in the mouth. It has spice from wood aging as well as crisp apple and pear flavors that are laced with pink grapefruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: From vineyards in the southern Minho, close to the Douro Valley, this blend of Loureiro and Arinto is rich and full in the mouth. It has spice from wood aging as well as crisp apple and pear flavors that are laced with pink grapefruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: This has some of the concentration you would expect from old vines, along with a lighter, fresher character that gives the wine a lift. It's as much young and fruity as structured, a well-balanced wine that will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This is a really refreshing, crisp and fruity wine. It achieves a good balance between acidity and lively red berries and lime juice. The wine dances brightly in the glass and would make a good apéritif.
title: Campolargo 2011 Bruto Rosé Pinot Noir (Bairrada)

description: This is a really refreshing, crisp and fruity wine. It achieves a good balance between acidity and lively red berries and lime juice. The wine dances brightly in the glass and would make a good apéritif.
title: Campolargo 2011 Bruto Rosé Pinot Noir (Bairrada)

description: This is the last vintage of a joint venture between J M da Fonseca and Cristiano van Zeller (the 2005 is a solo production by J M da Fonseca). It's a dry, dark, structured wine, with some minerality, full of ripe black plums and concentrated tannins.
title: J.M. da Fonseca and Van Zeller 2004 Domini Red (Douro)
winery: J.M. da Fonseca and Van Zeller

description: This limited production wine is a selection of the estate's best barrels. It's packed with tannin, giving it a dusty texture. Underneath, black fruit pulsates with energy and richness. The wine is still developing and will drink best after 2020.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Uniqo Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The owners' Swiss connections are commemorated in the international initials for Switzerland (CH) on the label, but everything else about this wine is resolutely Portuguese. From its dense tannins and dry core to its bold red fruit, it's full bodied, rich, ripe and likely to age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 CH by Chocapalha Red (Lisboa)

description: This floral, fresh wine has great acidity over its apple and intense citrus flavors and stays very fresh to the finish. Clean, fragrant and ready to drink, it is delicious now.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2011 Van Zellers White (Douro)

description: This is a red-fruit flavored wine, soft and warm. The wood aging shows as smooth vanilla that balances the soft, open, generous structure. It's a juicy wine that can be enjoyed now.
title: Herdade do Monte da Ribeira 2011 Varal Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a red-fruit flavored wine, soft and warm. The wood aging shows as smooth vanilla that balances the soft, open, generous structure. It's a juicy wine that can be enjoyed now.
title: Herdade do Monte da Ribeira 2011 Varal Red (Alentejano)

description: A well-structured wine, it really doesn't show its high alcohol. It has ripe berry fruits plus a solid and dense texture allied to a dark, mineral character. Juicy flavors come through strongly to give the necessary fruitiness.
title: Quinta da Maritávora 2010 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This ripe rich wood-aged blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon is full of juicy berry fruits and plenty of acidity. The wine is full bodied, poised and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a mineral-textured wine, full of fruit and with a background of firm tannins. Its juicy fruits and acidity, the red berry flavors and the balance create a wine that is not too dense, but with a firm core. It will be accessible soon, ready to drink from 2018.
title: Julia Kemper Wines 2012 Vinhas Selecionadas Red (Dão)

description: This is an easy wine to like. It does have some firm tannins from oak aging that the Portuguese like, but it also has ripe fruit, plenty of black-plum skins and bright ripe acidity. Together, this combination is full bodied and will benefit from a few more months of aging. Drink from late 2018.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a finely balanced, rich wine. Bringing together Antão Vaz, Arinto and Roupeiro, the wine is packed with white fruits and a citrus twist. It has a crisp edge and bright acidity although with an underlying richness that makes the wine ideal for spicy foods. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Esporão Reserva White (Alentejo)

description: This is a spicy earthy wine with its high percentage of Alicante Bouschet giving rich tannins and a dark dense texture. The wine is packed with dense fruit and power, perhaps erring on the side of too much, with a pepper edge to the concentrated black fruit. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2015 Sem Barrica Unoaked Red (Alentejano)

description: The red juiced Alicante Bouschet has produced a powerful and generous wine that's rich and full of southern sun as well as dark black fruits. It is concentrated and impressive with its ripe flavors. Foot-trodden in open fermenters, it is full and generous needing to age until 2017.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: This is a balanced wine that has attractive citrus flavors, riper peach and pineapple and a light apricot perfume from the Viognier in the blend. It is rich while having plenty of freshness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Estate Collection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A powerfully ripe wine, full of black fruit and sumptuous tannins. Despite its youth, the wine, wearing all its charms up front, is very ready to drink. It's dark, juicy and deliciously rich.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2009 Grande Reserva Classico Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Smooth and rich, its tannins are buried in the ripe, sumptuous fruit. It's packed with red-berry, wild-strawberry and raspberry flavors, along with intense and juicy acidity. The structure does have a dry edge that promises aging, although the wine is very ready to drink now.
title: Niepoort 2009 Redoma Red (Douro)

description: The wood aging has not yet left the fruit behind in this warm, rich yet dry Port. It has intense concentration, the herbs and spices showing through the rich, smooth texture. The aftertaste is rounded, even with its fortified edge.
title: Niepoort 1998 Colheita  (Port)

description: A powerful, full-bodied and rich wine. Its tannins are already well balanced, layered within the dense black fruit. The wood aging brings hints of bitter chocolate and spice to go with its impressive fruit. This is a wine for aging over the next 4–5 years.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Grand Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Even the stain on the base of the cork reveals this wine's huge color. With its open richness and structure, it's comparable to a Rhône wine. Wood aging has lended notes of spice to go with the flavors of plum jelly and ripe, sweet fruit.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2008 S Syrah (Alentejano)

description: A deliciously satisfying wood-aged Port. It has an intense fruitiness, with layers of acidity and oxidated notes. It's concentrated, yet shows lightness and poise.
title: Niepoort NV 20 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: A very dry Port, the tannins concentrating the fruit into a tight, mineral ball. Even if the fruit is suppressed at this stage, it will show through in years to come, leaving a structured but rich wine.
title: Niepoort 2008 Bioma Vinha Velha Vintage  (Port)

description: A complex, wood aged wine, this 20-year-old has a perfumed, dry style. Walnut and spice flavors blend together with the spirit and mature acidity. It's rich, with just the right amount of age.
title: Taylor Fladgate NV 20 Year Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This estate in Estremoz—the heart of the Alentejo—has made a ripe and full-bodied wine from the Bordeaux grape Petit Verdot. Produced in open-top stone fermenters, it's deeply colored, firm with tannins and brightened by ripe blackberry fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Dona Maria Petit Verdot (Alentejo)

description: Tinta Negra Mole, widely planted in Madeira, is a chameleon grape that can take on the character of any grape or style the producer fancies. Here it has transmuted into a rich Bual, wood aged and with old-gold flavors and color. The acidity at the end, which is what will preserve the wine for many years, is intense and impressive. Drink now.
title: Leacock's 1995 Tinta Negra Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)

description: Richly smooth, this is a beautifully generous wine that brings out the perfumed nature of the Syrah. Ripe with black fruits, it is still packed with dark tannins and dense concentrated fruit. Drink this powerful wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2013 Quinto Elemento Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: Richly smooth, this is a beautifully generous wine that brings out the perfumed nature of the Syrah. Ripe with black fruits, it is still packed with dark tannins and dense concentrated fruit. Drink this powerful wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2013 Quinto Elemento Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: This is a powerful ripe wine, packed with black fruits and firm tannins. It is an impressive blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, rich with black-plum flavors, a dark texture and great structure. This is a wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Grown in the schist terraces of the Douro, this wine is a Touriga Franca-dominated blend. Thyme and eucalyptus flavors are balanced by richly structured red berry fruit and tannins. It will be ready from 2018.
title: Antonio Lopes Ribeiro 2012 Red (Douro)

description: Two naturally crisp grapes come together in a sparkling wine of bright and delicious character. Its lively mousse carries its fruity, fresh citrus and apple flavor. Drink now.
designation: Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Bruto
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

description: Two naturally crisp grapes come together in a sparkling wine of bright and delicious character. Its lively mousse carries its fruity, fresh citrus and apple flavor. Drink now.
designation: Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Bruto
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

description: This is a rich, full and structured wine with a great balance between black fruit and tannins. It shows the stony minerality of the Douro, with generous fruit and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Colleja Red (Douro)

description: A lightly toasty character shows this has been subtly aged in wood. It adds spice, a creamy texture and richness to what is already a finely balanced wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho-Viognier Reserva White (Tejo)

description: A lightly toasty character shows this has been subtly aged in wood. It adds spice, a creamy texture and richness to what is already a finely balanced wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho-Viognier Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This ripe, oak-aged wine has smooth tannins and rich black fruit. It's balanced between rich fruitiness and structure. Half Touriga Nacional and half Cabernet Sauvignon, the combination imparts a delicious, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2015 Native Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: This firmly structured wine has robust tannins and concentrated black fruit. It's ripe and juicy, with blackberry flavor and acidity. Although drinkable now, it will be better from 2018.
title: Enoport 2015 Vilalva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A rich and perfumed wine that brings out the violet aromas and juicy black currant fruits of the Touriga Nacional. It is rich, structured with a tannic dryness that is well balanced with the juicy, ripe black fruits. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: From old vines, this is a densely concentrated wine that rejoices in its ripe fruit but keeps freshness and fine, dry tannins. The dark plum flavors go well with the smooth, herbal finish, and the lift of acidity. Imported by Michael Skurnik Wines.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A huge, smooth wine, full of superripe fruit that is intensely mouth-filling. The structure is submerged by all this black fruit. It's supremely rich, kept in balance by the acidity.
title: Quinta do Portal 2004 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A huge, smooth wine, full of superripe fruit that is intensely mouth-filling. The structure is submerged by all this black fruit. It's supremely rich, kept in balance by the acidity.
title: Quinta do Portal 2004 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A floral, fruity and intensely perfumed wine, yeasty, with mature acidity and almond flavors underlining the green lime element. It is very dry, needing the extra year since harvest to round it out and give it richness as well as freshness.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2006 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Mouth-filling wine, with delicious creamy red apples, some tropical fruits and a fresh, green citric edge. It is rich, full-bodied, layering citric crispness with rich white fruits.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2007 Alvarinho Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Lively and crisp, this has some good concentration and almond and creamy flavors over new wood. It shows ripe fruit, but there is also a zesty lemon character that gives it a lift and vibrancy. Deliciously refreshing.
title: Castello d'Alba 2006 Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: An impressive wine, with spice, intense ripe black berry fruits and a solid core of tannins. It has power without being overwhelming, densely textured and ready to age for several years.
title: Durham-Agrellos 2008 Marka Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Pitch black wine, densely concentrated, powerful, its wood aging giving shape to the huge fruit and tannins. Ripe black fruits add a juicy character, with a jammy richness complemented by exotic spices. The wine needs five years' cellaring.
title: Herdade das Servas 2008 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Aromatic, tropical textured wine. Great flavors of ripe pineapple and mango balance with more green fruit characters and a twist of lime. The wood flavors are well restrained, offering just a touch of final spice.
title: Fiuza 2008 Ikon Chardonnay/Trincadeira White (Tejo)

description: With its intense black color and perfumed aromas, this is a superb wine. The palate is firm, solid, still tannic, with the fruit just coming into balance. Nineteen months of wood aging has rounded the wine without dominating. Give this seriously ageworthy wine 5–6 years.
title: Vinha Paz 2008 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: With its intense black color and perfumed aromas, this is a superb wine. The palate is firm, solid, still tannic, with the fruit just coming into balance. Nineteen months of wood aging has rounded the wine without dominating. Give this seriously ageworthy wine 5–6 years.
title: Vinha Paz 2008 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This red wine is ripe and structured. It is has a finely textured mineral character that's typical of the Dão region. Rich berry and spicy fruits are dominant with attractive acidity. Behind this fruit, the tannins give a fine shape to a wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Catedral Red (Dão)

description: From grapes grown in the Douro Superior region, this is an open delicious fruity and ripe wine that is ready to drink. Its black currant and red berry tastes are balanced by spice, wood aged flavors and a core of tannins. The aftertaste introduces fresh juicy acidity.
title: Poças 2013 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: This is an elegant wine, with balanced fruit and tannins that make for a soft texture. It is rich and laced with fresh, raspberry-like acidity. It can age for another year, but it is also ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2009 Estate Bottled Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A typical local blend of Arinto, Fernão Pires and Chardonnay, this is smooth, ripe and creamy. It has touches of herb, honey and pineapple, which are laced together by citrusy acidity. The finish is soft.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Equally well known for its Ports, Churchill's makes this red wine from fruit that's sourced from its own vineyards. It has firm tannins and dark plum fruit, which is just waiting to break out beyond the concentrated, dry core. Give it 3–4 years.
title: Churchill's 2010 Churchill Estates Red (Douro)

description: This is dense, with its tannins still working hard to restrain the vivid fruit that, while evident now, is waiting to really burst. Its blackberry flavor dominates and contributes to a fresh aftertaste. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Granadeiro 2011 Tapada do Fidalgo Red (Alentejano)

description: This is dense, with its tannins still working hard to restrain the vivid fruit that, while evident now, is waiting to really burst. Its blackberry flavor dominates and contributes to a fresh aftertaste. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Granadeiro 2011 Tapada do Fidalgo Red (Alentejano)

description: This is the entry-level wine from Vallado, bright and fruity, with an attractive red-berry flavor and a solid, tannic core. As is typical with the 2010 vintage, it has some structure and should be aged for another year.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2010 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: This is marked by bold, dense and rich fruit. It has a sweet, soft character and is deliciously fruity. Packed with blackberry-juice acidity and ripe red plum, this is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Mouro 2009 Vinha do Mouro Red (Alentejano)

description: This crisp, herbaceous selection is a blend of Rabigato and other rarer varieties. It has a citrus note and lively acidity, with deep apple and pear flavors. There's a tangy, steely edge that suggests that the wine will age.
title: Muxagat 2011 Mux Branco White (Douro)

description: This blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is soft, fresh and fruity. Juicy green plums, citrus and bright acidity all give a lively character. A tangy texture needs several months aging. It will be best at the end of the 2014.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Made at Casa Emelinda Freitas in Setúbal, this is part of the nationwide range of wines under the Azul Portugal name. The Castelão grape dominates this spicy wine with its bold tannins and juicy red fruits. With its smooth texture, it's ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Castelão (Palmela)

description: Perfumed and exotic, the wine has a touch of lychee as well as fresh acidity, both given lift by a lemon zest flavor. With a crisp aftertaste, it's a lively wine for drinking now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Parcelas White (Douro)

description: The wine is fat and fruity, a bold statement of red berries that burst from the glass. It's fresh while also rich and structured. It's not going to age further, so drink now.
title: Caves Dom Teodosio 2010 Special Selection Red (Tejo)

description: This wine still shows its youthful tannins. Juicy acidity brings up the blackberry and blueberry. A touch of bitterness will blow away, giving an attractive, fruity wine by 2016.
title: Henrique José de La Puente Sancho Uva 2012 Alfaraz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)
winery: Henrique José de La Puente Sancho Uva

description: With a firmly tannic structure, this is a bright and ripe wine packed with black fruits. It's not a wine for aging, so drink now and until 2018.
title: Fiuza 2013 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Light and fruity, this is an immediately attractive, fragrant, off-dry wine. With its red berry flavors, it tastes warm and inviting. The touch of acidity reinforces the bright drinkability.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Coreto Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Smooth and light, it's all about fruitiness, crisp apples and a squeeze of lemon juice that perks up the soft texture. It's fresh and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Yellow fruits and fresh aromas characterize this attractive, fresh wine. With a touch of citrus to add to the bright character, it's a fruity wine that can be drunk now–2017.
title: Casal do Conde 2013 Viognier (Tejo)

description: Yellow fruits and fresh aromas characterize this attractive, fresh wine. With a touch of citrus to add to the bright character, it's a fruity wine that can be drunk now–2017.
title: Casal do Conde 2013 Viognier (Tejo)

description: This blend of Syrah, Petit Verdot, Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet shows power, with dense tannins shouldered by ripe black fruit flavors and a solid structure. From the Estremoz region of the Alentejo, it's a powerhouse of flavors and juicy acidity. Drink after 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Album Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Syrah, Petit Verdot, Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet shows power, with dense tannins shouldered by ripe black fruit flavors and a solid structure. From the Estremoz region of the Alentejo, it's a powerhouse of flavors and juicy acidity. Drink after 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Album Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Very perfumed and dense, this is a structured, aromatic wine, full of dark berry tones and fine acidity to balance. The dry texture and the solid tannins promise some medium-term aging, so drink after 2015.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich blend of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional that fills out broad black fruit and acidity with soft tannins and a ripe texture. Rich and juicy, it's ready to drink.
title: Roquevale 2010 Tinto da Talha Grade Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe, attractively fruity wine with black plum flavor and a generous texture. It's firm and rich, cut with acidity and tannin and needs further time to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This is a ripe, attractively fruity wine with black plum flavor and a generous texture. It's firm and rich, cut with acidity and tannin and needs further time to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Ripe fruit, touched by vanilla, layered with dark tannins: this is a winning formula, a wine packed with black jelly flavors, made more tense by acidity and smoothed with the hint of wood.
title: Dow's 2006 Vale do Bomfim Red (Douro)

description: Even after five years, this wine still shows its primary fruit—black plums, sweet but structured. Callabriga, a Tinta Roriz based wine, goes light on the acidity, but the tannins and the hints of vanilla balance well with the blackberry jam fruits.
title: Sogrape 2003 Callabriga Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Even after five years, this wine still shows its primary fruit—black plums, sweet but structured. Callabriga, a Tinta Roriz based wine, goes light on the acidity, but the tannins and the hints of vanilla balance well with the blackberry jam fruits.
title: Sogrape 2003 Callabriga Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Big in every sense, this powerful, almost black-colored wine is solid, packed with dry tannins and ripe fruit. Made from Alicante Bouschet, it is a rich, opulent wine, with a strong spice, pepper and fruit character. This blockbuster needs aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezirias 1836 Grande Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: DFJ was the first to plant Alvarinho in the Lisbon region. This wine shows tropical flavors, pineapple as well as apricots. This richness is layered by a mineral texture as well as final, bright acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Nature in the name of this wine signifies it was made with organically grown grapes. It is stylish, fresh in red berry fruits and attractive acidity. There is a tangy character that gives the wine a taut, nervy structure. With further aging, the wine will fill out more. Drink from 2018.
designation: Paço dos Cunhas de Santar Nature
title: Dão Sul 2012 Paço dos Cunhas de Santar Nature Red (Dão)

description: Aged three months in wood, there is a noticeable amount of toast and spice in this wine. That balances the blend of Chardonnay and Antão Vaz, yielding a smooth character of bright fruit flavors blending with warm apricot notes. Drink from 2017.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 Adega de Pegões Colheita Seleccionada White (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional from two Ramos-Pinto quintas results in a consistently smooth, finely rich wine. It has ripe blackberry fruits that are layered with subtle wood accents and given a great lift by ample acidity. It's a ripe wine, with enough tannins to age for the medium-term, although it can be drunk now.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2013 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: This wine is firm and structured, although it allows plenty of room for the aromatic berry and black currant fruits. The tannins are the support system to give the wine shape and the potential to age. Acidity at the end adds freshness. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Foz 2012 Red (Douro)

description: This wine is firm and structured, although it allows plenty of room for the aromatic berry and black currant fruits. The tannins are the support system to give the wine shape and the potential to age. Acidity at the end adds freshness. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Foz 2012 Red (Douro)

description: A dry wine, this offers intense acidity, bitter chocolate flavors and dried raisins. Full of complex aromas and flavors, it's full in the mouth, finishing dry with an intense aftertaste.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Feuerheerd's 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This special edition has been made to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the familiar Graham's Six Grapes reserve Ruby. Selected from old vines in the Graham's vineyards, it is dense and impressively ripe. Concentrated fruit dominates, cut with acidity as well as a dark texture. Rounded and rich, it's made to drink now. The label with symbols of six grapes was taken from original ledger entries—the Graham code for the highest of six possible classifications for wine destined to be vintage Port.
designation: Six Grapes Special Old Vine Edition
title: W. & J. Graham's NV Six Grapes Special Old Vine Edition  (Port)

description: This special edition has been made to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the familiar Graham's Six Grapes reserve Ruby. Selected from old vines in the Graham's vineyards, it is dense and impressively ripe. Concentrated fruit dominates, cut with acidity as well as a dark texture. Rounded and rich, it's made to drink now. The label with symbols of six grapes was taken from original ledger entries—the Graham code for the highest of six possible classifications for wine destined to be vintage Port.
designation: Six Grapes Special Old Vine Edition
title: W. & J. Graham's NV Six Grapes Special Old Vine Edition  (Port)

description: The wine is rich, ripe and fruity with good acidity as well as a bite of spirit and old-wood aging. It is well balanced, keeping the freshness of a 10-Year-Old while also showing good signs of its wood aging. Just what a 10-Year-Old should be.
title: W. & J. Graham's NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The wood aging is still showing in the aroma of the wine. On the palate, the fruitiness of the blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Viognier comes across richly with flavors of apricots, green plums and pink grapefruit. This fruitiness is layered over the wood spice to give a creamy wine that will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Luis Duarte 2014 Monte de Carrapatelo Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This single vineyard wine shows its pedigree with firm tannins and structured fruit. It is serious wine, designed for aging with its structure, wood aging aromas and perfumed fruits. It is a blend of Tinta Roriz and Castelão which together bring out both tight texture and fruitiness. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Quinta do Espirito Santos Red (Lisboa)

description: This single vineyard wine shows its pedigree with firm tannins and structured fruit. It is serious wine, designed for aging with its structure, wood aging aromas and perfumed fruits. It is a blend of Tinta Roriz and Castelão which together bring out both tight texture and fruitiness. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Quinta do Espirito Santos Red (Lisboa)

description: With its roundness, this wine shows the character of the Loureiro grape. Giving a tweak to the softer element is a burst of fine acidity, a lime juice note and a fresh aftertaste.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia Grande Escolha Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A smoothly textured wine that shows red-berry flavors, with very soft tannins along with a farmyard character. It feels ripe and fruit; a fine barbecue wine.
title: Vidigal 2008 NBNC Red (Lisboa)

description: A smoothly textured wine that shows red-berry flavors, with very soft tannins along with a farmyard character. It feels ripe and fruit; a fine barbecue wine.
title: Vidigal 2008 NBNC Red (Lisboa)

description: A wine whose real quality lies in its great fruitiness and open, soft tannins. With just a touch of wood, its stalky black-fruit flavors are all ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Cape Roca Fish Red (Alentejano)

description: Smooth and rounded with light, perfumed sweetness, this is an easy and approachable wine. Its pear and kiwi flavors come together easily. Screwcap.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2011 Hera White (Vinho Verde)

description: A young, fruity wine with soft tannins and juicy berry fruits. It is forward, very approachable, and is ready to drink with pasta or spicy food.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2010 Coudel Mor Red (Tejo)

description: Barnyard aromas offer a wine that is spicy and ripe, with the somewhat hard tannins lending a rustic feel. There is some juicy red fruit that blends with the acidity.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2009 Bridão Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: This is intensely juicy, with acidity that cuts through the black-currant flavors, creating a wine that's brimming with fruitiness. There is a slight distracting hint of oxidized tomato, but it's otherwise enjoyable.
title: Mouras de Arraiolos 2010 Private Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich soft wine full of tannins that have merged with the generous red-berry fruits. Colored by the unusual blend of Alicante Bouschet with Petit Verdot, it is smoothly textured and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Lobo e Falcão Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A bright and crisp wine with its red currant and raspberry flavors that are lifted by the delicious acidity. It is lively, and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Espirito Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: Produced from high-altitude (1,800 feet) vines, this wine is ripe while also crisply fresh. Its lime and lemon flavors are balanced by the mineral texture and intense final acidity. Drink now.
designation: Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco
title: Van Zellers 2015 Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced from high-altitude (1,800 feet) vines, this wine is ripe while also crisply fresh. Its lime and lemon flavors are balanced by the mineral texture and intense final acidity. Drink now.
designation: Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco
title: Van Zellers 2015 Rufo do Vale D. Maria Branco White (Douro)

description: Grown on the plateau above the Douro valley, this wine is rich, generous and finely balanced. Green plum and citrus acidity are dominant, while ripe melon and spice grace the finish. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a soft, rich and ripe wine that is full of red fruits. It has well-integrated tannins and a warm, southern feel of generous fruitiness. The wine is deliciously ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cal Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: From one of the great names of Port, this LBV is a richly sweet wine, full of dried fruits, balanced acidity and a soft, smooth texture. It is a generous, very accessible wine.
title: Delaforce 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A perfumed, juicy wine with delicious red fruits and well adjusted with acidity. There are good, dry tannins as well, suggesting this will make a good food wine. The aftertaste has chewy structure and acidity.
designation: The Cork Grove Castelão and Touriga Nacional
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 The Cork Grove Castelão and Touriga Nacional Red (Ribatejano)

description: This dry Vinho Verde shows great crisp, green apple and grapefruit flavors, a deliciously fresh wine, with green edges and lively flavors. Great summer drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The aromas are barnyard and rustic, but on the palate the wine has a richer character altogether. It has dark fruit flavors, solid tannins and a dense texture, well combined in a structured package. Wood softens the attack of the fruit, resulting in a wine that can be drunk now, but will be better in three years time.
title: Herdade Grande 2011 Audaz Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Full and round, this is a smooth and rich wine. It brings out the creamy side of Alvarinho, with stewed-pear and yellow fruit flavors. There is ample length and acidity at the end.
title: Vercoope 2012 Via Latina Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Full and round, this is a smooth and rich wine. It brings out the creamy side of Alvarinho, with stewed-pear and yellow fruit flavors. There is ample length and acidity at the end.
title: Vercoope 2012 Via Latina Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: The white wine in a new duo of branded wines called Loios, this is a simple citrus- and apple-flavored wine, relatively fat and full, but leaving enough fresh acidity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Loios White (Alentejano)

description: Sweet and mild aromas are highlighted by a touch of fresh prune. The mouthfeel is buttery, with plenty of toffee/coffee flavors poking through. Although it's a tad simple and straightforward, as a whole there is nothing not to like about this easy-to-drink Port.
title: Churchill's NV Tawny Ten Years Old Port (Douro)

description: Dark in color, this is a powerful, classic wine, with dense tannins. It has rich black-fruit flavors, and notes of wood and herb that are packed into its concentrated, dry structure. This is a great Douro for aging.
title: Niepoort 2009 Batuta Red (Douro)

description: Here is a powerful, dense wine, with modest alcohol— thanks to the Dão's mountain climate and granite soil. Pape is a top wine from Alvaro Castro made predominantly from Touriga Nacional. Perfumed, elegant and structured, with plenty of concentration, this is a wine for serious aging.
title: Alvaro Castro 2008 Pape Red (Dão)

description: A powerful, almost black-colored Port. It has the richness of the vintage allied to ripe blackberry flavors, and a mineral, tannic structure. Its great fruit makes it almost drinkable now, but aging will add so many more dimensions.
title: Niepoort 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: Old-gold in color, this wine has concentrated flavors with an almost medicinal intensity. Old wood and acidity form a dominant element along with a note of orange peel. A memorable wine for savoring.
title: Niepoort NV 30 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Powerful and dense, this wine exudes the darkest of tannins as well as intense black fruit. Layers of richness and structure show in this Port's considerable ageability, while its acidity lends freshness. This is a wine that should be aged for 15 years or more.
title: Niepoort 2005 Vintage  (Port)

description: Cool-climate Touriga Nacional brings forth intriguing red-fruit flavors and tannins that are soft. The wine is spicy and herbal, and lightly textured with a floral character and a smooth aftertaste, touched by brisk acidity. Langdon Shiverick, Comète Wines.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2009 Vinhas do Lasso Tinto Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Put two powerful, warm-climate grapes together and you get a rich, densely fruity and structured wine. Solid tannins complement a concentrated palate full of ripe red-berry fruits. Drink now, and until 2020.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Red (Duriense)

description: The ripe fruit of this Shiraz and Touriga Nacional blend exude a character of richness and sophistication. Dusty tannins provide the framework for red fruit flavors and the generous structure. From José Luís Santos Lima Oliveira da Silva's range, the wine would be best after 2015.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Cigarra Reserva Shiraz-Touriga Nacional Red (Lisboa)

description: The ripe fruit of this Shiraz and Touriga Nacional blend exude a character of richness and sophistication. Dusty tannins provide the framework for red fruit flavors and the generous structure. From José Luís Santos Lima Oliveira da Silva's range, the wine would be best after 2015.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Cigarra Reserva Shiraz-Touriga Nacional Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an off-dry wine, soft with a touch of tannin. It has some attractive acidity to keep it crisp as well as ripe red fruits. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. Smooth and lightly textured, its unusual blend of Pinot Noir, Shiraz and Castelão is generous and spicy with good final acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. Smooth and lightly textured, its unusual blend of Pinot Noir, Shiraz and Castelão is generous and spicy with good final acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Packed with black fruits and balancing acidity, this easy-going wine is ready to drink. With black currant and berry flavor, it is soft and hints at a touch of toast.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca Red (Lisboa)

description: With partial aging in wood, this is a spicy, smoky wine that is also full of ripe red fruits. Well-integrated tannins give shape to this wine. A crisp aftertaste and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is crisp, herbal and lightly textured. Lemon and grapefruit dominate the final acidity. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. Melon, pear and apricots come together in a fruit cocktail of a lively, crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is soft, and full of fruit with attractive spicy black currant flavors. Dominated by the rounded Tinta Roriz, it is an easy wine to drink young.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Colheita Red (Douro)

description: From 1800-foot vineyards, this is a crisp, cool, simply fruity wine that has great citrus and lemon character. Very aromatic, with green herb and fresh grapefruit zest over apple juice.
title: Niepoort 2009 Tiara White (Douro)

description: Solid, structured and tannic, this is a wine with potential. A mineral texture underlines the ripe, juicy fruit and berry flavors. It's rich and deliciously fruity while also structured.
title: Vidigal 2010 Reserva dos Amigos Seleção Especial Red (Lisboa)

description: A fresh, fruity lemon and pink grapefruit flavored wine, this is brightly full of acidity; a crisp and mineral texture creates a refreshing character. Ready to drink.
title: Félix Rocha 2012 Quinta de São Cristóvão White (Lisboa)

description: Almost black in color, this densely tannic wine is granular, dusty and mineral in character. The berry fruits shoulder the weight of the tannins easily, giving a ripe wine that will need until 2016 to develop fully
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Monte Alentejano Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Fruity and lemony, this is a bright and fresh wine with just a touch of steeliness. Almonds come through at the end.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2012 Quinta da Murta Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Fresh and really juicy, this blend of Tinta Roriz and Castelão has black currant flavors that are underlined by good wood aging. The acidity is a balanced component of this easy, ready-to-drink wine. Great fruitiness shows at the end.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2011 Quinta do Espirito Santo Red (Lisboa)

description: Fresh and really juicy, this blend of Tinta Roriz and Castelão has black currant flavors that are underlined by good wood aging. The acidity is a balanced component of this easy, ready-to-drink wine. Great fruitiness shows at the end.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2011 Quinta do Espirito Santo Red (Lisboa)

description: Produced from old bush vines, this is densely rich wine, with great structure and layers of full-bodied black fruit tones. It has a fruit and acid balance supported by concentrated tannins. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Casa Cadaval 2011 Vinhas Velhas Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: Trincadeira, also know as Tinta Amarela in the Douro, has produced this dense, rich, smooth wine. There are tannins but they are buried in the opulent spice, black plums and dark chocolate flavors. Wood aging shows, but only lightly. This is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Vila Santa Trincadeira (Alentejano)

description: Something of a disappointment in this vintage, a wine that has an awkward bitter character. The wine is fine enough, with rich berry fruits, but misses the style of previous vintages.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2008 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Tight, taut, mineral-driven wine, lively with a light prickle on the tongue. This is very fresh, with citrus and grapefruit flavors. Delicious, bone-dry Vinho Verde.
title: Quinta de Santa Maria 2009 Quinta do Tamariz Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A rich and powerful wine, dense and chewy. Its tannins dominate a wine that is still young. The damson and blackberry fruits give richness and acidity. Combined, the structure and the fruit make an imposing, potentially long-lived wine.
title: Alvaro Castro 2007 Pape Red (Dão)

description: Almost black in color, this powerful wine from vines in the Douro Superior region is impressively ripe and concentrated. Dark tannins, brooding black plum flavors and a solid age worthy structure will allow this wine to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2013 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a dark chocolate and licorice flavored wine with great tannins and minerality as well as black plum fruits. It is concentrated and powerful and still so young. Dense and brooding, it will need many more years to mature, so drink from 2019.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2011 Baton Red (Douro)

description: A wine that is ripe with a firmly tannic edge as well as rich black fruits. Juicy acidity and black fruits come from the eclectic blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Merlot and Syrah. The wine is still young although with its fruitiness it is ready to drink.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Dory Red (Lisboa)

description: A wine that is ripe with a firmly tannic edge as well as rich black fruits. Juicy acidity and black fruits come from the eclectic blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Merlot and Syrah. The wine is still young although with its fruitiness it is ready to drink.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Dory Red (Lisboa)

description: With a few years of age and three years in wood, this wine has become rich, full of concentration and delicious. It has weight and opulent black fruits to go with its fresh acidity. It's an elegant, smoothly textured wine, finishing with some dry tannins. Drink now.
title: Messias 2010 Clássico Garrafeira Baga (Bairrada)

description: With a part of this wine fermented in wood, it is rich and toasty yet still fruity at this stage. The layers of spice go with the ripe, creamy fruit and the mineral, tight texture. All these elements suggest successful aging, so this will be best drunk from 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A high elevation in the hills north of Lisbon allows the Alvarinho grape to flourish. The wine is crisp, lightly fruity, and driven by citrus flavors. Perfumed, aromatic and ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Quinta dos Loridos Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Tasting strongly of spicy wood, this wine is firm, with a tight, granitic texture. Tannins and acidity anchor its blackberry fruit, yielding a structured wine that is ready to drink.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: An open, ripe and fruity wine made to be drunk young, this has black currant and spice flavors, plenty of acidity to keep it crisp and balanced tannins. The aftertaste is bright and lively.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a young, fruity wine made for early drinking. With bright acidity, soft tannins and forward red fruit, it's easy-drinking and ready now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portal da Vinha Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a young, fruity wine made for early drinking. With bright acidity, soft tannins and forward red fruit, it's easy-drinking and ready now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portal da Vinha Red (Alentejano)

description: This very fruity wine oozes fresh apricot and elegant peach flavors. It's crisp and fragrant, a fine, ready-to-drink blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Arinto.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2011 Guadalupe Branco White (Alentejano)

description: High-elevation vineyards produce the fruit for this crisp, herbaceous wine. It has flavors of ripe gooseberry and lime, with a light hint of nutmeg, immediately appealing in its fruitiness.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Dourosa Branco White (Douro)

description: Rich and soft, this is marked by a powerful black-fruit flavor rather than by strong tannins. There is nothing subtle in this hugely dense and concentrated offering. Ready to drink.
title: Cortes de Cima 2010 Trincadeira (Alentejano)

description: This tangy, lemon-scented wine has a fine citrus flavor and a mineral touch due to its vineyard's high altitude. It is zesty and bright in character, with fresh final acidity.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta do Cardo Siria (Beira Interior)

description: This tangy, lemon-scented wine has a fine citrus flavor and a mineral touch due to its vineyard's high altitude. It is zesty and bright in character, with fresh final acidity.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta do Cardo Siria (Beira Interior)

description: This is a ripe, full wine, retaining Vinho Verde's classic taut acidity, but rounded out with sweet apple and lime flavors. It's food friendly and would make for a fine apéritif.
title: Casa do Valle 2011 White (Vinho Verde)

description: An unoaked wine that relies on its black fruits. While there are light tannins, it is the berry flavors and attractive acidity that carry the day. The wine with its final lift is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: Blending Chardonnay and Viognier with local grapes, the wine is smooth and creamy. It has apple and bright citrus flavors with a cool, crisp backdrop of acidity. The aftertaste, with its tangy, salty character is a reminder of the ocean climate of the region.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Palha-Canas White (Lisboa)

description: This is an off-dry wine, full of fruit and crisp acidity. It has a soft texture and touches of tropical fruit. The wine comes from vineyards in the south of Vinho Verde, close to the Douro.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Vilacetinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is dry and surprisingly rich for a Vinho Verde. It has pineapple and peach as well as the more familiar citrus and green fruit flavors. With lively acidity at the end, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is off dry, fruity and refreshing. It has lively citrus acidity as well as sliced apple crispness. The wine has the lightest prickle on the tongue, leaving a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Tiroliro White (Vinho Verde)

description: A sweet toffee flavor dominates this wine. It is soft, round and smooth. Dried prune and sultana add to the wine's richness. The aftertaste is soft and fruity.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Tawny Reserve Decanter  (Port)

description: A sweet toffee flavor dominates this wine. It is soft, round and smooth. Dried prune and sultana add to the wine's richness. The aftertaste is soft and fruity.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Tawny Reserve Decanter  (Port)

description: From vines grown on sandy soil close to the ocean, the wine is juicy, soft and fresh. It has attractive acidity, red-berry fruits and a generous open texture that makes the wine ready to drink now.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2012 Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: In this wine, the Van Zeller family—15 generations in the Douro—is recognizing the three valleys where they have grown grapes: Pinhão, Douro and Torto. It is a rich smooth wine, powered by tannins and the wood aging. Foot trodden in open fermenters, the wine is a blend of grapes from 35-year-old vines. It is rich, still developing and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 VVV Valleys Red (Douro)

description: In this wine, the Van Zeller family—15 generations in the Douro—is recognizing the three valleys where they have grown grapes: Pinhão, Douro and Torto. It is a rich smooth wine, powered by tannins and the wood aging. Foot trodden in open fermenters, the wine is a blend of grapes from 35-year-old vines. It is rich, still developing and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 VVV Valleys Red (Douro)

description: From vineyards owned by the Van Zeller family in the narrow valley of the Torto River, this serious powerful wine is a mere baby. It was produced in open-stone fermenters with traditional foot treading and that gives the wine its extra opulence and richness. Tannins and immense black fruit are still developing. Save this bottle until 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 CV Curriculum Vitae Red (Douro)

description: Harvested the year a princess became Queen Elizabeth II, this wine aged in oak until now. Bottled in 2016, this is a deep old-gold colored wine. On the palate, it is rich and sweet, with flavors of wood contrasting with the beautiful raisin and prune flavors. It is still impressively fresh and vibrant. It is, of course, ready to drink now.
title: Messias 1952 Porto Envelhecido em Casco Colheita  (Port)
