description: Harvested the year a princess became Queen Elizabeth II, this wine aged in oak until now. Bottled in 2016, this is a deep old-gold colored wine. On the palate, it is rich and sweet, with flavors of wood contrasting with the beautiful raisin and prune flavors. It is still impressively fresh and vibrant. It is, of course, ready to drink now.
title: Messias 1952 Porto Envelhecido em Casco Colheita  (Port)

description: As its name suggests this wine comes from vines planted close to the Torto River that runs through the quinta. The extra warmth from the river produces extra-ripe grapes that go into this powerful, although impressively restrained wine. Foot trodden in traditional stone fermenters, the wine is rich with the same opulent texture as a vintage Port (although of course dry). Dark and for the long haul the wine should not be consumed before 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Vinha do Rio Red (Douro)

description: Named after winemaker Domingos Soares Franco, this is a serious, intense, wood-aged wine. Along with the new wood flavors, it has rich blackberry fruit and dry tannins. With its firm concentrated structure, this is one age-worthy wine.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2009 Domingos Touriga Nacional & Syrah Red (Setubal)

description: A rich, smooth, sweet wine, full of caramel and almonds, with just a hint of acidity. The spirit edge gives the right bite in this mature, rounded, delicious tawny.
title: Kopke NV 20-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The Loureiro grape, grown mainly in the Lima Valley in the center of Vinho Verde, produces a distinctly mineral style of wine. This wine has that character as well as some riper tropical fruit notes and pure citrus acidity. The combination is intensely fruity and very refreshing.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Loureiro from the best parcels of Calçada estate. That gives it gravitas, that also comes through strongly from the wood aging. Vanilla and green fruits complement each other, leaving a wine that is both rich and fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2012 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Loureiro from the best parcels of Calçada estate. That gives it gravitas, that also comes through strongly from the wood aging. Vanilla and green fruits complement each other, leaving a wine that is both rich and fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2012 Edição Reserva White (Minho)

description: The wood and toasty character of this mature Port is just right. It has a fine balance between its old gold flavors and the spirit, giving an intense, concentrated character. Hints of fruitiness are still, just there. The aftertaste, rich and dry, lingers on and on.
title: Poças NV 20-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a style of Late Bottled Vintage that should be aged. It has great red and black fruits at this stage but will develop a more structured, dense and firm character as it matures. Give this well-made, juicy wine with its sweet black fruits at least until 2017.
title: Poças 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Lightweight wine, tasting of fresh raspberries and Morello cherries, with a high layer of acidity. It's pleasant, but dilute.
title: Alentex 2004 Red (Alentejo)

description: A juicy wine with cranberry fruit flavors, spice, and exotic berries, spoiled by a rustic, earthy, meaty edge. Not for aging.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2004 Alicante Bouschet Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Aragonez and Trincadeira, produced by a group of cooperatives in the Alentejo region. It is a simple wine, but has good red fruits, soft, velvet structure and a finishing edge of acidity. Good barbecue wine.
title: Red Fox 2004 Red (Alentejo)

description: With its great acidity and delicious citrus and peach flavors, this is a ripe wine. Its texture gives a touch of minerality and a swathe of rich fruitiness that is both delicious now and will age. Drink now, but the wine will be better from 2018.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2016 Parus Branco Antão Vaz (Península de Setúbal)

description: Bical, the local white of Bairrada on the central coast of Portugal, is used to make sparkling wines. Here in this still wine, it shows its crisp nature and fine acidity. It is light and fruity, with a perfumed citrus character. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)

description: Bical, the local white of Bairrada on the central coast of Portugal, is used to make sparkling wines. Here in this still wine, it shows its crisp nature and fine acidity. It is light and fruity, with a perfumed citrus character. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)

description: This single-quinta wine comes from central Alentejo. Its generous tannins and ripe black fruits are typical of the warm growing conditions of the region. Packed with fruit which is balanced with acidity and a solid core, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 Quinta da Esperança Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is rich, solidly tannic with a dry core. It has the dense color associated with this grape, more normally found in Bordeaux. There are juicy black elements and balanced acidity, with a dry core that makes for a firm wine. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Petit Verdot (Alentejano)

description: A crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde with a good prickle on the tongue. Flavors of lemon and green apple are well balanced in this ready-to-drink summer wine. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)

description: A crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde with a good prickle on the tongue. Flavors of lemon and green apple are well balanced in this ready-to-drink summer wine. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a soft, caramel-flavored rosé that has a wild-strawberry freshness, and a limpid texture.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2010 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: Blending local grapes with Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot has resulted in a bold, ripe and fruity wine. It has the warmth and richness of southern Alentejo, its soft tannins and ripe fruit cut with acidity and spice. Full bodied and balanced, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2014 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Grown in the sandy soil of Tejo, far from the granite of northern Portugal, this Alvarinho is broad but light, and attractively perfumed. It has light tannins, lime and apricot fruit and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: Grown in the sandy soil of Tejo, far from the granite of northern Portugal, this Alvarinho is broad but light, and attractively perfumed. It has light tannins, lime and apricot fruit and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: While this was not a generally declared Vintage, there are many attractive, structured single-quinta Ports, such as this. It has ripe sweet black plum and dried prune flavors along with just the right tannic structure to let it age further. While it is drinkable now for its fruit, it will be so much better from 2020.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2005 Vintage  (Port)

description: While this was not a generally declared Vintage, there are many attractive, structured single-quinta Ports, such as this. It has ripe sweet black plum and dried prune flavors along with just the right tannic structure to let it age further. While it is drinkable now for its fruit, it will be so much better from 2020.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2005 Vintage  (Port)

description: A wine that is dominated by the floral character of Touriga Nacional, this is a dense and dry at this young stage. It has a dry, firm character, with the fruit still firmly masked by tannins. Give it until 2017 before drinking.
title: Messias 2013 Superior Red (Douro)

description: A wine that is dominated by the floral character of Touriga Nacional, this is a dense and dry at this young stage. It has a dry, firm character, with the fruit still firmly masked by tannins. Give it until 2017 before drinking.
title: Messias 2013 Superior Red (Douro)

description: Perfumed Verdelho gives a ripe wine that is full and rich in the mouth. It has spice as well as sweet apricot and mango flavors. The acidity is a much lighter element, leaving a wine that feels fat and round.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection Verdelho (Península de Setúbal)

description: Encruzado produces ripe yellow-fruit and spice flavored wines of great quality. This is a soft, generous example, warm in its round texture and rich in apricot and toast flavors. It should be aged another few months and enjoyed from 2016.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Cabriz Encruzado (Dão)

description: Soft and ripe, with the warmth of a full, fruity Alentejano wine, this is generous and ready to drink. Red fruits are lifted by acidity, while flavors of wood aging and spice add an extra dimension. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich, wood-aged blend dominated by Viosinho is spicy with a ripe toastiness. The acidity highlights this impressively stylish wine through the tangy, fruit finish. Drink after 2018.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a full-in-the-mouth, ripe wine that's all red fruits and soft tannins. It has an open, juicy character with fruit right up front, but boosted by refreshing acidity. Not for aging.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: Pato Frio—cold duck—suggests this a summer picnic wine. It certainly has the freshness and crisp elegance. But it also some weight, ripe apple and citrus fruits and a texture that suggests it could age a few months longer.
title: Ribafreixo 2012 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)

description: This ripe wine is full of apple fruits with a tight streak of citrus acidity. It's a food wine, showing a creamy texture, a light texture and attractive acidity.
title: Poças 2012 Coroa d'Ouro White (Douro)

description: Anselmo Mendes from granite Vinho Verde and Diogo Lopes from clay-soil Lisboa brought together the fruit of their harvests to make one limited-edition Alvarinho wine. The result: a ripe, warm and creamy character with wonderful fresh acidity. Drink this refreshing, ripe wine now.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 2 2 1 Alvarinho (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This is a spicy, wood laden wine. It has notes of toast and burnt wood as well as a dense texture. Still young, the rich black fruits are there behind the wood flavors. It is powerful while still balanced. Drink this solid wine from 2018.
title: Dão Sul 2012 Monte da Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm, with a mineral texture that reflects the tough terrain of the Douro, this wine is also full of fine red fruits and acidity. It has young tannins as well as oak flavors that give the wine a dry core. Drink this firm wine from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Made from old vines, this top wine from Cartuxa (the name means a rough, stony place) is revered in Portugal. Only nine vintages have been made since 1986, a selection of a selection. Figs, superripe black plums, dense tannins, and bitter chocolate are all here. An impressive wine; likely to age over 5–10 years.
title: Cartuxa 2003 Pêra-Manca Red (Alentejo)

description: Crisp lemon and green apple flavors shine through this lively, fruity wine. It has a cool character, tangy fruitiness and a touch of pepper. The wine is made to drink in its youth and is ready now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Maria Papoila White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp lemon and green apple flavors shine through this lively, fruity wine. It has a cool character, tangy fruitiness and a touch of pepper. The wine is made to drink in its youth and is ready now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Maria Papoila White (Vinho Verde)

description: This ripe, juicy wine is full of rich tannins that are seamlessly integrated into its generous black fruit. It shows spice from wood aging, jammy fruitiness and balanced acidity. Ready to drink now for its delicious fruit, it will continue to develop until 2024.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From the Quinta da Aguieira, this serious, concentrated wine has the violet perfume typical of Touriga Nacional. It is a rich, dense and tannic wine, full of black fruit, dark chocolate and bright acidity. Drink this wine from late 2018.
title: Aveleda 2015 Follies Casa da Aguieira Touriga Nacional (Bairrada)

description: Perfumed floral and spice aromas give this wine its great character. It is a rich blend of Viosinho, Alvarinho and Chardonnay, ripe and full of spice, rounded apple and golden-plum flavors and cut with citrus acidity. This fine wine will be better from 2018.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Dory Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: This is an unusual limited-production wine from Perdigão's highest hottest vineyard. It is not often to find a 100% Alfrocheiro despite being native to the Dão region. The strongly tannic wine, which spent 12 months in wood, is intensely perfumed with hedgerow flowers and mint while full of dark plum-skin flavors. It has power and concentration and is likely to remain very firm into the future. Drink now or take a risk and cellar.
title: Quinta do Perdigão 2011 Alfrocheiro (Dão)

description: A single-vineyard blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot, this is a supremely dense wine. It is dark, almost black in color, concentrated both from rich tannins and wood aging. Its dark color is replicated in the dense dark character of the wine and its powerful fruits. Age this wine, don't drink before 2020.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Quinta da Viçosa TM Red (Alentejano)

description: A smooth wine that is very fruity while also rich. A ripe feel comes from the dominant Viosinho in the blend. There is a greener element, lightly tangy and herbaceous that gives a fresher aftertaste to this attractive wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A smooth wine that is very fruity while also rich. A ripe feel comes from the dominant Viosinho in the blend. There is a greener element, lightly tangy and herbaceous that gives a fresher aftertaste to this attractive wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This wine exudes southern warmth with its rich, soft fruit and ripe tannins. Generous and opulent, it is packed with red and black berry fruits and already drinkable. The aftertaste with its juicy acidity gives the wine a lift.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Monte Cascas Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine is all red fruits and soft tannins that make it rich and open. Made to be drunk young, it's perfect to drink now.
title: Campolargo 2011 Vinha do Putto Red (Bairrada)

description: A deliciously rich, sweet and youthfully fruity wine that has an opulent feel to it. There is a juicy element, with fresh acidity, but most of the character comes from the ripe fruit, the jelly character and the sweet tannins. It needs more bottle age.
title: Quarles Harris 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A smooth, rich wine that shows ripeness over a developing edge of tannin. This is a toasty, almost meaty wine, packed with concentration. It is still youthful, full of exuberant forward fruit flavors.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Rich with strawberry fruitiness, the wine also has a good fresh touch. It's a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, giving a warm, ripe and fruity aftertaste.
title: Herdade de Medeiros 2013 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Rich with strawberry fruitiness, the wine also has a good fresh touch. It's a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, giving a warm, ripe and fruity aftertaste.
title: Herdade de Medeiros 2013 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Castelão, this is a dense and rich wine. It has spice, soft tannins that are already well integrated, and ripe juicy black fruits. Drink this generous wine from 2016.
title: Enoport 2012 Enigma Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This wine swings between structure and ripe fruitiness. With a dense tannic background, the foreground has jammy, black fruits and a rich character. Not a wine for long aging, it's attractive now and ready to drink from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2011 Palha Canas Red (Lisboa)

description: Smooth and ripe, this wine comes from vines planted in what was once a royal hunting ground. It is a full-bodied blend of Douro grapes with a more local southern variety, giving both structure and warmth. An impressively concentrated wine, it needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Vale Veados 2014 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A great structured, finely textured wine. The black tarry fruit, sweet licorice and black currant flavors all hang together well, leaving ripeness and feel of elegance.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2005 Quinta la Rosa Red (Douro)

description: A great structured, finely textured wine. The black tarry fruit, sweet licorice and black currant flavors all hang together well, leaving ripeness and feel of elegance.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2005 Quinta la Rosa Red (Douro)

description: A finely structured wine that relishes its blackberry jelly, new wood and dense, concentrated texture. The wine is powerful, firm, certainly rich, but with a sense of restraint that gives it elegance.
title: Poças 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: An attractive, structured, balanced wine, showing floral aromas, deliciously rounded ripe fruit, held in check by fresh blackberry flavor. The richness is here, but it is subtle, giving a wine that is powerful but food friendly.
title: Kopke 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fine, balanced wine that brings out good toastiness alongside sweet, ripe fruit. Well made, showing good balance, with acidity giving a lift to all the richness. The aftertaste is rounded and delicious.
title: Quinta das Tecedeiras 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This big-seller is a delicious mint and wood polished wine, its berry fruits rounded and softened. The tannins meld easily into a warm, rich, accessible, forward-fruited wine that is definitely ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Cabriz Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: A finely structured, still young wine with an edge of austerity. It does have a rich core of red fruit, giving a slightly juicy character, but with its tannins it will always be a firm wine, dense and serious.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A finely structured, still young wine with an edge of austerity. It does have a rich core of red fruit, giving a slightly juicy character, but with its tannins it will always be a firm wine, dense and serious.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Still young, this is a firmly tannic wine, its fruit under this dry surface. Give it a few months for the ripe blackcurrant and blackberry fruits to come forward. In two years, it will be a finely balanced wine.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Ciconia The Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This big, bold and fruity wine is packed with red berry fruits touched with spice from wood aging, yielding a firm, already well-integrated wine. It has a solid, chunky character as well as density, and should age well.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Catedral Red (Dão)

description: Red-fruit flavors abound in this ripe and full wine. A blend of local grapes with Merlot, this has a smooth texture with tannins cushioned by the rich fruits. Touches of spice and wood give an extra complexity.
title: Casa Cadaval 2010 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: Red-fruit flavors abound in this ripe and full wine. A blend of local grapes with Merlot, this has a smooth texture with tannins cushioned by the rich fruits. Touches of spice and wood give an extra complexity.
title: Casa Cadaval 2010 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: A crisp, fruity wine, bright with red-cherry fruit and a touch of pepper. The acidity and the lively texture give this wine a refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Aragonez-Touriga Nacional Rosé (Alentejano)

description: The earthiness of Syrah dominates the aromas of this blended wine. The structure is dense and solid with perfume that elevates the black, juicy fruits. It is still beginning to integrate, so expect this fine wine to  age for at least 4–5 years.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2010 Estate Collection Red (Lisboa)

description: The earthiness of Syrah dominates the aromas of this blended wine. The structure is dense and solid with perfume that elevates the black, juicy fruits. It is still beginning to integrate, so expect this fine wine to  age for at least 4–5 years.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2010 Estate Collection Red (Lisboa)

description: This richly structured wine comes from the the state-owned Companhia das Lezirias, the largest estate in Portugal. With equestrian events, wine, olive oil and an ecological sanctuary just east of Lisbon, the property merits a visit. Named for the barn owl that nests in estate forests, the wine is opulent, dense and packed with tannins and ripe black fruits. Give it time, at least until late 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Red (Tejo)

description: The dense tannins of this wine balance the ripeness. With concentration and generous blackberry fruits, it is a rich wine, broadly structured and with swathes of opulent fruit. It will need plenty of time, so drink from 2026.
title: Viera de Sousa 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: This rich wine is concentrated and ripe with black fruits and juicy acidity. With its density, fruits, wood-aging and complex texture it provides a beautiful example of a Douro blend. Minerality in this still-young wine comes through strongly. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Aged for 14 months in large new-wood barrels, this wine from the Quevedo siblings is lush and generous, with swathes of ripe, rich fruit. Firm tannins promise further aging, while the juicy fruitiness shines strongly. Drink from 2019.
title: Quevedo 2014 Q Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Colheita must be barrel-aged for at least seven years, but Poças went for the long haul, bottling this in 2017. The result is a deep-gold color and richly mature flavors. Caramel, spice and a dry edge from the wood aging gives it character, just hinting at the brandy, with acidity at the end. It is rich and ready to drink.
title: Poças 2003 Colheita  (Port)

description: Colheita must be barrel-aged for at least seven years, but Poças went for the long haul, bottling this in 2017. The result is a deep-gold color and richly mature flavors. Caramel, spice and a dry edge from the wood aging gives it character, just hinting at the brandy, with acidity at the end. It is rich and ready to drink.
title: Poças 2003 Colheita  (Port)

description: This single-vineyard blend includes Jaen's fruitiness and Touriga Nacional's strength. That makes for a smooth, juicy wine, richly endowed with the spice of wood aging but more generously with the red fruits of the Jaen grape. Dusty tannins show behind all this delicious fruit. Drink this concentrated wine now.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Vinha da Carpanha Red (Dão)

description: This single-vineyard blend includes Jaen's fruitiness and Touriga Nacional's strength. That makes for a smooth, juicy wine, richly endowed with the spice of wood aging but more generously with the red fruits of the Jaen grape. Dusty tannins show behind all this delicious fruit. Drink this concentrated wine now.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Vinha da Carpanha Red (Dão)

description: This fortified red blend was aged in wood for 20 years. That has taken away fruitiness and, as with an aged Tawny Port, has given the wine flavors of dried prune, spice and old wood aromas. The wine is for sipping and savoring, ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines NV Cabriz Impar Red (Vinho Licoroso)

description: This oak-aged Touriga Nacional is rich and opulent. It offers fine tannins, flavors of dark chocolate and spice as well as black plum and berry fruit. It's dark and firm at this stage with tannins and dense fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Fiuza 2015 Ikon Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Produced at Quinta do Carmo, this easy and ripe wine is totally ready to drink. With bright red-berry acidity and soft tannins, the blend of Aragonez and Trincadeira is all fruit, finished with acidity.
designation: Monte das Amforas by Quinta do Carmo
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Monte das Amforas by Quinta do Carmo Red (Alentejano)

description: An almost black wine, its soft and velvet tannins polished by wood. The structure is powerful, with plum skins, red berries and spice. There is a firm, dry core from the Cabernet that brings out a more austere side. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2009 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: An almost black wine, its soft and velvet tannins polished by wood. The structure is powerful, with plum skins, red berries and spice. There is a firm, dry core from the Cabernet that brings out a more austere side. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2009 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Big and ripe wine with sweet, jammy black fruits layered with new wood. The wine is powerful, to be sure, but it also has a stylish elegance from the interplay of fruit acidity and tannins.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Quinta dos Aciprestes Red (Douro)

description: The stately hillside line of cypress trees gives its name to this estate on the south bank of the Douro. This complex, rich and dark wine is densely textured. The tannins are still young, while the black berry fruits pack into the solid structure. This is a wine to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2013 Quinta dos Aciprestes Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a wood aged wine, full of vanilla flavors as well as fragrant fruitiness. It has great flavor intensity, with bright notes of juicy green plum and grapefruit that are framed by acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It needs some years aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Poeira 2014 White (Douro)

description: This is a wood aged wine, full of vanilla flavors as well as fragrant fruitiness. It has great flavor intensity, with bright notes of juicy green plum and grapefruit that are framed by acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It needs some years aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Poeira 2014 White (Douro)

description: This is a solid and structured wine that is rich and full on the palate. With ripe tannins and black plum flavors, it is dense, packed with big, bold flavors and a velvety texture that is looking towards a long future. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2012 Red (Douro)

description: With its wire caged bottle, the wine appears as though it is Spanish. The flavors, though, are all Portuguese. Dominated by Touriga Nacional's distinctive perfumed and dry tannin character, with the addition of the powerfully juicy Alicante Bouschet, the wine is dark, solid and still coming together. It is concentrated and rich, shot through with acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2011 Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: With its wire caged bottle, the wine appears as though it is Spanish. The flavors, though, are all Portuguese. Dominated by Touriga Nacional's distinctive perfumed and dry tannin character, with the addition of the powerfully juicy Alicante Bouschet, the wine is dark, solid and still coming together. It is concentrated and rich, shot through with acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2011 Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged wine brings together some of the freshest of Portuguese white grapes along with Sauvignon Blanc. It's a surprisingly successful blend, with toast that smoothes out the herbaceous, crisp character of the fruit and adds some apricot highlights. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2013 Estate Collection White (Lisboa)

description: A spicy wine, this is full of dark fruits and great perfumes. Tannins are integrated into the concentrated fruits and stylish structure. The wine could be drunk, but this style of LBV will be better after a couple of years in bottle. Drink from 2017.
title: Duorum 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Tasting mature for a 10-Year-Old tawny, this ripe wine has lost fruit but gained in spirit, wood and acidity. Balanced just right, it finishes dry and fragrant.
title: Poças NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: A very spicy, wood-aged wine that has swathes of very ripe yellow fruits with almost sweet acidity. The fruits have weight, density and a toasty aftertaste. This impressive wine could wait and be drunk from 2016.
title: Quanta Terra 2012 Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine has juicy black fruits that are given shape by the firm tannins and dense, concentrated structure. Initially austere and packed with acidity, it needs time to develop. Drink this powerful wine from 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2011 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Pato's pair of old vine wines, a red and this white, are beautifully complex. With its rich melon, tropical fruits, spice and light toastiness, this wine is concentrated with still-young acidity and currant fruit flavors. It's a great wine that needs to develop before drinking. Wait until 2016.
title: Luis Pato 2013 Vinhas Velhas White (Beira Atlantico)

description: A wine that emphasizes the black currant acidity and firm tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon. The fruit layers acidity, wood and some herbs. Age for another year.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Casa do Lago Grande Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: One of a pair of wines under the Grilos name, this Alentejo blend is soft and generous, its ripe berry fruits laced with licorice. Juicy and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Grilos Red (Alentejano)

description: Very dry, the fruit losing some freshness with the wood aging. However the structure is firm and dark. With the acidity, this could be a wine for aging over 1–2 years.
title: Quanta Terra 2008 Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Very dry, the fruit losing some freshness with the wood aging. However the structure is firm and dark. With the acidity, this could be a wine for aging over 1–2 years.
title: Quanta Terra 2008 Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Young and fruity, this a crisp, lightly acid wine. Its raspberry fruits are already delicious.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 Vista Rosé Tinta Roriz (Beiras)

description: This is a juicy, ripe style of Vinho Verde that's soft, clean and refreshing. It's a summer-evening wine, light and bright. Screwcap.
title: Calamares 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This very crisp, cool-climate sparkling rosé is a blend of Castelão and Merlot. It has acidity, a touch of raspberry fruit and a just off-dry ripeness.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Loridos Rosé Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: From vineyards in the far eastern end of the Douro, this wine reflects the huge ripeness that comes from that hot land. It is mineral-driven, packed with sweet plum fruits, very ripe, spiced with new wood and concentrated. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Poças 2009 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: This is a fruity wine that's made to drink young. Bright red fruits, a light spice character and just the right amount of acidity make for a wine that is perfect for barbecues.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Monte dos Amigos Red (Alentejano)

description: Fruity and medium dry, this is soft, with citrus hits to balance the sweetness. The wine is bright and light in the mouth, better as an apéritif than with food.
title: Quinta da Raza 2014 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Branco Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: From the Vinho Verde region in northern Portugal, this tightly crisp, bone dry wine is fresh, almost shockingly so. Red currant flavors dominate along with a lively, light texture. Drink now.
title: Obrigado 2014 Nortico Rosé (Minho)

description: This is a soft, fresh and fruity wine. It has red berry flavors that are gently lifted by fine tannins. Acidity and a juicy aftertaste complete an attractive, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta do Figo Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft, fresh and fruity wine. It has red berry flavors that are gently lifted by fine tannins. Acidity and a juicy aftertaste complete an attractive, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta do Figo Red (Lisboa)

description: Solid tannins, juicy fruits and considerable acidity dominate this wine. It has a fresh character—dry at the back while showing some potential for aging. Spice and final refreshing acidity complete the picture. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Paseo of Portugal Red (Lisboa)

description: Rich, flowery wine that shows the potential for white wines in the Dão region. While it keeps plenty of lemon zest acidity, the apricot and peach flavors combine well with pears. There is spice from wood, but the fruit is the thing with this great food wine.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada White (Dão)

description: The T is for Touriga Nacional, the Merlot for Merlot, and the two blend easily into a wine that revels in the perfumes and tight tannins of the Touriga and the smoothness of ripe Merlot. The fruit is black, dense, but not too powerful, leaving fresh ripeness as well as a dry, tannic structured core.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 Quinta da Viçosa T.M. Red (Alentejano)

description: A rich, powerful wine that shows great aging potential. Spiced and perfumed, it brings in dark, black fruits, tight tannins and layers of acidity. It has ripeness as well, with sweet jelly flavors on top of the firm character of the wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Grande Encontro Red (Bairrada)

description: A rich, powerful wine that shows great aging potential. Spiced and perfumed, it brings in dark, black fruits, tight tannins and layers of acidity. It has ripeness as well, with sweet jelly flavors on top of the firm character of the wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Grande Encontro Red (Bairrada)

description: Tinta Roriz (in Spanish Tempranillo) is recognized in the Douro as a great table wine grape, and this big-hearted wine is good proof. It is surprisingly elegant for its weight and alcohol, a smoothness coming from wood aging. The fruits are black cherry and black plum skin, with tannins showing a tight, mineral edge. For aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2006 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Tinta Roriz (in Spanish Tempranillo) is recognized in the Douro as a great table wine grape, and this big-hearted wine is good proof. It is surprisingly elegant for its weight and alcohol, a smoothness coming from wood aging. The fruits are black cherry and black plum skin, with tannins showing a tight, mineral edge. For aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2006 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Powerful, ripe wine with black fruits and a great swathe of dark tannins. The flavors of berries, black plums, black figs and sage are echoed by the warm, herbal and wild flower aromas. This is a big wine, which needs at least a year to age.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2006 Red (Douro)

description: Powerful, ripe wine with black fruits and a great swathe of dark tannins. The flavors of berries, black plums, black figs and sage are echoed by the warm, herbal and wild flower aromas. This is a big wine, which needs at least a year to age.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2006 Red (Douro)

description: This bold, firm wine strikes a fine balance between structure and ripe black plum fruit. It has dense tannins that indicate it needs time. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca, it will be ready from 2018.
title: Enoport 2015 Tonel 22 Red (Douro)

description: This shows the subtlest hints of the apricot character so often found in Viognier. That gives richness to contrast its crisp acidity and apple and pear flavors. The finish is long and perfumed. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2015 Viognier (Alentejano)

description: This is Vallado's entry-level wine, full of open, easy, expressive fruit. Yet, it also shows the natural structure and texture that comes from schist soil. Its tannins remain in the background, with black currant fruit and acidity in the fore. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: This is Vallado's entry-level wine, full of open, easy, expressive fruit. Yet, it also shows the natural structure and texture that comes from schist soil. Its tannins remain in the background, with black currant fruit and acidity in the fore. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: From the estate's oldest vines, this Castelão brings flavors from the Setúbal peninsula further south. With its warm tannins and juicy red fruit, it's open and only lightly structured. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Castelão (Lisboa)

description: This wine, named for the present owners' mother, is full of red berry fruit, attractive acidity and toasty wood to balance. It has soft, generous tannins, an open, juicy texture and is very ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This wine, named for the present owners' mother, is full of red berry fruit, attractive acidity and toasty wood to balance. It has soft, generous tannins, an open, juicy texture and is very ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Aged for nine months in used and new wood, this wine is rich and smooth. Its acidity and blackberry fruit are balanced and ripe while staying crisp and tight on the mineral-laced finish. Ready to drink.
title: Opta 2013 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Aged for nine months in used and new wood, this wine is rich and smooth. Its acidity and blackberry fruit are balanced and ripe while staying crisp and tight on the mineral-laced finish. Ready to drink.
title: Opta 2013 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Big and bold, this is a structured, dark wine. Its wood aging still shows, although this will integrate. It will be a powerful, rich wine, dense and with dark tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Barão de Vilar 2014 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: While the small coastal appellation of Colares, just north of Lisbon, is better known for its reds, it does produce even smaller quantities of white Malvasia de Colares. This wine is perfumed, ripe with honeyed notes as well as a salty, mineral character. The aftertaste shows the spice from short wood aging. Drink now.
title: Adega Viuva Gomes 2013 Vinho Branco Malvasia (Colares)

description: While the small coastal appellation of Colares, just north of Lisbon, is better known for its reds, it does produce even smaller quantities of white Malvasia de Colares. This wine is perfumed, ripe with honeyed notes as well as a salty, mineral character. The aftertaste shows the spice from short wood aging. Drink now.
title: Adega Viuva Gomes 2013 Vinho Branco Malvasia (Colares)

description: A perfumed wine with soft tannins and juicy red fruits, this offers a concentrated aftertaste, giving spice as well as fruitiness. Drink this accessible wine now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2012 Castello d'Alba Limited Edition Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe and rich, with fine tannins and structure. Great swathes of blackberry fruits come with a mineral edge and some tight tannins. Give this balanced wine until 2019.
title: Roncão 2014 DR Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Wood flavors dominate this young wine. It has structure and tannins, with concentrated toast and chocolate flavors. The extraction of the fruit gives the wine a bitter character. It should soften, so drink from 2019.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This concentrated wine is dense with black fruits. Dark with chocolate and richness, it is still young and firm. Wood aging has smoothed the tannins and given extra fullness. The smoky aftertaste promises well. Drink from 2018.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Red (Lisboa)

description: This concentrated wine is dense with black fruits. Dark with chocolate and richness, it is still young and firm. Wood aging has smoothed the tannins and given extra fullness. The smoky aftertaste promises well. Drink from 2018.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Red (Lisboa)

description: A fruity blend of local Lisboa grapes along with Chardonnay, this wine is rich and full of citrus and crisp apple flavors. It is a ripe wine with a creamy texture enhanced by toast from the wood aging. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Premium Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from vines in the Lima Valley in northern Portugal, the home of the Loureiro grape, this light and fruity wine is immediately attractive, with its gentle citrus flavors and intense acidity. Drink this aromatic wine right now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Lima Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A bold, juicy and fruit-forward wine that is ready to drink young. The tannins are already well integrated into the black fruits and acidity. Drink from early 2016.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 F'Oz Red (Alentejano)

description: A bold, juicy and fruit-forward wine that is ready to drink young. The tannins are already well integrated into the black fruits and acidity. Drink from early 2016.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 F'Oz Red (Alentejano)

description: An intriguing blend of grapes both red (Touriga Nacional and Baga) and white (Bical), this is a fruity wine, deep in color although with a lightness from the lively acidity and fresh red-berry fruits. The wine is juicy, with the tannins already softening and rounding out. Drink from 2016.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Q do E Preto Branco Reserva
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta do Encontro Q do E Preto Branco Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine veers between richness and a severely tannic character. It has a dense texture and black plum flavors. These are contrasted by the dry dark-chocolate structure and tannins that show too much extraction. The wine could come together which will take time; drink from 2017.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Reserva do Comendador Red (Alentejano)

description: This Messias quinta in Bairrada, in the hills away from the coast, has produced a concentrated wine, dark in tannins and black plum-skin flavor. It is dense and dry in character, with attractive acidity at the end. It's a wine to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Messias 2011 Quinta do Valdoeiro Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine has all the classic structure and mineral tension of Dão. It gives both richness and dark, dry tannins that need several years to soften. At the same time, juicy black currant fruits give a fresh side to this complex, concentrated wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Sogrape 2010 Callabriga Red (Dão)

description: Concentrated tannins give this wine from organic grapes a powerful structure. For balance, it also has a more fruity character that offers blackberry and black plums. The wine's dense texture means it needs to age through late 2014.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2010 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This solid, dense blend of Touriga Nacional, Trincadeira and Aragonez has good structure with juicy berry fruits alongside sweet tannins. It's rich, the firm texture giving the wine weight and concentration. The aftertaste brings forward more juicy fruitiness. Drink from 2015.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Flor de Maio Red (Alentejano)

description: The southern coastal region of Algarve is better known for beaches than for wine. This blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah with long wood aging comes from the east of the region and shows great warmth as well as black plum fruit flavors. The juicy fruitiness is balanced by the youthful structure, showing the aging potential of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Al-Ria Reserva Red (Algarve)

description: While the wine, with its wood aging, does take away the fresh varietal character of the Arinto, it offers a rich, full and spicy wine that is stylish and well balanced. It has a firm, mineral character that cuts through the opulent texture to produce a wine that is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2012 Marquês de Marialva Grande Reserva Arinto (Bairrada)

description: This has just the right balance between the fresh fruit of younger Ports and the wood and dried fruit of aged tawnies. It's a dry style of Port, with a lift of acidity. It's delicious and, like all aged tawnies, ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Vallado NV 20 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: With good wood-aging aromas, this is a more mature style of aged tawny. The wood flavors come through strongly, bringing out acidity, coffee and dried raisins. Well balanced, it finishes with great acidity.
title: Quinta da Devesa NV 10-years old Tawny  (Port)

description: A mature wine, this is both fruity and nicely wood-aged. It has ripe dried fruits, apricot as well as raisins, giving freshness and old gold acidity. The fine balance works well.
title: Smith Woodhouse NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Tight acidity and a smoky, burnt character give this complex wine considerable intensity. It has a a dry character, full of flavors from its wood aging with an almost medicinal intensity.
title: Quinta de la Rosa NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Full of ripe tropical fruits, this is rich and opulent. Apricot, mango and peach all feature along with spice from wood aging. All this ripe fruit is balanced by fresher acidity. It's a powerful wine touched with pepper, full in the mouth and packed with fruit and toast. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Full of ripe tropical fruits, this is rich and opulent. Apricot, mango and peach all feature along with spice from wood aging. All this ripe fruit is balanced by fresher acidity. It's a powerful wine touched with pepper, full in the mouth and packed with fruit and toast. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and full of tropical fruits as well as a light touch of toast. Crisp acidity lies in the background, giving freshness to the natural ripeness of the fruits. It's still young, still showing a strong, tangy texture, so wait to drink until 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and full of tropical fruits as well as a light touch of toast. Crisp acidity lies in the background, giving freshness to the natural ripeness of the fruits. It's still young, still showing a strong, tangy texture, so wait to drink until 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: With its crisp and strongly mineral character, this is true terroir wine. It is stony, steely, very textured, with the apple skin and strong pink grapefruit citrus flavors pushing through to give a fresh character at the end. The structure shows the wine needs to age, so drink from late 2015.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Terroir White (Minho)

description: A soft, simple wine, the tannins set the pace, but the fruit doesn't quite follow. It is relatively light, with some red fruits and good acidity.
title: Poças 2003 Coroa D'ouro Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A wine with good richness and weight, the crisp fruit softening into a more mature character, but still retaining a bright, tight acidity. It has good weight and would work well with food.
title: Borges 2004 Real Senhor Velha Reserva Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Citrus fruitiness and mineral acidity that mark Douro character is balanced by a hint of toast from 50% of the wine being aged in oak. Drink this tight nervy wine from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Vinha da Urze Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Citrus fruitiness and mineral acidity that mark Douro character is balanced by a hint of toast from 50% of the wine being aged in oak. Drink this tight nervy wine from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Vinha da Urze Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Cool climate Alicante Bouschet from the Lisboa region has a strongly perfumed character as well as intense fruitiness. The structure, while offering firm tannins, is balanced with the acidity that gives a crisp aftertaste. It all makes for a firm wine with a chance to age. Drink from late 2018.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Aluado Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: This opulent blend of all four Dão grapes (Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Alfrocheiro and Jaen) is structured, full of tannins and sports a dry core. Its black fruits are in balance with this bold structure, giving a wine that is solid and concentrated, and still needing some aging. Drink from late 2018.
title: Boas Quintas 2015 Fonte do Ouro Reserva Red (Dão)

description: The Aragonez (aka Tempranillo or Tinta Roriz) is complex enough to produce a single varietal wine. Here, with wood aging, it has made a richly endowed wine, full of firm black fruits as well as acidity. With its structured aftertaste, it is dense and serious. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2013 Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: Alicante Bouschet and Syrah aged for 18 months in new wood give this wine concentration, richness and a dry tight core. It is a wine for long-term aging, rich with fruit potential, packed with dark tannins and solid with spice and concentrated black fruits. Drink from 2020.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a rich finely structured wine from Sogrape's Alentejo estate which is located close to the best place in Europe to stargaze. Powered with tannins as well as black fruits, this blend of Syrah, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional is dense and very ageworthy. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Sogrape 2014 Herdade do Peso Colheita Red (Alentejo)

description: A ripe, tannic and herbal wine, this has been produced for aging. It shows a dark tannic side over the juicy black plum fruits and berry flavors. The wood aging shows in the way the wine smoothes out at the end, leaving a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Quevedo 2011 Cláudia's Reserve Red (Douro)

description: A ripe, tannic and herbal wine, this has been produced for aging. It shows a dark tannic side over the juicy black plum fruits and berry flavors. The wood aging shows in the way the wine smoothes out at the end, leaving a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Quevedo 2011 Cláudia's Reserve Red (Douro)

description: From vineyards at the western end of the Douro region, this is a densely packed wine, with a dusty and tannic texture that also keeps a firm grip on dark berry and stone fruits. The acidity is less apparent, giving a wine that should be drunk in the next 1–2 years.
title: Douro Family Estates 2005 Quinta dos Poços Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From the Dom Martinho vineyard at Quinta do Carmo, this is a fresh wine, with an earthy, rustic character. Black fruits, juicy acidity and a leathery edge give it a mix of fruitiness and dryness. Age for a few more months before drinking.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 Dom Martinho Red (Alentejano)

description: This is fairly typical, light, fruity lemon-driven Vinho Verde. It has a light spritz, and is exuberantly fresh with just a touch of ripeness and crisp, cool acidity. Perfect to drink this summer.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bitter cherry, ripe berry fruits and some firm tannins are nicely blended in this forward, fruity wine. It has fresh acidity alongside black-currant fruit, ending on a spicy accent.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 JP Azeitão Tinto Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a delicious, ripe wine inspired by its Sémillon and Viognier. The lemon and grapefruit acidity is contrasted with the rich white stone fruits and warmth of this region. Drink from 2018.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: This superrich wine is full of intense yellow fruit and passion-fruit flavors. The fruit is underlined with wood aging, with toast and spice. The aftertaste, smooth and creamy, shows the wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade Grande 2016 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Intense perfumes give this fine apéritif wine an exotic character. Its crisp texture balances this, showcasing fine lime and grapefruit flavors as well as a touch of lychee. The acidity at the end is lively and refreshing. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Escada Reserva Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Intense perfumes give this fine apéritif wine an exotic character. Its crisp texture balances this, showcasing fine lime and grapefruit flavors as well as a touch of lychee. The acidity at the end is lively and refreshing. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Escada Reserva Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This is a fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest. It is a refreshing wine with an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste. Drink this lively wine now.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest. It is a refreshing wine with an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste. Drink this lively wine now.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: A smooth ripe wine, full of red fruits and bold kaleidoscope flavors. It has acidity, plenty of spice and a generous feel that comes from the oak aging and superrich fruits. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2014 Aliança Red (Dão)

description: The wine is dominated by perfumed Malvasia. That gives the wine its deliciously scented apples and pears. The texture—lightly mineral—adds a piquancy to this ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

description: This is a balanced blend of Rabo de Ovelha and Roupeiro grapes. They give the wine both its crisp acidity and its ripe white-fruit flavors. The acidity and the texture suggest the wine should age for a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Vila Santa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a generous blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Perrum (aka Pedro Ximenez). It is finely perfumed, full of juicy white fruits that are shot through with lemon juice. This is a wine to drink young and now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a rich wine with layers of tannins and generous black fruits. It is well balanced and concentrated with the acidity bringing out both the warmth of the grape and its natural fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)

description: The cork label is a reminder that the Alentejo is where most of Portugal's cork oaks grow. The wine is southern in feel, warm and ripe, with generous fruitiness from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend. Red berry fruits are laced with acidity and fine soft tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 São Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)

description: This local grape, only found in the Douro, gives a crisp, green and citrus flavored wine. It is tight, tangy and full of acidity with an orange zest aftertaste. The wine is all fruit, ready to drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Andreza Códega do Larinho (Douro)

description: Here is a lightly sparkling, just off-dry Vinho Verde, the sort of wine that just goes down as an apéritif or, in Portugal, with sardines. It's a crisp, bright wine, a lemon curd flavor finishing the apple fruitiness.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2013 Paço de São Lourenço Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This late-harvest wine has hints of honeyed botrytis as well as apricot fruitiness, though it is far from cloyingly sweet. The texture is soft and mature, with good integration of the fruit and the botrytis character. Try it now with cheese or foie gras.
title: Global Wines 2012 Outono de Santar White (Dão)

description: This late-harvest wine has hints of honeyed botrytis as well as apricot fruitiness, though it is far from cloyingly sweet. The texture is soft and mature, with good integration of the fruit and the botrytis character. Try it now with cheese or foie gras.
title: Global Wines 2012 Outono de Santar White (Dão)

description: Dense, dusty tannins dominate this rich wine that has structure as well as plenty of ripe black-currant fruits. The balance, ripe and with great tannins and acidity, is already there. Drink from 2026.
title: C. da Silva 2015 Quinta de Ventozelo  (Port)

description: Dense, dusty tannins dominate this rich wine that has structure as well as plenty of ripe black-currant fruits. The balance, ripe and with great tannins and acidity, is already there. Drink from 2026.
title: C. da Silva 2015 Quinta de Ventozelo  (Port)

description: A blend of the best grapes from the vintage, this is a powerful, oak-aged wine. Concentrated, rich and still showing signs of vanilla from the wood, it slowly reveals its great black fruits and acidity. With firm tannins at the end, the wine will need more time. Drink from 2019.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Dory Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: From vines close to the medieval castle of Numão in the Douro Superior, this wine represents the top of the range for this family-owned estate. Layers of new wood vie with the ripe fruit of this wine that offers spice as well as black-plum fruits and acidity. It is developing well, giving a rich wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: From vines close to the medieval castle of Numão in the Douro Superior, this wine represents the top of the range for this family-owned estate. Layers of new wood vie with the ripe fruit of this wine that offers spice as well as black-plum fruits and acidity. It is developing well, giving a rich wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: Here's a fruity wine that's full of juicy black-currant aromas and flavors. The tannins gives the wine a strongly earthy character on the finish.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: Here's a fruity wine that's full of juicy black-currant aromas and flavors. The tannins gives the wine a strongly earthy character on the finish.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is fresh, with plenty of acidity. It also has delicious raspberry fruits, the ripeness well integrated into the wine. For immediate drinking.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft and soapy, this is a simple wine without much character. It's a light, slightly sweet wine to be drunk this year. Screwcap.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is so soft, gently fruity and easy to drink, but without much character or freshness. It's a gentle ramble that takes no effort.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Portada Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This wine is so soft, gently fruity and easy to drink, but without much character or freshness. It's a gentle ramble that takes no effort.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Portada Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Castelão, a grape normally found south of Lisbon, has rather carried itself away here. Very firm tannins, a dark toasty extracted character and some bitterness are there along with considerable fruitiness and acidity. The wine is still coming together and will need time. Drink from 2016.
title: Campolargo 2009 Castelão (Bairrada)

description: Soft, sweet, smooth wine. Its age shows in a nutty character that boosts the attractive mature acidity. It is ripe, full in the mouth, well balanced for drinking with food.
title: Murganheira 1998 Grande Reserva Bruto Assemblage Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Dusty, perfumed tannins are suspended in a ripe and fruity wine, its damson skin texture given an extra boost by tannins. Very dark, concentrated wine, full of character.
title: Taylor Fladgate NV First Estate Reserve  (Port)

description: A dry wine, the sweetness overtaken by tannins, black currant stalkiness and acidity. It works well as a more serious style of Reserve Port, hinting at aging potential.
title: Dow's NV Trademark Finest Reserve  (Port)

description: A selection of Touriga Nacional, this was foot-trodden in open lagars. That gives a richness and smooth density to this stylish wine, adding to its concentration and powerful black fruits. It is solid with tannins that needs to age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2014 Carvalhas Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: Portuguese Sommelier Marco Alexandre selected the best barrels of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Petit Verdot for this wine. Rich and stylish, it offers plenty of black fruits and juicy acidity, with a touch of spice and hints from the wood aging. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Sommelier Edition Red (Alentejano)

description: Portuguese Sommelier Marco Alexandre selected the best barrels of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Petit Verdot for this wine. Rich and stylish, it offers plenty of black fruits and juicy acidity, with a touch of spice and hints from the wood aging. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Sommelier Edition Red (Alentejano)

description: Perfumed and crisp, this is attractive and medium-sweet. It has fine acidity to balance the sweetness and a line of clean acidity that goes with the preserved lemon and tangy aftertaste.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: There is a rustic side to this wine, not unattractive and given a lift by the juicy acidity and spice aftertaste. The wine is dark in color, more fruit than structure. It is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Touriga Nacional-Alicante Bouschet Red (Tejo)

description: With Verdelho and Viognier in the blend, this attractive wine has a ripe perfumed character. It also has a crisp side with its lemon fruits that contrast with the spicy pear and melon. It is ready to drink, bright and crisp at the end.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Big, bold and fruity, this dense wine has rich, red berry fruits and firm tannins its the core. While ripe and fruity, there is a hint of salty sea spray from a cool maritime influence. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2010 Palha Canas Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft wine, smoothly textured and rich, with concentrated and ripe black fruit tones. While there is a dry core, it is the generosity of the surrounding fruit that makes this an eminently drinkable wine.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft wine, smoothly textured and rich, with concentrated and ripe black fruit tones. While there is a dry core, it is the generosity of the surrounding fruit that makes this an eminently drinkable wine.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Even in the Vinho Verde region, specific vineyards can produce luscious sweet wines such as this. Honeyed and layered with delicious acidity, this is a very fine wine, worth aging for a year or two, but ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2011 Ameal S.H. White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Even in the Vinho Verde region, specific vineyards can produce luscious sweet wines such as this. Honeyed and layered with delicious acidity, this is a very fine wine, worth aging for a year or two, but ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2011 Ameal S.H. White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Big and rich, this wine is exuberantly fruity with a sweet juicy core of ripe blackberry. Big, bold and forward with well-integrated tannins, this is likely to age quickly; try in 2–3 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Big and rich, this wine is exuberantly fruity with a sweet juicy core of ripe blackberry. Big, bold and forward with well-integrated tannins, this is likely to age quickly; try in 2–3 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Big and spicy wood flavors dominate this rich, expressive wine. With its black currant and berry flavors, it's both fruity and structured. There is dense dryness as well that gives concentration to back up the fruitiness.
title: Caves Velhas 2009 Solo Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Big and spicy wood flavors dominate this rich, expressive wine. With its black currant and berry flavors, it's both fruity and structured. There is dense dryness as well that gives concentration to back up the fruitiness.
title: Caves Velhas 2009 Solo Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: A big fruity wine, full of black fruit flavors and laced with soft tannins and acidity. This is rich, dense and so delicious to drink now. You could age it for a year or two, but why wait?
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Vila Santa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Old gold in color, this is a really mature Colheita from a great vintage Port year. It shows a firm structure that brings out its dry character along with its dense mature flavors, its spicy wood and its great concentration. As it develops in the glass, rich fruitiness comes through to add to the old wood flavors. This is a wine to savor slowly, a real meditation wine that demands attention.
title: Cálem 1961 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: While not a declared vintage Port year, it did produce some impressive old tawnies, like this. It is such a balanced wine, fresh with ripe marmalade, raisin and old wood flavors. It has a wonderful milk chocolate aftertaste that is contrasted with its still-fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Kopke 1984 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: Bottled in 2015, this wine from a great Port vintage is dark in color and so concentrated. It is powered by intense acidity from the wood aging as much as any residual fruit. Spice, dried fruits and a perfect balance give this great wine elegance and surprising freshness. Drink now.
title: Kopke 1966 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: Produced from grapes grown on granite soil, this expresses the extremes of the Douro that produce the finest wines. This perfumed, structured wine, produced in open fermenters, is juicy with black plum fruits and dense with tannins. It is remarkable for its complexity, minerality and potential. Drink from 2018 and until 2030.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2012 Monte Meão Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: Produced from grapes grown on granite soil, this expresses the extremes of the Douro that produce the finest wines. This perfumed, structured wine, produced in open fermenters, is juicy with black plum fruits and dense with tannins. It is remarkable for its complexity, minerality and potential. Drink from 2018 and until 2030.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2012 Monte Meão Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is a wine for long-term aging. With a dense, intense structure that is still dominated by powerful tannins, it is dry, dark and concentrated. Black plum-skin flavors are just coming through all this density, hinting at the balance to come. It is a serious, complex wine that will not be ready before 2019.
title: Luis Duarte 2013 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)

description: There is a great balance between acidity and impressively fresh fruit considering the age of this venerable Port. Of course there are many flavors from the wood aging, but they are combined with orange marmalade, fig and raisin flavors in a riot of complex flavors that have created a very great wine. It comes from a year that was not generally declared as a vintage.
title: Kopke 1957 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: Noval has often in the past released a Vintage Port in years when other producers hold back. And, as in the past, the release is justified. For this is an impressive, dense and seriously age-worthy Port. While it has plenty of perfumed jammy red fruits and balanced acidity, it is the dark tannic character that will sustain this wine for decades. It could be drunk now for its fruit, although that would be a shame. Better to wait until 2030 and longer.
title: Quinta do Noval 2013 Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine comes from a small parcel of vines planted on the marble soil found around the Estremoz area of Alentejo. It's a limited edition blend of Alicante Bouschet and Trincadeira. Almost black in color, it's a powerful, dense and beautifully rich wine. Aromatic, packed with black fruits as well as tannins that will soften, it is going to age for a many years. Drink from 2020.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Estremus Red (Alentejano)

description: Because of its relative youth (for a wood-aged Colheita), this is almost a Late Bottled style, with ruby color and a fruity, red berry character. It meshes together, the fruit still dominant and only a few hints of wood aging apparent.
title: Cálem 1998 Colheita  (Port)

description: Sweet, surprisingly soft for its age, this shows light wood tannins, spice and dried fruits, followed by just an edge of the spirit. It is fresh, elegant, a pleasingly perfumed wine, but not exciting.
title: Burmester 1963 Colheita  (Port)

description: This is an impressively bold and rich wine for its low alcohol content. The character comes from the ripe, perfumed Touriga Nacional in the blend giving blackberry and plum flavors. The wine is concentrated and ready to drink.
title: Messias 2012 Quinta do Penedo Red (Dão)

description: Producing wines at the western end of the Douro vineyards since the 18th century, this family estate presents a young, vibrant tawny with this vintage. It has a fine mix of fresh and dried fruits along with wood flavors that come from the aging in old barrels. It is a dry tawny with some acidity at the end to give this rich wine a final lift.
title: Martha's Wines 2006 Colheita Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a seriously good wine, produced from a field blend of 100-year-old vines. It is concentrated and full of black plum fruit flavors. It brings out the heat of the Pinhão valley and also its wonderful structure. The one small downside is that the alcohol does show at this stage in a raw edge. Hopefully this will pass as it matures, because the wine will certainly not be ready to drink before 2020.
title: Wine & Soul 2013 Quinta da Manoella VV Red (Douro)

description: A section of the Crasto home vineyard has 70-year-old vines that are used to produce this wine. The resulting concentration and depth of flavor are remarkable. The wine is full of black fruits, dark plum skin and firm tannins. As a complement to this fruitiness, the wine also has the beginnings of a mature leather and spice character. It is likely to be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2013 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, complex wine that has great tannins as well as very fine, ripe black fruits. It comes from the showpiece estate for Casa Ferreirinha in the Alto Douro. The dense fruits and balanced tannins and acidity are just beginning to develop, hinting at the very fine wine it will become. With final acidity still very present, it needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2012 Quinta da Leda Red (Douro)

description: This is produced from a field selection of at least 20 different varieties. Dark in color, it is big and bold in flavor. The black fruits and the ripe tannins are combining well to give a wine that has both weight and elegance. With the acidity that comes through strongly, the wine is likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passadouro Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Tinta Roriz (aka Tempranillo) was once believed to be the finest grape for Douro table wines. While that view has been modified, it still makes an impressive wine. With 18 months in wood and super-ripe fruit, the wine is concentrated and opulent. It has fine tannins and acidity that are at the service of this great fruitiness. The wine will age further, with maturity likely to occur by 2020.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2013 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Tinta Roriz (aka Tempranillo) was once believed to be the finest grape for Douro table wines. While that view has been modified, it still makes an impressive wine. With 18 months in wood and super-ripe fruit, the wine is concentrated and opulent. It has fine tannins and acidity that are at the service of this great fruitiness. The wine will age further, with maturity likely to occur by 2020.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2013 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: The name Mãe translates as “mother vine” and this wine, made from the oldest vines on the estate, delves back into the roots of winemaking by using traditional open fermenting tanks and long wood aging. It is concentrated and ripe, still full of tannins and a powerful, dry and smoky structure. Age this wine for several years and drink from 2020.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Vinha Mãe Red (Lisboa)

description: Produced by Winemaker Luis Duarte, this wine is darkly colored and boldly composed, with long wood-aging leaving traces of spice and toast. The fruit is rich and complex, with firm tannins. It is still young and will need time; drink after 2019.
title: Herdade dos Grous 2013 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine comes from the Guedes family's Carvalhais estate in the heart of the Dão. Only made in better vintages, this latest release is almost at its peak. It has smooth, ripe tannins with leather, spice and acidity rather than the primary fruits. That makes for a sophisticated, complex wine that will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Sogrape 2010 Quinta dos Carvalhais Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A smooth, rich wine whose fruit is ripe, full of blackberry flavors and perfumed acidity. It also has weight, concentration and a tight mineral edge that gives it extra complexity. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Andreza Reserva  Red (Douro)

description: Syrah meets two Portuguese grapes in this rich and ripe wine, smoothing out the tannins of the Touriga Nacional in the blend. It has black fruits that are broad and dense along with juicy acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2012 2 Worlds Red (Tejo)

description: Packed with wood and fruit tannins, it is a solid, dark and dense wine that will develop well. It shows great structure, concentrated berry fruits and final acidity. Wait until 2017 before drinking.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: White peach aromas give a warm feeling. It has fine acidity as well, bursting with fruit and with just a touch of toast. It's ready to drink but will benefit by holding until 2015 in bottle.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2013 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional White (Tejo)

description: White peach aromas give a warm feeling. It has fine acidity as well, bursting with fruit and with just a touch of toast. It's ready to drink but will benefit by holding until 2015 in bottle.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2013 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional White (Tejo)

description: Big, bold and ripe, it has concentrated fruit flavors that give black plum juice and acidity, while the tannins still show strength and power. The blend of Syrah, Alicante Bouschet and Aragonez is coming together richly and with density. It needs to age, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Intense and crisp, it shows bright fruits and some weight as well. A touch of yellow fruits give the grapefruit a warmer character and good depth of flavor. It's a Vinho Verde for cooler days, ripe and ready for food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Maria Papoila Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Dense and concentrated, this powerful wine has bold tannins, a solid structure and a dry core. At the same time, plenty of fruit bestows richness and a juicy character. It will need time, so drink from 2016.
designation: Quinta de S João Batista Reserva
title: Caves Dom Teodosio 2011 Quinta de S João Batista Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: Fragrant and fruity, this very fresh wine has a strong mineral texture. The freshness gives way to a deeper, rich sense that brings out a more creamy character. It's ripe and rich at the end.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2013 Aphros Ten White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fragrant and fruity, this very fresh wine has a strong mineral texture. The freshness gives way to a deeper, rich sense that brings out a more creamy character. It's ripe and rich at the end.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2013 Aphros Ten White (Vinho Verde)

description: Layers of spice and wood dominate what is a young, fruity wine. Although this blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional is made to drink now, it does in fact need another year to balance red fruit and wood. Drink from 2017.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (Bairrada)

description: This blend of the rare Caladoc with Tinta Roriz has plenty of the red-berry fruitiness and cool acidity typical of a wine from the ocean-influenced Lisboa region. The tannins are soft; the fruit is up front, with just with a touch of spice.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Arinto and perfumed Verdelho, the wine is ripe with yellow fruits and pear. It has spice and a clean, clear texture that is immediately attractive and drinkable. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Santa Vitória Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is an open, fruity wine. It has soft tannins and juicy red fruit flavors. Made to be drunk young, it is just that, bright and rounded and with fine acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: UDACA 2014 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This is an open, fruity wine. It has soft tannins and juicy red fruit flavors. Made to be drunk young, it is just that, bright and rounded and with fine acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: UDACA 2014 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: A deliciously fresh and soft young wine, it is just off dry: really more light and crisp. Lemon and tight citrus flavors are lifted by a prickle on the tongue. This is a perfect summer drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Blue White (Vinho Verde)
