description: Blending Fernão Pires and Sauvignon Blanc from the Casal Branco estate, this is a crisp wine that is full of white fruit flavors, hints of pineapple and an herbal edge. It is bright, light and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Capoeira Branco White (Tejo)

description: This wine is all fruit, showing fresh berries and a balance of acidity. It is has a bright, lightly stalky character that comes from the black currant and blueberry flavors. The aftertaste continues the fresh theme.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a lightly textured wine that has red berry flavors, spice and lively acidity. It is sweet, rich and generous in character, with red fruit, black currant and fine, well-integreated acidity.
title: Messias 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a lightly textured wine that has red berry flavors, spice and lively acidity. It is sweet, rich and generous in character, with red fruit, black currant and fine, well-integreated acidity.
title: Messias 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: While the aromas of this rich wine suggest a barnyard character, on the palate it is ripe and still young. Yellow fruits dominate with light acidity and a generous structure. At the end, the wine is full, opulent and needing to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2013 Duas Quintas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Arinto is a grape that lends itself to the cool climate of Lisboa. It brings out the crisp, lemon character of the grape with its bright acidity. This wine is fresh, aromatic and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Arinto is a grape that lends itself to the cool climate of Lisboa. It brings out the crisp, lemon character of the grape with its bright acidity. This wine is fresh, aromatic and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Chocapalha's everyday red is soft, fruity and already delicious to drink. It has some richness and weight from the red fruits, but the acidity and the smooth texture make it so approachable.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a big, beefy and structured wine that at the same time is laden with fruit. A reminder of the tough schist soil of the Douro, the wine's mineral edge is balanced by the bright juicy fruit and acidity. With the tannins, this second wine from Duorum will age well, so drink from 2016.
title: Duorum 2013 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)

description: With its green edge, this is not a ripe vintage wine. Certainly, the fruit is dense and sweet, but there is always the feeling of astringency, black currant juiciness that does not suggest aging.
title: Burmester 2005 Vintage  (Port)

description: This blend of wines from Dão, Bairrada and Lisboa is ripe, full of black fruits and with subtle signs of the wood aging. Named to celebrate the Portuguese mariners who sailed to the spice islands of the East Indies, it is warm with its own spiciness as well as a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Sogrape 2015 Silk & Spice Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Firmly tannic and dry, this is a textured wine with a strong mineral character. Its dark plum-skin fruitiness is tight, nervy and spicy. A strong tannic element, very dry and firm, pushes forward. It's a wine to drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2011 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: Firmly tannic and dry, this is a textured wine with a strong mineral character. Its dark plum-skin fruitiness is tight, nervy and spicy. A strong tannic element, very dry and firm, pushes forward. It's a wine to drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2011 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: The Dão's Encruzado grape gives this wine its rich, yellow fruits and apple flavors. It is still young, textured and fruity. Balanced and very fresh with a tangy, tight texture, this wine will age well. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Somontes Branco Colheita White (Dão)

description: Alicante Bouschet gives intense color to any wine. Here. almost black in color, the wine is richly flavored with dark plum and berry flavors and considerable acidity. It's already balanced with a fresher element pairing with the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2012 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: In the Tejo region, Alvarinho loses its specific mineral and ripe creamy texture. What is has instead is intense fruitiness. Green and white fruits fill the glass with a fresh and youthful character. It's bright, crisp and ready to drink now.
title: Fiuza 2014 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: Dense in color, this firm wine has a rich black-fruit character. There is a strong element of acidity, which brings out the natural fruitiness of the wine. At the same time, there is enough dense texture to promise aging.
title: Cálem 2010 Vintage  (Port)

description: This perfumed, sweet and fruity wine is from Messias's flagship vineyard in São João da Pesqueira, high above the southern bank of the Douro. The tannins melt into the black plum flavor. This is rich, sweet and softly textured, and it will be delicious in a year or two.
title: Messias 2009 Quinta do Cachão Vintage  (Port)

description: This rich and juicy wine from the Pinhão Valley has enormous potential, as shown by its strong, tannic character and firm structure. The foot-trodden grapes lend great flavor intensity, fine concentration and a note of blackberry juice. It will age well.
title: Wine & Soul 2009 Pintas Vintage  (Port)

description: The creamy, ripe character of Alvarinho is pronounced in this rich wine. Ripe citrus and juicy apricot fruit give a smooth, rounded character that is lightly crispened by its final tangy acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Toucas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A big textured, smooth wine, sweet fruits with firm tannins finished with dark perfumes. It is a blockbuster, thankfully without high alcohol, balanced in its richness. A barbecue wine, ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Grand'Arte Shiraz (Lisboa)

description: A curious blend of local grapes with Syrah and Merlot has produced a bold, ripe wine. The tannins are soft, surrounded by juicy plum and damson flavors and a broad, ripe texture.
title: Azamor 2005 Red (Alentejano)

description: A curious blend of local grapes with Syrah and Merlot has produced a bold, ripe wine. The tannins are soft, surrounded by juicy plum and damson flavors and a broad, ripe texture.
title: Azamor 2005 Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe wine, with white fruits and a touch of spice. The crisp minerality of Vinho Verde is all there, with a satisfyingly textured aftertaste.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2009 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A light, sweet wine that has a faint prickle and candied-strawberry flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Flamingo Escolha Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a young- looking wine that tastes equally fresh. Red fruits and soft tannins are balanced with acidity It tastes too young to be a true tawny with no hint of any nutty maturity.
designation: Butler Nephew & Co Tawny Finest Reserve
title: Christie's NV Butler Nephew & Co Tawny Finest Reserve  (Port)

description: Made from Alicante Bouschet, this is a wine for drinkers who like experiences. With tannins, a dry texture balanced by black fruit, it will be a fine sparkler with food, and a conversation piece.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Tinto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires where the blend produces a wine that is soft and gently fruity. It has attractive acidity as well as a touch of spice and intense citrus at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: There is an attractive light sparkle to this off-dry rosé. It has strawberry fruit and a touch of acidity that balances the candied softness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Padeiro Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: There was probably too much wood aging of this wine. It shows in the woody character which threatens to smother the black-currant fruit. The acidity at the end helps to give the wine some attraction.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: There was probably too much wood aging of this wine. It shows in the woody character which threatens to smother the black-currant fruit. The acidity at the end helps to give the wine some attraction.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: This popular brand's pink version is off dry, lightly fizzy and fruity. It has a strawberry-sherbet character that is attractive and great for summer drinking.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This popular brand's pink version is off dry, lightly fizzy and fruity. It has a strawberry-sherbet character that is attractive and great for summer drinking.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A powerful, punchy wine that brings richness along with acidity to a blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca and Tinta Roriz. The smoothness of the surface hides firm, dusty tannins, with wild fig and dark plum flavors.
title: Messias 2004 Quinta do Cachão Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: A young, powerful wine, dominated by bitter chocolate, cocoa and dense ripe black fruits. The wood element lifts this mix of flavors and gives a great sense of structure. Dark figs and herbs add complexity, while the tannins are powerful.
title: J.M. da Fonseca and Van Zeller 2004 Domini Plus Red (Douro)
winery: J.M. da Fonseca and Van Zeller

description: Meat, bacon and plum skin aromas are followed by dense, ripe tannins, piled on by black, solid fruits. This is a powered, intense wine, with superrich fruit, but encased in dry tannins.
title: Falua 2005 Conde de Vimioso Reserva Red (Ribatejano)

description: With 15 months of wood aging enhancing the natural richness of old vines, this impressive wine is both spicy and packed with fruit. It is young, still with its bright baby fruit and with acidity that needs to soften. The wine, with its pepper toast flavors as well as its rich apple and citrus fruits, will be best from 2018.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2015 Crooked Vines Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: A lightly wood-aged wine, this is floral and spicy. With its pear and citrus flavors, soft texture and fine mature fruit, it is nicely balanced and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2014 Padre Pedro Reserva Branco Viognier-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: A lightly wood-aged wine, this is floral and spicy. With its pear and citrus flavors, soft texture and fine mature fruit, it is nicely balanced and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2014 Padre Pedro Reserva Branco Viognier-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: This wine is rich, full of dark fruits and dusty tannins. It has a solid structure with ripe black fruits and concentration. Wood aging and a dry edge have given the wine a core that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Parras Wines 2014 Montaria Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine has tannins, a dense structure and concentration. Still firm, it offers wood-aging flavors as well as big black fruits. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2013 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This wine has tannins, a dense structure and concentration. Still firm, it offers wood-aging flavors as well as big black fruits. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2013 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This is a balanced, ripe wine. Soft tannins support the fruit well, offering some good potential. It is ready to drink, fruity and with acidity in the aftertaste.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2012 Premium Red (Douro)

description: Initially austere, this is a strongly tannic wine with a firm structure and lean fruits. It is still young and the tannins should soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, smooth wine. With spice from wood aging and balanced acidity, it is fruity as well as lightly structured. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, smooth wine. With spice from wood aging and balanced acidity, it is fruity as well as lightly structured. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A classic Douro blend that includes Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca has produced a ripe, soft and full wine. It has licorice and dark-chocolate flavors as well as bold tannins and rich black-currant fruits. Drink this solid wine from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2014 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: This wine remains a benchmark for the Vinho Verde region, even though the producers have now recast it as a Minho wine. It is steely, tight and crisp, with a touch of creaminess that gives it a more rounded aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.
designation: Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho
title: Aveleda 2013 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Minho)

description: This wine remains a benchmark for the Vinho Verde region, even though the producers have now recast it as a Minho wine. It is steely, tight and crisp, with a touch of creaminess that gives it a more rounded aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.
designation: Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho
title: Aveleda 2013 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Minho)

description: Concentrated and powerful, this is a rich and intense black-fruited wine. Notes of spice, herb and dark chocolate mingle with the flavor of black plum juice and firm, dry tannins. The result is a wine that needs several more years to age.
designation: Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon
title: Aveleda 2010 Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Beiras)

description: Big, rich and ripe, this is packed with intense black fruits and dark tannins, with the solid structure yielding a dense core. Its fruit is balanced by acidity, giving the wine ­essential lift. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Ataide da Costa Martins Seredo 2009 Ataide Seredo Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: Big, rich and ripe, this is packed with intense black fruits and dark tannins, with the solid structure yielding a dense core. Its fruit is balanced by acidity, giving the wine ­essential lift. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Ataide da Costa Martins Seredo 2009 Ataide Seredo Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: The top red from Adega Mayor, this is serious and impressive. Its firm, dry and dusty tannins are balanced by an intense blackberry flavor and contrasted with licorice and coffee notes. As it ages, it will become more intense and elegant.
title: Adega Mayor 2008 Pai Chão Garrafeira Red (Alentejano)

description: Opulent and wood-aged, this feels intense and rounded with a ripe Burgundian feel. The full weight of the peach and apricot fruits are given a powerful push by the toast, spice and vanilla flavors. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2009 Palpite Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Richly structured and ripe, this has black tannins laced with dark plum fruit. Its tannins promise aging while its fruit already offers a rounded taste. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Duorum 2010 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is both fruity and mineral driven, a combination that gives intense structure surrounded by ripe black fruit. Chocolate and spice notes come from the wood aging. All of the elements come together in a powerful, full-bodied effort that should age for three years.
designation: Quinta de Pancas Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta de Pancas Selecção do Enólogo Red (Lisboa)

description: Full bodied and rich, this has a juicy core followed by firm, minerally tannins and intense acidity. Wood aging adds complexity to this impressive, ageworthy effort.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 Quinta da Garrida Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Approaching tawny in color, this is a mature white Port. It has a wood-aged tang, with spice and toast flavors that have given the wine an old gold feel. The surface is sweet, yet there is an underlying dryness.
title: Cálem NV 10-Years Old White  (Port)

description: Very structured and firm, this has dense tannins overlaying the black currant fruit. Its dry, solid texture ­dominates, yielding an impressive wine that has fine juicy fruit now and will age well over four years.
title: Sogrape 2009 Callabriga Red (Douro)

description: Very structured and firm, this has dense tannins overlaying the black currant fruit. Its dry, solid texture ­dominates, yielding an impressive wine that has fine juicy fruit now and will age well over four years.
title: Sogrape 2009 Callabriga Red (Douro)

description: Huge and rich, this offers ripe black fruits and a concentrated structure. It's packed with a seemingly sweet blackberry flavor that serves as a counterpoint to the firm texture. With both density and a dark edge, this will age over several years.
designation: Quinta da Fronteira Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta da Fronteira Selecção do Enólogo Red (Douro)

description: A dark-colored, wood-aged wine, this is serious and power­ful. It has tannic weight along with a black­berry flavor, and a smooth tar and herb layer that's all balanced by the acidity. The wood still needs another year to fully integrate; age for another 2–3 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Herdade da Farizoa Grand Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: A dark-colored, wood-aged wine, this is serious and power­ful. It has tannic weight along with a black­berry flavor, and a smooth tar and herb layer that's all balanced by the acidity. The wood still needs another year to fully integrate; age for another 2–3 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Herdade da Farizoa Grand Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm and structured, this is a densely rich wine for aging. Firm tannins dominate its ripe black fruit, lending notes of spice, licorice and toast from the wood. It needs several years of aging to round out—give it four years at least.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 T Quinta da Terrugem Red (Alentejo)

description: Firm and structured, this is a densely rich wine for aging. Firm tannins dominate its ripe black fruit, lending notes of spice, licorice and toast from the wood. It needs several years of aging to round out—give it four years at least.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 T Quinta da Terrugem Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a rich, wood-aged wine, with smoky aromas and a strong spiciness. On the palate, the wine is ripe, full of black fruits and firm tannins. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Syrah has a fine perfumed character, with generous structure and delicious acidity. Drink after 2015.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Vale do Armo Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Dominated by the Trincadeira and Aragonez grapes, this is a super-smooth, ripe wine from northeast Alentejo. Oak aging has rounded out the tannins, with generous red fruit driving the palate. Already completely integrated, this wine needs no further aging to be pleasantly enjoyed.
title: Monte da Penha 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: It's old-gold color says it all. This luscious, liquorous wine has a tangy edge to go alongside the acidity, the raisin fruits and flavors of long wood aging. It's not so much fresh as still very alive and poised. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Vallado NV 40 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Foot trodden in traditional open granite lagars, this is an elegant wine. Ripe black plum jelly flavors are balanced by firm tannins and a fresher edge. It's a wine that will develop over a long time, although with its fruit it's almost ready to drink now. Ideally, though, keep it until 2025.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2012 Adelaide Vintage  (Port)

description: The hot 2009 vintage has yielded young vintage Ports with intense color. Here the color shows the ripeness of the perfumed, concentrated black fruit. Rich, full, more open than tannic, likely to age over the medium term.
title: Duorum 2009 Vinha Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a sweet, soapy wine that has some red fruit and acidity. It is soft, without much definition. Seriously chilled, it could be enjoyable.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Rosé Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This is a sweet, soapy wine that has some red fruit and acidity. It is soft, without much definition. Seriously chilled, it could be enjoyable.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Rosé Sparkling (Tejo)

description: The wine is perfumed and so soft. It could make a good apéritif with its light texture and equally light acidity. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Monte do Enforcado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and candied, this is a ripe wine that has sweet strawberry-fruit flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Lago Cerqueira Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a sweet, lightly sparkling wine. It has crisp apple as well as citrus flavors to contrast with the sweetness. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)

description: A rich and smooth wine, its tannins already deliciously integrated into the juicy black fruits. The wine has a tarry character along with its blackberry acidity, sweetness and an extra roundness from the wood. Worth aging for 3–4 years.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Domini Plus Red (Douro)

description: At this high alcohol, the wine should be bursting the envelope. Yet it still has great elegance, its richness rolling around the mouth. Red- and blackberry-jelly flavors are laced with fine tannins and a young, juicy aftertaste. Only at the end does the alcohol show.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2009 Malhadinha Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich and concentrated wine, packed with tannins and dense, perfumed berry fruits. There is a fresh element to the wine also, that gives a lift to the aftertaste. For a lighter, softer style of LBV, this is just right.
title: C. da Silva 2010 Presdential  (Port)

description: Produced from the best parcels of the estate, this wine is structured, firm and concentrated. It is rich, hinting at dark chocolate flavors at this young stage along with dense tannins. As it matures, this will transform into a ripe and concentrated wine that is dark with black plum and juicy acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Mythos Red (Tejo)

description: Multicastas, or many grape varieties, holds a blend of five grapes. It's a young, fruity wine that has ripe tannins and a soft texture, but still manages a dry core. It would be good to drink now for its fruit, but will be better from 2016.
title: Lobo 2012 Multicastas Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: An old-vines white wine from the Douro is rare, and this rich wine rewards the winemaker who found the grapes. Aged in wood, ripe and with lemon, peach and grapefruit flavors, it balances richness with a crisp, taut texture. Age this wine a year.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: A wood- aged wine with strong toasty flavors. They don't mask the fruit too much and will integrate soon to give a rich, warm wine that has spiciness and ripe yellow fruit flavors. Drink from 2014.
title: Campolargo 2011 Branco Cerceal (Bairrada)

description: A sophisticated, mature wine, it combines fresh, ripe apple fruits with a toasty edge. It's a full-throated wine, full of flavor and ready to drink now.
title: Campolargo 2008 Borga Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: A beautiful, fragrant wine that is fresh with apples and pears and lightly mineral in character. It has great fruitiness and lively acidity that continues strong to the end. Drink now.
title: Muxagat 2011 Os Xistos Altos Rabigato (Douro)

description: A beautiful, fragrant wine that is fresh with apples and pears and lightly mineral in character. It has great fruitiness and lively acidity that continues strong to the end. Drink now.
title: Muxagat 2011 Os Xistos Altos Rabigato (Douro)

description: This rich and powerful wine offers dark tannins, great concentration and bold black fruits. Wood aging has added both spice and a smooth texture. The wine comes from a good vintage and although it is ready to drink will repay aging; drink now and until 2023.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2011 Dona Maria Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: You can tell this is going to be a top-of-the-range wine by the heavy bottle. Named after the apple orchard that was the original vineyard of the producer, it is powerful and concentrated, with blackberry fruits and a solid, firm texture that will soften. Drink from 2018.
designation: Pomar do Espírito Santo Cheleiros Reserva
title: Manzwine 2013 Pomar do Espírito Santo Cheleiros Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Following the current fashion in Portugal for single-varietal wines, this is a rich, structured take on what has become the country's national grape. Powerful and with a dense structure, it retains some of the perfumed elegance that is one of Touriga Nacional's hallmarks. The tannins will age further and the fruit will come out more strongly. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: This wine has fine tannins, rich black fruits and a dry core. It is produced by the Roquette family, who owns this spectacular estate high above the Douro. A solid, structured wine, it's packed with tannins and fruit, finishing with acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Superior Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, soft wine comes from a company based in Régua in the western end of the Douro vineyards. With light tannins that are dominated by the bold berry fruits, the wine is generous and full bodied. Acidity at the end will make this an impressive, balanced wine from 2019.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fruity, herbaceous wine that is both fresh and rounded. It has clean, bright, green fruit and citrus flavors, resulting in an overall crisp character. It is still settling down and developing its richer side; drink from 2014.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2012 DouRosa Branco White (Douro)

description: A fruity, herbaceous wine that is both fresh and rounded. It has clean, bright, green fruit and citrus flavors, resulting in an overall crisp character. It is still settling down and developing its richer side; drink from 2014.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2012 DouRosa Branco White (Douro)

description: Rough around the edges, this is a wine with some barnyard flavors as well as red berry fruits. It is soft, the tannins surrounded by juiciness.
title: Cortes de Cima 2009 Trincadeira (Alentejano)

description: The entry-level wine of Quinta do Crasto, this is soft, fruity, full of blackberries and sweetness. There is a smooth feel to it, with some wood but more just enjoyable juicy fruit.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2009 Crasto Red (Douro)

description: Firm tannins give a dry character. Black fruits are laced with acidity to give the fruity element, while the dry core is dense and promising aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2010 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: Firm tannins give a dry character. Black fruits are laced with acidity to give the fruity element, while the dry core is dense and promising aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2010 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: This soft, ripe and fruity blend of local grapes is young and spicy. It has flavors of ripe red fruits that are cut with juicy acidity. It's a fresh wine that is ready to drink.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: Earthy aromas set off a wine that is still very firm and dry. It's powerful, dense with tannins and big, ripe fruits. Everything is exaggerated, giving a wine that's missing elegance, although one that packs an impressive punch. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2009 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A light wine from a wet year. The wine is soft, seemingly dilute. It has some red berry flavors, but not much texture or structure, with wood aging taste.
title: Quinta da Prelada 2002 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This blend of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional is particularly crisp and fruity. It has some richness, but it is the bright red berry and red currant fruit that makes it so refreshing. Drink now.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional is particularly crisp and fruity. It has some richness, but it is the bright red berry and red currant fruit that makes it so refreshing. Drink now.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is an open, ripe and accessible wine. With soft tannins and ripe Aragonez and Syrah fruit, it is drinkable now. Berries and acidity complete this fruity wine.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged wine is full of toasty fruits and a mineral texture. Ripe apricots and sweet apples give a fruity aspect that is balanced by the toast and spice. Perfumed acidity finishes this wine that suggests further aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine is full of toasty fruits and a mineral texture. Ripe apricots and sweet apples give a fruity aspect that is balanced by the toast and spice. Perfumed acidity finishes this wine that suggests further aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva White (Douro)

description: This is a big wine with dark tannins and rich black fruits that are powerful and dense. The strong mineral texture comes from the rocky soils of Catapereiro. Wood aging adds to the complexity. Drink from 2017.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: This is a big wine with dark tannins and rich black fruits that are powerful and dense. The strong mineral texture comes from the rocky soils of Catapereiro. Wood aging adds to the complexity. Drink from 2017.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: This wood-aged Guru is a rich (while lemon- and lime-flavored) spicy wine. It has a strong mineral element with a crisp, tangy, steely character. Its fruitiness is tempered by the complex texture that promises aging for a few years. Drink from 2017.
title: Wine & Soul 2013 Guru White (Douro)

description: From vines on the cool plateau above the Douro, this is a fresh and fruity wine. Light wood-aging is just noticeable, giving a little spice to the textured, steely fruit. Crisp apples and pink grapefruit offer freshness. The wine could age more, so drink from end of 2015.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Reserva White (Douro)

description: A faintly metallic flavor spoils this red fruited wine. It brings out tight acidity and red currant fruits while the structure is lost.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2011 Red (Tejo)

description: Get through the dirty nose and there is plenty of red fruit and acidity. The wine is dry and fruity but spoiled by that rustic edge at the beginning.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Vinha Padre Pedro Rosé (Tejo)

description: A ripe, very fruity wine with enough softness to suggest sweetness. Smooth with red fruits and a touch of acidity, it's ready to drink now.
title: FVine 2012 Tinto Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A soft, fruity wine, it comes straight from tank without any wood aging. It's a fine barbecue wine with its black currant fruitiness and light, dry tannins. Drink 2014.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Dona Helena Colheita Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: A soft, fruity wine, it comes straight from tank without any wood aging. It's a fine barbecue wine with its black currant fruitiness and light, dry tannins. Drink 2014.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Dona Helena Colheita Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this is a delicate, bright and intensely fruity wine. It is tangy and textured, with fruit zest and crisp acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this is a delicate, bright and intensely fruity wine. It is tangy and textured, with fruit zest and crisp acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: Lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, almost dry wine that offers fresh sliced apples and citrus flavors. Made from the Louriero grape which is widely planted in the Lima valley, this is a fruity sip for the summer.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Ponte Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, almost dry wine that offers fresh sliced apples and citrus flavors. Made from the Louriero grape which is widely planted in the Lima valley, this is a fruity sip for the summer.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Ponte Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: An impressive wine from old vines. The 2009 has an extra depth of richness and full character. The black fruits go deep into the wine, hugely rich while still keeping a dark structure. Powerful and needing aging.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: Old vines in this case means an average age of 70 years, from a vineyard that is a mix of different varieties. The result is impressive, very floral with sweet black fruit, licorice and the ripest of tannins. Age this wine for 5–6 years.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2009 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This fruity wine has bright acidity and a perfumed character. With its crisp texture, it is full of lemon and green apple fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)

description: There is enough crispness to make this ripe wine tight and fruity. Its dry strawberry fruitiness comes with a light touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: There is enough crispness to make this ripe wine tight and fruity. Its dry strawberry fruitiness comes with a light touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a wine that shows a more serious side to Vinho Verde. Bone dry, with a crisp and creamy texture, it has citrus, pineapple and red apple flavors. It could even age a few months, but is so drinkable now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2013 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a wine that shows a more serious side to Vinho Verde. Bone dry, with a crisp and creamy texture, it has citrus, pineapple and red apple flavors. It could even age a few months, but is so drinkable now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2013 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: Deliciously aromatic, this is an assertive, fruit-forward wine, with textured minerality. It has yellow fruits that are cut with citrus as well as bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Porca de Murça 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This rich and rounded wine is full of attractive lemon and pineapple fruit. Light steeliness gives a fresh character to the ripeness. It is totally ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2013 Prova Régia Arinto (Lisboa)

description: As bright as a button, this is a crisp, cool wine, lightly herbaceous and deliciously fresh. Just touched by six months wood aging, the wine has an extra layer of richness that contrasts with the young green and citrus fruits. Drink now, or, better, keep until 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2012 Beyra Superior Branco White (Beira Interior)

description: A serious, structured wine that packs a punch of black-cherry and spice flavors, with edges of wood and fine acidity. This is full of ripe fruit, and the tannins take on a supporting role of tension and power.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2009 Quartilho Red (Ribatejo)

description: A sophisticated sparkling wine, showing minerality and structure. With some bottle age, it has developed an attractive nutty character, baring acidity and a tense texture.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2007 Vertice Millésime Sparkling (Douro)

description: This is a top wine from the Borba cooperative. It has all the right richness and fruitiness followed by great concentration, solid texture and dark tannins. The finish shows acidity, with touches of tar and perfume.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2009 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: A fine example of this sometimes tricky grape, this wine is structured with solid tannins and rich fruit. Wood aging has softened some of the structure, allowing a more rounded, rich aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2008 AB Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: This has attractive apple and citrus fruits,with a crisp structure and some sweetness on the finish.
title: Cavipor 2011 Vinhas Altas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine that's dominated by black currant and damson flavors. It is layered with acidity and light tannins. Drink this year.
title: Parras Vinhos 2010 Montaria Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine that's dominated by black currant and damson flavors. It is layered with acidity and light tannins. Drink this year.
title: Parras Vinhos 2010 Montaria Red (Alentejano)

description: Attractive and open, this has sweet fruit and a fresh character. With bright acids and hedgerow fruits, it is ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2009 Castelo do Sulco Red (Lisboa)

description: Chryseia is a benchmark wine in modern Douro table wine making. With its layered tannins, black currant fruit, minerality and stylish yet powerful structure, this is a wine of great stature, needing aging for 2–3 years.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2007 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: Chryseia is a benchmark wine in modern Douro table wine making. With its layered tannins, black currant fruit, minerality and stylish yet powerful structure, this is a wine of great stature, needing aging for 2–3 years.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2007 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: While there is no wood aging in this wine there is some good concentration and richness making it full-bodied, with ripe citrus and minerality. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This wine goes for the tropical fruit approach to Sauvignon Blanc. Fruity with peach and mango flavors, it is tangy with orange zest and textured with minerality. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: This simple wine blends the typical Dão grapes of Alfrocheiro, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional into a spicy fruity whole. Young and fruity with black currant and spice, it's finished with toast. This is ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Red (Dão)

description: This simple wine blends the typical Dão grapes of Alfrocheiro, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional into a spicy fruity whole. Young and fruity with black currant and spice, it's finished with toast. This is ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Red (Dão)

description: On the western side of the Lisboa region, this vineyard occupies a beautiful protected valley. The wine is made in an immediately accessible style with bright red fruits and light tannins. It is fruity, ready to drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: On the western side of the Lisboa region, this vineyard occupies a beautiful protected valley. The wine is made in an immediately accessible style with bright red fruits and light tannins. It is fruity, ready to drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A wood-aged Chardonnay from mountain vineyards above the Douro. The wine has spice, yellow fruits and a strong toast character. Acidity is there to add some freshness to the concentrated, rounded taste.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2009 Quinta de Cidrô Reserva Chardonnay (Duriense)

description: Exhibiting all the richness of the 2009 vintage, this is a serious, concentrated wine. The red fruits are deliciously juicy as well as layered with firm tannins. Ripe fruit is just waiting to burst out, but wait for two years.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2009 La Rosa Red (Douro)

description: Dark-colored wine, a blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional, both of which lend their tannins to this still-young wine. It is dense with a firm, dry presence. The fruit is textured, structured, focused on weight and aging potential.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2008 Red (Beiras)

description: Dark-colored wine, a blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional, both of which lend their tannins to this still-young wine. It is dense with a firm, dry presence. The fruit is textured, structured, focused on weight and aging potential.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2008 Red (Beiras)

description: Perfumed wine, with plum fruits, toast and a sweet, rich texture. It is dense, deep flavored, the fruit and tannins going right into the firm structure. Give this concentrated, bold wine at least 4–5 years.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Quinta dos Aciprestes Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Antão Vaz and Arinto, two classic white varieties of Alentejo, are blended into this simple, fruity wine. Its acidity and citrus fruitiness have been given weight by lees stirring. The wine is crisp and lively, ready to drink now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Antão Vaz and Arinto, two classic white varieties of Alentejo, are blended into this simple, fruity wine. Its acidity and citrus fruitiness have been given weight by lees stirring. The wine is crisp and lively, ready to drink now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Ripe fruit and dark-chocolate flavors mark out this concentrated wine. Intense flavors bring out the black plum and damson fruit and heavy tannins that lie behind. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: The latest vintage of this popular brand continues the same ripe, soft character as before. Red berry fruits, balanced acidity and a rounded aftertaste all contribute to a wine that is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The latest vintage of this popular brand continues the same ripe, soft character as before. Red berry fruits, balanced acidity and a rounded aftertaste all contribute to a wine that is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This fruity wine, named after the family that owns Rocim, has attractive acidity, spice and delicious citrus flavors. The aftertaste is tangy and zesty. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Alves Vieira Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a rounded wine, with soft tannins and a crisp aftertaste. Red fruits mingle with a yeasty character to give a wine that is warm, smooth and soft at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Brut Nature Rosé Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe wine with soft tannins and juicy black fruits. It has a good balance between the fruit and the structure, making it a wine for early, easy, beside-the-barbecue drinking.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Vega Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine has a lively, open and fruity side that promises plenty of good barbecues. Red fruits and acidity lie easily together. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: This wood-aged wine is spicy and toasty. It comes from a small property 1,000 feet above the Douro. Although it offers blackberry flavors and acidity, these are dominated by the wood. Let the wine soften a few months more and drink from 2018.
title: CARM 2014 Vinha da Urze Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This juicy wine is full of ripe, open fruit that makes it drinkable when young. It offers spice as well as rounded strawberry fruits that have just enough acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Lobo e Falcão Red (Tejo)

description: Typical of the wines from Estremadura, low in alcohol, offering great juicy fruit, very fresh, bursting with red currants and berries. It is balanced, a vivid painting of bright flavors.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2006 Portada Red (Estremadura)

description: A highly perfumed, lime-dominated wine that gets some freshness from apple skins and high acidity. Its flavors do feel awkward, fresh from the candy shop rather than the vineyard.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: From vines in the heart of the Dão, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. It is rich with both tannins and black fruits. The flavors of the wood aging are still there and need to soften out. Otherwise, this is a very fine that will repay aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta das Marias 2014 Cuvée TT Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This is a beautifully perfumed wine, with violets and ripe juicy black fruits. It has a concentrated firm structure that puts the fruitiness on a pedestal and gives it shape and intensity. The wine, named by the Danish and American owners after Denmark's literary legend, Hans Christian Andersen, is ready to drink.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Homenagem a Hans Christian Andersen Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This is a young wine in Madeira terms. That means it is full of fruit, with bitter orange and ginger to balance the acidity. The wine is sweet, always cut with that acidity and with a burnt character in the background. It is ready to drink, although some bottle age will still make it even better. Drink now and for decades.
title: Blandy's 2003 Colheita Single Harvest Bual (Madeira)

description: A deliciously rich and spicy wine, very much in the style of the new Douro wines, softly perfumed, with black plums, sweet and dusty tannins, only a hint of dryness. The wine is balanced, with great fruit and acidity to go with the structure.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2005 Três Bagos Red (Douro)

description: Any doubts that Portugal's Alentejo region can rival many big New World wines would be dispelled by this extravagant wine. With its intense fruit, sweet tannins, figs, coffee and spice flavors, it packs a serious punch of flavor. For drinking now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2007 Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: Any doubts that Portugal's Alentejo region can rival many big New World wines would be dispelled by this extravagant wine. With its intense fruit, sweet tannins, figs, coffee and spice flavors, it packs a serious punch of flavor. For drinking now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2007 Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: Without doubt a wine that needs aging. The tannins from both wood and fruit are dense, concentrated, layering over the delicious fruit. When it is balanced out—give it a year—then this is going to be a powerful, but impressively elegant wine, a real step forward in Churchill's table wines.
title: Churchill's 2007 Churchill Estates Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Wood-aged, this is a ripe-textured wine that has rich flavors of yellow and white fruits and toast. It has concentrated, intense fruit that bursts in the mouth. Delicious and impressive, this could be aged for another two years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Morgado de Santa Catherina Reserva White (Bucelas)

description: This is an austere wine that blossoms slowly. Using grapes sourced from a vineyard at an elevation of 2,000 feet, this has a wild herb character along with dark black fruits and tannins that need several years to age. Give this very ageworthy effort at least four years.
designation: Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo Red (Beira Interior)

description: Densely tannic, this is also full of sweet berry fruits. Powerful and superripe, its fruit is beginning to integrate into the big, smoky, chocolaty structure. The finish shows both toast and juicy fruit notes. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Using grapes sourced from old vines, this is dark and concentrated. It's dominated at the start by firm, dry tannins, with its power coming from its dark, brooding fruit and dense structure. Age for at least four years.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Lua Nova em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Using grapes sourced from old vines, this is dark and concentrated. It's dominated at the start by firm, dry tannins, with its power coming from its dark, brooding fruit and dense structure. Age for at least four years.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Lua Nova em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This wine is easy and accessible, with bright red fruits and a light structure. There is fresh character that brings out its fruitiness, lightened by acidity.
title: Symington Family Estates 2013 Altano Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine that is full of fresh white fruit tones on the nose. It has ripe yellow fruits along with crisp lemon and a touch of minerality. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2014 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: Berry fruit flavors give this wine a light, fruity character. It is stalky and fresh with acidity, showing a light aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Packed with all the ripe fruit of the Alentejo, this warm, full-bodied wine is generous and round. Black-fruit tones dominate, balanced by perfumed acidity and a smooth texture from the high proportion of Aragon (Tempranillo). It is ready to drink, although it will improve at least until 2017.
title: Espaço Rural 2013 Bojador Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fruity wine that has red fruit tones and a firm tannic character. It has juicy acidity, along with spice from wood aging. The Syrah in the blend gives an earthy character, while the acidity shows brightly at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Espaço Rural 2013 Alves Vieira Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A burly, rough-hewn wine that has been slightly tamed by the use of French oak aging. But it remains a dense wine, packed with dry tannins, spice and herbs, and some juicy black plum flavors. The finish is dry, very firm, and the wine needs at least five years.
title: Dão Sul 2005 Grilos Red (Dão)

description: This limited edition wine from Passarella's original vineyard is wood-fermented, bringing out a creamy texture and the natural richness of the fruit. It's deliciously rich, laced with spiced apple and white stone fruit flavors, and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2014 Villa Oliveira Encruzado (Dão)

description: With 18 months in French and American oak, this wine is structured with concentrated tannins under its bright, juicy blackberry fruit. Still young and brightly acidic, it's drinkable now but will be better from 2019.
title: CARM 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Full of black fruits, the wine is solid, still very dense and young. Dark chocolate and coffee flavors give a bitter edge to the dense tannins, which need to be allowed to soften. Its black fruits and acidity are exuberant, and the wine will mature well. Drink from 2019.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2011 Maria Mora Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a super-ripe, still very young wine. It's showing all its concentrated fruits, wood aging flavors and dense texture as well as the firm tannins that will allow it to age. With its combination of black plum skin, blackberry and dark concentration, leave the wine until 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: The top wine in the Rocim range is produced from selected Alicante Bouschet grapes. It is huge and powerful, perhaps too much in its concentration, richness and density. Dark and brooding, it is super everything and certainly needs to calm down. Drink from 2019.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Grande Rocim Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: The top wine in the Rocim range is produced from selected Alicante Bouschet grapes. It is huge and powerful, perhaps too much in its concentration, richness and density. Dark and brooding, it is super everything and certainly needs to calm down. Drink from 2019.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Grande Rocim Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich wine that feels full-bodied and with concentration. It has ripe pineapple and tropical fruit flavors as well as fresher citrus acidity. It has also a fine texture that gives the wine great depth and ripeness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Cartuxa 2013 Foral de Evora Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: Named after the Tyto Alba, the barn owl that lives in the forests around the vineyard, the wine shows a tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc. Mango and pineapple dominate the ripe character of the wine. It is aromatic, just hinting at something more herbal. Drink from 2017.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: Named after the Tyto Alba, the barn owl that lives in the forests around the vineyard, the wine shows a tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc. Mango and pineapple dominate the ripe character of the wine. It is aromatic, just hinting at something more herbal. Drink from 2017.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: From vines in the Tua Valley, a tributary of the Douro, this is a rich wine, structured with dark and firm tannins. Although it is mature, the fruit is still fresh with black-plum flavors and a touch of dark chocolate. Drink the wine now and until 2020.
title: Vale da Corça 2011 Brunheda Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, smooth wine with balanced black fruit flavors and a solid layer of tannins. It is ripe with juicy fruit and cool acidity. The wine is delicious, ready to drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Vale da Poupa Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: There is a good bite to this tight, mineral wine. It has candied orange, a bite of brandy and fine acidity. This is a well-balanced wine, never too sweet with a burst of final freshness.
title: Quinta de Santa Eufemia NV Finest Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: This wine has the dark fruit typical of this quinta, but this year shows more elegance than usual, with dusty tannins and concentrated, sweet fruit.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 1998 Port (Douro)

description: A powerful, solid wine, packed with luscious fruit. The perfumes and the ripeness of the fruit are currently covered with a firm tannin layer, but this should develop well as a medium-term wine.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1998 Quinta de Vargellas Port (Portugal)

description: A powerful, solid wine, packed with luscious fruit. The perfumes and the ripeness of the fruit are currently covered with a firm tannin layer, but this should develop well as a medium-term wine.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1998 Quinta de Vargellas Port (Portugal)

description: Dense color is the character of the Sousão grape, and this wine—almost black—exhibits that character very well. For taste, cherry juice, cranberry and chewy tannins are sharpened by acidity.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2008 Sousão (Douro)

description: Smooth-textured, spicy wine with rich tannins and red berry fruits. Its structure is well integrated, sweet jammy flavors surrounding a dry core, with delicious juicy final acidity.
title: Quinta do Portal 2008 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: With 50% fermentation, this is a ripe, toasty wine, the wood balanced by a great citric swipe. Bright white fruits and wild flower perfumes give the wine a great lift.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2009 Vinha Grande Branco White (Douro)

description: With an extra year in bottle compared to the regular bottling of this wine, the wine has gained some extra depth and richness. It has spice, firm tannins and a juicy background of berry fruits. It's developing well and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: With 12 months in wood, the wine has a smooth, ripe character. The tannins are well integrated into the spicy black fruits from a blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Trincadeira. Juicy acidity and fresh black currant fruits give the wine a lift at the end. Drink from late 2016.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: With 12 months in wood, the wine has a smooth, ripe character. The tannins are well integrated into the spicy black fruits from a blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Trincadeira. Juicy acidity and fresh black currant fruits give the wine a lift at the end. Drink from late 2016.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This blend of four grapes, partially fermented in wood, is an immediately attractive wine. Fresh and fruity with only the lightest toasty hints, the wine has citrus acidity, crisp pear and green plum flavors and a zingy, mineral aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Esporão Reserva White (Alentejo)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley. It has a cool, mineral character that suits it well. Fresh with acidity and tight with its chalky texture, it's a delicious wine to drink now, fruity, tangy and complex.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Crisp, lemon fresh and fruity, this is an attractive wine to drink now. It has some richness from the mineral texture and the tangy orange edge. The aftertaste continues the fruity theme.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2013 Branco White (Douro)

description: A perfumed wine with crisp acidity and light acidity. Lemon and pear fruit are allied with an intensely tangy orange zest character. Lively and fresh, it is ready to drink now.
title: Casal do Conde 2013 Quinta da Arrandosa Moscatel Graúdo (Tejo)

description: This is an attractive, fruity, fresh rosé. It is dry but balances acidity and fruitiness with its sweet strawberry fruit and light touch of vanilla pod. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezirias Catapereiro Rosé (Tejo)

description: An intense wine. it has a cool feel from its 900-foot-high vineyards. Plenty of acidity keeps it fresh and fruity, bringing out flavors of black currant as well as spicy wood. It could age a year, so wait until 2015.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Colleja Red (Douro)

description: This structured, dense and smoky wine features dry tannins and a mineral texture. It has blackberry fruitiness to go with this scaffolding, so it will develop well to give a ripe, full, rich wine. Wait until 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Patamar Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a full and spicy wine that is rich with black plum and berry flavors. The wood comes through strongly with its cedar and pepper character. The contrast with fresher acidity gives this wine its balance. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a full and spicy wine that is rich with black plum and berry flavors. The wood comes through strongly with its cedar and pepper character. The contrast with fresher acidity gives this wine its balance. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana Red (Alentejano)

description: The top wine from La Rosa is produced out of selections from the vineyards and the cellar. Wood aged and with serious concentration, it is packed with dark fruits and dense tannins. They contrast with the generous texture and acidity. The wine should really age for several years. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 La Rosa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is an impressive wine that is rich and generous while also being firm and structured. It has a sense of concentration and power that doesn't take away from its elegance. A fresh black currant tone is balanced by tannins and a lingering flavor of oak. Already showing good integration, this wine will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2017.
title: Cartuxa 2012 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: This is an impressive wine that is rich and generous while also being firm and structured. It has a sense of concentration and power that doesn't take away from its elegance. A fresh black currant tone is balanced by tannins and a lingering flavor of oak. Already showing good integration, this wine will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2017.
title: Cartuxa 2012 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: Aragonês (Tinta Roriz or Tempranillo) is given intense power in the Alentejo. It has sold fruits, black cherry and spice flavors, with a big shoulder of tannins and vivid acidity. A wine for aging—3 to 4 years.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2007 Aragonês da Peceguina Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: Aragonês (Tinta Roriz or Tempranillo) is given intense power in the Alentejo. It has sold fruits, black cherry and spice flavors, with a big shoulder of tannins and vivid acidity. A wine for aging—3 to 4 years.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2007 Aragonês da Peceguina Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: Red-currant jelly aromas and a floral character are followed by a soft-textured, caramel-flavored wine. It has a ripe feel, that's gentle and rather too easy.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A big, ripe and rich wine, whose tannins are so well integrated into the bold, black fruits. The wine has weight, concentration and dark plum flavors that are spiced from wood aging. It's a wine that is ready to drink but will age, so drink until 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A big, ripe and rich wine, whose tannins are so well integrated into the bold, black fruits. The wine has weight, concentration and dark plum flavors that are spiced from wood aging. It's a wine that is ready to drink but will age, so drink until 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This is a deliciously fresh, yet also rounded and rich wine. Creamed apples and soft pears go with a lime juice crispness, resulting in a wine that is ripe, fruity and delicately acidic. Drink now.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2012 Muros Antigos White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a deliciously fresh, yet also rounded and rich wine. Creamed apples and soft pears go with a lime juice crispness, resulting in a wine that is ripe, fruity and delicately acidic. Drink now.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2012 Muros Antigos White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a smooth, wood aged wine that comes from the Mouchão estate. It has rich red fruits, finely integrated tannins and a solid structure. It has an open, generous feel to it, given shape and aging potential by the dry core and fruity acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Mouchão 2010 Dom Rafael Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a dark and dense wine, serious with its firm tannins and solid black fruits. It has spice, blackberry and currant flavors, along with a pure line of acidity. With its firm structure, this dry, concentrated wine needs to age. Drink from 2015.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Solid and structured, this is a rich, darkly tannic wine. It's not all structure, with the ripe black plum and berry fruits giving weight to the palate and smoothing the structure. The end is spicy, tannic, dense and worth aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 Herdade da Pimenta Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a beautifully fresh wine, very clean and crisp. It has a lemon zest and crisp apple character that cuts through the tangy texture. Bright and light, it's fruity and very ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This is an impressive still young wine. With its dense texture and powerful tannins it is concentrated, packed with ripe berry flavors and juicy acidity. It is bold, certainly not reticent, made for some long-term aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Olho de Mocho Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A powerful wine that has licorice and black coffee flavors as well as ripe plum and berry fruits. The balance is there, along with a solid structural base and acidity. The dense wine has power, rich and ripe for development. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Grande Escolha Red (Palmela)

description: This firm, powerful and structured wine is rich with tannins and dark fruits. Spice and wood flavors compete with the ground coffee and juicy fruitiness. A concentrated wine for the long-term, it needs to age, . Drink from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Terra d'Alter Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: This firm, powerful and structured wine is rich with tannins and dark fruits. Spice and wood flavors compete with the ground coffee and juicy fruitiness. A concentrated wine for the long-term, it needs to age, . Drink from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Terra d'Alter Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: There are flavors of sweet wood along with spice and red-berry fruits in this attractive wine. It has enough freshness and acidity to give it a good lift. The wine is smooth and attractively perfumed.
title: Blackett NV Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: There are flavors of sweet wood along with spice and red-berry fruits in this attractive wine. It has enough freshness and acidity to give it a good lift. The wine is smooth and attractively perfumed.
title: Blackett NV Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: A short time in wood has given this wine some extra richness without taking away the fruit. It is a ripe blend of Códega do Larinho, Gouveio and Viosinho, smooth and rich. Acidity, minerality and a fine dash of lemon keep everything fresh.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Douro)

description: A short time in wood has given this wine some extra richness without taking away the fruit. It is a ripe blend of Códega do Larinho, Gouveio and Viosinho, smooth and rich. Acidity, minerality and a fine dash of lemon keep everything fresh.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Douro)

description: This is full of fruit, dried prune and raisin flavors. It's fresh with an attractive lilt of acidity and a light texture that keeps it ready to drink.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Statement Tawny Reserve Decanter  (Port)

description: Fine and ripe, this is a sweet—while also complex—wine from Graham's flagship estate. Its tannins lead easily to ripe flavors of black plum and berry juice, resulting in a wine that is firm, full bodied, fruity and generous. It needs to age.
title: W. & J. Graham's 2010 Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage  (Port)

description: With firm, smoky tannins and a dark bitter-cherry flavor, this is a dense wine. It is fully ripe and rich, with a firm kick at the back. Tough and age worthy, it expresses the schist soil of the region.
title: Duorum 2010 Quinta do Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

description: Floral, ripe and fragrant, this is a stand-out from a new entrant on the vintage Port scene. The forward blackberry flavor is full of sweet tannins. At the same time, the structure, with its core of dense dryness, does promise good aging. This is concentrated and full of potential.
designation: Quinta do Mourão São Leonardo Vintage
title: Mário Braga 2009 Quinta do Mourão São Leonardo Vintage  (Port)

description: Floral, ripe and fragrant, this is a stand-out from a new entrant on the vintage Port scene. The forward blackberry flavor is full of sweet tannins. At the same time, the structure, with its core of dense dryness, does promise good aging. This is concentrated and full of potential.
designation: Quinta do Mourão São Leonardo Vintage
title: Mário Braga 2009 Quinta do Mourão São Leonardo Vintage  (Port)

description: A firm and very structured wine, this is for long-term aging. At this young stage, the fruit seems extracted, but this will pass as the weight of the dense damson skin and tannic character shines through. Complex and finally ripe.
title: Duorum 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: A crisp, fresh white wine, with clean acidity and a forward, easy lemon and melon character, with a hint of honey from the Malvasia Fina grapes in the blend.
title: Quinta dos Roques 2008 Quinta do Correio White (Dão)

description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, crisply flavored with raspberries and fresh acidity. A dry rosé, which finishes with a bright lift.
title: Colinas de São Lourenço 2008 Rosé Red (Bairrada)

description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, crisply flavored with raspberries and fresh acidity. A dry rosé, which finishes with a bright lift.
title: Colinas de São Lourenço 2008 Rosé Red (Bairrada)

description: Delicious citrus and grape juice aromas, with a vivid, lively dry style that explodes with white fruit and lime flavors. The wine is a great apéritif, or with shellfish.
title: Caves da Cerca 2008 Famega White White (Vinho Verde)

description: The perfect summer apéritif, this light, fresh, crisp wine tastes just drier than previous vintages, allowing the apple and lemon fruits to shine even more. It has a tight, taut aftertaste, leaving the mouth clean and refreshed. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Young and with great potential., this is a powerful, firmly tannic wine, full of wood-aging flavors. It is The dark tannins are lifted by a juicy edge that will be attractive as the wine develops although the wood needs time to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 CV Curriculum Vitae Red (Douro)

description: Young and with great potential., this is a powerful, firmly tannic wine, full of wood-aging flavors. It is The dark tannins are lifted by a juicy edge that will be attractive as the wine develops although the wood needs time to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 CV Curriculum Vitae Red (Douro)

description: This is a northern Rhône-style blend, with a touch of Viognier in the Syrah that softens the considerable dark, tannic power of the wine. Along with this solid structure, the wine also has ripe black-plum-skin and blackberry flavors. A concentrated wine, it still needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2012 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a northern Rhône-style blend, with a touch of Viognier in the Syrah that softens the considerable dark, tannic power of the wine. Along with this solid structure, the wine also has ripe black-plum-skin and blackberry flavors. A concentrated wine, it still needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2012 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A wood-aged red Vinho Verde brings out some richness in the Vinhão grape. With its already-red juice, the wine has surprising weight and ripeness with black currant fruit to the fore. Drink now.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2012 Aphros Tinto Vinhão (Vinho Verde)

description: This rich wine has peach and quince flavors along with spice and hints of toast. It's full in the mouth, very fruity and fresh, a warm wine that does manage to keep a fresh burst of lemon acidity at the end. Drink now, but better at the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2012 Sagrado White (Douro)

description: This rich wine has peach and quince flavors along with spice and hints of toast. It's full in the mouth, very fruity and fresh, a warm wine that does manage to keep a fresh burst of lemon acidity at the end. Drink now, but better at the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2012 Sagrado White (Douro)

description: A smooth, fruity wine, it has a light layer of tannins to shape the red fruit flavors. It has great poise, fresh acidity, with a structure already well integrated into the fruitier element. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2011 Falcoaria Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Named in homage to a Marquesa de Alorna who was a poet in the 18th century, this wood-aged rich wine is serious and complex. It has ripe yellow fruits that balance with the spice from the wood aging, giving a ripe creamy wine that will still age. Drink from 2017.
designation: Marquesa de Alorna Grande Reserva Branco
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Marquesa de Alorna Grande Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a powerful wine, perfumed and ripe. Its aromas come from the Touriga Nacional in the blend that also includes Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. It's a dark and dense wine, very rich with enough juicy black fruit to balance. The concentration and tannins suggest long aging, so don't drink before 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Monta da Baía Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: With a firm, almost granite structure, this is a terroir-driven wine, from a quinta named after the River Mondego that flows through the Dão region. It has a dense, tannic character based on ripe berry fruits and concentrated juicy black currants. The wine is intense and still needing to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2009 Quinta do Mondego Red (Dão)

description: The classic Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz has created a solid, dense and very structured wine. Black plums dominate on the fruit spectrum, supported by dry tannins. Fragrant and fresh, it's a wine to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta da Fronteira Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This rich and fruity wine shows the natural richness of the Douro, with dense and firm tannins that will allow the wine to age. Black plum fruits are powerful and concentrated, giving fruit and acidity. It needs to age for several years, don't drink before 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta da Fronteira Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: Full of tannins at this stage, it shows power and density. It's a blend of more than 10 varieties, giving complexity as well as structure. There is acidity as well, bringing together the rich texture and a solid, wood and dark fruit combination. It needs to age a few years, so drink from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2010 Confidencial Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Here is a brisk and fruity wine that has bright acidity and a fresh raspberry flavor. There is an attractive crispness to the finish of this bright rosé.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 Dona Helena Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: This is a light, crisp and fresh wine, with tight acidity and a mineral texture. It has black and red currant flavors, and needs a few months more to age; drink from the end of 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cape Roca Fisherman Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: This is an extracted wine, with licorice and dark chocolate flavors as much as fruit. It is tough at the moment, with dry tannins dominating the black plum flavor and the acidity. Leave until 2016 in the hope it will soften.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2011 Coudel Mor Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a smooth blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto, with a shot of Alvarinho. It is bright and fruity yet also somewhat creamy. There is a lemon tang to this still young wine. Fresh and fruity at the end, drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana White (Alentejano)

description: This is a smooth blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto, with a shot of Alvarinho. It is bright and fruity yet also somewhat creamy. There is a lemon tang to this still young wine. Fresh and fruity at the end, drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana White (Alentejano)

description: Fermentation in oak has given this wine both a toasty aroma and a palate that is spicy in burnt caramel flavors. Yellow fruits are there as well, giving promise for a more balanced future. Drink from 2016.
title: Azamor 2014 Selected White (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, lightly aromatic wine with fresh apple and quince flavors. It has light spice, balanced acidity and a mineral streak that gives the wine shape and texture. It is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2016.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a soft, lightly aromatic wine with fresh apple and quince flavors. It has light spice, balanced acidity and a mineral streak that gives the wine shape and texture. It is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2016.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is soft, fruity and already delicious with ripe red fruits. There's no wood aging, and the wine displays berry flavors, balanced acidity and a soft, jammy aftertaste. Drink 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: This is soft, fruity and already delicious with ripe red fruits. There's no wood aging, and the wine displays berry flavors, balanced acidity and a soft, jammy aftertaste. Drink 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: This light wine has vanilla flavors from wood aging, fresh red fruits and soft tannins. Acidity gives wine poise and an elegant touch. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Pessegueiro 2010 Aluzé Red (Douro)

description: Pineapple and mango dominate this full-bodied, ripe wine. Soft and given a lift by lime juice, it is a well-balanced blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 White (Tejo)

description: Pineapple and mango dominate this full-bodied, ripe wine. Soft and given a lift by lime juice, it is a well-balanced blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This wine is rich, full of black fruits. It has the typical Dão mineral texture that comes from the granite rocks of the region. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro, it is ripe while remaining balanced and with a crisp edge of acidity. Drink the wine from late 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Jardim da Estrela Red (Dão)
