description: This is a ripe wine that includes Chardonnay and Viognier in its blend. It has yellow fruits that are cut with plenty of acidity. A cool, crisp element reminds that the vineyards are close to the ocean. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Palha-Canas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Rounded, smooth and fruity, this is an attractive wine. With its light texture and acidity that balance the juicy black fruits, it is ripe while also poised. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.
title: Cartuxa 2014 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: While the wine is very ripe in character, it is also finely structured and generous while still keeping a sense of proportion. It is dense, full of blackberry jelly flavors that are balanced by a final burst of acidity. Drink now, although better from early 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Syrah (Alentejano)

description: While the wine is very ripe in character, it is also finely structured and generous while still keeping a sense of proportion. It is dense, full of blackberry jelly flavors that are balanced by a final burst of acidity. Drink now, although better from early 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Syrah (Alentejano)

description: The grape gives a pale rosé color and a fine perfumed jasmine aroma that follows through on to the palate. The aftertaste has just the right amount of crisp acidity to balance. This rare grape is planted in the Setúbal vineyards of José Maria da Fonseca.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Colecção Privada Moscatel Roxo (Península de Setúbal)

description: After Verdelho, Loureiro is the other fine Vinho Verde grape. Here it gives crisp lemon acidity that goes with a bright fruitiness and a tight, mineral texture that comes from the granite soil. Drink this fresh wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: After Verdelho, Loureiro is the other fine Vinho Verde grape. Here it gives crisp lemon acidity that goes with a bright fruitiness and a tight, mineral texture that comes from the granite soil. Drink this fresh wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: The iconic Periquita brand has expanded into a range of wines, from which this is an ageworthy example. It has smoky wood flavors, a rich texture and warm, rounded fruitiness. The density, tannins and final acidity all promise aging, so drink from 2015.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: The iconic Periquita brand has expanded into a range of wines, from which this is an ageworthy example. It has smoky wood flavors, a rich texture and warm, rounded fruitiness. The density, tannins and final acidity all promise aging, so drink from 2015.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is the best vintage of Delaforce table wine so far. It has weight, density, great red fruits and a final freshness. A ripe wine, with some spice and hints of wood aging, it is ready to drink but can be enjoyed until 2020.
title: Delaforce 2012 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is the best vintage of Delaforce table wine so far. It has weight, density, great red fruits and a final freshness. A ripe wine, with some spice and hints of wood aging, it is ready to drink but can be enjoyed until 2020.
title: Delaforce 2012 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: The wine is firm and dry, with concentrated tannins that are still masking the fruit. There is considerable structure here, along with acidity and a fresh layer of black currant. This is a wine that needs aging, drink from 2019.
title: Sandeman 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a smooth, ripe wine with an underlay of dusty tannins. It is rich in character, with juicy blackberry flavors and crisp acidity. The aftertaste brings out the fresh character while keeping the rich texture. Drink now.
title: Barros 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Organically grown grapes in an old field-blend vineyard make a juicy wine that is dominated by red fruits. It has structure under the red berry flavors and the acidity. It is still a young wine and shouldn't be drunk until 2018.
designation: Vale da Poupa Field Blend Biologico
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Vale da Poupa Field Blend Biologico Red (Douro)

description: A 100% Alvarinho wine grown outside its classic area in the north of Vinho Verde, this one earns the Minho regional designation. This wine is in a light style, fruity with green plums and tangy with orange peel. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Alvarinho (Minho)

description: The wine is ripe and soft with black-currant acidity and gentle tannins. There is a firm structure behind the jammy fruit flavors, enough to give the wine support. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2012 Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is ripe and soft, though there are tannins at the back of the palate. The wine shows pepper, black currant and bitter cherry notes. Not for long-term aging.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2010 Vintage  (Port)

description: This sweet, smooth and approachable wine shows a rounded, ripe fruit character. It tastes sweet, with a note of black plum jelly and hints of treacle and sultana. For mid-term aging.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: With its big, fat mouthfeel, but very little fruit to back it up, at this stage this wine seems to be about wood, spice and richness without balance. The Reserva from the property seems to have a better focus.
title: Casa de Santar 2005 Condessa de Santar White (Dão)

description: With its big, fat mouthfeel, but very little fruit to back it up, at this stage this wine seems to be about wood, spice and richness without balance. The Reserva from the property seems to have a better focus.
title: Casa de Santar 2005 Condessa de Santar White (Dão)

description: Soft, rich and fruity, this is the epitome of an accessible Alentejo. With ripe fruits and a sense of warmth, it is made to drink young. Red-stone fruits and acidity are in fine harmony. Drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Morgado da Canita Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, rich and fruity, this is the epitome of an accessible Alentejo. With ripe fruits and a sense of warmth, it is made to drink young. Red-stone fruits and acidity are in fine harmony. Drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Morgado da Canita Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A balanced wine that has both fresh red fruits and some tawny maturity. It has acidity, hints of wood aging and a spirit of freshness. The aftertaste is soft, smooth and toffee-like.
title: Poças NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: Think of Subsídio as a contribution rather than as a subsidy, says the producer—in this case a contribution to a meal. The wine is soft and fully ripe. It has generous tannins and black fruits. The rich wine, with its juicy aftertaste, is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2013 Subíidio Red (Alentejano)

description: Think of Subsídio as a contribution rather than as a subsidy, says the producer—in this case a contribution to a meal. The wine is soft and fully ripe. It has generous tannins and black fruits. The rich wine, with its juicy aftertaste, is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2013 Subíidio Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an aromatic wine, one of a series of four wines featuring the major red grapes of the Dão. It is ripe, fruity with soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berry fruit and a balanced structure give a fragrant wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Alfrocheiro (Dão)

description: This is an aromatic wine, one of a series of four wines featuring the major red grapes of the Dão. It is ripe, fruity with soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berry fruit and a balanced structure give a fragrant wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Alfrocheiro (Dão)

description: A very sunny, New World style of wine, all exuberant fruit and flavors of milk chocolate, made richer by blackberry and caramel tastes. Approachable, very drinkable.
title: Quinta de Roriz 2003 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Powerful wine. It has intense berries, a definite edge of black plum skins, spicy tannins and big black berry fruits. This is serious stuff, but the fruit is always there, a big burst of flavor followed by bright acidity.
title: Poças 2006 Novus Red (Douro)

description: From the Moncão region, heartland of Alvarinho, at the north of Vinho Verde, this is a delicious wine, its green flavors bursting out of the glass. It is fresh, very crisp, edged with yeastiness but then boosted by its tight acidity.
title: Aveleda 2007 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: There is the faintest prickle on this dry, ripe and creamy wine. It has ripe acidity with crisp apple and green plum fruits. There is just the edge of minerality to give this wine texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: There is the faintest prickle on this dry, ripe and creamy wine. It has ripe acidity with crisp apple and green plum fruits. There is just the edge of minerality to give this wine texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth wine. With its attractive black fruits and the lightest touch of tannin, it is fruity with a hint of toast. Drink this wine now.
title: Fiuza 2015 Merlot (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, sweet wine, full of toffee and smooth vanilla. There is just enough tangy bitter orange to give it a tawny character. The aftertaste, though, is soft and rounded.
title: Dow's NV Dow's Boardroom  (Port)

description: Serious wood aging has given this concentrated wine power and great aging potential. For now, it is firmly tannic, but rich black fruit tones and juicy acidity are there, waiting to develop. It will be an impressive wine after 2018.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Red (Alentejano)

description: Serious wood aging has given this concentrated wine power and great aging potential. For now, it is firmly tannic, but rich black fruit tones and juicy acidity are there, waiting to develop. It will be an impressive wine after 2018.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Red (Alentejano)

description: Structured and, very firm, hinting at the black fruit potential. This solid, foursquare wine, is chunky but not without some elegance. The dry tannins come through strongly on the dense finish.
title: Skeffington 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Structured and, very firm, hinting at the black fruit potential. This solid, foursquare wine, is chunky but not without some elegance. The dry tannins come through strongly on the dense finish.
title: Skeffington 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Apples and crisp pears give this wine its intensely fresh character. It has bright acidity that shoots right through the wine, resulting in a tangy texture. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This wine is soft and ripe, with fresh acidity over wild strawberry fruits. It is an attractive wine, with a sense of richness as well as fruitiness. The refreshing finish is fresh and crisp.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cape Roca Fisherman Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Here's a bright, slightly sparkling wine, with fresh acidity and an off-dry, fruity character. It has attractive lemon-lime flavors and a salty, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Here's a bright, slightly sparkling wine, with fresh acidity and an off-dry, fruity character. It has attractive lemon-lime flavors and a salty, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a soft, round and fruity wine that is ready to drink. Spice, red berries and a tight layer of acidity bring balance to the soft, open structure. The aftertaste is fresh and full of fruit.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Coudel Mor Classico Red (Tejo)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto gives a fruity, fresh and fragrant wine, with lively bright acidity. A lemon edge is filled out by ripe apricot flavor, resulting in a rounded finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezirias Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto gives a fruity, fresh and fragrant wine, with lively bright acidity. A lemon edge is filled out by ripe apricot flavor, resulting in a rounded finish. Drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezirias Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This just off-dry rosé is crisp, packed with strawberry fruits and balanced in acidity. Made from the Padeiro grape, one of the many Vinho Verde red grapes, it is an attractive wine, finishing with a bright, light aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Raza 2014 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Aromas of white flowers lead into crisp lemon and grapefruit flavors. This has a fresh tang from the light prickle on the tongue, along with ripe peach and apple skin flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2014 Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This juicy wine boasts lemon aromas and bright citrusy acidity, resulting in a light, crisp and bright sip. It has a frest lilt, with an attractive zesty texture. Drink now.
title: Quevedo 2014 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: With the classic tongue-tickle of young Vinho Verde, this fresh, crisp and off-dry wine is immediately drinkable. It has ripe orange and sweet citrus fruitiness, and plenty of acidity.
title: Obrigado 2014 Vera Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a full-bodied rosé. It is ripe, with rich red fruits and spice. It has enough acidity to cope with this full fruitiness, making it a wine that is really for food rather than as an apéritif.
title: Nelson Neves 2014 Rosé (Bairrada)

description: This is a full-bodied rosé. It is ripe, with rich red fruits and spice. It has enough acidity to cope with this full fruitiness, making it a wine that is really for food rather than as an apéritif.
title: Nelson Neves 2014 Rosé (Bairrada)

description: With Viognier and Sémillon in the blend, this has the potential to be a ripe, smoothly textured wine. Acidity acts as a contrast and gives a tight lemon edge. The wine is still young, with its full fruitiness suppressed. Drink from 2016.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and fresh, with ripe yellow fruits, this is an immediately attractive wine. It has acidity a bright fruitiness from the blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto. The finish is crisp and tangy.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Young and fruity, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine. It has just enough acidity to give a fresh edge to the ripe quince and Rocha pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2014 Branco White (Alentejano)

description: On the lean, mineral side, this is a firm, extracted wine. It has a dry core that is masking the hints of juicy berry fruits. Give the wine a year to allow it to soften and drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Pedras do Monte Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: On the lean, mineral side, this is a firm, extracted wine. It has a dry core that is masking the hints of juicy berry fruits. Give the wine a year to allow it to soften and drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Pedras do Monte Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: With Encruzado and Malvasia in the blend, it is no surprise this wine is deliciously perfumed. It has fresh acidity as well as ripe apple and pear flavors. The wine is fruity, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Dão)

description: One of Portugal's top reds, this is a richly endowed wine. Ripe fruits are cut with fresh acidity, dark tannins and signs of judicious wood aging. It shows elegance, style and a rich aftertaste. Drink this great wine from 2018.
title: Luis Duarte 2011 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)

description: One of Portugal's top reds, this is a richly endowed wine. Ripe fruits are cut with fresh acidity, dark tannins and signs of judicious wood aging. It shows elegance, style and a rich aftertaste. Drink this great wine from 2018.
title: Luis Duarte 2011 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine reflects the fresh, cool character of Lisboa, with its ocean influence. A tangy, steely edge brings out a mineral character to top up the crisp citrus and apple fruitiness. The wine needs until 2016.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Dory Colheita Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This ultrayoung wine is all fruit. It is textured with minerality and a chalky character that is keeping the fresh green fruits in balance. The wine is delicious, although really not ready. Better to wait until 2016.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo)

description: Mar de Palha (seaweed) is a reminder of the closeness of the ocean to the Chocapalha estate. This is a rich, wood-aged wine, full of dark plum and berry fruits with almost-sweet tannins. It's ready to drink in a rich, young fruit way, although it will be even better from 2016.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 Mar da Palha Red (Lisboa)

description: Mar de Palha (seaweed) is a reminder of the closeness of the ocean to the Chocapalha estate. This is a rich, wood-aged wine, full of dark plum and berry fruits with almost-sweet tannins. It's ready to drink in a rich, young fruit way, although it will be even better from 2016.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 Mar da Palha Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine is all about black and red berry fruits. It has a ripe, fruity character with soft tannins and generous acidity. Full in the mouth and with a crisp finish, it is ready to drink.
title: Seacampo 2013 Casa Américo Red (Dão)

description: This ripe wine is smooth and rounded. Its melon and pear flavors give a generous, fruity character. Clean and crisp at the end, finished with acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: With partial aging in wood, this is a spicy, smoky wine that is also full of ripe red fruits. Its well-integrated tannins give shape to this wine. A crisp finish and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Credencial Red (Lisboa)

description: The estate, created at the beginning of the last century, has produced a soft wine that has generous tannins, black currant, and red fruits. The acidity and the spice both leave a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa Batoreu 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: The estate, created at the beginning of the last century, has produced a soft wine that has generous tannins, black currant, and red fruits. The acidity and the spice both leave a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa Batoreu 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: This is a fruity wine with crisp red fruits and acidity that are balanced by gentle tannins. With its warm feel, it is an easy wine that is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fruity wine with crisp red fruits and acidity that are balanced by gentle tannins. With its warm feel, it is an easy wine that is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of the white Trincadeira das Pratas and Arinto is soft and perfumed. It has some ripe acidity and an open texture. The aftertaste brings in some attractive melon flavor. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Selection White (Tejo)

description: This is an attractive, lemon and lime-flavored wine. Riper yellow fruits also show through the crisp acidity and the lightly mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Classico Branco White (Tejo)

description: Soft and warm, this is an apricot and pear-flavored wine. It has a soft texture, with a ripe feel that is just lifted by acidity. The aftertaste, with a more citrus character, adds the freshness.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Roupeiro-Antão Vaz White (Alentejo)

description: Soft and warm, this is an apricot and pear-flavored wine. It has a soft texture, with a ripe feel that is just lifted by acidity. The aftertaste, with a more citrus character, adds the freshness.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Roupeiro-Antão Vaz White (Alentejo)

description: One of the better examples in this category, this is crisp and clean. It has a hint of tannin and a green edge from the only just-ripe grapes. The strawberry flavor at the end does bring an attractive aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is ripe, fat and with melon and green-plum flavors. It has a spicy edge along with ripe acidity. The wine, with its full fruitiness, is ready to drink.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2015 Private Selection Verdelho (Península de Setúbal)

description: Produced in the Lima Valley, in the heart of the Vinho Verde region, this is fruity and crisp. It is medium sweet in character, the sweetness balanced by the refreshing acidity and citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a light-colored wine with spice, wood flavors and balanced acidity. It is soft with caramel and vanilla flavors along with touches of red berries and dried fruits. The aftertaste is fruity.
title: Kopke NV Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: With both soft and red fruits, this is a gentle, easy wine that has only a hint of tawny character. The acidity is enough to keep it light and perfumed at the end.
title: Ferreira NV Dona Antónia Reserva Tawny  (Port)

description: There is plenty of acidity here, giving a fresh, fruity wine that tastes young. It is full of red-berry and sultana flavors with a fine lift at the end.
title: Sandeman NV Imperial Reserve  (Port)

description: There is plenty of acidity here, giving a fresh, fruity wine that tastes young. It is full of red-berry and sultana flavors with a fine lift at the end.
title: Sandeman NV Imperial Reserve  (Port)

description: Superripe, with sweet black fruit, and ripe, soft tannins. The structure is here, but the acidity seems to have missed out with such richly ripe black fig flavors.
title: Quinta do Carmo 2003 Red (Alentejano)

description: Superripe, with sweet black fruit, and ripe, soft tannins. The structure is here, but the acidity seems to have missed out with such richly ripe black fig flavors.
title: Quinta do Carmo 2003 Red (Alentejano)

description: The aromas are the thing here, as so often with Touriga Nacional, keeping the soft tannins and ripe, sweet fruit buoyant and lively. There is acidity, but there's more, maybe too much, of blackberry jam flavor.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2004 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft ripe wine that has yellow fruits alongside crisper red apples and touches of grapefruit. That makes for a balanced light wine that has a fine texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monta da Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: The wine is soft, ripe and fruity. With a smooth line of tannins, it is open and full of black currant and berry flavors. The acidity gives a fine lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Bátoreus Red (Tejo)

description: This is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, a blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires. Bright and fruity with plenty of citrus freshness, it is lightly crisp and fresh at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 White (Tejo)

description: A lemon flavored wine that's crisp and fruity. The texture is soft with fruit and fresh acidity dominant. With its refreshing aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Arinto (Tejo)

description: This is a bright lemon and grapefruit flavored wine that has lively acidity and the lightest touch of mineral texture. It's crisp, refreshing and will be ready to drink from mid-2016.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an unusual white made from red Touriga Nacional and white Tamarez. Bright lemon flavors are balanced by notes of apricot and richer fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Tamarez White (Tejo)

description: This is an unusual white made from red Touriga Nacional and white Tamarez. Bright lemon flavors are balanced by notes of apricot and richer fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Tamarez White (Tejo)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dry rosé, dominated by caramel and raspberry fruit flavors. It has attractive acidity, but the texture does feel heavy, leaving a dull aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Ventozelo Rosé (Douro)

description: Named after a traditional Douro dance, this wine is ripe and spicy, with new wood flavors. It has a soft structure that allows the vibrant berry fruits to come through strongly. Both the fruit and the wood aging say this wine is too young, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Named after a traditional Douro dance, this wine is ripe and spicy, with new wood flavors. It has a soft structure that allows the vibrant berry fruits to come through strongly. Both the fruit and the wood aging say this wine is too young, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A ripe, tropical fruit flavored wine that is both fresh and rich. While produced in an area of Vinho Verde that is predominately dedicated to the Alvarinho grape, this dry wine is a refreshing, bright blend of many of the local varieties. It is juicy, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2015 Muros Antigos Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, a lively, fruity wine that has just a hint of a prickle on the tongue. It has apple and grapefruit flavors that are fresh and deliciously crisp. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, a lively, fruity wine that has just a hint of a prickle on the tongue. It has apple and grapefruit flavors that are fresh and deliciously crisp. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A gold colored wine, this is a medium-sweet white Port with maple syrup and toffee flavors balanced by fresh acidity. It would make a great cocktail base or can be drunk chilled on its own.
title: Ramos-Pinto NV Adriano White Reserva  (Port)

description: Very ripe yellow fruits make this a generous, dense, rich wine. A light touch of wood and acidity balance the super-rich character of the wine. Maybe it's all too much—too opulent—but then again, it is delicious.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2011 Viognier-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Dominated by acidity and a smoky character, the wine has great balance, with flavors of caramel, red cherry and sweet fruits. It shows a generous character that is attractive for early drinking.
title: Dow's 2008 Quinta do Bomfim Vintage  (Port)

description: Dominated by acidity and a smoky character, the wine has great balance, with flavors of caramel, red cherry and sweet fruits. It shows a generous character that is attractive for early drinking.
title: Dow's 2008 Quinta do Bomfim Vintage  (Port)

description: A beautiful, fruity wine that also has good structure to balance its black plum fruits. The acidity is important, although the wine as a whole is on the dry side, with spice and dominant final tannins.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2008 Quinta de Vargellas Vintage  (Port)

description: This is both powerful and elegant, giving great ripe fruit, black berries and dark tannins. It is a solid wine, its fruit packed into a firm structure. It has a delicious juicy character that balances the acidity and tannins. Age for several years.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passadouro Red (Douro)

description: This is both powerful and elegant, giving great ripe fruit, black berries and dark tannins. It is a solid wine, its fruit packed into a firm structure. It has a delicious juicy character that balances the acidity and tannins. Age for several years.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passadouro Red (Douro)

description: Dark in color, this is a fine, rich and still-elegant wine. Its tannins are like velvet, buried in the rich texture of ripe black fruits. With a firm backbone, layers of wood and spice, this could still age for several years.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2006 Dona Maria Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Alicante Bouschet gives a definite farmyard character to this wine. It also offers juicy berry fruits and balanced acidity. The two characteristics put the wine firmly on a food friendly side.
title: Roquevale 2007 Tinto da Talha Grande Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: With its earthy aromas and soft palate, this is a rustic wine, the sort designed for pairing with grilled meat. It has black plum flavors along with spice and bright red fruits. Drink now.
title: Falua 2009 Tâmara Red (Tejo)

description: The juiciness of Alicante Bouschet shows well in this full-bodied wine, packed with black berries and soft tannins. The dry finish suggests some aging—maybe 1 year.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Estremadura)

description: An elegant, understated wine that shows balanced red fruits, vanilla and touches of chocolate. Its attractiveness lies in the balance, with structure and acidity keeping the exuberant fruit flavors in check. Worth aging for 1–2 years.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2005 Palha-Canas Red (Estremadura)

description: Blending Encruzado and Malvasia Fina, this lightly wood-aged wine is rich, stylish and full of young fruit flavors. Green plums, apricots and a squeeze of lemon all give their bright character to the palate. There is a firm, mineral texture that promises some aging; drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Ribeiro Santo White (Dão)

description: An attractive, red-fruited wine, lightweight with acidity and smoothed with wood. It is fresh, with coffee and black cherry flavors, now ready to drink.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do Pégo Red (Douro)

description: An attractive, red-fruited wine, lightweight with acidity and smoothed with wood. It is fresh, with coffee and black cherry flavors, now ready to drink.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do Pégo Red (Douro)

description: Pure fruit flavors are fresh, but still show the ripeness of 2009. This is a fruity, ready-to-drink wine that has citrus, green plums and fresh acidity.
title: Maritávora 2009 Branco White (Douro)

description: A soft wine, creamy and ripe. The flavors are open, with white fruits, green plums, a baked apple character. There is acidity, but with the gentle, ripe fruit, this blends in easily. For early drinking.
title: Borges 2008 Meia Encosta White (Dão)

description: It takes a while for the taste of this light, fresh white to come through. Then, it is soft, creamy textured, flavored with pear juice and lemon zest. It is simple, easy, cleanly made.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada Branco White (Estremadura)

description: This is a featherlight red, full of berries and bright acidity, but with a texture that just coats the palate. This is one of those rare reds that works as an apéritif, fresh, clean and fruity. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Coreto Tinto Red (Estremadura)

description: A tight, freshly acid wine, with stalkiness but also good juicy fruit. There is a green pepper element, leaving a wine that is light, simple.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: A fresh, bone-dry rosé, packed with acidity, red currants and a touch of caramel. The wine is light, summery, good for apéritif or food.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Grand'Arte Rosé Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: Attractive fruits with a good, juicy flavor characterize this easy, fresh wine. Black berry flavors and vivid acidity make it ready to drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Serras de Azeitão Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Attractive fruits with a good, juicy flavor characterize this easy, fresh wine. Black berry flavors and vivid acidity make it ready to drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Serras de Azeitão Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A medium-dry Vinho Verde, this is light and fresh without being quite crisp enough. Well chilled, though, it makes a lively and fresh apéritif.
title: Caves Aliança 2009 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh and crisp, classic dry Vinho Verde, a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, with citrus flavors and a tight texture. Lively and fresh.
title: Borges 2009 AT White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh and crisp, classic dry Vinho Verde, a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, with citrus flavors and a tight texture. Lively and fresh.
title: Borges 2009 AT White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a huge wine—almost too much so—with superripe tannins and fruit. It tastes concentrated, its black fruit sweet and rounded. A pepper note comes from the alcohol and gives it a bitter edge.
title: Monte Branco 2009 Alento Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The historic Port house of Delaforce has now launched its own Douro table wines, and this Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a creamy initial texture followed by touches of vanilla and quince. This is not for aging, so drink it now.
title: Delaforce 2011 Alvarinho (Duriense)

description: This is a soft, tropical-fruit-driven Sauvignon Blanc made in a warm-climate style. It has a clean, fresh character, with an apricot note and a soft touch of orange zest. It's fragrant, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: Red sparkling wine is always an acquired taste, especially when it is a tannic, tart version like this. But this is as fine as a red sparkling Vinho Verde can be. Pair it with sardines.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro NV Aphros  Super-Reserva Bruto Vinhão (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright and fruity, this has a ripe applesauce flavor that's cut with citrusy acidity. It's a great apéritif, with a soft texture and refreshing finish.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Alandra Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This soft, balanced selection has warm, ripe red fruits that are laced with acidity. With its spicy edge and open texture, this is ready to drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Portuguese grapes with Cabernet Sauvignon, this is attractive and softly fruity. Its black fruit and gentle tannins make it completely ready to drink.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2011 Sexy Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Round and soft, this features white fruit flavors filled out by a touch of smokiness and light acidity. It's gentle, dry and full bodied. Screwcap.
designation: Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires
title: Falua 2011 Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: In this rich, earthy wine, plum and licorice flavors combine with a core of tough tannins. It is rich, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Delaforce 2009 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Rich and fruity, this is rounded as well as concentrated. It's on the sweet side, yet its acidity and blend of black and dried fruits are finely balanced. Like all LBVs, it can be consumed now, but it can also age over several years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Rich and fruity, this is rounded as well as concentrated. It's on the sweet side, yet its acidity and blend of black and dried fruits are finely balanced. Like all LBVs, it can be consumed now, but it can also age over several years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Round and smooth, this has a weighty, full-bodied structure, with the Alvarinho adding a more crisp character. Pear and melon fruits are balanced by citrusy acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Round and smooth, this has a weighty, full-bodied structure, with the Alvarinho adding a more crisp character. Pear and melon fruits are balanced by citrusy acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: A properly rich wine that benefits from its wood aging to give a polished, minty feel to the plush black plum fruits. Solid tannins are easily enveloped by fruit, while retaining a firm structure. Keep for 2-3 years.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Monte da Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A properly rich wine that benefits from its wood aging to give a polished, minty feel to the plush black plum fruits. Solid tannins are easily enveloped by fruit, while retaining a firm structure. Keep for 2-3 years.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Monte da Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced from Aveleda's Quinta da Aguieira, this is a blend of typical Portuguese white grapes with a dash of Chardonnay. From old vines, it has concentration and a rich texture that is cut by fragrant acidity. There is a ripe feel to this impressive wine, generous and full of fruit. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Reserva da Familia White (Bairrada)

description: From a vineyard of 100-year-old vines discovered during building works in the city of Almeirim, this beautiful wine is ripe with tropical mango and pineapple fruits and an intense rich character. The concentration is balanced with pear and apple acidity, giving a fine wine that is now ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: From a vineyard of 100-year-old vines discovered during building works in the city of Almeirim, this beautiful wine is ripe with tropical mango and pineapple fruits and an intense rich character. The concentration is balanced with pear and apple acidity, giving a fine wine that is now ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: A rounded wine, this gives pleasure with its pear and ripe apple flavors. Lightly touched with acidity, this has a soft finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: With an attractive fresh prickle on the palate, this is a crisp wine with a red fruit flavor, acidity and a soft, sweet finish.
title: Parras Vinhos NV Filigrana Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Here are all the perfumes and tannins of Touriga Nacional. The wine does, though, seem one-dimensional, the fruit offering acidity, berry flavors and fresh acidity.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2008 Touriga Nacional (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: The mountain vineyards of Nespereira give a firm, mineral-driven wine, dark and intense, while never heavy. The acidity holds the balance of freshness between the dense tannins and the black currant fruits.
title: Quinta da Nespereira 2008 Sarmentu Red (Dão)

description: Perfumed with violets and smoky wood, this rich wine moves away from structured Touriga Nacional to a more opulent interpretation. It is hugely rich, with a major spice and herbal character. Without apparent acidity, it is not for aging.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2008 Touriga Nacional da Peceguina Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Rich fruit, tempered with the perfumed structure of Touriga Nacional, give this wine both complexity and fruitiness. It has weight and concentration, followed by juicy acidity.
title: Quinta da Plansel 2009 Plansel Selecta Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: The wine has the character of a perfumed Moscatel from Setúbal, but is in fact from Fernão Pires. It has a rich—never heavy—feel to it, flavors of caramel and smokiness from wood aging. Consider this as an apéritif, rather than as a dessert wine.
title: Quinta da Alorna NV Abafado 5-years Fernão Pires (Vinho Licoroso)

description: This is a full-bodied, ripe and perfumed wine. Rich melon and white peach are balanced with bright lemon and lime to give a warm, generous wine. The acidity keeps everything deliciously in place.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: This Port comes from a good year for single-quinta vintages. Made in open stone lagars, it is a ripe, black-fruited wine, packed with sweet plums as well as raisins and figs. At this stage, the added brandy is very prominent and the wine needs time. It should be ready to drink for its fruit by 2018, for its maturity by 2026.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Vintage  (Port)

description: This Port comes from a good year for single-quinta vintages. Made in open stone lagars, it is a ripe, black-fruited wine, packed with sweet plums as well as raisins and figs. At this stage, the added brandy is very prominent and the wine needs time. It should be ready to drink for its fruit by 2018, for its maturity by 2026.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Vintage  (Port)

description: Named after one of the old names for the Mondego River (which flows past the estate), this blend of the red grapes of the Dão, is aromatic, with a touch of barnyard as well as red fruits. Light wood aging has smoothed some of the fruit tannins and added spice. Drink now.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2012 Mondeco Tinto Red (Dão)

description: This lightly oaked wine is full of fruit, ripe with red berries and crisp with acidity, just hinting at Douro minerality. That makes for a balanced fruity wine that with its soft tannins is ready to drink.
title: Delaforce 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The wine is soft and ripe. With delicious yellow fruits, a soft texture and just enough lively acidity, it is rich and fruity. There is an attractive orange zing at the end.
title: Colinas do Douro 2014 Branco White (Douro)

description: Grapes grown at high altitude give the cool feel to this crisp wine. A light touch of oak is revealed in the vanilla flavor that is finely integrated into the citrus and apple fruit. The wine is fruity, ready to drink young.
title: Churchill's 2015 Churchill's Estates Branco White (Douro)

description: The Alvarinho grape, more at home in northern Portugal, makes a fine wine in the Alentejo hill country northeast of Lisbon. Here the flavors are tropical: ripe pineapple, a touch of spice and just the right amount of acidity. The wine will be better from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe perfumed wine based on Verdelho and Arinto. The blend, which also includes some Antão Vaz, creates a rich character full of juicy apricot and melon fruit shot through with lime zest. It is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of four classic Douro grapes, this is structured and firm. It has a mineral texture that gives the wine depth and concentration. Ripe red berries and balanced acidity are now mature and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2014 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A ripe red-fruit flavored wine that comes from the Douro village of Murça. It has light tannins as well as red-berry fruits and balanced acidity. There is a mineral textured touch at the end.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Porca de Murça Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a very crisp wine dominated by herbaceous notes and intense acidity. It is bright and lively, hinting at spice and toast and tantalizingly fresh on the finish.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This is a very crisp wine dominated by herbaceous notes and intense acidity. It is bright and lively, hinting at spice and toast and tantalizingly fresh on the finish.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and fruity, the fruit light, flavored with plum jelly and dried fruits. The wine is soft, somewhat unfocused, the tannins giving some dryness, but leaving a feeling of old-fashioned over-ripe fruits.
title: Casaleiro 2006 Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Ribatejo)

description: Soft and fruity, the fruit light, flavored with plum jelly and dried fruits. The wine is soft, somewhat unfocused, the tannins giving some dryness, but leaving a feeling of old-fashioned over-ripe fruits.
title: Casaleiro 2006 Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Ribatejo)

description: Deep gold in color, this wood-aged wine made from Moscatel Galego grapes is unctuously rich and concentrated. The 40 years in wood have given it depth and density, balancing spicy flavors with hints of honey and apricot. An orange peel note finishes the beautiful combination. Drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines NV 40 Years  (Moscatel do Douro)

description: This impressive Port was made with old vine grapes foot-trodden in open lagares. Opulent, dense and rich with sweet fruit balanced by dry tannins and considerable acidity, it's built to age seriously. Named after Antonia Adelaide Ferreira—a legendary Douro figure from the 19th century whose family still owns the estate—it will be ready to drink from 2028 at the earliest.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Vallado Adelaide Vintage  (Port)

description: This impressive Port was made with old vine grapes foot-trodden in open lagares. Opulent, dense and rich with sweet fruit balanced by dry tannins and considerable acidity, it's built to age seriously. Named after Antonia Adelaide Ferreira—a legendary Douro figure from the 19th century whose family still owns the estate—it will be ready to drink from 2028 at the earliest.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Vallado Adelaide Vintage  (Port)

description: Known for its seemingly unlimited stocks of aged tawnies and white Ports released in small quantities, this firm's 20-year-old white is a beautifully smooth wine. It shows its maturity in old wood character and deep gold fruit flavors. Maintaining its juicy acidity, it's a superb sipping wine. Drink now.
title: Kopke NV 20 Years Old White  (Port)

description: For six generations, the Ferreira family has owned this estate, a parcel of which boasts 100-year-old vines planted as a traditional field blend. It yields an impressive, serious and ageworthy wine, with dense tannins, powerful ripe black-plum and damson fruit and a tight character recalling schist soil. Drink from 2023.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: For six generations, the Ferreira family has owned this estate, a parcel of which boasts 100-year-old vines planted as a traditional field blend. It yields an impressive, serious and ageworthy wine, with dense tannins, powerful ripe black-plum and damson fruit and a tight character recalling schist soil. Drink from 2023.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: A traditional style of Alentejo wine, which pushes dry tannins as much as fruit. It is solid, dark, intense, powered by its structure, the fruit coming way behind. It is always going to be a tannic wine, but it makes a great partner with rich winter stews.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2008 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Tropical fruits are cut with citrus acidity in this warm, ripe wine that has rich fruitiness as well as a crisper texture. The wine is bright while also full and rounded in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: The wine is soft and lightly textured. It has fruit with ripe apricot and white peach flavors that are lifted by the bright citrus aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 White (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich wine showing jammy blackberry flavors against pronounced alcohol. The acidity at the end does provide a lighter, fresher lift.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2012 Quinto Elemento Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: This wine is made from the Bastardo grape which, as its name suggests, is tough to handle and rarely found. Very light in color and with a rustic flavor, the wine is light with hints of red berry fruits. A curiosity. Drink now.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Bastardo (Douro)

description: A powerfully constructed wine, it is packed with fruit and tannins. With a leather and spice character, it shows a dry texture while the black plum skin flavors are still developing. The future holds rich fruitiness as well as a solid, concentrated structure. Drink from 2017.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Santar estate is a showpiece in the Dão, producing ageworthy wines. This impressive, rich and juicy wine has structure, dark tannins and powerful black plum fruits. It's full of bold flavors and ready to age a few more years. Drink from 2017.
title: Dão Sul 2009 Conde de Santar Red (Dão)

description: Vineyards in the upper Douro Superior region are able to produce surprisingly fresh and fruity whites like this, despite the heat and dry climate. Old vines go into this yellow and green fruit flavored wine with its lively acidity and totally refreshing palate. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged, fortified Moscatel has retained its fruitiness while also showing older, wood and toast flavors. Perfumed and fragrant, with integrated acidity, enjoy this offering soon.
title: Adega de Favaios 1999 Colheita  (Moscatel do Douro)

description: Produced from vines grown in a boulder and fossil strewn vineyard, this is a rich smoky wine. It has a deep color from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend, with firm tannins and dark juicy plum skin flavors. It's going to be a ripe rich wine as it develops. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Stones & Bones Red (Lisboa)

description: Attractive and fruity, this is bright and crisp. It does have some weight and a backdrop of ripe strawberries. But it's the fresh acidity that gives lift and freshness. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Somontes Rosé (Dão)

description: Still very youthful, this concentrated wine has structure, deep black-fruit flavors and intense acidity. Its wood aging offers an extra spice note and a polished surface. Underneath, the wine is dense, needing aging. Give it 2–4 years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2009 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Initial new wood flavors show the youth of this complex wine. Then it fills out in the mouth with an explosive blackberry flavor and dense fruit tannins. With its power and flavor intensity, it has firm potential to age over at least five years.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2009 Vinhas Velhas de Santa Maria Red (Beiras)

description: Initial new wood flavors show the youth of this complex wine. Then it fills out in the mouth with an explosive blackberry flavor and dense fruit tannins. With its power and flavor intensity, it has firm potential to age over at least five years.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2009 Vinhas Velhas de Santa Maria Red (Beiras)

description: This is beautiful, with smooth, polished tannins and a spice note from the wood aging. It is layered with black plum, chocolate and licorice flavors, along with structure. The fruit is rich and likely to come forward in the next 3–4 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta de Pancas Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A big bruiser of a wine that hits you with its big, rich fist of blackberry fruits and sweetness. Maybe it is not elegant, but there is no denying the force behind this wine, the spice to go with the velvet texture.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2005 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Dominated by spicy wood, this first vintage from the Symington family's organic vineyards is big, rich, very toasty, with layers of new wood over the sweet blackberry fruit. If it doesn't hang together now, it is likely to integrate over the next few months, as the exuberant wood and alcoholic heat calm down.
title: Symington Family Estates 2007 Altano Organically Farmed Vineyard Red (Douro)

description: Fresh fruits dominate here. The wine is full of red cherry and bright acidity. The core of tannins is discreet, giving a soft, juicy character, offering easy, early drinking.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2005 Red (Douro)

description: Fresh fruits dominate here. The wine is full of red cherry and bright acidity. The core of tannins is discreet, giving a soft, juicy character, offering easy, early drinking.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2005 Red (Douro)

description: The Dão's very own Encruzado is the backbone of this beautiful fresh wine. Made by top winemaker Alvaro Castro, the wine is rich, full of pears, apricots and pears with a touch of nutmeg. It needs another year to age. Drink from early 2016.
title: Obrigado 2013 DAC Encruzado (Dão)

description: The Dão's very own Encruzado is the backbone of this beautiful fresh wine. Made by top winemaker Alvaro Castro, the wine is rich, full of pears, apricots and pears with a touch of nutmeg. It needs another year to age. Drink from early 2016.
title: Obrigado 2013 DAC Encruzado (Dão)

description: The Estremoz region in Alentejo is at the heart of one of the major vineyard areas. This rich and now mature wine shows the ripe fruit and structure that can be produced there. It is packed with tarry black fruits and dusty tannins. Drink now.
title: Monte dos Cabaços 2008 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: From the northern Portuguese heartland of Alvarinho, this beautifully ripe and rich wine is packed with intense perfumes of white peach and green apple. Fresh fruit and crisp acidity give a lively, tangy aftertaste. Drink from late 2015.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2014 QM Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: From the northern Portuguese heartland of Alvarinho, this beautifully ripe and rich wine is packed with intense perfumes of white peach and green apple. Fresh fruit and crisp acidity give a lively, tangy aftertaste. Drink from late 2015.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2014 QM Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This has great fruits and plenty of structure to go with it. Juicy plum flavors complement the dense tannins, mineral structure and concentrated texture. It's a stylish wine that will develop some more. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2010 Rede Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Aging has brought out a toffee character as well as the red fruits. It is ripe, smoothly textured and recognizably a Port with the hints of spirit at the end.
title: Rozes NV Terras do Grifo Pink  (Port)

description: Deliciously crisp and fruity, this is a bright, clean style of wine not showing much terroir character but is fresh and full of citrus fruits. The acidity gives a refreshing lift at the end.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2013 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: The Moscatel in this blend gives an attractive floral perfumed character that balances the crisper Fernão Pires. It is a fruity, light-hearted apéritif-style wine that is ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This ripe and sweet wine has only light acidity. That gives it a soft, light character, emphasizing fruitiness rather than the wood aging of an old tawny. The aftertaste is round and soft.
title: Dalva NV Presidential 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Azal is a comparatively rare grape to be vinified on its own, so this example is something of a curiosity. It has plenty of acidity and is a refreshing, appley wine suited for summertime drinking, very chilled.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: A simple fruity wine, attractive all the way through, the berry flavors given balance with some tannins. The wine has structured currants and acidity to bring out extra character.
title: Quinta do Portal NV Cellar Reserve  (Port)

description: Dusty tannins lie easily on this perfumed, smoky wine. It is balanced, its sweetness layered with some acidity. Rich and smooth, although also structured and very attractive.
title: Churchill's NV Finest Reserve  (Port)

description: This is an earthy wine, showing strong tannins, minerality and a distinctly dry texture. The wine does have weight with its layered black currant fruits giving a strong sense of structure. From the granite soils of the Dão, this is a wine to age for three more years.
title: Moura Basto 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: One of Portugal's priciest table wines, this vintage boasts cherry and plum aromas that just don't seem all that intense, followed by bright cherry flavors accented by modest cedar. The long finish is evidence of its quality, but it turns astringent and one wonders whether the fruit will outlast the tannins.
title: Quinta do Fojo 2000 Fojo Red (Douro)

description: Interesting contrast to the 20 Years Old from the same house, yielding similar walnut and caramel scents and also a touch of spirit on the nose. But quite different in the mouth, where it is blockier and more intense, with robust berry flavors. Finishes a little coarse and rustic.
title: Poças NV 10 Year Old Tawny  (Port)

description: With its well-integrated scents of cedar, plum and tobacco, this is a medium-weight wine whose hallmark is its balance. Vanilla and dried spices meld nicely with cherry and plum fruit, finishing smooth, with modest tannins. Drink now-2008.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2000 Cado Red (Douro)

description: A pear-and pineapple-flavored wine, lifted with bright fresh acidity. There is a smooth texture that comes from ripe fruit. Drink now to enjoy its crispness.
title: Casa de Santa Vitoria 2010 Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Dark, structured and bringing out the natural minerality of the Douro, this is a dense and tannic wine at this stage. It has layers of black currant, rich and full of juicy acidity. The wine really needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Tom de Baton Red (Douro)

description: This is a tight and structured wine, showing a fine balance between tannin and acidity, with dark, brooding fruit that still need time to develop. Give this wine until 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This is a tight and structured wine, showing a fine balance between tannin and acidity, with dark, brooding fruit that still need time to develop. Give this wine until 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This is aromatic and, yes, exuberant in its bright fruitiness and total freshness. It's crisp with a cool character that is expressed in the layers of citrus that dominate the wine. At the end, a tangy texture offers a tight aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2013 Edição Exuberant White (Minho)

description: Ripe and perfumed, this has great fruitiness and crisp acidity that suit the delicate texture. The wine is completely ready to drink.
title: Pedra Cancela 2013 Seleção do Enólogo White (Dão)

description: Bright pink in color, this is a fruity as much as rich wine. It has freshness, cherry flavors with acidity and an intensely candied, honey-sweet finish. It's complete enough to drink by itself.
title: Croft NV Croft Pink  (Port)

description: Fruity, sweet and soft, this is immediately attractive. It shows red fruits as well as a light toffee character with the wood aging flavors in the background. For a wine in bottle for three years, it has excellent freshness at the end.
title: Butler Nephew & Co NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Bright, ripe red plums predominate in this wine that tastes very young, intensely fruity and veering towards dryness. Rich and juicy, it is still developing its mature velvet character. It should lose some its primary fruits and become more balanced, so wait until 2016.
title: Cálem 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Bright, ripe red plums predominate in this wine that tastes very young, intensely fruity and veering towards dryness. Rich and juicy, it is still developing its mature velvet character. It should lose some its primary fruits and become more balanced, so wait until 2016.
title: Cálem 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: The scene is set by the natural herbaceous notes of Sauvignon Blanc. They follow through to the green, crisp flavors of the wine. However, it also has a more sunny feel, more tropical in character at the end. Ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: A fruity and attractive wine from high vineyards above the Douro valley, with acidity, red berry fruits and a touch of tannin. Made in a light, fresh style, it is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: With a typical touch of fizz, this wine is fruity, light and bright. It is dry, very fresh, full of apples and lime juice. Refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Cruzeiro 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: With a typical touch of fizz, this wine is fruity, light and bright. It is dry, very fresh, full of apples and lime juice. Refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Cruzeiro 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly wood aged and spicy, this is a fine reflection of this great grape variety. It is rich and smooth, yet retains mineralitym, a crisp apricot and green plum fruit. Drink this impressive wine from 2017.
title: Seacampo 2014 Casa Américo Branco Reserva Encruzado (Dão)

description: Syrah is not an approved grape for Douro wines, so the grapes from the small parcel at Romaneira go under the regional name. The wine is rich, generous and concentrated. Perfumed black fruits are laced with fine tannins and a ripe acidity. A wine for aging further, it will be ready from 2018.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Syrah (Duriense)

description: The wood fermentation has just brushed the ripe notes of this wine, rounding out the young, fresh fruitiness. It's a full wine with pear, citrus and a tangy, mineral texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Reserva White (Douro)

description: The wood fermentation has just brushed the ripe notes of this wine, rounding out the young, fresh fruitiness. It's a full wine with pear, citrus and a tangy, mineral texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Reserva White (Douro)

description: This firm, mineral-textured wine is full of solid tannins and dark black fruits. A blend Alfrocheiro, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional, it's a classic, structured, dense Dão. Still young with its rough edges, it nonetheless will age well. Drink from 2018.
title: Parras Vinhos 2012 Evidência Red (Dão)

description: Generous, fruity and rich, this ripe wine has black chocolate flavors to go with its soft tannins and rounded structure. At the end, acidity gives freshness and blackberry-jelly sweetness.
title: Nelson Neves 2012 Merlot (Bairrada)

description: Generous, fruity and rich, this ripe wine has black chocolate flavors to go with its soft tannins and rounded structure. At the end, acidity gives freshness and blackberry-jelly sweetness.
title: Nelson Neves 2012 Merlot (Bairrada)

description: A blend of four grapes, this structured wine shows big black fruitiness along with fresh acidity. It's still young, bright with acidity and needs time to round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Samora Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of four grapes, this structured wine shows big black fruitiness along with fresh acidity. It's still young, bright with acidity and needs time to round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Samora Red (Tejo)

description: A light, crisp strawberry- and melon-flavored wine, with a fresh mint aroma. There is some sweetness, but the acidity and fresh fruits balance that attractively.
title: Herdade do Esporão NV Alandra Rosé Red (Portugal)

description: A light, crisp strawberry- and melon-flavored wine, with a fresh mint aroma. There is some sweetness, but the acidity and fresh fruits balance that attractively.
title: Herdade do Esporão NV Alandra Rosé Red (Portugal)

description: Fresh red berry fruit and caramel aromas create a wine that is all sweet strawberry, highly aromatic and just touched by acidity. There's a definite softness, almost sweetness in the aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Monte Alentejano Rosé Red (Alentejano)

description: The aim of this wine presumably is to show off the fruit quality from the quinta. It does succeed, but at the expense of complexity and richness. So the wine is tight with tannins and edgy with a texture that is dry and firm. Give it another year until 2017 before drinking.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2011 Unoaked Cuvée Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: The wine is soft and smooth with yellow fruits and a light texture. It is ripe, generous balancing fruit against the rounded perfumed structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is soft and smooth with yellow fruits and a light texture. It is ripe, generous balancing fruit against the rounded perfumed structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this is refreshingly fruity. It has pineapple as well as citrus flavors, an attractive blend of freshness and crispness. The aftertaste is bright, full of lively acidity.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Maria Mora Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A young and fruity wine that is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, red berry fruits and a juicy fresh character. Full of fruit with just a light structure, it can be drunk now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Red (Alentejo)

description: An immediately attractive fruity wine that's half-and-half Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. Neither of the two grapes' natural tannins show in this wine with its soft texture and blackberry fruitiness. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Forma de Arte Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: There is a good balance in this wine between fresh berry fruits and a firmer structure so the tannins are present while never hiding the attractive fruitiness. Simple and one-dimensional, it is still attractive and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Just off-dry, this is a smooth, caramel and red fruit flavored wine. It has plenty of acidity to balance its soft texture, with red currant freshness coming in at the end. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Medicinal, herbal wine, with attractive white fruit aromas. The palate is rich and soft, with fresh honey and sweet fruits. Definitely sweet, it is still balanced with the fruits and the spirit underlay.
title: Ferreira NV Porto Branco  (Port)

description: A yellow colored wine, showing oxidation, but delicious. Although there is some bitterness it is well integrated and the ripe fruit, marzipan and acidity are all finely in balance.
title: Poças NV Special Reserve Dry White  (Port)

description: The kind of succulent aged tawny that gives the class a good name. It's a dreamy kind of drink, chock full of buttery hazelnut and dried stone fruits. If you like yours rich and creamy, yet still alive enough to warm the system on a chilly night, this is the one.
designation: Quinta do Bom Retiro 20 Year Tawny
title: Ramos-Pinto NV Quinta do Bom Retiro 20 Year Tawny Port (Portugal)

description: The soft, honeyed nose is entirely inviting, hinting at the refinement this wine carries from start to finish. Though not a heavyweight, there's a goodly amount of apricot and quince mixed with toffee and crème brûlée. Scrumptious, racy and recommended for those who like good Port.
title: Delaforce 1997 Curious & Ancient - 20 Yrs. Old Port (Douro)

description: Light in color, refined in the nose, and intense in the mouth. It's packed with toffee, nuts, dried apricot and other delicious and sophisticated flavors. There's dynamite fruit quality here, but it's the creamy nuttiness on the palate and the finish that steals the show.
title: Warre's 2000 Otima Port (Douro)

description: Light in color, refined in the nose, and intense in the mouth. It's packed with toffee, nuts, dried apricot and other delicious and sophisticated flavors. There's dynamite fruit quality here, but it's the creamy nuttiness on the palate and the finish that steals the show.
title: Warre's 2000 Otima Port (Douro)

description: This manages to be rounded and crisp at the same time, giving an intense citrus flavor and a soft texture, with just a touch of honey on the finish.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine has plenty of crisp fruit along with touches of smokiness and a riper, yellow fruit character. It's a rich wine, young and fresh and with the potential to age. Drink now, although it will be better from 2017.
designation: Castas de Monção Reserva Bruto Natural
title: Adega de Monção 2011 Castas de Monção Reserva Bruto Natural Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: A bold wine, this is full of ripe tannins and black-plum fruits. The local Baga grape dominates the blend, giving its special style of firm tannins that are integrated into the rich fruits. The wine will be best from 2018.
designation: Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva
title: Global Wines 2014 Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: A bold wine, this is full of ripe tannins and black-plum fruits. The local Baga grape dominates the blend, giving its special style of firm tannins that are integrated into the rich fruits. The wine will be best from 2018.
designation: Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva
title: Global Wines 2014 Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a balanced blend of seven grapes, headed by Bairrada's own Baga. It is this grape that gives the tannins and tight acidity that dominate this structured wine. Its potential is considerable, with its texture still evolving. The black-currant fruits at the end are crisp and will soften with age. Drink from 2019.
title: Campolargo 2015 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a balanced blend of seven grapes, headed by Bairrada's own Baga. It is this grape that gives the tannins and tight acidity that dominate this structured wine. Its potential is considerable, with its texture still evolving. The black-currant fruits at the end are crisp and will soften with age. Drink from 2019.
title: Campolargo 2015 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: This well-integrated wine is full of black plums and stylish tannins. The structure is all there, giving firm tannins as well as richness. It is already a beautiful wine, ripe, solid and with excellent potential. Drink from 2026.
title: Vallegre 2015 Quinta da Vista Alegre Vintage  (Port)

description: This well-integrated wine is full of black plums and stylish tannins. The structure is all there, giving firm tannins as well as richness. It is already a beautiful wine, ripe, solid and with excellent potential. Drink from 2026.
title: Vallegre 2015 Quinta da Vista Alegre Vintage  (Port)

description: A field blend dominated by old-vine Touriga Nacional, this is a richly endowed wood-aged wine. It is dark and concentrated, packed with juicy black fruits and acidity. The tannins support the ripe fruitiness. Drink this generous wine from 2018.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Sémillon weaves its magic as a grape that attracts noble rot. This wine that comes from some of the higher-elevation Douro vineyards is rich with honey, dried apricot and intense acidity. The classic dry edge of the botrytis is very evident in this ripe, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2013 Grandjó Late Harvest Semillon (Douro)

description: From a small Lisboa vineyard owned by Rocim's Catarina Vieira, this wine is a rich blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. It offers concentrated tannins and solid texture. At the same time, the black-currant fruit adds a great lift of juiciness and acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Vale da Mata Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Baga can be a shock to the palate because of its tannins. But this wine seems to have fruitiness to offset the intense, dry texture. It shows black currant and herb flavors, which come laden with spice on the finish.
title: Campolargo 2010 Tinto Baga (Bairrada)

description: As the wine's name indicates, it is made from century old vines, planted by a Burgundian who arrived in Portugal to escape World War One. The result is a wine of immense concentration, dark tannins and beautiful fruit. The vineyard is planted as a field blend, the grapes are fermented in traditional open stone lagares. It is a superb wine that deserves further aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Fugitivo Vinhas Centenárias Red (Dão)

description: This wine is dry, firm and structured. There is a tight, extracted character that brings out a bitter edge. Acidity and stalky black fruits are certainly not ready at the moment. Drink from 2018.
title: Burmester 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a ripe, generous wine that speaks of the sun and warmth of the Alentejo. It has rich black fruits, dark plums and berries, with spice and vanilla flavors. The acidity, with its final lift, gives the wine a fresh aftertaste.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a perfumed wine that has attractive strawberry and blackberry fruit flavors along with a stalky background. Fragrant and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine has a structured character suggesting it is still young. Stalky black currant fruit flavors give fresh acidity as well as firm tannins. It is very fruity, just needing to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Now in a smart clear blue bottle, this is Aveleda's estate wine. It is always a classic, with just some extra weight to give it distinction. The flavors are apple, brightened with lime, finishing with vibrant acidity.
title: Aveleda 2009 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: A rich wine, the tannins of the blackberry fruits smoothed by wood. Along with its richness, it has an attractive lightness, freshened with acidity. It is ready to drink now, a delicious mouthful.
title: Apegadas Quinta Velha 2007 Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, this combines a creamy texture with bright green fruit acidity. There is weight as well as freshness, the aftertaste rich while also crisp.
title: Provam 2009 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: Gold in color, this wine deftly balances the sweetness of the orange marmalade flavor with the dry edge that comes from the spirit and the slight tannic character. Ready to drink.
title: Ramos-Pinto NV Adriano Reserva White  (Port)

description: A structured wine, this reflects the granite soil of the Dão. Fruit from seven vineyards is blended to make this firm, tannin- and black-currant-driven selection. Perfumes from the Touriga Nacional lend lift to the finish.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: A warm wine, open, broad and soft with just some mineral texture. Flavors are of quince, sweet white plums, with some final green, herbal character.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passadouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A soft and ripe wine with spicy red fruit flavors cushioned by a smooth texture, this has well-embedded tannins and can be drunk young.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a dry sparkling wine with tannins, spice and berry fruit, giving it a deep color. Not an apéritif wine, it's perfect for cutting through rich, oily foods. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Tinto Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: A wine for early drinking, this is soft, fruity and bright. With red berry flavor and gentle tannins, it's direct and packed with fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Pé Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A wine for early drinking, this is soft, fruity and bright. With red berry flavor and gentle tannins, it's direct and packed with fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Pé Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: With hints of minerality typical of any wine from the Dão, this has tight, yeasty notes that contrast with its crisp, bright apple fruit. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Bruto Sparkling (Dão)

description: This is a light wine with plenty of acidity and soft tannins that come together in a juicy, crisp, red fruit-flavored medley. Ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)

description: This is a light wine with plenty of acidity and soft tannins that come together in a juicy, crisp, red fruit-flavored medley. Ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)

description: The light prickle adds to the natural freshness of this lemon-sherbet-flavored wine. Very crisp and light in the mouth, this dances on the palate with just a touch of sweetness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Salsus White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp and herbaceous, this is a green-fruited wine that's light on the palate, offering delightful refreshing acidity. This is very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp and herbaceous, this is a green-fruited wine that's light on the palate, offering delightful refreshing acidity. This is very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe and fruity, this bears a red berry flavor and a dry structure. It has weight, richness and a smooth finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Rosé (Setubal)

description: Ripe and fruity, this bears a red berry flavor and a dry structure. It has weight, richness and a smooth finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Rosé (Setubal)

description: Fruity and off-dry, this has light touches of sweet strawberry and vanilla to go with the orange zest acidity. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Pink Elephant Rosé (Lisboa)
