description: This is a lightweight, fruity and softly tannic wine. The red berry flavor is bright and breezy, and the acidity is a dominant feature. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a lightweight, fruity and softly tannic wine. The red berry flavor is bright and breezy, and the acidity is a dominant feature. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a floral, aromatic and dry rosé, full of red currant fruit and refreshing acidity. It's a great apéritif wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a classic style of Bairrada sparkling wine—a blend of Bical, Maria Gomes and Arinto. Plenty of crisp acidity and soft white fruit flavors balance its yeasty character. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This warm, ripe wine is open and ready to drink. With its bold red fruit and generous, well-integrated tannins, it's made for barbecues. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: According to legend, the Baron of Figuiera got his foot stuck in the stirrup while riding one day. He promised that where his horse stopped, he would build a chapel, and that's where this 2,100 foot high, cool-climate vineyard is today. The wine is crisp and fresh, with attractive citrus notes and plenty of refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Barão de Figueira Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: With its typical prickle on the tongue, this is a medium sweet wine. It's clean, crisp and citrusy, with sliced apple and orange zest flavors. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Made to be drunk young, this wine gives a burst of ripe red fruit. The tannins are soft and open, balanced with acidity. The aftertaste is smooth and generous. Drink now.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Versátil Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an earthy blend of Touriga Nacional, Jaen and Trincadeira. Unencumbered by wood aromas, it's full of structured red berry fruit and balanced acidity and is ready to drink.
title: Boas Quintas 2014 Encosta da Vinha Red (Dão)

description: A soft and easy wine with black currant fruit and gentle tannins, this has just enough acidity and structure to hold it together. Spice adds interest on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft and easy wine with black currant fruit and gentle tannins, this has just enough acidity and structure to hold it together. Spice adds interest on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine balances swathes of ripe berry fruit with hints of tannin. It's fruity, full bodied and delicious to drink now. A great barbecue wine.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cal Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This sparkling wine from Touriga Nacional grapes is dry, not just with acidity but also its firm tannic structure. An acquired taste, perhaps, but great with fresh sardines or other oily fish. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Named for the Servite convent in the town of Borba, this fresh, crisp and tangy wine is citric, with almond and apple overtones. It's young, fruity and made for immediate consumption.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named for the Servite convent in the town of Borba, this fresh, crisp and tangy wine is citric, with almond and apple overtones. It's young, fruity and made for immediate consumption.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a dense wine, with mint aromas and dark, brooding tannins. Black plum and berry fruits are both rich and tight, with a strong mineral texture. It brings out the hard soil of the Douro and also the heat in the valley. It does need to age, so drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Domini Plus Red (Douro)

description: This is a dense wine, with mint aromas and dark, brooding tannins. Black plum and berry fruits are both rich and tight, with a strong mineral texture. It brings out the hard soil of the Douro and also the heat in the valley. It does need to age, so drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Domini Plus Red (Douro)

description: In an oxidative style, this is a wine that is smooth and full of ripe fruit tones. With black plum and berry flavors it has just enough of a tannic edge, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: With a great balance between fruit and acidity, this is just what a 10-Year-Old tawny should be. Ripe fruits are cut by acidity and given a shot of wood aging. Spice and old gold flavors lead to a delicious fresh aftertaste.
title: Delaforce NV His Eminence's Choice 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Firm and dry, this wine shows more than its 10 years of aging. It has acidity as much as fruit, along with strong wood-aged flavors that push the spirit forward. At the end, it is all about the acidity and old wood flavors.
title: Dalva NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Dark-colored, this rich, full-bodied wine is flavored with dry molasses as well as raisins. Cut with acidity, it has a mature feel that is both ripe and, at the end, dry, with a fragrant aftertaste.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Maynard 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: While there is some bitterness in this wine, it also has forward black fruits and a great sense of juicy acidity. It needs a little time, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Herdade dos Coelheiros 2011 Vinha da Tapada Red (Alentejano)

description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp, citrus and green plum flavored wine. The tight texture gives a fresh character that also has some minerality. Lively and bright at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp, citrus and green plum flavored wine. The tight texture gives a fresh character that also has some minerality. Lively and bright at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires is aromatic and ripe. Its fruitiness is tropical, with pineapple as well as apricot flavors. It's softly textured  and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Branco White (Tejo)

description: The wood aging of this wine has given a lightly oxidized character. It is rich and creamy with toasty acidity as well as yellow fruits. Drink now.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: An attractive entry level Port, fruity with a light tannic structure and a sweet character. Blackberry jam dominates the fruit flavor of this everyday Port.
title: Croft NV Fine Ruby  (Port)

description: Aragonês, a k a Tempranillo and Tinta Roriz, is the source of this smooth, rich wine that shows great elegance despite its high alcohol. It has concentration, very dense fruit flavors and a gorgeous ripe finish.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2008 Aragonês de Peceguina Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: A very aromatic, violet-perfumed wine. It has structured fruit, with wood and blackberry flavors, plenty of acidity and long-term aging potential.
title: Quinta da Cortezia 2008 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, firm while also fruity, this is an intense, aromatic and finely perfumed, smokey wine. The wood aging has softened the tannins while keeping the structure.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Quinta da Pancas Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Deliciously perfumed wine that revels in its cool-climate structure and freshness. Black currant fruits and soft tannins follow through with some dryness. A fine, food-friendly wine.
title: Sanguinhal 2006 Quinta do Sanguinhal Red (Obidos)

description: Toasty as well as fruity, this serious and complex wine has powerful tannins, a dense structure, red fruits and good concentration. There is weight here and aging potential.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Porca de Murça Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Smooth Chardonnay-like richness gives concentration to this magnificent ripe wine. The wood aging shows through the fruit, ending on toast, spice and green herbs.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: Smooth Chardonnay-like richness gives concentration to this magnificent ripe wine. The wood aging shows through the fruit, ending on toast, spice and green herbs.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: A rich wine that takes time to show its structure, starting with blackberry fruits, then revealing firm, closed tannins. The wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz, giving off power and complexity.
title: Quinta da Nespereira 2008 Vineaticu Red (Dão)

description: Named after the pomegranate orchard that existed before the vines, this is a powerful, dense wine, concentrated with fruit and dark tannins. Good spice, extreme juiciness and acidity give extra character. This is for aging over 4–5 years.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2008 Vinha das Romãs Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the pomegranate orchard that existed before the vines, this is a powerful, dense wine, concentrated with fruit and dark tannins. Good spice, extreme juiciness and acidity give extra character. This is for aging over 4–5 years.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2008 Vinha das Romãs Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine has sweetness as well as a sugar-water character. It is fruity, but has a concocted, artificial aftertaste.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Late Harvest Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Tejo)

description: Vividly pink in color, this is a light and sweet wine. There is a sugary aftertaste followed by fresh, crisp acidity.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Ela Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A sweet wine that has a candy shop confected taste. It does have acidity along with a touch of citrus although the sherbet aftertaste is off-putting.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Ela Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This candied rosé is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. Full of soft red berry fruits with only light acidity, it is off-dry to taste. A touch of pepper at the end is less attractive.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and smooth with light toast blending with the yellow fruit and spice. Acidity gives the wine its freshness contrasting with the complex fruit and wood balance. Drink this fine wine from 2017.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Quinta do Mondego Branco White (Dão)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich and smooth with light toast blending with the yellow fruit and spice. Acidity gives the wine its freshness contrasting with the complex fruit and wood balance. Drink this fine wine from 2017.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Quinta do Mondego Branco White (Dão)

description: An off-dry, crisp and very fruity wine that has a light lilt of freshness. The wine is just sparkling, giving an attractive burst of apple and citrus at the end.
title: Sogrape NV Mateus White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: An off-dry, crisp and very fruity wine that has a light lilt of freshness. The wine is just sparkling, giving an attractive burst of apple and citrus at the end.
title: Sogrape NV Mateus White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: The Jaen in Portugal is unique to the Dão (in Spain it is called Mencía). It gives, as in this wood-aged wine, a richly tannic character, full of red-berry fruits. The wood aging creates the hint of toast that is still present. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Enxertia Jaen (Dão)

description: Fresh and fruity, laced with citrus, crisp apricot and a delicious layer of lime juice. Drink now, but the wine will age a year.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2009 Fernão Pires (Lisboa)

description: Lemon flavored, this light and fruity wine has a hint of minerality, followed by a crisp, fresh aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sobreiró de Cima 2012 Santa Valha Branco White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: Lemon flavored, this light and fruity wine has a hint of minerality, followed by a crisp, fresh aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sobreiró de Cima 2012 Santa Valha Branco White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: Solid and dry, the wine is sustained by its rich tannins and earthy character. Rooted in the tough soils of the northeast, it's always going to be firm. Give it until 2015 to soften a little.
title: Quinta do Sobreiró de Cima 2011 Tinto Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: Sweet red berry fruits come through the firmer tannins. An unusual blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, it has plenty of acidity, delicious juiciness and touches of wood at the end. It's not for long-term aging, ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: Textured and mineral, this crisp wine has some lively acidity as well as raspberry fruitiness. It's totally ready for the summer.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: Red berry fruits great freshness and brightness to this fruity wine that has tight acidity as a balance. The wine is crisp, young and layers light tannins at the end.
title: Fiuza 2013 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Red berry fruits great freshness and brightness to this fruity wine that has tight acidity as a balance. The wine is crisp, young and layers light tannins at the end.
title: Fiuza 2013 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Bigode, meaning the mustache, is fruity, fresh and light in texture. The juicy character needs another few months to integrate fully with the berry fruits. Spice adds interest. It will be better by the end of 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Bigode, meaning the mustache, is fruity, fresh and light in texture. The juicy character needs another few months to integrate fully with the berry fruits. Spice adds interest. It will be better by the end of 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is the entry-level wine from Herdade da Farizoa in Alentejo. With its spice, soft tannins and blackberry juice flavor, it's a fresh wine that can be drunk now through 2019.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Farizoa Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is the entry-level wine from Herdade da Farizoa in Alentejo. With its spice, soft tannins and blackberry juice flavor, it's a fresh wine that can be drunk now through 2019.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Farizoa Red (Alentejano)

description: Bright, fruity and fresh, this familiar Vinho Verde brand does exactly what it's meant to do: provide a refreshing, light glass of wine. Apples and citrus easily carry the lightly sweet flavors and blend with an orange zest texture. Drink immediately.
title: Aveleda 2013 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This well-balanced wine is rich, just off dry and with a mineral texture. Plenty of freshness with a crisp aftertaste balances the softer side of the wine. It's for immediate drinking.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera White (Vinho Verde)

description: Tight and textured, this is a mineral structured wine. Green fruits and acidity keep the wine fresh. The aftertaste is flatter, not bringing out enough fruit.
title: Herdade do Perdigão 2013 Villa Romanu White (Alentejo)

description: Initially just juicy black currants, it shows a more structured side very slowly. The result is a fruity wine, ready to drink soon.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2009 Aragonês da Peceguina Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: Initially just juicy black currants, it shows a more structured side very slowly. The result is a fruity wine, ready to drink soon.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2009 Aragonês da Peceguina Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: Crisply fruity, this light, bright wine is designed for immediate drinking with its acidity, lemon fruits and lightly herbaceous touch.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2013 Comporta White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Crisply fruity, this light, bright wine is designed for immediate drinking with its acidity, lemon fruits and lightly herbaceous touch.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2013 Comporta White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Very young, the wine gives out pure fruitiness, very fresh and lively. Good juiciness offers a riper view of this already very drinkable wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Fiuza 2013 Native Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: A perfumed wine that is soft and fruity. It has a fresh, tangy character that makes it very refreshing and crisp.Think of this as an apéritif rosé, bright and light.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

description: A perfumed wine that is soft and fruity. It has a fresh, tangy character that makes it very refreshing and crisp.Think of this as an apéritif rosé, bright and light.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a seriously impressive, ripe and powerful wine. Boasting rich fruits, black plum and berry flavors and concentrated acidity, it also has a dark, solid structure. Still young, this shows boisterous acidity and needs to soften and fill out further. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The wine is produced from old Alicante Bouschet and Sousão vines both of which contribute to the dark, almost black color. It is concentrated while with considerable acidity, tannins and a mouth- tingling juicy black currant character. The wood-aged, spicy wine needs to age much longer to even begin the round out, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Opaco Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, tropical take on Alvarinho. The effects of partial malolactic fermentation in wood are there in the round, creamy character of the wine and the lights touch of oak. It is all ready to drink although it will be even better from late 2016.
title: Quinta da Soalheiro 2014 Terramatter Alvarinho (Minho)

description: The family-owned vineyard of Santar is run by Dão Sul. This white has plenty of the mineral texture of the region, along with a rich, fruity character. Orange zest, refreshing acidity and bright pear and green-plum flavors come together. Drink from 2016.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Branco White (Dão)

description: The family-owned vineyard of Santar is run by Dão Sul. This white has plenty of the mineral texture of the region, along with a rich, fruity character. Orange zest, refreshing acidity and bright pear and green-plum flavors come together. Drink from 2016.
title: Dão Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Branco White (Dão)

description: The heatwave summer of 2003 gave the right conditions for producing a Vintage Port. Many seemed drinkable younger than usual for this style of wine, and this is totally open, fruity, soft and ready to drink. It's a rich, sweet style, very perfumed and ripe.
title: Butler Nephew & Co 2003 Vintage  (Port)

description: Made in tanks with no wood aging, this wine from classic Portuguese grapes is all about fruit. It has soft, ripe tannins that sustain the big berry and black currant flavors. With its juicy acidity and a light dry core, it will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2011 Piorro Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Attractively nutty and fruity, this approachable everyday drinking Port has just the right acidity, ripe almond and red fruits. The wine has a drier tannic element as well as the richer, sweeter raisins and spice. Like any tawny, it's ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro NV Tawny Reserva  (Port)

description: A beautifully smooth wine, with a rich Port-like texture. The dry, firm tannins give the wine impressive structure, although it remains opulent, its dark fruit, cocoa and herbal flavors just breathing the concentration of the Douro.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2007 Red (Douro)

description: A beautifully smooth wine, with a rich Port-like texture. The dry, firm tannins give the wine impressive structure, although it remains opulent, its dark fruit, cocoa and herbal flavors just breathing the concentration of the Douro.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2007 Red (Douro)

description: From old vines, this powerful wine is the epitome of a great Douro red. Its ripe, plum and prune fruits, layered with bitter chocolate, are tinged with acidity. Spice and pepper add to the complexity of this ageworthy wine.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2007 Adelaide Red (Douro)

description: From old vines, this powerful wine is the epitome of a great Douro red. Its ripe, plum and prune fruits, layered with bitter chocolate, are tinged with acidity. Spice and pepper add to the complexity of this ageworthy wine.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2007 Adelaide Red (Douro)

description: Gorgeously impressive wine, super-rich, balanced by acidity, juicy, concentrated red stone fruits, mulberries and dark chocolate. It is a powerhouse of ripe fruit, dark, ready to age for six years and more. One downside: high alcohol.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2007 Vinha da Ponte Red (Douro)

description: Concentrated and dense, very structured, swathed in sweet ripe plums, dark chocolate, spice and balancing acidity. This is complex, dark, while remaining stylish. For aging over 5–6 years.
title: Quinta de São José 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Selected from barrel tastings, this mineral, vibrant wine demands aging. The flavors are bright white fruits, with a tropical touch, followed by a dense biting texture. Final grapefruit acidity tops this ageworthy wine.
title: Niepoort 2009 Redoma Reserva White (Douro)

description: Initially fresh, with a creamy, white-fruit texture, this has acidity, but it finishes fat and rather hot, with pepper.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2006 Visconde de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Initially fresh, with a creamy, white-fruit texture, this has acidity, but it finishes fat and rather hot, with pepper.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2006 Visconde de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: This is a fruity wine showing a touch of wood aging alongside juicy red fruit flavors. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet, this wine has a bright youthful color and fresh acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is soft and rounded. It has lemon and light spiciness along with cool acidity. It is an easy wine that is ripe with apple and fresh lemon juice and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Barão de Figueira Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: This is a broad, earthy wine showing black fruits and a rich aftertaste. It has spice, juicy acidity and tannins in the background. The fruit is verging on overripe, giving a jammy aftertaste.
title: Espaço Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a broad, earthy wine showing black fruits and a rich aftertaste. It has spice, juicy acidity and tannins in the background. The fruit is verging on overripe, giving a jammy aftertaste.
title: Espaço Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Red (Alentejano)

description: A perfumed and crisp citrus wine that is light and fruity. It is soft and smooth with a light creamy texture and refreshing acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a perfumed, lightly herbal wine. It has fine acidity with the crisp fruits and a touch of minerality. Floral aromas and citrus fruit give a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2015 Pacheca Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a perfumed, lightly herbal wine. It has fine acidity with the crisp fruits and a touch of minerality. Floral aromas and citrus fruit give a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2015 Pacheca Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine that has soft tannins and ripe fruit. Berry flavors and a full-bodied fruitiness are right up front, while the aftertaste has crisp acidity. Drink Now.
title: Perescuma 2015 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: With pictures of violinists, this is obviously a musician's wine. The wine is soft, full of red berry fruits, and attractive bursts of acidity. Drink this crisp wine from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2015 Orquestra Red (Alentejano)

description: A totally ready-to-drink wine that is full of bright red fruits and crisp acidity. It has some soft tannins and a dry edge, though the wine just bursts with fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: Melon and ripe pear flavors give some richness to this lightly citrus flavored wine. With attractive acidity, it is crisp, clean and tangy at the end. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

description: Bold and spicy, this is a soft, round wine. It is ripe with berry fruits and crisp with acidity. While it only hints at the structure of Touriga Nacional it does have a rich, warm character that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Península de Setúbal)

description: A deliciously fresh wine, the bright acidity coming from green fruit and peaches. A creamy character adds a sense of roundness, but there is a crisp, taut aftertaste.
title: Kopke 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This attractive, soft and fresh wine is fruity, with red berry flavors, balanced acidity and warm tannins. With its light touch of spice, it is ready to drink.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2009 Periquita Red (Setubal)

description: Named after the crows that fly on the Campolargo estate, this is a warm, ripely fruity wine with sweet flavors and soft tannins. It is ready to drink, a delicious winter warmer.
designation: Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa
title: Campolargo 2008 Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)

description: Raisins and ripe fruit combine in this LBV that has some richness while remaining on the dry side. Blackberry jelly is layered with acidity and a dark tannic structure. For drinking now.
title: Cálem 2006 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: All spice, juicy fruit and dry tannins, this certainly evokes the spirit of the grape. There is a mineral quality to the red berry fruits, which comes through in the youthful, firm edge. Give this wine another two years so the  fruit will open up.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2004 Touriga Franca (Douro)

description: A wood-aged, rich wine that shows big, ripe fruits and a good spice and toast element from the wood, balanced by white nectarines and currants. It is full, rounded and creamy.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2006 Falcoaria Fernão Pires (Ribatejo)

description: Ripe and smooth, balancing dense black fruit flavors with spice, wood and acidity, this is a solid, concentrated wine. It has a good restrained power, although the pepper hints at the alcohol. It certainly demands rich food.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2003 Casa de Alorna Colheita Seleccionada Red (Ribatejo)

description: A densely tannic wine, dry with bitter dark cocoa and black fruit flavors. The concentration of fruit and tannin is impressive, and gives considerable complexity of fruit as it powers alongside the dryness. It needs aging for the rough edges to smooth out, probably 2–3 years.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A fine, firm, structured wine that shows richness along with elegance. Fresh, black fruits ride over dry tannins and acidity, allowing this to be a food-friendly wine that could benefit from some aging. To finish, the lifted, vibrant fruits leave a ripe, clean taste.
title: Messias 2003 Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: Bold, ripe and fruity, this is a young wine that will be ready to drink soon. It has blackberry notes laced with bright acidity to balance the rich palate. Already delicious and approachable, this is a generous wine with a fresh aftertaste.
title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2013 Herdade das Albernoas Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine has a hot character, full of spice and overripe fruit. Black plum notes combine with a strongly toasty character that needs time to soften. It is rounded and rich, with mild freshness at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Tight and tannic, very taut, the tannins initially long and one-dimensional. Then great fruit kicks in, black jelly, ripe plums and cherries and a fine fresh aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Infantado 2005 Red (Douro)

description: The Lapa vineyards are away from the Tagus (Tejo) river giving better structured soil and therefore firmer wines. That shows in this ripe wine with its tannins and bold fruits. It is attractively fruity, with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Red (Tejo)

description: The Lapa vineyards are away from the Tagus (Tejo) river giving better structured soil and therefore firmer wines. That shows in this ripe wine with its tannins and bold fruits. It is attractively fruity, with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Red (Tejo)

description: The wood aging shows strongly in this spicy wine. Besides bitter tannins it also gives the wine a minty character. It is young and hopefully the fruit will develop more and fill out this structure.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The wood aging shows strongly in this spicy wine. Besides bitter tannins it also gives the wine a minty character. It is young and hopefully the fruit will develop more and fill out this structure.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is Alvarinho from the southern part of the Minho region, close to Oporto. It has lemon fruit and a smooth texture, giving a rich wine. It could age a little longer, so wait until 2018.
title: Conde Villar 2015 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This is Alvarinho from the southern part of the Minho region, close to Oporto. It has lemon fruit and a smooth texture, giving a rich wine. It could age a little longer, so wait until 2018.
title: Conde Villar 2015 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This is young for an Alvarinho. Its bright fruit needs time to fill out and open its ripe texture. The elements are there in this attractive wine, so just wait until 2018.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2016 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A ripe blend of local Douro white grapes, this is attractively soft and fruity. It has a warm, creamy texture that encompasses the young fruits. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ready to develop for a few more months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Porrais Branco White (Douro)

description: A ripe blend of local Douro white grapes, this is attractively soft and fruity. It has a warm, creamy texture that encompasses the young fruits. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ready to develop for a few more months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Porrais Branco White (Douro)

description: Blending Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this personal blend is named after Domingos Soares Franco, the head winemaker at J.M. da Fonseca. The wine is big, fruity and perfumed, with black, ripe fruit flavors and a solid edge, finishing with dark chocolate.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2005 Domingos Red (Terras do Sado)

description: The Alicante Bouschet and Castelão in the blend give it its rich, immediately fruity character and dense color. Structure and concentration leave room for an elegant texture. Blackberry juiciness shines at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e Falcão (Wolf and Falcon) Red (Tejo)

description: Made from fruit that's sourced from the Buçaco Mountains in the east of Bairrada, this wine is rich and elegant, and its juicy fruit provides a counterbalance to the structure. With its youthful fruitiness, this is worth aging for another 2–3 years.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)

description: Sweet, toffee aromas lead to an equally sweet wine. It has richness, a very smooth, soft texture that coats the mouth with toffee, treacle and only a hint of blackberry fruits. Dried fruits come through in the aftertaste.
title: Burmester NV Sotto Voce Reserve  (Port)

description: Sweet, toffee aromas lead to an equally sweet wine. It has richness, a very smooth, soft texture that coats the mouth with toffee, treacle and only a hint of blackberry fruits. Dried fruits come through in the aftertaste.
title: Burmester NV Sotto Voce Reserve  (Port)

description: An entry-level tawny, soft, sweet, still keeping fruitiness. The spirit blends well with black plum and treacle flavors, leaving some freshness.
title: Gilberts NV Tawny Porto  (Port)

description: Perfumed and bright, this is an attractive blend that includes Pinot Noir and Syrah. With its ripe creamy texture and exuberant red fruits, the wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Lisboa's coastal climate keeps this wine fresh and with good acidity despite its richness. Wood aging has smoothed the natural tannins of the fruit, yileding a concentrated wine with a deep, solid base that could still benefit from some aging.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2009 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: There is something of the essential crispness and green fruit character of a Vinho Verde. But the wine also has some richness, weight, and a creamy texture. Very aromatic, this is a wine to drink and also age a few months.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Maria Papoila Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe yellow fruits and light almond flavors, a rounded and soft texture. This is a wood-aged wine, the vanilla toast giving a smooth structure. while leaving the concentrated fruits firmly in charge.
title: Sogevinus 2009 Curva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Ripe yellow fruits and light almond flavors, a rounded and soft texture. This is a wood-aged wine, the vanilla toast giving a smooth structure. while leaving the concentrated fruits firmly in charge.
title: Sogevinus 2009 Curva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Putting Syrah and Touriga Nacional together is a popular blend in Alentejo, producing structured wines that also exude ripe berry fruitiness and a fine aromatic character. This wine is still young as its firm tannins are evident even as its fruit is well in place, fresh and fruity and with a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Vinha da Defesa Red (Alentejano)

description: There is an earthy element to this ripe and fruity wine. It adds some herbal flavors to the tannins, red fruits and final acidity. Drink this wine soon, and until 2020.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Chaminé Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a light wine, with fresh berry fruits and acidity that delineate the structure. It's already an easy wine to drink, hinting at minerality and finishing softly.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This sweet sparkling rosé is clean and crisp. It has attractive strawberry fruit, soft texture and a light mousse. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Rosé Castelão (Tejo)

description: Soft, light and fruity, this wine is ready for a warm day. Apple flavors and clean acidity balance its soft sweetness, making it ready to drink now. Intriguingly, its label resembles that of a much more familiar brand of Vinho Verde.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)

description: High-acid red wine is not for everyone, but this one—dry, stalky and light—is a genuine example of a wine that has always had a following in northern Portugal, great for pairing with fresh sardines. Think that way, and it's more than just a curiosity.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo Tinto Red (Vinho Verde)

description: This pleasant, fruity wine has lemon-lime crispness. Hints of apricot flavor prove the Alvarinho grape is far from its northern Portuguese homeland. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Senses Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, fruity and easy wine. With simple tannins and black currant fruit laced with spice, it's made to be drunk now.
title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2015 Animus Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft and crisp wine that shows attractive, tangy orange flavor and has plenty of acidity to keep it as fresh as possible. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)

description: This blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires is soft and bland. Its light fruit and acidity feel open and ripe.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: This blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires is soft and bland. Its light fruit and acidity feel open and ripe.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: This wine comes from the home region of this producer, and features the local Baga grape. Once difficult to control, this grape can now produce richly structured wines, as it does here. This is packed with as much fruit as tannin—ripe fruit giving red-berry flavors that are bursting with juice as well as acidity. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Caves Aliança 2015 Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: Aged in small and larger barrels for an average of 20 years, the wine is beautifully poised between fruit and old gold intensity. It is rich, with dark marmalade flavors, orange peel and spice. The intense acidity keeps some crispness to this intense, dry and concentrated wine. Drink now.
designation: Quinta da Soalheira 20 Years Old Tawny
title: Borges NV Quinta da Soalheira 20 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This superrich blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Roupeiro was tank fermented to keep the crispness and fruit of the blend. It is certainly rich but it has fine acidity as well—juicy and full of apple flavors. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Luis Duarte 2016 Monte do Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: A rich opening is followed by firm tannins. The wine has ample weight and a solid structure around the blackberry fruit. While deliciously fruity now, just watch those tannins in the future.
title: Maynard's 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A rich opening is followed by firm tannins. The wine has ample weight and a solid structure around the blackberry fruit. While deliciously fruity now, just watch those tannins in the future.
title: Maynard's 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Great berry and plum fruits leap out of the glass. It has a solid structure, to be sure, but it is the ripe character of the wine, a delicious balance between great fruit and acidity that dominates.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Great berry and plum fruits leap out of the glass. It has a solid structure, to be sure, but it is the ripe character of the wine, a delicious balance between great fruit and acidity that dominates.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A fragrant and fruity wine, ripe in character, its black currant fruits showing strongly. The wine is richly textured, opulent and full in the mouth. It has weight, spice, jammy black fruit and sweet tannins.
title: Quinta do Pego 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a complex wine—packed with tannins and dark fruit. The clean core is layered with blackberry flavors, powerful ripeness and a dense structure.
title: Offley 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This structured, dark, brooding wine is closed up at this stage. It's a wine with serious tannins, powerful spiciness and plenty of concentration. A dry core is surrounded by the fruit, hinting at potentially rich texture.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2011 Quinta de Roriz Vintage  (Port)

description: While this is lightweight for a Douro wine, it does have a backbone of tannin. It is warm, with its damson jelly flavors giving a reassuring winter feel. The texture shows dusty tannins and a final juicy character. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2008 Red (Douro)

description: While this is lightweight for a Douro wine, it does have a backbone of tannin. It is warm, with its damson jelly flavors giving a reassuring winter feel. The texture shows dusty tannins and a final juicy character. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2008 Red (Douro)

description: A light and fruity style of Vinho Verde, its acidity balanced with pear and white-currant notes. Lemon flavors cut through, adding brightness.
title: Vercoope 2011 Terras de Felgueiras White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Touriga Nacional, this is a ripe, mature wine that shows a great balance between acidity and rich flavors of almond and toast. It has weight but still hints at freshness. This is a food sparkling wine.
title: Falua 2009 Conde de Vimioso Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A rich and fruity wine, it's not subtle, but is full of spice and red berry flavors. Firm tannins underpin the bright, bold flavors and suggest that this is a wine that could age for a few years but is also very enjoyable now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: A perfumed wine that is ripe and richly tannic, with the minerality of the Douro. It has weight, while also retaining elegance and rounded black fruits. Give this wine a few years, and drink from 2015.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Boat Red (Douro)

description: With great fragrance and just a touch of spiciness, this is full-bodied ripe wine. Along with the more exotic flavors, it has intense apple and nectarine fruit, and a bright, tight texture. Drink now, or age for a year.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Branco White (Dão)

description: Here's a smooth and juicy wine that has great black fruit aromas and flavors. It has good balance between the dry tannins and firm structure of Dão and the fruity character, meaning it is likely to develop over the medium term. Drink from 2015.
designation: Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita Red (Dão)

description: Here's a smooth and juicy wine that has great black fruit aromas and flavors. It has good balance between the dry tannins and firm structure of Dão and the fruity character, meaning it is likely to develop over the medium term. Drink from 2015.
designation: Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This brand, first produced in 1881, has been among the most famous in Portugal. In its latest manifestation, it has a fresh red fruit character, smooth, with light acidity and soft tannins. There is a burst of juicy flavors that promises easy drinking.
title: Caves Velhas 2005 Serradayres Reserva Red (Ribatejo)

description: This brand, first produced in 1881, has been among the most famous in Portugal. In its latest manifestation, it has a fresh red fruit character, smooth, with light acidity and soft tannins. There is a burst of juicy flavors that promises easy drinking.
title: Caves Velhas 2005 Serradayres Reserva Red (Ribatejo)

description: A fresh, slightly sweet rosé, that keeps crispness through its bright, breezy strawberry flavors. The wine is soft, crisp, clean, a summer rosé.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada Rosé Red (Estremadura)

description: A soft, clean, fruity wine, with spice and a fresh, aromatic character. The lemon and white fruit flavors are in an easy, apéritif style, with a lightly sweet aftertaste.
title: Dão Sul 2008 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada White (Dão)

description: This wine, the first vintage produced by the Esporão winemaking team, gives fine, elegant Douro tannins along with new wood and rich flavors of damson and blackberry. It is structured, powerful and very age worthy. Keep for at least four years.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Firmly tannic and still dominated by new wood, this is dense and brooding. It has the typically mineral feel of a fine Douro wine. Concentrated, brambly fruits and a powerful structure make this a wine that needs to age for at least five years.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2010 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: Firmly tannic and still dominated by new wood, this is dense and brooding. It has the typically mineral feel of a fine Douro wine. Concentrated, brambly fruits and a powerful structure make this a wine that needs to age for at least five years.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2010 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: From the highest point of the Herdade da Boavista Vineyard in Alentejo, this is complex, mineral driven and structured. It combines great fruitiness with spice, intense acidity and dark smokiness. Best aged for at least three years.
title: Terras de Alter 2009 Outeiro Red (Alentejano)

description: This smooth and rich selection is wood aged and full of ripe, juicy black fruits. Made from grapes sourced from vineyards in the upper valley of the Douro, it showcases its tough, mineral soil while retaining its dense weight. Worth aging for at least four years.
title: Muxagat 2010 Mux Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Packed with ripe fruits and soft tannins, this is a juicy, red fruit flavored wine. Although it is young with the fruity side right up front, it is really not a wine that needs to age for long. Enjoy the wine for its freshness and light touch of minerality.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Tinto Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Côa Valley is in the far eastern end of the Douro vineyards, increasingly exciting for red wines. This wine, from organic vineyards, retains plenty of freshness with red berry fruits and tannins that are already well integrated. It is fruity, ripe and ready to drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2013 Quinta do Côa Red (Douro)

description: With its typical perfumed fruit and firm tannins this is a ripe structured wine. It does suffer from the one-dimensional character that can come with a mono-varietal Touriga Nacional. That keeps the wine firm with good fruit although without great depth and complexity. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: With its typical perfumed fruit and firm tannins this is a ripe structured wine. It does suffer from the one-dimensional character that can come with a mono-varietal Touriga Nacional. That keeps the wine firm with good fruit although without great depth and complexity. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is a deliciously perfumed wine that is fresh and fruity with a fine, tight texture to add interest and give it shape. It takes advantage of the natural aromatic flavors of the grape to produce a wine that is both crisp and fragrant. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Verdelho (Lisboa)

description: The wine has the correct texture and attractive perfumes for a delicate Riesling. The crisp apple and tight mineral flavors are light and floating. It's a surprising wine for the Lisbon region, but it works so well.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Riesling (Lisboa)

description: This is a dark, dense wine. It has concentrated tannins that are still dominant. The ripe fruit that is underneath will shortly reveal red berry and red currant freshness. This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is perfumed with a fresh, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Lobo 2013 Selecção Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a dark, dense wine. It has concentrated tannins that are still dominant. The ripe fruit that is underneath will shortly reveal red berry and red currant freshness. This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is perfumed with a fresh, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Lobo 2013 Selecção Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Although it's young, this wine has seen some time in oak, which has given it a ripe fruity character balanced by toast. It's rich and full with balancing acidity and a spicy aftertaste. It needs to age a few months, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A perfumed, ripe wine, attractively flavored with citrus, peach and melon, this is a wine for drinking young, a warm day wine, or as an apèritif. The crisp structure adds to its mouthwatering character.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Grand' Arte Chardonnay (Estremadura)

description: It is the ripe dark Alicante Bouschet that dominates this firmly structured wine. It is packed with tannins along with a hugely dense texture and concentrated juicy berry flavors. It is very firm, still young. Wait until 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: It is the ripe dark Alicante Bouschet that dominates this firmly structured wine. It is packed with tannins along with a hugely dense texture and concentrated juicy berry flavors. It is very firm, still young. Wait until 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2015, this brand was the among the first Douro still wines. This Reserva, with its wood-aged flavors, is rich and full of ripe white fruits while not losing sight of the mineral texture of white wines from the region. While it is drinkable now, it will be much better from 2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2015, this brand was the among the first Douro still wines. This Reserva, with its wood-aged flavors, is rich and full of ripe white fruits while not losing sight of the mineral texture of white wines from the region. While it is drinkable now, it will be much better from 2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a creamy ripe wine, spicy and toasty in character with rich Chardonnay and local grapes to give a balanced texture. Acidity is there along with pineapple and white peach flavors. The rich rounded texture is generous and opulent. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Terras do Anjo Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Very fruity, this is a dry wine, with green fruits, citrus and a tangy character. It is light, bright and fresh, very ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This appealing wine is rich, smooth and juicy, with a spice and blackberry character. Still young, it has the chance of aging another year, but remains great to drink now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Vinho Atlântico Red (Alentejano)

description: A rich, full-bodied, yet also elegant wine that is ripe and mature. A selection of the best lots, it has spice, rich red plum and generous texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Marias 2013 Cuvée TT Red (Dão)

description: New wood aging gives this fine wine its smooth, ripe texture. It is rich and full of spice and generous tannins. It is dense with plum skin and blackberry fruits. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2015 Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: With vines in the south of the Vinho Verde region, the estate has wines with a warm, ripe character. This example shows a richer side of Vinho Verde while preserving the natural crisp edge. Tropical fruits are balanced with a citrus aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: From the homeland of Alvarinho in the Monção region in the north of Vinho Verde, the wine is rich and mineral with touches of wood fermentation adding spice. It is textured, full of juicy fruit at the end. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a highly perfumed wine from the village of Favaios above the Douro valley and well known for its Moscatel. It is rich with its candy-shop aromas and lychee flavor. The acidity of this dry wine is enough to keep it crisp and fresh. Drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2015 Vale de Poupa Galego Branco Moscatel (Douro)

description: Getting past the heavy bottle, you find a structured and firm wine that has aging potential. Dark and firm, with rich black-plum flavor and a concentrated texture, the wine is developing into a ripe, impressive wine. The mineral edge will integrate well over the next year. Drink from 2018.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Especial
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: Young vines give a fruity style of wine with attractive violet aromas and black-fruit flavors. The wine has powerful dense tannins, spice from the wood aging and a cooler, mineral texture at the end. It is a rich wine, just now ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: A small quantity of Warre was declared as a vintage in 2009, to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the liberation of Oporto from Napoleon by Anglo-Portuguese forces. The is made in the dry, firm Warre style, dense and packed with solid tannins. At the same time, it has a perfumed character, leaving the tannins to return on the finish.
title: Warre's 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: A small quantity of Warre was declared as a vintage in 2009, to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the liberation of Oporto from Napoleon by Anglo-Portuguese forces. The is made in the dry, firm Warre style, dense and packed with solid tannins. At the same time, it has a perfumed character, leaving the tannins to return on the finish.
title: Warre's 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: This ripe and full-bodied wine from Cristiano van Zeller is powerfully concentrated, showing all the right weight while also providing generous fruitiness. Rich black fruits and sweet tannins are layered with acidity. This is a wine for long-term aging.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: The concentration of old vines is very evident in this wine, which uses fruit that was sourced from a portion of old vines in Niepoort's Quinta da Pisca. There is a touch of bitter cherry, as well as a firm, dense core that shows a fine balance of acidity. This is powerful, full-bodied and packed with dark fruit—for long-term aging.
title: Niepoort 2009 Bioma Vinha Velha Vintage  (Port)

description: Fado, wine and song, reads the label, and Fado is the essentially Portuguese style of music. The wine is more international in character, ripe, soft and smooth, with attractive acidity and juicy fruit. Drink through 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The apricot notes of Viognier come through strongly with this smooth, ripe wine. It has a steely character and a cool freshness from the Arinto and Síria in the blend. All in all, an attractive wine that could age a few months.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The name of the wine is, of course, a branding exercise in itself. Luckily, the wine inside the bottle is ripe and enjoyable. It's fruity, soft, gently tannic with juicy red fruits and black plums, all finished with fresh acidity. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2012 NBNC = No Branding No Cry Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a finely made, easy to drink wine. It is soft, round, with spice and light tannins, a wine that would travel to parties, barbecues and pasta bakes. The acidity from the blackberry flavor keeps it fresh and fruity.
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Shiraz and Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, dusty-textured wine that shows blackberry and black currant fruit flavors, along with a dry, firm core of tannins. The edge initially shows some bitterness, but then the wood comes through. Drink now or until 2010.
title: Falua 2007 Conde de Vimioso Red (Ribatejano)

description: Fruity, full-bodied wine, with tropical fruits, pear and sweet orange flavors. The acidity is just right, but richness is where this is going.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marques de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Fruity, full-bodied wine, with tropical fruits, pear and sweet orange flavors. The acidity is just right, but richness is where this is going.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marques de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Bright, lively and fruity, this is a delicious, crisp, dry Vinho Verde from the north of the region, close to Spain. It has citrus notes, a bright texture, lively acidity and a touch of spritz.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2012 Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fernão Pires and Arinto are blended together to yield this ripe and warm, while also poised wine. It has pear and creamed apple flavors that are shot through with orange-zest acidity. Ready to drink in six months.
title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada White (Tejo)

description: Fresh black fruits give this wine a bright start in life. It is rich with some tannins and dark spice. Dominant berry-fruit flavors are balanced with acidity and a dry, firm aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Romeira Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Fresh black fruits give this wine a bright start in life. It is rich with some tannins and dark spice. Dominant berry-fruit flavors are balanced with acidity and a dry, firm aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Romeira Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Aging on the lees for a few months has given this fresh white wine also richness. It has lemon juice and crisp apple flavors and a bright mineral acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A freshly textured wine that has a bite of spice to contrast with its tangy lemon acidity. It's fresh, fruity and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2011 Crasto Branco White (Douro)

description: Soft, ripe and juicy, this wine is full of ready-to-drink fruit housed by soft tannins from light wood aging. Mainly fruit-forward in style, a bright acidity kicks on the finish to balance the palate out.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)

description: Soft, ripe and juicy, this wine is full of ready-to-drink fruit housed by soft tannins from light wood aging. Mainly fruit-forward in style, a bright acidity kicks on the finish to balance the palate out.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)

description: Fresh, fruity and crisp, this is an attractive, refreshing wood aged wine. It has citrus and crisp apple and riper apricot flavors, bright with acidity and needing a few more months to age. Drink from late 2016.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Bridão Reserva Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe wine with its juicy black fruits and generous tannins. It has a mature character that's emphasized by the wood aging and rich fruitiness. There's a touch of pepper at the end from the alcohol which is a shame. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Cassa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft fruity wine with stalky blackberry fruits. Like many wines from the Tejo region it has a light structure that is built around easygoing fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Red (Tejo)

description: This is a soft fruity wine with stalky blackberry fruits. Like many wines from the Tejo region it has a light structure that is built around easygoing fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Red (Tejo)

description: A popular Portuguese brand, this is a ripe, fruity wine that's made to be drunk young. It has fresh berry fruits and some firm tannins to support the otherwise easygoing acidity and fruitiness. Aging in large barrels has given the wine an open, ripe aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Marquês de Borba Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: From a single vineyard, this wine has structure and dense tannins. It is still young and the lean stalky character needs time to open up. Look for the black currant fruit to become richer over the next year and drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Tightly coiled, the firm tannins hold down the exuberant berry fruits and fresh acidity. It is certainly young, but the elegance is already here, as well as the herb and spice seasoning from wood. The dry aftertaste reinforces the need for aging, at least 4–5 years.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2004 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A lively, fresh wine, whose wood aging has just enhanced the delicious fruit flavors of mango and pineapple. The acidity bounces up and down, vibrant and crisp. Considering its origin in one of the hottest regions of the Douro, this is impressive.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Côa White (Douro)

description: Old vines in the quinta have produced a fine wine from a great Douro year. The tannins, although softened, are still there giving licorice flavors while supporting powerful black fruits. The only downside to this otherwise important wine is the touch of pepper that comes from the alcohol. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2009 Sagrado Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Old vines in the quinta have produced a fine wine from a great Douro year. The tannins, although softened, are still there giving licorice flavors while supporting powerful black fruits. The only downside to this otherwise important wine is the touch of pepper that comes from the alcohol. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2009 Sagrado Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This barrel selection shows its wood-aged flavors strongly in a spicy toasty character. It does need time to bring out the ripe red fruits that are rich as well as crisp. Drink this serious wine with its firm tannins still intact from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Syrah-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)

description: This barrel selection shows its wood-aged flavors strongly in a spicy toasty character. It does need time to bring out the ripe red fruits that are rich as well as crisp. Drink this serious wine with its firm tannins still intact from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Syrah-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)

description: This limited production blend of Arinto and Baga is tight, taut and creamy. Initial intense acidity is balanced by citrus fruits and a lively, bright mousse. The wine has an impressive depth of flavor, richly endowed with fruit, yeastiness and the ability to age further. Drink now, but better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2011 Encontro Special Cuvée Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This limited production blend of Arinto and Baga is tight, taut and creamy. Initial intense acidity is balanced by citrus fruits and a lively, bright mousse. The wine has an impressive depth of flavor, richly endowed with fruit, yeastiness and the ability to age further. Drink now, but better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2011 Encontro Special Cuvée Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: A rugged wine to suit the steep Douro vineyards, this is solid, dark, packed with tannin and a strong structure. Black plum skins, spice and an opulent concentration combine to give a wine that needs time to fulfill its potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Castello d'Alba 2011 Limited Edition Red (Douro)

description: The vineyard around the renaissance palace of Bacalhôa was first planted with Cabernet Sauvignon in the mid-20th century. The estate continue to produce an exemplary, memorable wine. This latest release is full of tense tannins, black currant fruit and acidity and a smooth texture from the wood aging. It is a wine for holding, so drink from 2017.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Quinta da Bacalhôa Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Tangy, ripe and full of fruit, this is a sweet Port that tastes young. Its fruit is right up front, full of red-berry and sultana flavors. While it is sweet, it is also cut with attractive acidity to give a bitter-orange aftertaste.
title: J. H. Andresen NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: The wine is dusty, dry with layers of fruit that are still developing. Blackberry fruitiness is embedded in the firm structure of this stylish wine. It has a delicious, juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal Red (Tejo)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this Alvarinho specialist. A blend with Trajadura, it is crisp, light and bright. Tangy orange and lemon zest flavors give the wine its tight, lively acidity and refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Provam 2015 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a sweet and perfumed wine, rich in red fruits and with a floral character. It shows some of the structure of the year while offering a ripe, smooth, caramel flavored character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Duorum 2014 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: With attractive lemon flavors within a smooth and rich wine, this is both bright and ripe. It's aromatic and full in the mouth, showing apple, peach and mineral tones. Drink from 2015.
title: Kopke 2013 White (Douro)

description: While the wine is rich and tarry, it has an old-fashioned feel to it that comes from the juicy tannins and touch of rusticity. That's not unattractive, a wood-aged oxidized wine that has fruit and spice to add to its allure. Drink from 2015.
title: Vidigal 2010 Reserva dos Amigos Red (Lisboa)

description: A cherry pink, red-cherry flavored wine that has soft, clean fruit and acidity. It's pure fruitiness, easy to drink although with a heft of alcohol that contrasts with its light style.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Vinha da Defesa Rosé (Alentejano)

description: While the wine does have tannins, it's dominant characters are juicy red fruits, sweet tannins and a fresh, lightly mineral texture. It's a wine that's ready to drink, fruity while firm at the end.
title: Borges 2012 Meia Encosta Red (Dão)

description: While it's fresh and creamy, as any Vinho Verde should be, there's something extra to this smooth wine. The tangy acidity is balanced by melon and apple flavors to give the wine some richness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera Grande Escolha Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, showing touches of wood as well as a more rustic character. It is packed with acidity and black currant flavors, at the core firmly tannic.
title: Quinta do Infantado 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, showing touches of wood as well as a more rustic character. It is packed with acidity and black currant flavors, at the core firmly tannic.
title: Quinta do Infantado 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and a dense texture. The wine has finely integrated weight and spice. It is soft and on the sweet side, with black currant fruit and a dense finish.
title: Delaforce 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and a dense texture. The wine has finely integrated weight and spice. It is soft and on the sweet side, with black currant fruit and a dense finish.
title: Delaforce 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A full rich and ripe wine that has toast as well as juicy citrus and yellow fruit flavors. It's a young wine, full of crisp fruitiness that will soften and fill out. With its mineral texture, typical of Douro whites, it is a wine for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Conceito Branco White (Douro)

description: A Garrafeira wine is a special selection and this wine, which was aged for 30 months after bottling before being released, shows its quality quickly. Now reaching drinkability, its tannins have softened leaving rich full black currant and fresh acidity along with a more mature leathery character. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2009 Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: A Garrafeira wine is a special selection and this wine, which was aged for 30 months after bottling before being released, shows its quality quickly. Now reaching drinkability, its tannins have softened leaving rich full black currant and fresh acidity along with a more mature leathery character. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2009 Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: Based in the southern Alentejo, this producer has made an old-fashioned, dark, brooding wine. It's still full of tannins even after six years, although the fruit is certainly there. It is rich and concentrated, dense with plum skin and ripe fruit flavors. The aftertaste is dry. The wine needs to age another year. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade da Capela 2010 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: An easy, fresh, slightly sparkling wine with pleasant, soft, lightly sweet fruit flavors. It is clean, a great apéritif for a summer's day.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: An easy, fresh, slightly sparkling wine with pleasant, soft, lightly sweet fruit flavors. It is clean, a great apéritif for a summer's day.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Made by a Spanish bodega with grapes from the Portuguese Douro, this is a sophisticated Douro wine that has a smooth, ripe texture underpinned with dry tannins. Now mature, it's very elegant. Drink now.
title: Emilio Moro 2007 Drink & Dream D+D Red (Douro)

description: This sophisticated wine is full of rich, beautifully integrated tropical and citrus fruits enhanced by an elegant use of wood. It feels rich, sumptuous and concentrated, while allowing for good acidity at the end. Drink from 2015.
title: Fiuza 2011 Ikon White (Tejo)

description: With strong wood-aging flavors, this is a full, very ripe and concentrated wine. Coming from old vines, it has depth of flavor, both fruity and rich. Peach and pear flavors dominate, along with spice from wood aging. The wine needs some aging, so drink from 2015.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Some wood aging has rounded out this fruity wine. But it has not radically changed its inherent fresh, crisp character. It shows apples, lemon and lime juice and just a touch of spice from wood. The wine is ready to drink but will be best if left until 2015.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2011 Daphne Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Made from old vines, this ripe and firm wine is young and still developing. It has black fruits that are lifted by the juicy, concentrated acidity. Structure, spice, pepper and a generous, full palate all point to some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: From a very fine Port vineyard, this is an attractive wine from what is not a great Port vintage. It has perfumed fruits and gentle tannins that give a red fruit character to the wine. The wine is in a style that can almost be drunk young for its fruit, red plums and dried raisins spiced with acidity and a easy structure. Drink now, although for the true vintage Port experience, wait until 2025.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Vintage  (Port)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This is a serious sparkling wine, with richness as well as properly tense structure. It has weight, some bottle age with yeast and toast as important as citric fruit flavors. The initials stand for the names of the two winemakers.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2007 CC & CP Pinot Noir (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: This is a serious sparkling wine, with richness as well as properly tense structure. It has weight, some bottle age with yeast and toast as important as citric fruit flavors. The initials stand for the names of the two winemakers.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2007 CC & CP Pinot Noir (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Rounded, warm wine, its walnut and kiwi fruit balanced by a soft texture. It has preserved its freshness, allowing the acidity to shine through. A serious wine, as well as delicious, to drink now.
title: Murganheira 2004 Bruto Chardonnay (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: There is no dosage on this lightly pink, beautifully made wine. It has fresh crisp fruit, just hinting at raspberry, floating easily to its final fresh finish.
title: Filipa Pato NV 3B Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is slightly austere in style, with plum and blackberry tones providing weight. Some tannins and acidity accompany its fine, fruity core, giving a more serious note to this wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Pedra Cancela 2010 Seleção do Enólogo Red (Dão)

description: Ripe and smooth wine, with a rich Port-like aroma, the sweet fruit structured with some fresh stalky tannins. Great herbal and wild berry flavors to finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Douro)

description: An herbal wine, rather green in character and missing fruitiness. Structure and cherry fruits are there but lost in this green stalky character.
title: Casa Cadaval 2011 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has seen some wood aging and that seems to miss out on fruitiness. It has toast, a burned character and a taut texture. The rest of the wine is bland.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has seen some wood aging and that seems to miss out on fruitiness. It has toast, a burned character and a taut texture. The rest of the wine is bland.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Dornas Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Sweet, frothy and very pink, this is a strawberry-jelly rosé, light and fruity. The touch of acidity at the end is very welcome.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2013 Conde Villar Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a structured and beautifully wood-aged wine. It comes from vineyards high up in the hills above the Douro, giving a balanced character to the wine. Red berries and black plum skins give the fruit, balanced by the dense, dry core of serious tannins. It's a wine for long aging, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2012 Red (Douro)

description: Named after the fourth Marques da Alorna, a Portuguese poet of the 18th century, this powerful wine (both in terms of the wine and the heavy bottle) is hugely dense, brooding and still very young. Its tannins dominate, giving strength to the fresh blackberry flavors under all this structure. Drink from 2018.
designation: Marquesa da Alorna Grand Reserva Tinto
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Marquesa da Alorna Grand Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Made from old plantings of Touriga Nacional in the Alentejo, this is a structured wine. Perfumed and juicy, it's rich in dark fruits and powerful tannins. Like any great wine from this grape, it's ready for aging, still densely textured and immense. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 TN Touriga Nacional (Alentejo)

description: This is a big, perfumed wine. It is still young, with new wood flavors, touches of eucalyptus and dense, dry tannins. To balance all this structure, the ripe and juicy berry flavors give the wine the richness it needs. Drink from 2017.
title: Campolargo 2011 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: CH, the international initials for Switzerland, are here as a reminder of the birthplace of Alice Tavares da Silva, one of the estate's owners. The wine, rich and dense, offers layers of new wood, mint and dark tannins. Seriously ripe, it's produced from old-vine Touriga Nacional, allowing juicy acidity to give some freshness, although the wine is much more concerned with power and longevity. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 CH by Chocapalha Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Dry in character, not a heavyweight. The wine has some fresh fruit through the dry tannins and spice. There's good balance, even if the wine is on the light side.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: The lightweight of the Passadouro range, Passa has lively berry fruits, soft tannins and acidity to match. It's a drink-now wine, the texture open and ready to go.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passa Red (Douro)

description: Fruity, juicy wine, with some acidity pushing through the light structure. It is attractive, with a tangy, spicy edge.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Dry, firm and toasty, this has acidity over a tight black currant character. That makes it feel almost as much wine as Port, the woody character adding to the dry side.
title: Quevedo 2008 Quinta Vale d'Agodinho Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a fruity wine with plenty of dried-fruit flavors and sweetness. There is a nice bite of spirit, a touch of wood and acidity to balance the sweetness.
title: Quevedo NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a fruity wine with plenty of dried-fruit flavors and sweetness. There is a nice bite of spirit, a touch of wood and acidity to balance the sweetness.
title: Quevedo NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)

description: This soft wine is ripe with berry fruitiness. It has a warm sunny character while still demonstrating smoothness and flashing bright blackberry flavor and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Cabernet Sauvignon-Aragonez Red (Tejo)

description: With some concentration from skin contact during fermentation, this is a wine with richness, spice and apricot character. The palate is full with hints of toastiness, with the ripeness laced by a fresher burst of lemon acidity, resulting in an overall well-balanced wine.
title: Terra Silvestre 2012 Arinto (Tejo)

description: While it is still young, this is a complex wine, with black currant notes supported by firm tannins. It shows wood aging, fresh acidity and a solid core of structure that promises good aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Forma de Arte Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: A full-bodied wine, ripely fruity while preserving the natural, cool freshness of a Vinho Verde. It is richly endowed with apple and pear flavors, a touch of yellow fruit and a just a hint of spice. One in a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Avesso (Vinho Verde)
