description: A full-bodied wine, ripely fruity while preserving the natural, cool freshness of a Vinho Verde. It is richly endowed with apple and pear flavors, a touch of yellow fruit and a just a hint of spice. One in a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: The Encruzado is Dão's own grape, rarely found outside this mountain region. Here, it has produced a smooth wine, with reminders of a mineral Chardonnay—textured, cool, collected and crisp. Apples and white fruits are laced with delicious, refreshing acidity. Drink from 2014.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Branco Encruzado (Dão)

description: The Encruzado is Dão's own grape, rarely found outside this mountain region. Here, it has produced a smooth wine, with reminders of a mineral Chardonnay—textured, cool, collected and crisp. Apples and white fruits are laced with delicious, refreshing acidity. Drink from 2014.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Branco Encruzado (Dão)

description: A barrel-aged Alvarinho, but one that is so delicately toasty that the fruit is what this ripe generous wine is all about. It is rich with citrus and pear flavors, zesty and tangy while also having room for a round ripe aftertaste. This is an impressive wine, ready to drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a rich, powerful wine. It is dense, with dusty tannins and great swathes of ripe black fruits. The acidity, crisp and generous at the same time, is well integrated with the fruit. Its solid, firm texture promises aging. Drink this serious, concentrated wine from 2019.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2014 Quinta da Esperança Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This fine wine has firm tannins and a solid feel from serious wood aging. The toast and spice flavors merge with the black fruits, the dark plums and the rich texture of this ripe wine. It is still young, needing further aging to soften those tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Caves Aliança 2014 Aliança Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This fine wine has firm tannins and a solid feel from serious wood aging. The toast and spice flavors merge with the black fruits, the dark plums and the rich texture of this ripe wine. It is still young, needing further aging to soften those tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Caves Aliança 2014 Aliança Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Properly old gold in color, this is a wine from a single year, aged in casks. It's poised between amazing fruit and a wonderful velvet texture that is shot through with acidity. A feeling of lightness comes from the acidity that gives great freshness as well as complex flavors. It's ready to drink.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1964 Very Old Single Harvest  (Port)

description: Properly old gold in color, this is a wine from a single year, aged in casks. It's poised between amazing fruit and a wonderful velvet texture that is shot through with acidity. A feeling of lightness comes from the acidity that gives great freshness as well as complex flavors. It's ready to drink.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1964 Very Old Single Harvest  (Port)

description: This is the latest release of Portugal's most iconic wine. It's made only in selected years (the last vintage was 2000) from Ferreira's Quinta da Leda in the Douro Superior. This new vintage is superb. It's a richly tarry wine laden with dark plum fruits and tannins that are just beginning to mature. It's a ripe and luscious, demanding attention, yet will still age for many years. Drink now, or hold until 2020.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2004 Barca Velha Red (Douro)

description: This is drier than some 10-year-old Tawnys, showing a taste of wood, with acidity and the fig and raisin flavors behind the mature flavors. This is all suggests that much of the wine in the blend is older than 10 years, giving extra richness and depth of flavor.
title: Poças NV 10-years old Tawny  (Port)

description: A big, chunky wine, wearing its tannins easily over the ripe fruit. The wine has black berry juice flavors, bright acidity and a suggestion of aging potential.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2004 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine is fruity, rich and well structured, with tannins that are already integrated with the fruit. Juicy and fruity, it is going to be delicious as it develops. Drink from 2019.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This wine is fruity, rich and well structured, with tannins that are already integrated with the fruit. Juicy and fruity, it is going to be delicious as it develops. Drink from 2019.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this fruity wine is deliciously refreshing and crisp, with great acidity. It is bright with lemon acidity finished with pink grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This ripe, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is zesty and lightly spicy, with a warm, ripe character. The strawberry fruit is laced with acidity, allowing the smooth texture to shine. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz Rosé Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Dão)

description: This ripe, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is zesty and lightly spicy, with a warm, ripe character. The strawberry fruit is laced with acidity, allowing the smooth texture to shine. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz Rosé Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Dão)

description: This fruity wine bursts with the warmth of the Alentejo. It has a rich texture, black currant and berry fruits, and just the right amount of acidity. It is a good wine to drink young.
title: Global Wines 2015 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: The Guarda Rios, or kingfisher, lives in the vineyards that produce this wine, which is bright pink, strawberry flavored, attractively dry and crisp.
title: Vale d'Algares 2009 Guarda Rios Rosé (Tejo)

description: This aromatic wine, floral and ripe, is made from the Gouveio grape (known in Spain as Godello). The wine has a rich, yeasty character as well as crisp white fruits and acidity. It is finely balanced, ready to drink now.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2008 Brut Gouveio (Douro)

description: Port made from white grapes is a great cocktail base (think white Port and Tonic for a start) as well as a delicious drink in its own right. This wine, well poised between sweet and dry, is a rich golden color, with dried apricot and plenty of fresh citrus to give it a crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Borges NV Reserva Branco  (Port)

description: Port made from white grapes is a great cocktail base (think white Port and Tonic for a start) as well as a delicious drink in its own right. This wine, well poised between sweet and dry, is a rich golden color, with dried apricot and plenty of fresh citrus to give it a crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Borges NV Reserva Branco  (Port)

description: A spicy, perfumed blend of Encruzado with Malvasia and Gouveio, the wine comes from 35-year-old vines, simply fermented in stainless steel. It is ripe, packed with fruit and delicious to drink.
title: Vinha Paz 2016 White (Dão)

description: This dry rosé is soft and fruity. Red-berry fruit permeates a wine that also has a rich texture from lees aging giving the wine some weight. Its acidity balances all this, finishing the wine with crisp acidity.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Rosé (Douro)

description: Partly a blend of old vines in a field blend, this fruity wine with its tropical aromas and pink grapefruit and pineapple flavors is crisp and taut with a mineral texture. It is intense, the fruitiness given a firm shape by the tangy acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2016 Pôpa Branco White (Douro)

description: In a Bordeaux tradition, this is the second wine from this Douro quinta. Wood aging and ripe berry fruits have combined to make an accessible wine that's soft and open. It is made to be drunk young and is ready now.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Sino da Romaneira Red (Douro)

description: In a Bordeaux tradition, this is the second wine from this Douro quinta. Wood aging and ripe berry fruits have combined to make an accessible wine that's soft and open. It is made to be drunk young and is ready now.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Sino da Romaneira Red (Douro)

description: Open-tank fermentation gives this wine a ripe, jammy character that is balanced by the intense black fruits and acidity. Together they form a rich, structured, juicy and firm wine that is likely to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Open-tank fermentation gives this wine a ripe, jammy character that is balanced by the intense black fruits and acidity. Together they form a rich, structured, juicy and firm wine that is likely to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: With dense tannins and already generous and opulent fruit, this wine has great structure plus fine black-currant fruit and acidity. Its perfumes are balanced, with an elegant character. It should be ready to drink from 2026.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2015 VZ Vintage  (Port)

description: With dense tannins and already generous and opulent fruit, this wine has great structure plus fine black-currant fruit and acidity. Its perfumes are balanced, with an elegant character. It should be ready to drink from 2026.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2015 VZ Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine has richness, with fine tannins along with exuberant fruit. With its concentration and ripe berry flavors it has power as well as elegance. Juicy and packed with blackberry and damsons, it will be ready to drink from 2026.
title: Quevedo 2015 Quinta Vale d'Agodinho Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine comes from an estate in southern Alentejo. Aged for 14 months in mainly new barrels, it is rich in spice and toast that are balanced by great black fruits and generous tannins. This excellent wine is still aging; drink from 2019.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2014 Maladinha Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is packed with intense black-currant flavors. It is perfumed, ripe with a good tannic background. The density of the wine and the firm structure point to a long aging process. Drink this beautifully structured wine from 2026.
title: Dow's 2015 Quinta Senhora da Ribeira Vintage  (Port)

description: Oscar Quevedo, a new star of the Douro, has produced a stylish wine, suffused with tannins, fresh acidity, solid black fruits and a lively bright feel. It is ready to drink, but could age 3–4 years.
title: Quevedo 2008 Oscar's Red (Douro)

description: Honey and tropical fruit aromas open the nose, leading to the palate that is warm and ripe with pineapple and white peach fruit. The bright acidity lends a fresh and crisply fruity finish, with notes of citrus and apple.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Monte Mayor Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is ripe, almost too ripe, with its broad red fruits and soft tannins. The texture is smooth, with a burst of acidity. It's ready to drink now.
title: Adega Mayor 2007 Reserva do Comendador Red (Alentejano)

description: Floral and aromatic, this has a hint of prickle to go with the citrus, green apple and white peach flavors. There is an attractive mineral character—the wine dancing and fragrant.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Made from the Códega do Larinho grape (also called Síria), this is a refreshingly rich wine. It's full in the mouth yet it retains its natural freshness, with a touch of pepper, tangy acidity and great depth of flavor. The finish bears notes of citrus, pear and green apple.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Andreza Códega do Larinho Siria (Douro)

description: This is a really soft wine with the minimum of tannins and the lightest fruit. It has just a hint of crisp, clean red berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bons Ventos Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This wine, with its late release and maturity is aiming to show that Alvarinho can age. The verdict: Sometimes, but not this time. The wine is definitely old with a strong oxidative character and no sign of any fruit.
title: Howard's Folly 2012 Sonhador Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Pure Arinto from the Lisbon region, this wood-aged wine is delicious and Chardonnay-like in its richness, with great swathes of apples and cream flavors, layered with toast. This is a great advertisement for a neglected region in Portugal's viticulture.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Morgado Santa Catherina Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Fermented in wood and naturally spicy flavors, this is a ripe, honeyed wine. Apricots and pears give the fruit element to a wine that is toasty and crisp. Fruitiness predominates in the aftertaste.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Late Harvest Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a smooth, ripe wine with just enough tannin to give it structure. The main character is rich, full of black plums and blackberries—ripe and generous. It has a wonderful juicy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Great Bustard Red (Alentejano)

description: The Avesso grape is grown mainly in the south of Vinho Verde, in the warmer area nearer the Douro. Green plums and white peach flavors give this a ripe character while the citric edge adds the freshness. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: The Avesso grape is grown mainly in the south of Vinho Verde, in the warmer area nearer the Douro. Green plums and white peach flavors give this a ripe character while the citric edge adds the freshness. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: A dense wine that is structured and concentrated, it has black fruits and dusty tannins under juicy acidity. With hints of the wood aging and fine berry fruits, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Fiuza 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: A full-bodied, rich wine that combines extra juiciness with delicious red-berry fruits. It is structured while being immediately attractive. It's a great wine to go with pasta dishes.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)

description: A full-bodied, rich wine that combines extra juiciness with delicious red-berry fruits. It is structured while being immediately attractive. It's a great wine to go with pasta dishes.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)

description: Pears and red apples come through strongly in this light bodied, aromatic and fruity wine. It has almonds, fresh acidity and a bright character that is just softening out.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta do Alqueve Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: It's a ripe wood-aged wine, showing a full body, dark plum flavors and generous tannins. It is maturing well, giving plenty of ripe fruits along with spice and a solid tannic aftertaste.
title: Altas Quintas 2007 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Full of aromas of dark plums, bitter chocolate and a bit of spice, this is a powerful wine. It is warm, rich and juicy, with a fruity character that is balanced by dense, dusty tannins. For aging over 4–5 years.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2009 Private Collection Red (Alentejano)

description: Bottled in January 2012, this classic LBV has great perfumed fruit, soft and elegant. A blackberry jam flavor dominates, laced with black cherries and soft tannins. Immediately appealing and drinkable now.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Very rich, ripe wine, full and round in character. It has spice from wood aging as well as almost-sweet yellow fruits. Pineapple acidity does give some balance to this powerful white wine.
title: Herdade dos Grous 2010 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: An impressive wine that is packed with notes of rich fruit, toast and vanilla. It has weight to its apple, peach and intense spice flavors. The style is like a ripe Chardonnay, just with extra acidity. Ready to drink, but could age for another year.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2008 Falcoaria Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: An impressive wine that is packed with notes of rich fruit, toast and vanilla. It has weight to its apple, peach and intense spice flavors. The style is like a ripe Chardonnay, just with extra acidity. Ready to drink, but could age for another year.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2008 Falcoaria Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a minty, aromatic Syrah, with tannins that are laced with violet and blackberry flavors. It's finely structured, and shows a spice charcter from the fruit that combines easily with the wood toast. Age for 4 years.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2008 Grande Escolha Syrah (Tejo)

description: From old vines, this is a wine of great structure and depth. Serious tannins and dark fruits give a dense, brooding character. This solid, powerful and mineral-driven wine is still young, still coming together. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2012 Passadouro Red (Douro)

description: This rich, oak-aged wine is so smooth with yellow fruits, with just an edge of citrus and spicy, toasty character. It's a beautiful, generous wine, opulent in its ripe fruit while keeping a cool, salty character. The wine is still young, needing to bring out even further flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2013 Branco White (Beira Atlantico)

description: This is a strongly tannic, obviously wood-aged wine. The black fruits are paralleled by the new-wood toastiness, which gives a vanilla flavor. With top Portuguese consultant Anselmo Mendes involved, the wine has style as well as weight and dense fruit. Give it several years to mature. Drink from 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2011 Dory Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Made from dense, rich, perfumed Baga, this is a structured wine. Layers of wood aging and strong tannins give a dark, brooding character. The wine is balanced and almost ready to drink, but is always likely to be firm and dry. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Monte Cascas Vinhas das Cardosas Baga (Bairrada)

description: From selected grapes, this concentrated wine is dense and still needs aging. It has layers of wood over dark, brooding black fruits and a powerful structure of smoky toast and tannins. Big, rich and with great potential, it should be drunk from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is structured and tannic which gives a dry edge that balances the perfumed black fruits and acidity. The aftertaste is fruity and juicy. Ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Syrah (Península de Setúbal)

description: The wine is structured and tannic which gives a dry edge that balances the perfumed black fruits and acidity. The aftertaste is fruity and juicy. Ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Syrah (Península de Setúbal)

description: Named after an old parcel of vines on the estate, the wine is ripe, and flavored with black currant and red berry. Its tannic character and tight line of acidity gives it a crisp and fruity finish. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Noval 2013 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

description: Named after an old parcel of vines on the estate, the wine is ripe, and flavored with black currant and red berry. Its tannic character and tight line of acidity gives it a crisp and fruity finish. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Noval 2013 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

description: Possibly too much wood has been used in maturing this wine, which results in a toasty, burnt character to the otherwise ripe fruit. At four years, the wood should have mellowed.
title: Quinta das Marias 2012 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: The wine is smooth, soft and juicy. It has a fine balance, ripe with berry fruits and light with acidity and a easy-going texture. The oak aging has served to smooth any tannins, leaving a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Espiga Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is smooth, soft and juicy. It has a fine balance, ripe with berry fruits and light with acidity and a easy-going texture. The oak aging has served to smooth any tannins, leaving a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Espiga Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This wood-aged wine shows dark berry fruits and a dusty structure. That goes with the juicy fruitiness that is perfumed, fresh and spicy. The wine has a stalky aftertaste with plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cabra Cega Red (Lisboa)

description: A young and fruity wine that is soft with gentle tannins and juicy black currant fruit flavors. It is ripe, fresh and balanced with generous acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: A blend of two really local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is a fresh, mineral and citrus driven wine. It is so light and crisp with acidity that shoots though the wine. From high altitude vineyards, it has a refreshing, cool aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)

description: The blend of local Douro white grapes gives a soft wine that has a fine streak of freshness. Citrus is balanced with white peach and shot through with mineral acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Rede Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: There is some of the freshness of the ocean climate in this cool, red fruited wine. It has a fine structure, juicy red berry flavors and fresh, lifted acidity. It's a wine to drink now for its fruitiness and fresh character.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)

description: This fruity young wine has a ripe spring in its step. It has red-berry fruitiness as well as sweeter candied fruits balanced by an edge of spirit and acidity. This is an easy style of Port, ready to drink at any time.
title: Borges NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

description: Firmly tannic, this wine is richly endowed with a solid structure and also with bold black fruits. It comes from the producer's main Douro vineyard. Concentrated and ripe, it will age and should be drunk from 2018.
title: Borges 2015 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: Named after a traditional Portuguese dance, the wine is full of red fruits, soft tannins with a rich texture. It is made to be drunk young, its red berry and red-currant fruits well integrated into the structure and acidity. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Part of a series highlighting the principal varieties of the Douro, this wine is made from the grape that is known as Tempranillo in Spain. It is structured and dense, with red-berry fruits and the beginnings of the smooth texture more familiar with the grape. The mineral texture and acidity give further complexity. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Part of a series highlighting the principal varieties of the Douro, this wine is made from the grape that is known as Tempranillo in Spain. It is structured and dense, with red-berry fruits and the beginnings of the smooth texture more familiar with the grape. The mineral texture and acidity give further complexity. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: This densely structured, finely crafted wine is the latest vintage from one of the Douro's iconic brands. It has great weight and, at the same time, elegant fruits and structure that offer good aging potential. It could be drunk now, but best to wait until 2016.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: Called 2 Worlds because of the two different vineyards that go into the blend, this is a structured, firm wine. It has a fine balance between the acidity, the tannins and the black currant fruit. With its texture and dry core, it needs time, so drink after 2015.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2009 2 Worlds Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a firmly structured, dark wine. It has black cherry and berry fruit, a solid core of tannins and tight acidity. With its dense character, there is every chance of this impressive wine aging well, yielding a more rounded wine. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Vega Red (Douro)

description: The full juiciness of Castelão is balanced by spice and structure from wood maturation. The result is a smooth, textured wine, firm with tannins for aging. It is rich, smoky, dry and edgy at this young stage. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: Full-bodied and smooth, this wine has weight, richness and a dense, rounded texture. There's some good juiciness as well, adding dark berry fruits to the soft tannins and rounded feel of the wine. Acidity at the end brings a sense of balance. Drink from 2014.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Full-bodied and ripe, this is a rich, generous wine that shows complexity as well as subtle fruitiness. A blend of Viosinho and Verdelho, it's full of tropical fruit flavors, with ample weight and concentration. Spicy accents, a dense texture and a fine, long-lasting finish are all part of this stylish wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: From old vines, this is the estate wine of Carvalhas. Black in color, it is hugely rich, dense and brooding. The wine is still young, pushed forward by tannins as much as fruit and packed with a concentrated structure. Spice at the end and a dry aftertaste need time to soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Carvalhas Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: Powerful and tannic, this is a brooding wine that will need many years aging. It is powered by its dry core, with the structured red plum skin flavors adding to the sense of concentration. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Dona Isabel Juliana Red (Tejo)

description: Since we last reviewed a vintage of Romaneira, with the 2005 wine, the estate has moved closer to realizing its potential. This is an impressive, powerful yet elegant wine. Its dark fruits are sustained by wood and leavened by acidity. It has a great sense of style and considerable aging potential.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2008 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A new release from the joint venture between Quinta de la Rosa and winemaker Jorge Moreira, this is a beautiful wood-aged wine, with delicious tropical fruits as well as a tense young structure. It has fine acidity that cuts through the rich fruitiness and the tangy texture. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2014 Passagem Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: Powerful tannins are still at work in this structured and dense wine. Produced from grapes that were foot trodden in open fermenters, this wine shows considerable richness and dark plum and damson flavors. Spice and licorice add depth, while ample acidity and the firm texture suggests a considerable future. The wine comes from the Foz Vineyard at the mouth of the Pinhão river in the heart of the Douro. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Foz 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Wood aged, this has rich, perfumed and rounded fruits that give a beautiful, creamy texture. There is a light tang of acidity as well to give freshness. Still young, this fine wine should be drunk from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Ribeiro Santo Vinha da Neve White (Dão)

description: This is a serious, concentrated wine. Still young, with dark tannins to go with the dark fruit, it was fermented in open tanks, a process that gives the wine extra richness. It has hints of the wood aging behind the ripe fruit and final acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Fonseca uses its Guimaraens brand in years when there is no general vintage declaration. Even so, the wine has all the broad, ripe and generous character that is so typical of Fonseca. It is packed with rich black fruits that are enveloped by the structured tannins and never-too-sweet character. It obviously needs to age; drink from 2025.
title: Fonseca 2013 Guimaraens Vintage  (Port)

description: Fonseca uses its Guimaraens brand in years when there is no general vintage declaration. Even so, the wine has all the broad, ripe and generous character that is so typical of Fonseca. It is packed with rich black fruits that are enveloped by the structured tannins and never-too-sweet character. It obviously needs to age; drink from 2025.
title: Fonseca 2013 Guimaraens Vintage  (Port)

description: Produced from a single parcel in the family vineyard, this wine shows concentration and density. It has a tense structure that is softened by wood aging, resulting in a fine balance between the natural fresh acidity of the fruit and a smooth character. Abundant in ripe yellow and citrus fruits, this is ready to drink now.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2012 Parcella Unica Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Produced from old vines, this big and rounded wine has dark, dusty tannins that come from the concentrated fruit flavors as much as the wood. It comes from a producer whose main quinta, São Bernardo, was created in 1912. It is a dense, brooding wine that shows great weight and power. Black plum, dark berries and intense acidity are there in richness and profusion. Drink from 2018.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2009 Encosta do Bocho Grand Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Baga and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a powerful wine. Densely tannic and firmly dry, it is also rich and structured. The acidity from the black currant fruitiness shows strongly. It is not a shy wine, all guns blazing. It is a shame about the heavy bottle. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2011 2221 Terroir de Cantanhede Red (Bairrada)

description: Dominated by the local Castelão grape, this easy-drinking, fruity wine has soft tannins, attractive acidity and blackberry fruit. Juicy and soft, this is a classic barbecue wine.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 Periquita Original Red (Setubal)

description: This is floral and aromatic, bearing soft, ripe yellow fruit, attractive acidity and a soft, rounded texture. A shaft of citric acidity cuts through the palate, making the wine feel lively and refreshing.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Caiado White (Alentejano)

description: Attractive and herbaceous, this has an apple flavor that's laced with a citrus note. Fresh and crisp, it's fruity, forward and can be consumed now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: A richly ripe wine, full of tarry, dark tannins and black fruits. Despite its weight and density, it is well balanced, the dark flavors opening out with flavors of licorice, bitter chocolate and spicy wood.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2005 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: A dark, brooding wine, packed with black fruits that are dominated by dry tannins. This is still young, but the dense blackberry fruit flavors are all here. Its weight and power need time to tame, but for now, the acidity and fruit are impressive.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2004 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A dark, brooding wine, packed with black fruits that are dominated by dry tannins. This is still young, but the dense blackberry fruit flavors are all here. Its weight and power need time to tame, but for now, the acidity and fruit are impressive.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2004 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: The flagship wine from Alorna is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, the two grapes melding well into a rich, harmonious whole. Flavors of spice, black figs and dark plum skin tannins are smoothed by 12 months wood aging. There is an edge of youth, which suggests good aging potential.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2004 Reserva Red (Ribatejano)

description: Herbaceous and richly crisp, its acidity is tangy with mineral undertones and bright green- and white-fruit flavors. This is delicious and fruity, with a great final zing.
title: Duorum 2011 Tons de Duorum Branco White (Douro)

description: Sweet fruit, coupled with a core of firm tannins form a wine that is dense and juicy. It has fine layers of acidity, with black plum and chocolate flavors and a finish that's smooth yet still firm.
title: Parras Vinhos 2010 Casa Brancas Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is a blend of Aragonez with Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Firm and rich while maintaining fresh fruit flavors, this is a solid, intense and stylish wine. The palate balances red-berry fruits with a core of dry tannins laced with acidity. Keep this wine for another year.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada Red (Tejo)

description: A rounded wine with spiced pear and citrus fruits, this is juicy and full bodied. A touch of textured minerality gives a sense of structure. It's still young and needs aging. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: A rounded wine with spiced pear and citrus fruits, this is juicy and full bodied. A touch of textured minerality gives a sense of structure. It's still young and needs aging. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: The cooperative of Reguengos is now a major force in the region. This wine, named after the hilltop town of Reguengos, is a powerful, condensed wine. It has dark black fruits, solid tannins and a smooth texture. Full-bodied and worth aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2012 Reguengos Red (Alentejo)

description: This is an impressively rich wine, packed with dark black fruits and solid tannins. While it certainly has power it also has a sense of style with the acidity and the concentration well contained. Drink from 2017.
title: Lobo 2014 Selecção Syrah-Touriga Nacional Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: As befits a reserve wine, this blend was aged in wood for six months. That has given a ripe lightly toasty character to the wine along with its cool crispness that reveals its origin in the mountainous northern Alentejo. The wine is fruity with lemon and melon over the wood. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named after the grandfather of the present Reynolds, this oak-aged bend of Alicante Bouschet, Trincadeira and Syrah is firm and solid. It has perfumed black fruits, generous tannins and a concentrated structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Julian Reynolds 2011 Carlos Reynolds Red (Alentejano)

description: Perfumed wood aromas lead to tarry tannins and flavors of chocolate and coffee. The black fruit comes later, bringing a richer edge to this structured wine. Wood aging gives the burnt-toast character to this wine that is still firm and dense. Drink from 2016.
title: Julian Reynolds 2008 Reynolds Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Perfumed wood aromas lead to tarry tannins and flavors of chocolate and coffee. The black fruit comes later, bringing a richer edge to this structured wine. Wood aging gives the burnt-toast character to this wine that is still firm and dense. Drink from 2016.
title: Julian Reynolds 2008 Reynolds Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Dark, brooding and still tough, this powerful wine has layers of spice, black plum skins and dense tannins. Wood aging has added further tannins to this already dry and tough wine. Give it at least two years and drink from 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Vila Santa Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Touriga Nacional is even more at home in the Dão than it is in the Douro. Here it gives an initially austere wine, very mineral and textured. There is fruit there, juicy black currants, red berries balanced by dark tannins and condensed acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Adega de Penalva 2009 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Made from 100% Touriga Nacional grapes, this wine is very perfumed and fruity while also structured. It is still young, showing its tannins and acidity as much as its berry fruits. It is not for long-term aging, so drink from 2015.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: Made from 100% Touriga Nacional grapes, this wine is very perfumed and fruity while also structured. It is still young, showing its tannins and acidity as much as its berry fruits. It is not for long-term aging, so drink from 2015.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A solid, ripe, fruity wine, rich in tannins that blend well into the texture. Black plum skins, damsons and berry fruit are all present, revealing the natural freshness of the vintage as well as great potential. A wine with a long life.
title: Cálem 2011  Port

description: Big, bold and fruity, this wine shows richness, opulence and swathes of black plum fruit that cushions the structure. Powerful and fruity now, with long aging potential shown by the ample tannins and acid.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This shows very sweet fruit that's ripe, dense and already delicious. That doesn't mean the tannins don't bring out the firmness at the core of this powerful wine. It is integrated, packed with black plum flavors, and full bodied. For long-term aging.
title: Croft 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Smooth and rich, concentrated and dense. Dusty tannins power the dark fruit and sweet texture. Black plums and acidity match the dry, tannic structure.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A densely tannic wine, firm at the center and richly fruity on the outside. It is concentrated, with acidity shooting through the jammy black fruit. It's a finely structured wine, likely to age well, but showing its rich side already.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Estate Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Violet perfume, sweet fruit and a rich character make this wine immediately appealing. Delve into it and the tannins emerge, powerful in character. Berries and sweet, ripe plums complete this serious, impressive wine.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2011 Quinta da Eira Velha Vintage  (Port)

description: Violet perfume, sweet fruit and a rich character make this wine immediately appealing. Delve into it and the tannins emerge, powerful in character. Berries and sweet, ripe plums complete this serious, impressive wine.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2011 Quinta da Eira Velha Vintage  (Port)

description: Fruit and acidity dominate the initial impression. The wine certainly has power and richness, as it's full in the mouth, juicy and fruity. In the background, there is a darker element, solid and dense, promising long-term aging.
title: Niepoort 2011  Port

description: Fruit and acidity dominate the initial impression. The wine certainly has power and richness, as it's full in the mouth, juicy and fruity. In the background, there is a darker element, solid and dense, promising long-term aging.
title: Niepoort 2011  Port

description: Tannic and concentrated, this is a powerful wine from its first moment. Ripe perfumes confirm the wine's richness, while acidity and density show strongly. Power and concentration match big berry fruit and finishing acidity.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Distinctive Vintage  (Port)

description: This delicately perfumed wine opens to reveal power combined with elegance. The wine has great ripeness—a soft texture on the surface masking the severe tannins at the center.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This delicately perfumed wine opens to reveal power combined with elegance. The wine has great ripeness—a soft texture on the surface masking the severe tannins at the center.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A hugely dense wine, with immense ripe black fruit and dusty tannins. The wine is balanced, rich and structured at the same time. Powered by a dark core, the wine has weight, intensity and a solid long-term future.
title: Barão de Vilar 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a very dry, firm wine that's solidly tannic but never harsh. The wine combines weight and ripe black fruit in a powerful expression of dense vintage Port from this estate in the Upper Douro. Acidity shines through the density on the finish. Age for many decades.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a very dry, firm wine that's solidly tannic but never harsh. The wine combines weight and ripe black fruit in a powerful expression of dense vintage Port from this estate in the Upper Douro. Acidity shines through the density on the finish. Age for many decades.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A powerful, concentrated wine, full of dark tannins, ripe fruit and rich texture. This is a wine based on a solid structure—very firm in character while still allowing the gorgeous fruits to express themselves. It's obviously destined for long-term aging.
title: Quinta do Noval 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A powerful, concentrated wine, full of dark tannins, ripe fruit and rich texture. This is a wine based on a solid structure—very firm in character while still allowing the gorgeous fruits to express themselves. It's obviously destined for long-term aging.
title: Quinta do Noval 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A powerfully dense wine, solidly based on dry tannins and rich black fruit. Structure, fruit and acidity all come together in a wine that shows immense potential as well as a softer side now.
title: Dow's 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Red and black berries bring out the richness of the year, masking the seriously tannic structure. The wine has great spice, richness and a dark, smoky core of powerful tannins. For long-term aging, but delicious now.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: From a region well-known for its sparkling wines, this is a fruity wine with soft acidity and a ripe apple character. It has a light mousse, creamy rather than crisp. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2009 Grande Cuvée Chardonnay-Arinto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
title: Borges NV Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: With 12 months of oak aging, this is a ripe smoothly textured wine. It has black fruits, rich tannins and a jammy, generous texture. The wine is fruity and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: With 12 months of oak aging, this is a ripe smoothly textured wine. It has black fruits, rich tannins and a jammy, generous texture. The wine is fruity and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a soft wine, attractively fruity with gentle tannins. It is fresh with red berry fruits and open acidity. There is a burnt edge at the end which needs to blow off. Drink from 2015.
title: Vidigal 2011 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Green plums and ripe apples bring out the best in Arinto's range of flavors. This is a soft wine, with light acidity that's well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This is a young yeasty and nutty-flavored wine from the Bairrada region, home to many sparkling wines. It is crisp, with some apple fruitiness, and ready to drink. The acidity keeps it in shape.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto
title: Global Wines NV Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: One of the most familiar Vinho Verde brands in Portugal, this wine is medium sweet with a light prickle on the tongue. It is fruity with creamed apple and citrus along with a touch of honey. The wine is crisp and clean, delicious to drink as an apéritif.
title: Borges NV Gatão White (Vinho Verde)

description: One of the most familiar Vinho Verde brands in Portugal, this wine is medium sweet with a light prickle on the tongue. It is fruity with creamed apple and citrus along with a touch of honey. The wine is crisp and clean, delicious to drink as an apéritif.
title: Borges NV Gatão White (Vinho Verde)

description: Perfumed and lightly spicy, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the tropical fruit side of the grape. With its rich fruit and soft citrus, it is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Sauvignon Blanc (Península de Setúbal)

description: Perfumed and lightly spicy, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the tropical fruit side of the grape. With its rich fruit and soft citrus, it is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Sauvignon Blanc (Península de Setúbal)

description: A ripe blend of fresh apple and lemon fruits give this wine is crisp, dry character. It is packed with acidity, orange and lemon zest and has a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Vines in the southern Amarante region of Vinho Verde give this wine its ripe melon and apple flavors. It is tangy, bright with ripe fruit and with a lightly mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Portal da Calçada Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe wine that is soft and fruity, this is juicy and with fine acidity. The quinta, situated at the western end of the Douro region, has produced a wine with light tannins and which has fine, ready to drink fruitiness.
title: Messias 2013 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: A ripe wine that is soft and fruity, this is juicy and with fine acidity. The quinta, situated at the western end of the Douro region, has produced a wine with light tannins and which has fine, ready to drink fruitiness.
title: Messias 2013 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from Fernão Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from Fernão Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: This smooth, wood-aged wine is ripe with red fruits, soft tannins and a generous, full-bodied character. The acidity keeps the wine in shape, round and ready to drink.
title: Falua 2014 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: The wine is rich and dense. It has plenty of black fruits although it does suffer from some bitter extraction notes. There is power here, with high toast flavors and a dark, spicy character. The final taste of pepper comes from the high alcohol percentage.
title: Maçanita Vinhos 2012 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The wine is rich and dense. It has plenty of black fruits although it does suffer from some bitter extraction notes. There is power here, with high toast flavors and a dark, spicy character. The final taste of pepper comes from the high alcohol percentage.
title: Maçanita Vinhos 2012 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe wine that is all fruit. Red berries and crisp acidity come together in a texture that is gently tannic and very ready to drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe wine that is all fruit. Red berries and crisp acidity come together in a texture that is gently tannic and very ready to drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: To the blend of local Aragonez and Trincadeira, the producer has added the Dão's Alfrocheiro. That gives a ripe and attractively perfumed wine. It is soft and juicy, full of rich berry fruits and with a generous, warm texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Audaz Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is rich, with an attractive acidity to go with the citrus and green-fruit flavors. A delicious tang gives lemon and orange-zest flavors and some minerality. Drink from mid-2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Branco Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: This gently wood-aged wine has spice and toast flavors over ripe mango and guava that are cut with a tight band of citrus. The wine is rich and full, finishing with just a lift of acidity.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This rich wine still shows its wood-aging character. It has firm tannins, dark fruit and concentration. From vineyards in the Douro Superior, this wine should be drunk from 2018.
title: Douro Prime 2010 Inquieto Tinto Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This yeasty wine is bone-dry, mature and ready to drink, a toasty element having replaced any fruitiness. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Brut Nature Reserva Arinto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A typical Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca, this wine is all about bright, crisp fruit. Black and red currant flavors come with tight acidity and a juicy character. Tightly wound now, it needs a few more months to calm down. Drink from 2018.
title: Alves de Sousa 2014 Caldas Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft, creamy wine with fruitiness and a yeasty edge. Made from Bical, Arinto and Maria Gomes, it's ready to drink.
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Blanc de Blancs Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe and creamy wine. It has light acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors and a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Arinto-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe and creamy wine. It has light acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors and a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Arinto-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: With the lightest, freshest tingle on the tongue, this is an off-dry wine that is crisp and fresh, combining citrus with sweetness. It is light-bodied, bright and ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Encostas do Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a simple, fruity wine that has ripe black fruits and soft tannins. Made for early drinking, it is aromatic, juicy with a spicy aftertaste.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Topázio Red (Douro)

description: The family vineyards of consultant Anselmo Mendes are in the north of the Vinho Verde region the home of Alvarinho, so it's no surprise that this wine is a great interpetation of the grape. It is almost luscious in its intensity and richness. Orange, ripe apple and intense citrus flavors are encased in a generous, full-bodied wine. Drink now, although this wine will be even better from 2017.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2015 Muros Antigos Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A selection of old vines has given an intensely structured wine. It is packed both with tannins and concentrated black fruits. The density of the ripe fruits show how well the wine is maturing. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Scancio Private Selection Vinhas Velhas Red (Lisboa)

description: Surprisingly tannic, this juicy wine shows intense structure and a smoky character from wood aging. It feels as though the tannins and extract have smothered the natural fruitiness of the wine. It will need time to come round, so wait until 2017.
title: Casal do Conde 2011 Terras do Vale Colheita Seleccionada Merlot (Tejo)

description: A rich and fruity blend with swathes of ripe red berry fruits that are smoothed out by the soft wood and tannin flavors. Acidity freshens the ripeness. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta dos Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: A rich and fruity blend with swathes of ripe red berry fruits that are smoothed out by the soft wood and tannin flavors. Acidity freshens the ripeness. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta dos Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: A ripe wine dominated by tropical pineapple and fresh peach. This warm, lively and fruity wine can be drunk in 2014.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: As always, Loios is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink young. With peach, grapefruit and red apple flavors, it's a soft wine with a crisp streak. It is ready to drink now and will be better at the end of 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: As always, Loios is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink young. With peach, grapefruit and red apple flavors, it's a soft wine with a crisp streak. It is ready to drink now and will be better at the end of 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A smooth, ripe, juicy wine, with vanilla flavors from wood aging and fresh berry fruits as companions. The wine is soft, gently tannic and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2013 Vale de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, it is full of bright red fruits, very soft tannins and juicy acidity. It's just the wine for drinking young, so drink this summer through 2015.
title: Moura Basto 2013 Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, it is full of bright red fruits, very soft tannins and juicy acidity. It's just the wine for drinking young, so drink this summer through 2015.
title: Moura Basto 2013 Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Young and fresh with an attractive prickle on the tongue, this medium-sweet Vinho Verde is well cut with acidity. Accented with apple and citrus, it is bright and ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: FVine 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a light, fruity, fresh and clean wine. With lemon and crisp apple flavors, it is bright, simple, attractive and ready to drink.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Dão)

description: Named after the rare Douro golden oriole bird (which obviously likes to eat figs), this is a bright, fruity wine with light tannins that give it a delicious fresh, red fruit character. It has a smoky edge from wood aging, finely balanced and ready to drink now.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2014 Papa Figos Red (Douro)

description: A rich interpretation of the Castelão grape, the wine is opulent and generous. It has juicy black fruits that are lifted by acidity. The slight tannins are far in the background of this wine that will be ready to drink by the end of 2016.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Castelão (Lisboa)

description: A rich interpretation of the Castelão grape, the wine is opulent and generous. It has juicy black fruits that are lifted by acidity. The slight tannins are far in the background of this wine that will be ready to drink by the end of 2016.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Castelão (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura from vineyards in the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is rich, aromatic, creamy. It has the right prickle in the mouth, with a final lemon peel character.
title: Provam 2010 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: Aragonez, aka Tempranillo, is the Tinta Roriz of the Alentejo—just to make things simple. Whatever the name, the smooth, rich character of this wine is characteristic of the grape. It has weight, ripe damson fruit and a core of powerful tannins. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Cortes de Cima 2009 Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: Produced from old vines on schist soils, this is an intensely structured wine. While it has power, it is the texture and the firm fruit that give it character. Black fruits combine with dark tannins to create a dry, solid aftertaste.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2007 Montes Claros Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: A big, sweet, fruity wine, with ripe tannins, mint and chocolate flavors from the wood aging. It is rounded, polished, full of black plums, spice and finishing with balanced acidity. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Evel Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This relies on its ripe fruit to convey the rich flavors of the Douro. Its black fruit flavors dominate the broad tannic structure, with a light hint of wood aging. It's bold, chunky and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This relies on its ripe fruit to convey the rich flavors of the Douro. Its black fruit flavors dominate the broad tannic structure, with a light hint of wood aging. It's bold, chunky and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Soft and herbaceous, this is a warm wine, its acidity leading to apricot and pineapple flavors. The apple skin texture and the tangy final acidity make it crisp.
title: Quevedo 2011 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: Full and ripe, this balances round pear and peach flavors with intense acidity. It is a beautifully fruity wine, one that also has a sense of structure and a fine, elegant texture.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Colecção Privada Verdelho (Setubal)

description: This full-bodied selection hails from the same region as Vinho Verde, offering creamy apricot and ripe white-fruit notes. It has great depth of flavor, with toast and spice tones as well as fragrant acidity.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Minho)

description: Smooth, soft and powerfully rounded, this is made from concentrated grapes grown in the hot eastern Alentejo. Flavors of spice, black plum and rich damson jelly abound. The tannins and acids provide a gentle thrust at the end.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: Smooth, soft and powerfully rounded, this is made from concentrated grapes grown in the hot eastern Alentejo. Flavors of spice, black plum and rich damson jelly abound. The tannins and acids provide a gentle thrust at the end.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: This smooth, rounded wine has touches of wood aging, along with a herbaceous character just now beginning to soften and fill out. It has a light touch of spice along with apple and tangerine notes. Ready to drink.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2010 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: Lightly spicy aromas give this an exotic feel. At the same time, there is plenty of crisp, citrusy acidity, along with a rounded melon texture. The wine is full-bodied, concentrated and will be ready to drink in six months.
title: Terra d'Alter 2011 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: This is a creamy, intensely fruit wine, with lime and tropical fruit flavors, merely hinting at a minerally structure. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
title: Terra d'Alter 2011 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: The aristocratic estate of Santar produces some of the most elegant wines in the Dão. The 2009 vintage adds richness to a deep, complex and powerful wine, which is full of dark plum and damson flavors, rounded by wood aging. Age for 3–4 years.
designation: Casa de Santar Conde de Santar
title: Dão Sul 2009 Casa de Santar Conde de Santar Red (Dão)

description: Still an icon of Douro reds, this is marked by elegance. The fruit blends effortlessly with the acid-laced, firm tannins. It has fine potential for aging over at least five years.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2009 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: This is a shade off-dry, with ample crispness, a bright, prickly lightness and delicate texture. It's a great apéritif style, with its soft edge and easygoing freshness, that's ready to drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Vilacetinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright and fresh, this is a delicate rosé, showing both fruitiness and some structure. Strawberry dusted with pepper lends a spicy berry character throughout. It's not for aging, so drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Casa da Passarella O Brazileiro Rosé (Dão)

description: A dark colored red that is firmly tannic as well as ripe and fruity. The wine is spicy and earthy, redolent of dried fruits, like figs and red berries. With its solid texture, it can age; drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: A full and rich wine, almost too powerful and concentrated. It has great solid tannins, dark plum and chocolate flavors and a dense texture. It does need aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2011 Alente Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Alvarinho is best from the far north of Vinho Verde, which is the source for this wine. It gives a full, rich, very ripe wine that's rounded and packed with yellow fruits and a tight mineral and lemon juice character. The wine also has youth on its side and could age for several more years. Drink from 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Senhora da Convento's late release of its Ports has paid off with this impressively ripe, mature wine. It has the feel of a vintage wine with its depth of black flavors, spice, dried fruits and balance. Drink now.
title: Senhora do Convento 1996 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Green plums, freshly sliced melon and some pineapple all come together in this fruit-salad-fresh wine. It is ripe, but retains plenty of crispness, a light structure of orange zest giving shape and piquancy.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)

description: This firm wine shows fresh, compacted fruits and vivid acidity. Its tight tannins suggest aging potential, while the black plum juice and blueberry fruit flavors make it attractive now. Layers of smoky toast show through on the finish.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Berço do Infante Red (Estremadura)

description: This is a perfumed wine that has just pure berry fruits, red plums and spice from tannins. There's no wood aging here, but the wine succeeds because of its delicious ripe fruits and balancing sweet acidity.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: A rich wood-aged wine, this is dense and creamy. With acidity and toast, ripe apples as well as spice, the wine is made to age. Coming from the Alvarinho heartland of Melgaço on Portugal's northern border, the wine has minerality and great intensity. It will be good until at least 2020.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This rich wine is made from old vines in a field blend. With its intense acidity and ripe apple fruitiness, the wine is full and concentrated. The spice and toastiness are at peace with the fruit, giving a balanced wine that will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Lacrau Old Vines White (Douro)

description: This is an impressive concentrated wine. Now with a couple of years of aging, it has lost its baby acidity and developed a leaner more structured character. That goes with the apple and citrus fruitiness to give the wine a balanced mature character. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Terra Matter Alvarinho (Minho)

description: From Passadouro's old vines, this is serious, complex wine. Its fruit is an integral part of the dark tannic structure, adding to the gentle power. It has spice as well as juicy fruit, wood and, on the finish, sweet fruit flavors.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2008 Passadouro Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Big, powerful wine that is restrained by its ripe, dusty tannins. It is concentrated, with an almost Port-like texture, a result of the open lagars in which it is fermented. The fruit is likely to be rich and opulent as the tannins move into balance.
title: Wine & Soul 2008 Pintas Red (Douro)

description: Big, powerful wine that is restrained by its ripe, dusty tannins. It is concentrated, with an almost Port-like texture, a result of the open lagars in which it is fermented. The fruit is likely to be rich and opulent as the tannins move into balance.
title: Wine & Soul 2008 Pintas Red (Douro)

description: The wine is spicy, fruity with soft tannins and plenty of ripe red berries. Its dry core gives it shape along with a firm anchor for the generous fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Canoa Red (Lisboa)

description: This attractively fruity wine is crisp and full of red currants. Its acidity and soft caramel flavor are nicely blended with the touch of tannin and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Vinho Rosé (Tejo)

description: A fruity blend of four local Alentejo grapes, this wine is soft and smoothly rich with fine acidity and a mix of yellow fruit and apple flavors. It has plenty of crisp acidity to bring out a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A fruity blend of four local Alentejo grapes, this wine is soft and smoothly rich with fine acidity and a mix of yellow fruit and apple flavors. It has plenty of crisp acidity to bring out a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The two white grapes of the coastal Bairrada region in central Portugal are blended to give a ripe, crisp and creamy wine. Fragrant Maria Gomes is known as Fernão Pires in other parts of Portugal. Its acidity fits perfectly into this smooth textured wine that is ready to drink.
title: Caves Aliança 2016 Aliança Reserva White (Bairrada)

description: The oak aging is what makes this wine. It brings out the black fruits and juicy acidity as well as adding toast and vanilla flavors. The result is a wine that is smooth, balanced, full of fruit and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Tarambola Red (Lisboa)

description: Ripe, spicy and full both of ripe fruits and tannins, this is a full-bodied wine that brings out the minerality and structure of a Douro wine. It has plenty of red fruits to balance these tannins, resolving into the wine that is firm but ready to drink.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Premium Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, spicy and full both of ripe fruits and tannins, this is a full-bodied wine that brings out the minerality and structure of a Douro wine. It has plenty of red fruits to balance these tannins, resolving into the wine that is firm but ready to drink.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Premium Red (Douro)

description: This attractive, spicy and fruity wine brings out the warmth of the Alentejo while also keeping crispness and black-currant acidity. It is smooth, rich and very ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Rotas de Portugal Red (Alentejano)

description: A caramel aroma is followed by sweet strawberry fruit from the Touriga Nacional, lending a wine that is freshly fruity and soft.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Mouthfilling and round, without any sharp edges, but this wine remains extremely firm and dense, with several decades of life ahead of it. Dried fig, chocolate and black licorice flavors only hint at what lies ahead.
title: Dow's 1997 Vintage  (Port)

description: Mouthfilling and round, without any sharp edges, but this wine remains extremely firm and dense, with several decades of life ahead of it. Dried fig, chocolate and black licorice flavors only hint at what lies ahead.
title: Dow's 1997 Vintage  (Port)

description: A powerhouse of a wine that goes from densely rich to massive without a pause. The ripe fruit, the dark, heavy tannins, the black plum and fig flavors, all come from the terroir of this great vineyard.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2004 Vintage  (Port)

description: In the Fonseca tradition, this is a hugely rich wine, very dense. It is not all weight, with excellently integrated firm tannins and a range of complex flavors, from nuts and berry fruits to full frontal ripeness. There is some dryness to finish.
title: Fonseca 2004 Quinta do Panascal Vintage  (Port)

description: Perfectly mature, this Port's tannins have softened over the past 40-plus years, leaving it lushly textured and displaying rich fig and chocolate flavors. Finishes long, picking up a touch of almond to go with the fig, flavors Symington calls “Dow's hallmarks.” Drink now–2015, longer if you prefer very mature wines.
title: Dow's 1963 Vintage  (Port)

description: Dry and stalky, this wine from the eastern Alentejo is structured and firm. It has ripe black fruit flavors along with acidity, both of them dominated by tannins from the fruit. The wine needs to age; drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Santos Jorge Red (Alentejo)

description: This big, bold wine blends local grapes with Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional. It has red fruits and rounded tannins that are well integrated with the fruitiness. Full in the mouth and with delicious acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Herdade das Servas 2013 Monte das Servas Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: This big, bold and fruity wine highlights the juicy quality of ripe Castelão. The tannins are just there, forming the base for the ripe red fruits and warm structure. It could do with just a few more months, so drink from late 2015.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Eximius Red (Lisboa)

description: This big, bold and fruity wine highlights the juicy quality of ripe Castelão. The tannins are just there, forming the base for the ripe red fruits and warm structure. It could do with just a few more months, so drink from late 2015.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Eximius Red (Lisboa)

description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: A bold ripe wine that is full of dark fruits and tannins. It is warm, rounded with spice as well as fine acidity and blackberry flavors. The wine is now fully developed, ready to drink.
title: Monte da Capela 2013 Private Selection Red (Alentejo)

description: A ripe, smooth and richly fruity wine that has a well-integrated structure. Flavors of generous blackberry and red plums are lightly touched by acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Clássico Red (Tejo)

description: This tight, stalky, still-young wine has a firm structure of tannins over the blackberry fruits. Wood aging has softened some of the harder edges and has also given the wine a chance to mature. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Catedral Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This wine combines freshness and structure. It's full of acidity and bright berry fruits. At the same time, the solid structure gives the wine balance and a fine future. Wood aging offers further support to the fruitiness of this ageworthy wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)

description: While there is little varietal character in this Pinot Noir, it is still an attractive, light and fruity wine. Red berries come through strongly sustaining acidity and some tight, mineral tannins. The wine is already well developed and ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Q de Sant'Ana Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: While there is little varietal character in this Pinot Noir, it is still an attractive, light and fruity wine. Red berries come through strongly sustaining acidity and some tight, mineral tannins. The wine is already well developed and ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Q de Sant'Ana Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: Quinta da Lapa has plantings of the rare Tamarez grapes that have gone into the blend of this wine along with Arinto. It is perfumed, ripe and fruity with a touch of spice and citrus and yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This blend of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is rich and concentrated. It is full of dark tannins as well as spicy fruit. Blackberry flavors are perfumed, ripe and shot through with dry, smoky wood tastes. It's still a firm wine that will need more time. Drink from late 2016.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: With apricot and floral perfumes, this is a ripe wine, full in the mouth and with a subtle mix of fresh acidity and rich yellow fruits. It is still a little young and will be better from late 2016.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Viognier (Alentejano)

description: With apricot and floral perfumes, this is a ripe wine, full in the mouth and with a subtle mix of fresh acidity and rich yellow fruits. It is still a little young and will be better from late 2016.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Viognier (Alentejano)

description: With a few months aging, the baby freshness of this wine has turned into ripe fruit with fresh apricot as well as citrus flavors. It's a bright wine, of course, full of lively acidity while having this extra layer of richness that comes from ripe Alvarinho. Drink now.
title: Dom Ponciano 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a grapefruit- and apple-flavored wine with a lively prickle on the palate. Bright and dry, this is sharpened by a citrus flavor and acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2011 Paço de São Lourenço White (Vinho Verde)

description: As the base for a sparkling wine, Baga doesn't lose its tannic character. But it does offer great fruitiness, an apple crispness and tight acidity. A sparkling wine for food.
title: Luis Pato 2010 Quinta do Moinho Rosé Bruto Baga (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: This quinta is in the Rio Torto Valley in the heart of the Port vineyards. The wine is rich, sweet fruited, ripe with jammy blackberries and great perfumes. Open, already drinkable in a fruity way, it is likely to age over the medium term.
title: Wiese & Krohn 2009 Quinta do Retiro Novo Vintage  (Port)

description: This entry level wine from top Douro estate Quinta do Vallado is soft and full of red berry fruits that are laced with firm, solid tannins. It has weight and concentration, the ripe fruits balanced by a fresher side to the wine. With its tannins and touches of wood aging, it needs to age a few months. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Vallado Red (Douro)

description: Vines grown at 1,800 feet give this wine its cool climate attitude. The granite soil gives a strong mineral character to the grapefruit and green apple flavors. With its textured almond and spice character, this is a ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 douROSA Branco White (Douro)

description: Even in inland Alentejo, the Portuguese think of the ocean and of seafaring. This smooth, fruity wine, with its soft tannins and touch of spice, is ready to drink. With a round texture, rich berry fruits and balanced acidity, it is a fine, fruity wine for now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Atlântico Red (Alentejano)

description: A rustic wine that blends Cabernet Sauvignon with local fruit. It has a layer of wood, uncomfortable black currant acidity and a core of tannins.
title: Ervideira 2008 Conde d'Ervideira Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a rich and dense wine, full of dusty tannins and ripe, generous black plum and berry fruits. It's spicy and juicy, with an herbal overtone and a warm, full-bodied character. The wine could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich and dense wine, full of dusty tannins and ripe, generous black plum and berry fruits. It's spicy and juicy, with an herbal overtone and a warm, full-bodied character. The wine could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a smooth, toffee and caramel-flavored wine. It has a comfortable maturity, with acidity coming from hints of fruitiness, and sweet sultanas acting as a foil. Like any aged tawny, this magnificent wine is ready to drink.
title: Senhora do Convento NV Porto Tawny 40 Years Old  (Port)

description: New wood aromas give this very fine wine a firm start in life. It also shows rich blackberry fruits, dark plums and a solid, tannic character. Dense and concentrated with a smooth surface hiding a much firmer core. A serious wine  needing aging.
title: Poças 2010 Simbolo Red (Douro)

description: Made from selected barrels, this reserve wine is serious, dark and dense. It's strongly influenced by the richness of the blackberry and dark plum fruit flavors that roll through the firm structure giving waves of richness. Keep this impressive wine and drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2010 La Rosa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Wonderfully floral, this wine is rich while also having great fruits, a fresher edge and tannins that caress. From the Croft home vineyard, it shows fullness and structure. The aftertaste is so fruity and fragrant, it's almost drinkable now. Wait, though, until 2020.
title: Croft 2012 Quinta de Roêda Vintage  (Port)

description: Wonderfully floral, this wine is rich while also having great fruits, a fresher edge and tannins that caress. From the Croft home vineyard, it shows fullness and structure. The aftertaste is so fruity and fragrant, it's almost drinkable now. Wait, though, until 2020.
title: Croft 2012 Quinta de Roêda Vintage  (Port)

description: Packed with ripe fruit, this wood-aged wine is dense and rich. A blend of Arinto and the Douro's local white grape, Rabigato, it is full of the ripest yellow fruits, laced through with stony minerality.
