The acidity and the spice from the wood give this wine its aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Packed with ripe fruit, this wood-aged wine is dense and rich. A blend of Arinto and the Douro's local white grape, Rabigato, it is full of the ripest yellow fruits, laced through with stony minerality. The acidity and the spice from the wood give this wine its aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Made from old vines grown in a field blend, this is a finely structured wine, fermented in open stone lagares. With its fine tannins, ripe black fruits and concentration, it is an impressive wine that is still aging. The black fruits and tannins will soften and broaden if the wine is kept. Drink from 2019.
designation: Villa Oliveira Vinha das Pedras Altas
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Villa Oliveira Vinha das Pedras Altas Red (Dão)

description: Made from old vines grown in a field blend, this is a finely structured wine, fermented in open stone lagares. With its fine tannins, ripe black fruits and concentration, it is an impressive wine that is still aging. The black fruits and tannins will soften and broaden if the wine is kept. Drink from 2019.
designation: Villa Oliveira Vinha das Pedras Altas
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Villa Oliveira Vinha das Pedras Altas Red (Dão)

description: All the ripe fruit potential of a Douro red is displayed in this unoaked wine. Intense blackberry flavors are laced with fruit tannins and plenty of acidity. The young wine has a mineral edge that gives the aftertaste a fine bite. Drink now.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Unoaked Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: All the ripe fruit potential of a Douro red is displayed in this unoaked wine. Intense blackberry flavors are laced with fruit tannins and plenty of acidity. The young wine has a mineral edge that gives the aftertaste a fine bite. Drink now.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Unoaked Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Foot treading during fermentation, plus aging in French oak or large vats for four years makes this a special sort of Ruby. It is in a dry style, with a good balance between the wood and the juicy red-berry fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado NV Fine Ruby  (Port)

description: Part of a series that showcases major grape varieties, this wine brings out the creamy, green and apple-fruit character of the Chardonnay. It conveys hints of tropical fruits and a ripe apricot flavor. Balanced acidity lifts all this rich fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Part of a series that showcases major grape varieties, this wine brings out the creamy, green and apple-fruit character of the Chardonnay. It conveys hints of tropical fruits and a ripe apricot flavor. Balanced acidity lifts all this rich fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This wine has weight and considerable richness. Spice and an attractive perfume meld with the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. The Castelão grape is at home in this region, which shows in the sense of terroir in this bold wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: A firmly tannic wine with a powerful structure, this is rich and well concentrated, with a solid character that supports the generous black fruits. Juicy and with good acidity at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A firmly tannic wine with a powerful structure, this is rich and well concentrated, with a solid character that supports the generous black fruits. Juicy and with good acidity at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This rich wine comes from the far south of Portugal. It is structured and dense with black-plum fruit and firm tannins. Spice and grilled toast from wood aging and acidity gives this wine a good balance as well as ripeness. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Rabo de Galo Red (Algarve)

description: This is a good example of a red Portuguese wine, showcasing soft, generous tannins and juicy red and blackberry fruits. It is ripe, full of fruit and rounded with a firm, dry aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Passion of Portugal Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: The cork label of this rich, smooth wine is a reminder that Alentejo's vines are interspersed with the trees that provide much of the world's cork. The wine has a rich southern character, soft tannins and plenty of blackberry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 São Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)

description: The cork label of this rich, smooth wine is a reminder that Alentejo's vines are interspersed with the trees that provide much of the world's cork. The wine has a rich southern character, soft tannins and plenty of blackberry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 São Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)

description: An easy focus on fruit and flavor is the key to this ripe wine that is full of creamy apple and peach flavors. It is crisp, with plenty of acidity and a delicious, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 Branco Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: This is a potentially fine wine, spoilt by high alcohol. The structure is dense and with enough acidity and solid tannins. The alcohol is the problem, derived from fruit that tastes overripe.
title: Douro Family Estates 2007 Signature Red (Douro)

description: This has soft, ripe fruit, with notes of lime and orange zest fitting easily with the ripe peach and melon flavors. This is warm, rounded and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Portada Winemaker's Selection White (Lisboa)

description: Made from Touriga Nacional, this is a deliciously light, crisp and clean strawberry-flavored wine. It has lively acidity and a real summer feel. Screwcap.
title: Churchill's 2011 Rosé (Douro)

description: This earthy wine has barnyard aromas and a rough edge. The redeeming feature is the juicy black-currant fruit that provides a crisp aftertaste.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: This earthy wine has barnyard aromas and a rough edge. The redeeming feature is the juicy black-currant fruit that provides a crisp aftertaste.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: Lightly perfumed, this is a simple, fruity wine that is ready to drink. It is floral, with a citrus flavor and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Rota de Cabral Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a strongly perfumed wine with a curious barnyard flavor that hides the fruitiness. This spoils the tangy texture and acidity that are there in the back.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 Fernão Pires (Minho)

description: Named after an Arabic battle cry and now an expression that's shouted at wine festivals, the wine is lightly wood aged, ripe although with a stalky edge. It's easy and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Algazarra Red (Lisboa)

description: An off-dry pair with the rosé in this range, this is a soft white wine that is clean, fruity with attractive sweet pear and quince flavors. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is an aromatic wine with generous fruit and soft tannins. Its wood aging has given the wine extra richness as well as spice. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Alteza Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an attractive wine that is crisp while also having a soft background texture. It is fruity, perfumed and balanced. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Tres Castas White (Vinho Verde)

description: Big and bold, this is a massive Touriga Nacional, emphasizing the structure as much as the fruit. It has a rich black plum character that is paired with firm wood and fruit tannins and a ripe juicy aftertaste. It could do with a year's aging, so drink from early 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Big and bold, this is a massive Touriga Nacional, emphasizing the structure as much as the fruit. It has a rich black plum character that is paired with firm wood and fruit tannins and a ripe juicy aftertaste. It could do with a year's aging, so drink from early 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: A mineral textured wine with stone fruits and attractive fresh acidity, it has a lively citrus character that comes out of the bright citrus and green plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2013 Vargosa Branco White (Douro)

description: Just off dry, this is a bright and crisp wine that bounces round the palate. It is summer apéritif time with this vivid, pink grapefruit-flavored wine.
title: Aveleda 2009 Fonte White (Vinho Verde)

description: Just off dry, this is a bright and crisp wine that bounces round the palate. It is summer apéritif time with this vivid, pink grapefruit-flavored wine.
title: Aveleda 2009 Fonte White (Vinho Verde)

description: More commonly found in the Dão region, the Alfrocheiro is sometimes called the Pinot Noir of Portugal for its smooth, red cherry flavors and sometimes earthy character. Those attributes are found in this cherry-flavored wine with its bright acidity and fruitiness. The whole effect is spoiled by a green edge that shows tight tannins at the end.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Rabigato and Códega do Larinho grapes brings out the crisp acidity of a Douro white. The wine has a fragrant character with hedgerow fruits and white flower aromas. The aftertaste goes more towards yellow fruits while keeping all the freshness.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2014 Passa White (Douro)

description: The wine is tannic and structured, with a dry character that masks the juicy black currant fruits that are there at the back. It shows its wood aging in spice and toast. The wine is ready to drink, although it will always be tannic.
title: Herdade da Capela 2011 Vila Alice Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is tannic and structured, with a dry character that masks the juicy black currant fruits that are there at the back. It shows its wood aging in spice and toast. The wine is ready to drink, although it will always be tannic.
title: Herdade da Capela 2011 Vila Alice Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: It's unclear why this wine's bottle has to be so heavy. After all, the wine inside is ripe, fruity and very ready to drink, certainly not for aging. Black fruits have matured into a leather texture and smoky flavors. The wine is ripe and full in the mouth with just a touch of pepper at the end from alcohol. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2010 QP Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: It's unclear why this wine's bottle has to be so heavy. After all, the wine inside is ripe, fruity and very ready to drink, certainly not for aging. Black fruits have matured into a leather texture and smoky flavors. The wine is ripe and full in the mouth with just a touch of pepper at the end from alcohol. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2010 QP Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: One of the historic Portuguese branded wines, Serradayres continues to offer well-balanced fruit, attractive acidity and tannins that fit well into the overall ripe character of a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Serradayres Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Gouveio and Verdelho, this is a spicy, perfumed wine that has fine, lively acidity to go with its honey, lemon and pear flavors. To drink now, although the mineral edge suggests aging potential.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 2 Duas Castas Gouveio-Verdelho White (Alentejano)

description: Its Grand Escolha (equivalent to a Reserve wine) label explains why this is a young, reticent and closed wine. With its firm fruits and tight tannins, it needs several years of aging to reveal what will always be a serious wine.
title: Quinta Vale de Fornos 2008 Grande Escolha Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: From a top vintage year, this LBV has a fine richness and dry core to its blackberry-jelly and spice flavors. Despite being softened by wood aging, it could withstand a few more years in bottle.
title: Niepoort 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: From a top vintage year, this LBV has a fine richness and dry core to its blackberry-jelly and spice flavors. Despite being softened by wood aging, it could withstand a few more years in bottle.
title: Niepoort 2007 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This big and rich wine is succulent and generous. Firm tannins show strongly through the ripe juicy black currant fruits. Full of the strong minerality typical of the Douro, this wine and its dry core still needs time to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2012 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: This big and rich wine is succulent and generous. Firm tannins show strongly through the ripe juicy black currant fruits. Full of the strong minerality typical of the Douro, this wine and its dry core still needs time to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2012 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: Richly golden in color, this Moscatel is grown on the plateau high above the Douro Valley. Long wood aging has masked much of the typical varietal character, yet yields a rich wine that has concentrated over the years and is now ready to be enjoyed.
title: Adega de Favaios 1980  Moscatel do Douro

description: This is a beautifully perfumed wine, with just the right dense texture of tannins and depth. A balance of fruit, tannins and acidity make this quite attractive. Drink now for immediate pleasure or wait until 2017 for a more mature character.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine is dry and firm, showing developing fruit under dark tannins. Big plum and berry flavors are ripe, juicy and fresh on the finish. Drink from 2019.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This wine is dry and firm, showing developing fruit under dark tannins. Big plum and berry flavors are ripe, juicy and fresh on the finish. Drink from 2019.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a smoothly textured wine, full of berry fruits that are rich enough to cope with the acidity. The tannins come through slowly, balanced by plenty of acidity as well as lively fruit tones at the end. This is full of life and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santa Eufemia 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Firm and tannic, this powerful wine is solid, foursquare and dense in structure. There is plenty of fruit as well, with the typical juiciness of Alicante Bouschet to give a ripe fruity character under the tannic structure. Drink this concentrated wine from 2017.
title: Espaço Rural 2011 Dornas Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fresh wine that is balanced between solid tannins and the ripe red berry fruits. Made to be drunk young, it has juicy acidity along with a firm mineral texture. Pure fruitiness shines at the end. Drink from late 2016.
title: Caminhos Cruzados 2013 Titular Tinto Red (Dão)

description: The heavy bottle is probably a good proportion of the price of this wine—an unnecessary affectation. The wine itself is firm and structured, perfumed with typical Touriga Nacional violet aromas and rich. With its dense texture and juicy black plum fruits, it is still coming together, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: The heavy bottle is probably a good proportion of the price of this wine—an unnecessary affectation. The wine itself is firm and structured, perfumed with typical Touriga Nacional violet aromas and rich. With its dense texture and juicy black plum fruits, it is still coming together, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: The wine is fresh, aromatic and so crisp. Made from Fernão Pires and Verdelho, it is ripe with apple flavors and tangy with orange zest. The wine is young, fruity and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo)

description: The wine is all fruit, so fresh and crisp and light. Sliced apples and sharp lime juice are swirled around with so much acidity that the wine just dances in the glass. This is delicious and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)

description: The wine is all fruit, so fresh and crisp and light. Sliced apples and sharp lime juice are swirled around with so much acidity that the wine just dances in the glass. This is delicious and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This firmly tannic, serious wine has great potential for aging. It shows the structure and acidity typical of the Baga grape, while also bringing out red berry fruit that will be delicious as it develops in the bottle. Drink from 2019.
title: Vadio Wines 2012 Grande Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: This firmly tannic, serious wine has great potential for aging. It shows the structure and acidity typical of the Baga grape, while also bringing out red berry fruit that will be delicious as it develops in the bottle. Drink from 2019.
title: Vadio Wines 2012 Grande Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: From old vines in selected vineyards, this wine is richly endowed with dense black fruits and dusty tannins. Full bodied and intense with a ripe, jammy character, its fruit concentration is bolstered by wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: CARM 2013 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From old vines in selected vineyards, this wine is richly endowed with dense black fruits and dusty tannins. Full bodied and intense with a ripe, jammy character, its fruit concentration is bolstered by wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: CARM 2013 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A beetroot character to this wine is off-putting. It masks the fruit and acidity that otherwise would show well.
title: Wines & Winemakers NV Azul Portugal 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: A beetroot character to this wine is off-putting. It masks the fruit and acidity that otherwise would show well.
title: Wines & Winemakers NV Azul Portugal 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This soft, caramel flavored rosé is produced from the native Castelão grape in coastal Setúbal south of Lisbon. With rounded red fruits and light acidity, it is dry and destined to pair with food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This crisp, lightly sparkling, off-dry Vinho Verde offers attractive acidity and bright citrus flavors, with hints of apple and green plum. Light and fresh, it's ready to drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Sweet and fruity, this rich wine hangs heavily. It has candied flavors without enough acidity to balance. The aftertaste is rich and full, easily in search for a cocktail. Drink now.
title: Gran Cruz NV Pink  (Port)

description: Crisp raspberry flavors along with candied sweetness give this fruity Port a soft and gentle character. It is certainly sweet, even sugary, while retaining good balance. Pink and rosé Port is usually served chilled and in cocktails. Founded in 1862 and historically known as C. da Silva, this producer is now Dalva.
title: Dalva NV Rosé  (Port)

description: Crisp raspberry flavors along with candied sweetness give this fruity Port a soft and gentle character. It is certainly sweet, even sugary, while retaining good balance. Pink and rosé Port is usually served chilled and in cocktails. Founded in 1862 and historically known as C. da Silva, this producer is now Dalva.
title: Dalva NV Rosé  (Port)

description: The meaty, yeasty character here doesn't chime well with the ripe, soft fruit. It is sweet with a full, toffee flavor and only light acidity.
title: Wine & Soul NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The meaty, yeasty character here doesn't chime well with the ripe, soft fruit. It is sweet with a full, toffee flavor and only light acidity.
title: Wine & Soul NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Reliant on perfumed Touriga Nacional, this single estate wine is generous, ripe and full of black fruits. Richly tannic and structured, it has a serious side, firm and with good potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Red (Douro)

description: Not many Douro whites get the heavy bottle treatment like this fine wood-aged wine. It is a half-and-half blend of Gouveio and Viosinho, ripe and with layers of toast and intense yellow fruits as well as citrus acidity. It is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2014 Carvalhas Branco White (Douro)

description: Although no longer widely planted, Tinta Francisca is often found in old vineyards. It doesn't have the power of some Douro reds, but it does have the concentration and a fine balance of fruits, tannins and acidity. There is a freshness that brings a bright edge to this fruity wine. A bonus: It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Carvalhas Tinta Francisca (Douro)

description: Although no longer widely planted, Tinta Francisca is often found in old vineyards. It doesn't have the power of some Douro reds, but it does have the concentration and a fine balance of fruits, tannins and acidity. There is a freshness that brings a bright edge to this fruity wine. A bonus: It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Carvalhas Tinta Francisca (Douro)

description: The two grapes in this blend create a finely structured wine full of tannins that give shape and density to its young fruit. Blackberry flavors dominate—they are cut with acidity and filled out with dense tannins. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2017.
title: Lobo 2014 Selecção Cabernet Sauvignon-Touriga Nacional Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: The bottle is stupidly heavy but there is a nice cool feel to the taste. It's to do with the vineyard's proximity to the ocean which brings out acidity to balance the delicious ripe pear and sweet melon fruit. It is ripe and lightly toasty. The aftertaste adds a mineral texture to the complex mix. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2012 Encontro 1 Branco Arinto (Bairrada)

description: A richly spicy wine, showing its wood aging in the mint flavors as well as toast. Despite a dodgy harvest year, the wine has the dense, ripely fruity character that comes from winemakers João Menezes and Francisco Montenegro's use of foot treading and fermentation in open stone lagars and that gives great black fruits and soft tannins. This is a wine that is powerful and concentrated, ready to age for a few more years. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2014 Pôpa Black Edition Red (Douro)

description: This is one of a series of limited-production single-variety wines from this large Alentejo estate. Ripe spice and bold juicy flavors, both the hallmark of Alicante Bouschet, give this wine its richness and concentration. It is generous, opulent and just ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Vinhas das Palmeiras Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Concentrated tannins and rich black plum and currant flavors distinguish this serious, dense wine. It has structure and dry tannins resulting from both the old vine fruit and the barrel aging. This is a wine that deserves some good aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Duorum 2015 Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)

description: An attractive, fruity wine, very pure in character, with some minerality along with dry tannins. The wine does keep a little sweetness, but remains on the dry side.
title: Croft 2008 Quinta da Roêda Vintage  (Port)

description: An attractive, fruity wine, very pure in character, with some minerality along with dry tannins. The wine does keep a little sweetness, but remains on the dry side.
title: Croft 2008 Quinta da Roêda Vintage  (Port)

description: A Portuguese classic, this fresh and fruity wine comes from a small zone in the heart of the Lisboa region. It is citrus flavored with delicious lime and pear flavors, fine acidity and a bright, zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Bucellas Arinto (Bucelas)

description: From vines in the upper Douro valley, this is an intense wine that's still young. Its smooth, ripe black cherry fruits are followed by blueberry, spice from wood and bitter chocolate. This is a complex wine that finishes fresh.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Fronteira Red (Douro)

description: From vines in the upper Douro valley, this is an intense wine that's still young. Its smooth, ripe black cherry fruits are followed by blueberry, spice from wood and bitter chocolate. This is a complex wine that finishes fresh.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Fronteira Red (Douro)

description: Bright and fresh, a great mouthful of lemongrass spices, lime and tight, young flavors of grapefruit. The acidity suffuses the wine, lifting it, giving the fruit a vivid character. There is a clean, mineral aftertaste.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2007 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Initially rustic, this is likely to develop into a dry, firmly tannic wine. The acidity and red berry notes come together in balance, but it does need serious aging to develop fully. Drink from 2018.
title: João Teodosio Matos Barbosa 2009 Ninfa Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: A spicy, ripe wine that is part of the second line from Quinta de la Rosa. With its rich tannins, fine layers of acidity and sweet berry fruit, it is already drinkable. Give it 2–3 years and it will develop beyond its just fruity stage.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 DouRosa Red (Douro)

description: A spicy, ripe wine that is part of the second line from Quinta de la Rosa. With its rich tannins, fine layers of acidity and sweet berry fruit, it is already drinkable. Give it 2–3 years and it will develop beyond its just fruity stage.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 DouRosa Red (Douro)

description: A fruity blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, the two most familiar white grapes of the region, this wine is soft and creamy. The acidity and the green fruits are already refreshing. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Ardósia Branco White (Tejo)

description: Part of a range of single-varietal wines from this producer, this bottling features richly structured and perfumed Touriga Nacional. A firm core gives a minty edge to the blackberry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This soft, spicy wine has easy fruitiness. Black currants are balanced with acidity and a bright aftertaste. This great-value wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This simple wine is all about crisp citrus and apple fruits that keep it bright and lively. It offers a tight texture and good fruitiness at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: This simple wine is all about crisp citrus and apple fruits that keep it bright and lively. It offers a tight texture and good fruitiness at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 White (Alentejano)

description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Rosé (Douro)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A sweet, soft, clean wine, anonymous almost. Yes, there is freshness, lightness, but all the time the awkward, unbalancing sweetness pulls it down. Drink very chilled.
title: Lagosta 2008 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is more of a chunky, rich tawny; the mouthfeel comes across more syrupy than svelte. But with a ton of hazelnut/walnut character and plenty of bitter coffee nuances on the finish, it comes home nicely.
title: Offley NV Baron de Forrester  (Port)

description: This is more of a chunky, rich tawny; the mouthfeel comes across more syrupy than svelte. But with a ton of hazelnut/walnut character and plenty of bitter coffee nuances on the finish, it comes home nicely.
title: Offley NV Baron de Forrester  (Port)

description: This is a young wood-aged wine with rich toast. While the toast does smother the fruit at the moment, there are enough crisp acidity and citrus flavors in the background to come through as the wine matures for another year or two. Drink from 2018.
title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: This is a finely made wine, fresh and crisp. It is dry but with a soft texture that turns it into a wine that's both good with food and as an apéritif. The aftertaste is crisp and still fruity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Portugal Ramos Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This organic vineyard in the northern reaches of Tejo regularly produces concentrated wines like this. It's richly endowed with fine tannins and black fruit but also has the sort of structure that will allow it to age well. Drink from 2019.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: This organic vineyard in the northern reaches of Tejo regularly produces concentrated wines like this. It's richly endowed with fine tannins and black fruit but also has the sort of structure that will allow it to age well. Drink from 2019.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: This is a limited quantity release from the Kopke's stock of aged Ports. At 40 years, the wine has become concentrated, intense and almost unbearable in its acidity and spirit. It's a great bottling although much less drinkable than other aged White Ports in their range.
title: Kopke NV 40 Years Old White  (Port)

description: Named on whim after a peacock's feathers and hence a fan, this attractive wine is full of bright fruit and the proper stony mineral structure typical of the Dão. The wood aging has given the wine extra richness without losing the fruit. Drink this finely wrought wine from 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A big, bold, black vintage Port, already enticingly perfumed, packed with as much rich fruit as tannin. It's in the sweet vintage Port arena, an immediately attractive wine, yet layered with enough structure to keep it maturing for many years. The final sense is all richness.
title: Poças 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: The Arinto grape and the town of Bucelas go together. This small enclave in the larger Lisboa region produces this crisp fruity style, like a southern version of dry Vinho Verde but with extra weight. Drink this attractive, lemon and red-apple flavored wine now.
title: Caves Velhas 2016 Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This wine has a strange juicy character, reminiscent of tomato juice. The tannins under the odd fruitiness are firm, with a bitter edge.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2012 Fonte da Serrana Red (Alentejano)

description: Lightly wood aged, this is a rich wine that has tropical fruits as well as toast and pepper from the alcohol. Unfortunately, there's a streak of citrus that sits awkwardly with the rest of the wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Judeu 2012 White (Douro)

description: Lightly wood aged, this is a rich wine that has tropical fruits as well as toast and pepper from the alcohol. Unfortunately, there's a streak of citrus that sits awkwardly with the rest of the wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Judeu 2012 White (Douro)

description: With its flamboyant aromas of oranges, tangerines and apricots, this screams “Muscat” at the top of its lungs. The plump flavors of tropical and citrus fruits make it easy to like and easy to drink. Great as an apéritif.
title: João Pires 2001 Muscat of Alexandria Muscat (Terras do Sado)

description: A lively, crisp wine that boasts intense pineapple and citrus fruits. From high-elevation Douro vineyards, it is light and refreshing, with great swathes of acidity.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2009 Vertice Cuvée Reserva Sparkling (Douro)

description: Fermented in open stone lagars, this wine shows a smooth, rounded and very rich character. Sweet wood flavors suggest vanilla, while the tannins are fine, dense and attractively spicy. The aftertaste, with juicy black fruits, adds balance to the wine. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2009 Visconde de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a ripe, soft and juicy wine that is ready to drink. Warm blackberry tones are contrasted by a rich wood character and fresh, lively acidity.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a firm and serious wine, with dark tannins behind the rich black fruit tones. The solid structure is likely to smooth out with time to give a ripe and juicy wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Roquevale 2011 Tinto da Talha Red (Alentejano)

description: Petit Verdot is known for its color, and this wine is dark purple, almost black. The tannins are also pretty prominent, although they are balanced by a freshness from black currant fruits and a fine, mineral structure. There is a touch of pepper and spice at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Mãe 2012 Petit Verdot (Lisboa)

description: This field blend is produced from old vines. It is rich and smooth with touches with spicy wood. The wood is showing strongly, perhaps not leaving enough room for fruit, however, that could improve as the wine ages more. Wait until 2017.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Fugitivo Garrafeira Branco White (Dão)

description: The wine has dark tannins and a firm structured texture. They act as a foil to the berry fruits and intense, young acidity. Dominated by Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, the wine has black fruits, juicy freshness and and an almost crisp aftertaste. It needs some time to fully integrate, so wait until 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine has dark tannins and a firm structured texture. They act as a foil to the berry fruits and intense, young acidity. Dominated by Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, the wine has black fruits, juicy freshness and and an almost crisp aftertaste. It needs some time to fully integrate, so wait until 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is smooth and creamy, its acidity just pointing up the ripe apple and pineapple fruit flavors. It does have a crisp citrus edge that just freshens the aftertaste. This is a wood-aged wine, the toast giving a light spice and nutmeg character. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova Régia Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Produced from old vines, this is an impressive wine, rich and dense. It brings together dark tannins and opulent black fruits that cushion the firm structure. A lively acidity and a silky character show that the wine is ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2009 Dona Maria Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a finely perfumed wine, full of ripe Castelão grapes. It has a smooth, polished feeling from the wood aging, yet still allows plenty of room for a dense black-fruit character. It will need to age and will be best after 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Pegos Claros Reserva Castelão (Palmela)

description: This estate wine is seriously structured, with tones of dried herbs alongside richer elements of dense tannins and ripe black fruits. A bright acid backbone maintains a fresh and lively character. It might be best to lay down this selection for further integration.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Red (Alentejano)

description: Rui Madeira's flagship red is a formidable, powerful wine. It has intense tannins that are surrounded by dark fruits and rich, juicy acidity. The core is dry, concentrated and dense, and the wood aging shows against the background of ripe fruits, promising good aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Castello d'Alba 2012 Vinhas Velhas Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Arinto grape is a Lisboa specialty and this lightly wood-aged wine shows it to great advantage. Plenty of acidity and a crisp texture are balanced by vanilla and creamy apple. This fine wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Oak Aged 6 Months Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Two types of wood barrels were used to age this wine: large chestnut and smaller oak. The wood shows although it does not detract from the tightly crisp and aromatic fruitiness of the Bical grape. It is lively at the end with plenty of bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Campolargo 2015 Branco Bical (Bairrada)

description: Two types of wood barrels were used to age this wine: large chestnut and smaller oak. The wood shows although it does not detract from the tightly crisp and aromatic fruitiness of the Bical grape. It is lively at the end with plenty of bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Campolargo 2015 Branco Bical (Bairrada)

description: Also known as Tinta Amarela in the Douro, Trincadeira gives wines with firm structure while also having a juicy fruit acidity. This wine, with its red berries and red currant flavors fits the bill, a fresh wine that also has weight and density. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: This attractive, fruity wine comes from vineyards in the Douro Superior region close to Spain. It is a fresh wine with red berry fruit flavors and bright acidity. It is still young although the fruitiness is enough to give a bright wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, bold wine is rich in black fruits. They cushion the naturally prominent tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional that form part of the blend. It is a solid effort, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2014 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine, sumptuous in its smooth and creamy texture. It has citrus, lime and really fresh acidity to balance the toast and rich fruitiness. Elegant and worth aging further. Drink from 2016.
title: Quanta Terra 2013 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine, sumptuous in its smooth and creamy texture. It has citrus, lime and really fresh acidity to balance the toast and rich fruitiness. Elegant and worth aging further. Drink from 2016.
title: Quanta Terra 2013 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A generous wine that still manages to keep elegance and style. It offers black, juicy fruits that are blended with the spice from wood aging. There are blackberries, plenty of acidity and a dry but always fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Vilalva 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A smooth wine, feeling light in style, with a touch of acidity to go with the gentle tannins. It is now quite ready to drink, easy and approachable.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 Vista Tinto Tinta Roriz (Beiras)

description: The most successful wine in the medium-sweet Portada range, with its light honey and lemon flavors, both crisp and soft, ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: The most successful wine in the medium-sweet Portada range, with its light honey and lemon flavors, both crisp and soft, ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, this is very aromatic, full of citrus flavors, crisp and clean. Light, refreshing, quaffing wine. Screwcap.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Cortello Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a fresh and bright wine. It has tangy acidity, a citrus character and a zesty aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2015 Bastardo! Black Edition Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh and bright wine. It has tangy acidity, a citrus character and a zesty aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2015 Bastardo! Black Edition Branco White (Tejo)

description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: As crisp as possible, this is a light, strawberry fruited wine with balanced acidity and a fresh, delicious aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: The wine is ripe, full with red currant and raspberry fruits and some attractive acidity. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot, it is soft, fruity and needs drinking fast before it fades.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Rosé (Tejo)

description: The wine is soft, fruity and with its light tannins and fresh red berry fruits, it is ready to drink. The aftertaste has a fresh, bright finish. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Xairel Red (Tejo)

description: Produced by the cooperative of Santo Isidro de Pegões south of Lisbon, this wine comes from the grape variety that's planted across the region. It's an open, soft wine, great for pasta dishes with plenty of ripe fruits and gentle tannins. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Colheita Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Maria Gomes, here is a ripe wood- and apricot-flavored wine. It is full, spicy, livened by crispness from a red apple skin texture. The vanilla from the wood adds a delicious richness to this impressive wine.
title: Aveleda 2007 Grande Follies Quinta da Aguieira White (Bairrada)

description: A fruity and aromatic wine that is a blend of Syrah and Castelão. It has bright red fruits and a soft, ripe character. Berries and acidity complement the round finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Rosé (Tejo)

description: Light, fresh and sweet, here is an attractive, red fruit-flavored wine. It has the typical Vinho Verde prickle, along with balanced acidity that gives a crisp aftertaste.
title: Vercoope 2012 Pavão Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Here's a caramel and red fruit-flavored wine that is soft and round. It is light and bright, with a light prickle on the tongue as well as a tangy, orange peel texture. Screwcap.
title: Vera 2012 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a well balanced, ready to drink tawny, showing ripe, mature, wood-aged fruit notes along with raisins and some firm tannins. It's rich while still showing some freshness.
title: Caves Vale do Rodo NV Tellu's Tawny  (Port)

description: A bright pink wine that tastes drier than it looks. It has bright strawberry aromas, as well as touches of caramel and lively final acidity. It's not for aging.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Rosé (Dão)

description: A bright pink wine that tastes drier than it looks. It has bright strawberry aromas, as well as touches of caramel and lively final acidity. It's not for aging.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Rosé (Dão)

description: This is a brightly crisp wine, bringing out the acidity in Alvarinho rather than the more exotic fruitiness. It has a direct line of fresh citrus, a mineral tang and juicy freshness. Drink now.
title: Delaforce 2012 Alvarinho (Duriense)

description: This fruity, unoaked wine is bright with citrus and crisp apple flavors, lightly perfumed from the Verdelho and Cerceal grapes in the blend. It's a refreshing wine that is ready now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Porca de Murça Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This ripe wine, full of black fruits, is juicy, rich and ready to drink. Packed with fruit and acidity, it is balanced and smooth. It takes its name from the small town of Murça to the north of the main Douro region.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Porca de Murça Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This ripe wine, full of black fruits, is juicy, rich and ready to drink. Packed with fruit and acidity, it is balanced and smooth. It takes its name from the small town of Murça to the north of the main Douro region.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Porca de Murça Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Merlot and Syrah are added to Portuguese varieties to give a solid and fruit-driven wine. Rich berries and generous tannins are dominant partners, with juicy acidity giving balance. It's a wine that is ready to drink, full of fruit and generous.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Vila Jardim Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The local Baga grape makes an appearance in this blend, creating a firm texture with solid tannins. Its rich, dense core is dark and brooding in character, but could soften out with age. Drink after 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: The local Baga grape makes an appearance in this blend, creating a firm texture with solid tannins. Its rich, dense core is dark and brooding in character, but could soften out with age. Drink after 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: A fruity style of Douro wine, perhaps missing the tannins but with generous black fruits and ripe berry flavors. Acidity and a streak of minerality combine to give the final tight texture. Drink now.
title: Borges 2012 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: The estate wine of Mouchão is serious, dense and complex. It is a wine that's made for the long haul, still with its youthful tannins that are balanced by juicy black fruits. There is a leathery texture developing alongside the fruit. It is dark and solid, likely to age for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Mouchão 2010 Red (Alentejo)

description: After 14 months in large wood barrels, this wine is full of spicy flavors that go with the rich yellow fruits, generous apricots and peaches, and delicious acidity. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Quanta Terra 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Winemaking at the aristocratic Santar estate is run by Global Wines. This rich wine, dominated by the high-quality Encruzado grape, is poised between crisp apple fruitiness and toast from wood aging. At two years old, the wine is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2015 Casa de Santar Branco Reserva White (Dão)

description: Winemaking at the aristocratic Santar estate is run by Global Wines. This rich wine, dominated by the high-quality Encruzado grape, is poised between crisp apple fruitiness and toast from wood aging. At two years old, the wine is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2015 Casa de Santar Branco Reserva White (Dão)

description: This lightly wood aged Douro blend is certainly rich, full of generous white stone fruit as well as melon. With its balancing acidity, the wine is both rich and crisp and will be better from 2017.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Branco White (Douro)

description: One of Portugal's oldest plantings of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, from 1974, produced at the beautiful renaissance estate of Bacalhôa. With its dark color, elegant richness, black currant and red berry fruits, this remains a great benchmark, a brilliant transformation of the French grapes into Portuguese tastes.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2007 Quinta da Bacalhôa Red (Terras do Sado)

description: This big, firm wine, produced by the team that makes Dow's and Graham's Port, is as impressive as always. With its tight plum skins and dense character, ripe jammy texture and sweet fruit, it combines immediate charm with the potential for long-term aging.
title: Quinta de Roriz 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: This big, firm wine, produced by the team that makes Dow's and Graham's Port, is as impressive as always. With its tight plum skins and dense character, ripe jammy texture and sweet fruit, it combines immediate charm with the potential for long-term aging.
title: Quinta de Roriz 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: With its enticing perfumes, sweet plum and damson fruit flavors, this is initially a seductive wine. But at the same time, the vivid acidity and the strong tannic element suggest good aging potential.
title: Offley 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: The initial wood flavors dominate this still-young wine. With its tight mineral character and black currant fruits, it is very focused despite its power and intensity. The flavors open slowly over many hours, emphasizing the need for 4–5 years' aging.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2006 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: The initial wood flavors dominate this still-young wine. With its tight mineral character and black currant fruits, it is very focused despite its power and intensity. The flavors open slowly over many hours, emphasizing the need for 4–5 years' aging.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2006 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A first vintage Port for José Maria Soares Franco, the man behind the legendary Douro table wine Barca Velha. He has teamed up with J. Portugal Ramos, better known in the Alentejo. This is beautifully perfumed Touriga Nacional, followed by fine and ripe tannins. A layer of acidity gives the wine a more dry, serious side. Powerful and intended for aging.
title: Duorum 2007 Vintage  (Port)

description: From 70-year-old vines on the Crasto estate, this is an impressive wine, with its superripe fruit layered with acidity and the sweetest of berry flavors. Wood aging gives roundness to go with the tight mineral complexity.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2006 Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)

description: This is a bone-dry, piercingly fresh wine. It has tense acidity and a mineral texture that would make it delicious as an accompaniment to seafood. The wine is crisp, refreshing and bright.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a bone-dry, piercingly fresh wine. It has tense acidity and a mineral texture that would make it delicious as an accompaniment to seafood. The wine is crisp, refreshing and bright.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Vinho Verde)

description: If any producer is going to make sense of Vinhão in red Vinho Verde, it's biodynamic producer Casal do Paço Padreiro. This has some richness as well as the typical cool-climate acidity, with a touch of spice and a balanced, smooth finish. Drink within the year.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2011 Aphros Vinhão (Vinho Verde)

description: Showcasing the richness of 2009 without sacrificing fine structure, this is stylish and concentrated. Dark black fruit accompanies a tight, minerality and a fine shaft of acidity. This single-vineyard offering is worth aging for 2–3 years.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Smooth and rounded, this has the dense character of Douro wines, with open flavors of spice and black currant. The junior wine of Quinta de la Rosa, this is balanced and will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2010 Dourosa Red (Douro)

description: This Port is structured, with notes of mint and herb. It has blackberry jam flavor and a firm, solid structure, while it also shows intense youthful fruitiness. It is rich and full, showing some firm tannins. Either drink it right now, or leave it for 10 years.
title: Quevedo 2010 Quinta Vale d'Agodinho Vintage  (Port)

description: This is light and bright, with crisp acidity and the fruitiness of an attractive, early-drinking wine.
title: PV Vinhos 2010 Egle White (Douro)

description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ripe, warm and ready to drink. With its ripe black fruits, soft tannins, layers of wood spices and just a hint of acidity, it's a rich offering from a big vintage.
designation: Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2009 Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: An ancient variety now seen rarely, this Códega do Larinho has produced a wine that has a steely texture and tangy citrus flavors. It is bright with acidity, lime and grapefruit fruits and so crisp. It is ready to drink.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva Códega do Larinho (Douro)

description: This is a dense wine with firm tannins and a solid structure. The black currant fruits are stalky and still developing, along with the acidity. It's a lean wine and needs to age for a few more months to fill out, so drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Maria Mora Red (Alentejano)

description: The popular Marquês de Borba brand is a soft, ripe, very accessible wine. With a light touch of wood aging, it follows easily through with cherry and red plum fruits, a deliciously mouthwatering aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2009 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: The popular Marquês de Borba brand is a soft, ripe, very accessible wine. With a light touch of wood aging, it follows easily through with cherry and red plum fruits, a deliciously mouthwatering aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2009 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: In a richer style of Vinho Verde but nevertheless retaining plenty of cool, fresh characters. The wine has vivid grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors, rounded out attractively.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: A stylish wine, with mineral tannins and a dusty texture. It is cool, elegant and with a tight layer of acidity. There's plenty of firm structure, with berries and sweet fruit to finish. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Falua 2009 Red (Tejo)

description: This dark-colored wine, dominated by Touriga Nacional, is rich, perfumed and dense. It has impressive tannins and rich blackberry fruit. The structure is concentrated, giving the wine power as well as a sense of style. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2011 Quinta do Mondego Tinto Red (Dão)

description: This dark-colored wine, dominated by Touriga Nacional, is rich, perfumed and dense. It has impressive tannins and rich blackberry fruit. The structure is concentrated, giving the wine power as well as a sense of style. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2011 Quinta do Mondego Tinto Red (Dão)

description: A field blend of grapes from two vineyards forms the backbone of this vintage Port. It is rich with young fruitiness that masks the firm tannins that will allow this wine to age many years. Berry flavors are balanced with acidity and richness to give a perfumed wine. In its young fruitiness it is ready to drink, although it will age well and really should not be drunk until 2025 at least.
title: Churchill's 2014 Vintage  (Port)

description: This great north-facing vineyard is opposite the village of Tua in the heart of the Douro. It has produced this densely rich wine from selected parcels in a spectacular cypress-lined vineyard on the south bank of the Douro river. Aged for 18 months in wood, the juicy black fruits and acidity balance intense spice and toast flavors of this powerful wine. Keep until 2019.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2012 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a dense and very powerful wine that manages to retain a sense of style. It is certainly rich, although the juicy black fruits and acidity give it a great lift of acidity that balances the density and ripeness. The wine is just approaching its maturity although it will be better from 2017.
designation: Monte da Cal Saturnino Grande Reserva
title: Global Wines 2011 Monte da Cal Saturnino Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The 12-months of oak aging has given this wine a fine structure, hints of mint and attractive tannins. Grown in vineyards south of Lisbon, it is ripe and sunny, while still firm. It is wine that is now ready to drink.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2013 Adega de Pegões Touriga Nacional (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: There is a toasty character to this wine with its (not unpleasant) lightly oxidized flavors. There is also perfumed fruit and flavors of ripe rich fruitiness. It is a finely structured wine, ready to drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Private Collection Branco Verdelho (Tejo)

description: From 60-year-old bush vines, this is rich, spicy and with a soft texture. Black fruits give a ripe character and a smooth texture that is beginning to bring in some secondary, earthy flavors. Drink this mature wine now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Preta Vinhas Velhas Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: Big, ripe and spicy, with tobacco and herbal flavors alongside the black currant intensity and powerful acidity. It is rich while the austere tannins of the Baga grape are still young. Keep for 2–3 years.
title: Caves Primavera 2008 Primavera Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: Big, ripe and spicy, with tobacco and herbal flavors alongside the black currant intensity and powerful acidity. It is rich while the austere tannins of the Baga grape are still young. Keep for 2–3 years.
title: Caves Primavera 2008 Primavera Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: Ripe and juicy, maybe a little rustic round the edges, certainly fruity. Red berry flavors dominate along with an edgy center of tannin, while juicy acidity completes this attractive wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Samora Red (Tejo)

description: Ripe and juicy, maybe a little rustic round the edges, certainly fruity. Red berry flavors dominate along with an edgy center of tannin, while juicy acidity completes this attractive wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Samora Red (Tejo)

description: This rich, delicious blend of Castelão and Alicante Bouschet is soft and juicy, with black and blue berry flavors, dusty tannins and a fine, jammy aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: Tropical and citrus fruits complement each other in this soft and fruity wine. It has some richness and a tangy texture of orange peel, which give it a balanced character. Drink now, although the wine will be better in 2016.
title: Casa de Vila Nova 2013 Visconde de Garcez White (Douro)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires, this crisp, lightly herbaceous wine has a soft texture and attractive, creamy acidity. Hints of yellow fruits come through deliciously at the end.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Rede is at the cooler western end of the Douro vineyards, known for its table wines rather than Ports. This ripe, toasty wine has a generous tannin and fruit structure. Red berry fruits dominate the texture, along with a lightly mineral character. The wine could age, so drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2011 Rede Tinto Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is a powerful, concentrated wine, just verging (but not quite passing) on overweight. That makes it rich and dense, full of black plum fruits and damson skins both giving a textured juiciness. The tannins, though, are still young and the wine needs plenty of time. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Grande Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a powerful, concentrated wine, just verging (but not quite passing) on overweight. That makes it rich and dense, full of black plum fruits and damson skins both giving a textured juiciness. The tannins, though, are still young and the wine needs plenty of time. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Grande Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: Dedicated to the producer's father, this 100% Alicante Bouschet is superbly ripe and rich without overwhelming. It has the dark black colors of the grape that are followed by full-bodied black fruit flavors and impressive spice and pepper flavors. The wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2018.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Júlio B. Bastos Grande Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)

description: Dedicated to the producer's father, this 100% Alicante Bouschet is superbly ripe and rich without overwhelming. It has the dark black colors of the grape that are followed by full-bodied black fruit flavors and impressive spice and pepper flavors. The wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2018.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Júlio B. Bastos Grande Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)

description: This is a wine that is full of red fruits and fresh acidity. The tannic structure is well in balance giving a firm edge to the bright, ready-to-drink fruits. The wine is the entry level to the always impressive range from Crasto. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Crasto Red (Douro)

description: This is a wine that is full of red fruits and fresh acidity. The tannic structure is well in balance giving a firm edge to the bright, ready-to-drink fruits. The wine is the entry level to the always impressive range from Crasto. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Crasto Red (Douro)

description: A blend dominated by 80% Viosinho, this wine is cool. fresh and fruity. It has a light herbal character that contrasts with the apricot and pear flavors. The citrus acidity completes an attractive, balanced wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Bairrada is well known for its sparkling wines often based around the Baga grape. This example is fruity with crisp apple flavors and just a touch of tannin to give structure. The wine is still young and could age more, although it is ready to drink now.
title: Messias 2012 Bruto Grand Cuvée Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This is a ripe, spicy wine that has dense tannins and dark fruits. Now mature, it is full bodied, packed with black fruit flavors and a concentrated structure. The Alicante Bouschet in the blend gives the wine its dark color and also its intense fruits. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2011 Visconde de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe wine. This Alvarinho, planted east of Lisbon, is far south of its normal Vinho Verde region. The wine retains its rich character while adding more tropical fruit flavors. This tangy wine is lightly mineral in texture. It will be ready to drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2015 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: The two grapes here are more commonly found in the Douro. Here in the south of Portugal, they give a softer character—less mineral more ripe apple and pear fruitiness. The aftertaste does keep the delicious wine bright and lively.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Duas Castas Roupeiro-Viosinho White (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe take on the crisp Alvarinho. The wine does have acidity but it also has hints of rich tropical fruits. The texture is tangy while revealing a full-bodied, perfumed and vibrant wine. Drink now.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: This fine ripe wine is smooth and rich. Its acidity and apple-fruit aspect is balanced by richer yellow fruit and a touch of almonds. Drink this finely made wine now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Full and ripe, this is a lemon and crisp apple flavored wine. There is a hint of toast from the six months in barrel that also adds a little pepper. Fine acidity and a tangy texture suggests it could age. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: This Reserve tawny has a color hinting at red gold and wood-aging flavor. It presents a ripe character, full of sultanas and fig flavors, rich and sweet. The spirit does show and needs to integrate more to make this truly satisfying.
title: Butler Nephew & Co NV Finest Reserve  (Port)

description: Partly wood-aged, this Alvarinho gives a smooth southern take on this northern Portuguese grape. It brings out apricot and pineapple fruits as well as the more typical lemon flavors. The acidity remains in place to give a crisp, tight aftertaste.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Quinta dos Loridos Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Blackberry and ripe black currant flavors are interspersed with acidity and a juicy texture. The wine has a dry, tannic core, with flavors of old wood that spoils the general fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Blackberry and ripe black currant flavors are interspersed with acidity and a juicy texture. The wine has a dry, tannic core, with flavors of old wood that spoils the general fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this rosé gives ripe red fruits that are cut with lively acidity. There is a jammy, caramel-flavored backdrop to this wine that makes it heavy rather than fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this rosé gives ripe red fruits that are cut with lively acidity. There is a jammy, caramel-flavored backdrop to this wine that makes it heavy rather than fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: This wine is lean and still young, with concentrated tannins, firm acidity and smoky fruits that will take some time to develop. The palate suggests it will always be a mineral, tight and firm wine, even as the tannins soften. The finish is pure, juicy black currants. Drink from 2018.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This wine is lean and still young, with concentrated tannins, firm acidity and smoky fruits that will take some time to develop. The palate suggests it will always be a mineral, tight and firm wine, even as the tannins soften. The finish is pure, juicy black currants. Drink from 2018.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A wood-fermented and -aged wine, this tones down the fruity freshness of Alvarinho and instead brings out a smooth, toasty and ripe character. Rich apricot and pineapple flavors and acidity are enveloped by notes of toast and spice. This impressive wine is still developing, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2013 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Touriga Nacional and Syrah make a harmonious blend in this dense, structured wine. With complex tannins that need to soften into the ripe fruit, the wine is still developing. It's dry for now, although the black plum and berry flavors will be delicious. Drink this age worthy wine from 2017.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2012 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Fermented in amphora in the traditional Alentejo style, this old-vine wine has a naturally oxidized character. It is a yeasty, ripe wine that is reminiscent of dry Sherry or Jura's Vin Jaune while preserving fine freshness. It is certainly a food wine, ripe and laden with apricot flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2013 Branco de Talha White (Alentejano)

description: The Borba cooperative is in one of the most productive Alentejo wine regions. With this simple and fruity wine, it has captured warmth as well as ripe tannins. Berry fruits and acidity give it a lift. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: Fernão Pires with Sauvignon Blanc allows the second grape's herbal nature to shine. So it is crisp, citrusy and with intense acidity. The wine has a ripe feel with hints of tropical fruit at the end. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: The wine is full of acidity and with stalky fruit. There is a sharp edge that detracts from the otherwise fruity character of this light crisp wine. This is ready to drink now.
title: Vinihold 2015 Altimo Red (Douro)

description: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a young and fruity wine that has the rare Vital grape in the blend. It is crisp although with an attractive creaminess that gives the wine a smooth texture. The acidity and red apples are balanced and make the wine ready to drink.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Perfumed wine, deliciously aromatic but also structured. This is balanced, intently tannic. The fruit is equally important, the black currant juice and refreshing acidity a counterbalance to the tannins.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2006 Syrah-Touriga Nacional Red (Ribatejano)

description: Initially, this is a fruit-dominated wine, with a cherries-in-syrup flavor. Only gradually do the tannins and the stalky but rich texture come in to suggest aging potential. The wine finishes with the fresh edge typical of 2007.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2007 Conceito Vintage  (Port)

description: With a blend that includes the Encruzado grape better known in the Dão region, this is a full-bodied, wood-aged wine. The acidity contrasts with the toast and ripe yellow and citrus fruits. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Seriously dense and with signs of extraction, this is a powerful wine. Its big black fruits give it richness while there is also fine juicy acidity. It comes from vines over 100-years-old grown on the spectacularly steep slopes of the quinta. The wine is still young, so don't drink before 2019.
title: Quinta da Foz 2013 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A powerful wine, certainly, although in the elegant style of Quinta do Portal. Big black berry and plum flavors wrap around tannins that are still young, exuberant, needing time to settle down. The acidity and the solid tannic structure suggest good aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This firmly tannic wine shows rich fruit and warm black berry flavors spiced with fig juice and sultanas. It is a solid, chunky effort, needing a few months' bottle age to achieve its full, impressive character.
title: Niepoort 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Showing freshness as well as sweet jelly fruit, this has a young feel to it. An edge of bitter chocolate and spice is layered over tannins that are not yet integrated.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2004 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Fermented in open stone lagars, this wine has the typical opulent structure that comes from this time-honored technique. With its dark tannins and concentrated black fruits, this wine, dominated by Touriga Nacional, is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2009 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Fermented in open stone lagars, this wine has the typical opulent structure that comes from this time-honored technique. With its dark tannins and concentrated black fruits, this wine, dominated by Touriga Nacional, is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2009 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is the result of a selection of 12 barrels that were chosen after aging. It is rich, smooth and concentrated, with powerful tannins behind the ripe texture and generous blackberry fruits. It needs to age further; drink from 2019.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Quinta de Fafide 12 Barrels Red (Douro)

description: Fruity and soft, this appealing wine is ready to drink. Lemon juice and lime zest give freshness along with bright acidity and a light sense of mineral texture.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Dine with me Tonight White (Tejo)

description: Syrah performs well in the hot, dry climate of Alentejo. This is a perfumed wine, richly tannic although the tannins are cushioned by the red fruits, spice and fresh acidity. It is ready to drink now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Syrah (Alentejano)

description: A fine, sweet, fresh Port, well integrated with the spirit. It has just a touch of acidity to give a good balance.
title: Poças NV Pink Rosé  (Port)

description: Soft berry fruits, touches of wood vanilla and creamy caramel make for an accessible wine, simple, finishing with fresh acidity.
title: Quinta Santa Eufemia 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A salmon-colored wine, very fresh, with a full palate that carries flavors of strawberries and red currants. The wine is dry, but with the smooth caramel texture, it seems sweeter and softer.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2007 Touriga Nacional-Raboso Rosé (Ribatejano)

description: This medium-sweet, fruity wine is both light and crisp. Attractive acidity contrasts with the sparkling texture and the sugared citrus. It's very ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Vilacentinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: This medium-sweet, fruity wine is both light and crisp. Attractive acidity contrasts with the sparkling texture and the sugared citrus. It's very ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Vilacentinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: Cigarra, a cricket, is common in the Lisboa vineyards. The wine has a good mix of citrus and yellow fruit flavors, crisp and ripe at the same time. An attractive chalky, steely feel comes through in the acidity and the tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cigarra White (Lisboa)

description: Cigarra, a cricket, is common in the Lisboa vineyards. The wine has a good mix of citrus and yellow fruit flavors, crisp and ripe at the same time. An attractive chalky, steely feel comes through in the acidity and the tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cigarra White (Lisboa)

description: There is plenty of lively acidity in this crisp, light and fruity wine from the Fino family based in northeast Alentejo near the Spanish border. It is fresh, perfumed, full of hedgerow fruits, lemon and lively acidity. There is no need to age this delicious wine, drink now.
title: Monte da Penha 2013 Montefino Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is fruity, with a strong showing from the spirit. The wine is ripe with touches of wood aging and red fruit flavors. However, it does lack acidity.
title: Rozes NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This is fruity, with a strong showing from the spirit. The wine is ripe with touches of wood aging and red fruit flavors. However, it does lack acidity.
title: Rozes NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: It takes a while for this wine to make its presence felt. It is dry, reticent in its favors, hinting at fruitiness. A smoother, caramel and vanilla texture also shows attractive acidity. Even at the end, it remains a curiously mute wine.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This appealing blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez gives a fresh, crisp red fruited wine. Just the right amount of acidity produces a light, bright aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Light in color from the wood aging, this is also a light wine. Fruit is secondary to the acidity and strong wood-aging flavors. It leaves a dry aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Esporão NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Soft, fruity and off dry, this is a typically fresh and light-hearted Vinho Verde. Attractive apple and lemon flavors shine through the lightly prickly texture. Drink immediately.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, fruity and off dry, this is a typically fresh and light-hearted Vinho Verde. Attractive apple and lemon flavors shine through the lightly prickly texture. Drink immediately.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh and lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, citrus-driven wine. Its acidity is just right, fruity while well integrated. Some sweetness at the end makes it fine for apéritif drinking.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh and lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, citrus-driven wine. Its acidity is just right, fruity while well integrated. Some sweetness at the end makes it fine for apéritif drinking.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a fresh wine with attractive ripe fruits. Apples, bitter orange and a streak of citrus are coupled with pineapple acidity. It's a well-made, immediately drinkable wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz White (Alentejano)

description: This is a fresh wine with attractive ripe fruits. Apples, bitter orange and a streak of citrus are coupled with pineapple acidity. It's a well-made, immediately drinkable wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz White (Alentejano)

description: With high acidity, touches of new wood and dense tannins, this is a very wine-like vintage, Port. It has weight, formidable berry fruit and a slightly rustic finish.
title: Gran Cruz 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: With high acidity, touches of new wood and dense tannins, this is a very wine-like vintage, Port. It has weight, formidable berry fruit and a slightly rustic finish.
title: Gran Cruz 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A young firmly tannic wine still influenced by its wood aging. The berry fruits are ripe and chunky with a licorice and nutmeg character. It needs aging over several years.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: A young firmly tannic wine still influenced by its wood aging. The berry fruits are ripe and chunky with a licorice and nutmeg character. It needs aging over several years.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)
