description: This wine is soft and juicy, with ripe red fruits balanced by acidity. A firmer backdrop offers serious tannins and dark-coffee flavors. The wine needs a few more months, so wait until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: This wine is soft and juicy, with ripe red fruits balanced by acidity. A firmer backdrop offers serious tannins and dark-coffee flavors. The wine needs a few more months, so wait until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: A light, modern, just off-dry and fruity wine, freshened by bright lime and apricots, with a tang of orange zest. This is crisp, very clean, a good apéritif drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2008 Espirito Branco White (Tejo)

description: Juicy, sweet fruited wine, with a ripe, jammy character allied to fresh acidity and soft tannins. With enticing raspberry flavors, the wine is for easy and early drinking.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2007 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Juicy, sweet fruited wine, with a ripe, jammy character allied to fresh acidity and soft tannins. With enticing raspberry flavors, the wine is for easy and early drinking.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2007 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Soft and fruity, this has just a touch of tannins to go with the flavors of spice, blueberry and caramel. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Parras Vinhos 2010 Caval Bravo Red (Tejo)

description: Planting Alvarinho in the Lisboa region, many miles south of its native Minho, could be risky. But winemaker José Neiva Correia took a chance on the ocean-climate similarities and the result is a wine that's as fresh and crisp as possible. Citrus, green plums and lively acidity all come together in a wine that has a bright, spicy aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Aluado Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Maria Gomes and Bical, this soft, resiny wine has an intensely dry character. Apples as well as raisins give an intriguing set of flavors. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança Reserva Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Maria Gomes and Bical, this soft, resiny wine has an intensely dry character. Apples as well as raisins give an intriguing set of flavors. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Aliança Reserva Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This is fragrant, fresh and full of the original fruitiness of the wine. The wood aging, mainly in small barrels, has smoothed the wine out while leaving a hint of toastiness. At the end, the acidity is both delicious and refreshing.
title: Andresen NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Very light wood aging gives a complex dimension without losing the ripe yellow fruits that give the wine its rich character. Fresher acidity is integrating well with the spice and vanilla. Drink in 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: You want rich fruit, here it is. The wine is soft, with dense, sweet plum flavors followed by milk chocolate smoothness. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Fisherman Red (Tejo)

description: You want rich fruit, here it is. The wine is soft, with dense, sweet plum flavors followed by milk chocolate smoothness. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Fisherman Red (Tejo)

description: Light mouthfeel to this cinnamon- and herb-flavored wine. The fruit shows through with a black jelly character. Soft, rounded, ready for drinking.
title: Finisterra 2009 Red (Alentejano)

description: Unlike some of the old, wood-aged Moscatels, this gold colored wine has kept so much freshness and bright acidity to contrast the honeyed intensity and yellow fruit flavors. It is sweet, but not cloying because it is kept crisp by a touch of citrus that cuts through the honey. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes NV Moscatel de Setúbal Moscatel (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a full-bodied wine. It has some firm tannins under the red fruits and fresh acidity that gives a good structure. Wood aging has rounded out the mineral texture to give a rich feel at the end. It could age further, so drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2012 Adega de Pegões Colheita Seleccionada Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Aragonez, or Tempranillo, is grown more widely in Alentejo than in Setúbal where this wine comes from. The move gives the wine a softer character, with fresh blackberry acidity and a smooth, ripe fruitiness. It has some gentle tannins to balance the fruit. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2012 Adega de Pegões Aragonez (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Aragonez, or Tempranillo, is grown more widely in Alentejo than in Setúbal where this wine comes from. The move gives the wine a softer character, with fresh blackberry acidity and a smooth, ripe fruitiness. It has some gentle tannins to balance the fruit. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2012 Adega de Pegões Aragonez (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: This is a dusty, earthy wine that has structure rather than fruit. It is tough in tannins that give a dry character to the wine. There is the potential for juiciness as the wine opens up, so wait before drinking. It will be best after 2017.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Dona Maria Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Citrus and ripe yellow fruits weave harmoniously throughout this warm, rich wine. There is no wood, just generous fruitiness and acidity in a creamy texture. It is approachable now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, structured wine. It has complex black fruits and layers of spice from wood aging. Dominated by Alicante Bouschet, it is dark in color, packed with dense tannins and needing to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine, with impressive intensity for a red Vinho Verde, is ripe in attractive red berry flavors alongside crisp acidity. It is fruity, soft and ready to drink. Wines called Pardusco were exported from Portugal to England in the 14th century.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2013 Pardusco Red (Vinho Verde)

description: The Douro version of Paxis is a blend of Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. It is a rounded, smooth and spicy wine, with weight and richness. Packed with red berries and plums, it is fruity and structured, with tannins providing a strong base of support. Drink from 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Red (Douro)

description: Here is a solid, while also elegant, wine. It has rich berry and plum flavors, dark tannins and ample acidity. Already well integrated, these form a full, stylish wine that shows good potential. Drink this concentrated wine from 2017.
title: Terra Silvestre 2010 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Here is a solid, while also elegant, wine. It has rich berry and plum flavors, dark tannins and ample acidity. Already well integrated, these form a full, stylish wine that shows good potential. Drink this concentrated wine from 2017.
title: Terra Silvestre 2010 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a delicious wine, where the richness of Chardonnay dominates the fresher character of Arinto, resulting in a creamy, full-textured wine with touches of vanilla and ripe yellow fruits. It's well balanced, with the ripe acidity showing well at the end.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Margarides White (Tejo)

description: This dark-colored wine is herbal in character, showing spicy red berries and soft tannins. Wood aging has rounded out the structure, giving it some depth of flavor from fermentation in traditional open fermenters. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Falcoaria Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: The white grapevines at Carvalhas are located at the top of the hills that faces the Douro River, which helps retain acidity. This mineral and floral wine is textured,with a crisp citrus and ripe apricot flavor. It is still young and will be better from late 2016.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Branco da Quinta das Carvalhas White (Douro)

description: Released in 2015 to celebrate the 200th anniversary of Fonseca, this Port is a style that's a Fonseca specialty. Bottled without filtering allows the wine to age, and this was bottled in 2008. It is a beautiful full, ripe wine, with a generous structure of red fruits and raisins supported by a dense texture.
title: Fonseca NV Bicentenary Edition Crusted  (Port)

description: This big wine, now almost mature, shows dark plum and dense fruits that are pushed into shape by the firm tannins and wood aging flavors. The wine is dense and concentrated, with a fine juicy aftertaste that also promises further aging. Drink until 2020.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2011 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This young, ripely fruity wine is made to be drunk quickly and easily. It has light tannins, plenty of red fruits and acidity. It is smoothly textured, with a crisp aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Portada Winemaker's Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine already has delicious red fruits. It is soft, made to be drunk young with attractive fruitiness and light tannins. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Papa Figos Red (Douro)

description: While this wine is dry and firm, it is also full of ripe black-plum-skin flavors and juicy acidity. The two together have produced a wine that should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Barão de Vilar 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is full and richly fruity. It has a cool feel to it from the proximity of the vines to the ocean, which gives a mineral, crisp character that adds tang to the texture. Acidity lifts the ripe fruit, allowing it to age a few more months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has firm tannins as well as ripe fruits. A tough edge needs to soften as the wine matures. Drink from 2019
title: Symington Family Estates 2015 Altano Organically Farmed Vineyard Red (Douro)

description: Aged 12 months in French oak, this wine is rich and spicy. It has concentration as well as juicy blackberry fruits. With its edge of tannin and smooth texture, it is ripe, perfumed and ready to drink during 2017.
title: Sanguinhal 2014 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: This is a balanced wine from an estate owned by Herdade do Esporão based in the Alentejo. With ripe tannins and juicy fruit, it has some structure as well as blackberry fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2015 Minas Red (Douro)

description: Half-and-half Arinto and Fernão Pires, this ripe wine has lemon and pineapple fruits, along with tangy acidity. A strong herbal character gives lift as well as crispness. Drink the wine from mid-2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2015 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada White (Lisboa)

description: This perfumed, juicy wine is bright with red berries and acidity, while a core of firmer tannins gives structure. Even with this, the wine is forward, ready to drink with its long-drawn fruitiness and acidity.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2012 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Lisboa)

description: A sweet style of white Port, almost tawny in character, with nuts, acidity and old fruit flavors. Crystallized red fruits add an extra element. Drink by itself, or as long cocktail with tonic.
title: Rozes NV Porto White Reserva  (Port)

description: A sweet style of white Port, almost tawny in character, with nuts, acidity and old fruit flavors. Crystallized red fruits add an extra element. Drink by itself, or as long cocktail with tonic.
title: Rozes NV Porto White Reserva  (Port)

description: A firmly tannic wine, bringing out its cool climate origin. But the wine does have weight and the potential for showing black fruits and dark-plum skins, as well as a dry character. Keep for another year.
title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2010 Mina Velha Red (Lisboa)

description: A soft, gentle wine, this is clean and purely fruity. With ripe pear and apple flavors, it gets a tang of lemon acidity. It's already drinkable, but could age for several more months.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2010 Arinto Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This simple, ripe and fruity wine is destined for early drinking. It has rich dark plum fruits, a sprinkling of tannins and a fine juicy character. Very ready to drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2010 Alabastro Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a densely tannic wine, very ripe and concentrated. It is perfumed, rich, and blackberry fruited, showing the character of Touriga Nacional, but in an exaggerated form. Age the wine for at least two more years.
title: Adega Mayor 2010 Solista Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This is a densely tannic wine, very ripe and concentrated. It is perfumed, rich, and blackberry fruited, showing the character of Touriga Nacional, but in an exaggerated form. Age the wine for at least two more years.
title: Adega Mayor 2010 Solista Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: The fine qualities of Alicante Bouschet shine in this dense, darkly colored wine. With firm tannins and intense fruitiness combined, the wine has black plum, red currant and prominent acidity to balance the mineral texture. From an old single vineyard, the wine will need to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Falua 2011 Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: Produced from the Boavista vineyard, the base of Casa Santos Lima, this wine comes from old vines. It is a serious, complex and structured wine that will develop well over many years. Dark fruits, dense tannins and really fresh acidity are integrated into a fine wine. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a seriously dense wine—very structured and also with swathes of generous black plum and berry fruits. It is mineral in character, dark with firm tannins and still showing intense acidity that will need to soften. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Villa Oliveira Tinto Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: The vineyard is on typical steep slopes on the north bank of the Douro River with cooler corners for white wine. This wood-aged wine is in a bottle more suited to a liqueur and is impressively rich while preserving its cool feel. The mouthfeel has toastiness and ripe yellow fruits which are cut with a steely texture and pink grapefruit acidity. It's a wine to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Mirabilis Grand Reserva Branco White (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This is a powerful and concentrated wine. It is full of dusty, dark tannins that are still masking the rich blackberry and black currant fruits. There is a dry core here that will fill out as the wine matures. It's a serious, long-lasting wine that needs aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: The old vines do their work and produce a highly concentrated wine. It has a dusty tannic structure, the tannins held in suspension surrounded by ripe black plum flavors. The oak aging adds to the richness of this fine, balanced wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2018.
title: Vila da Fonte 2013 Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)

description: This is rich and dry yet also fruity. Perfumed in character, it is full, soft and smooth, allowing the acidity a place on the finish.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: Bright and fruity, with a tannic edge, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. This is food friendly, with a rich red-fruit flavor that's cut with a caramel note and strawberry acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: Bright and fruity, with a tannic edge, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. This is food friendly, with a rich red-fruit flavor that's cut with a caramel note and strawberry acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: Very aromatic, this has flavors of lychee and lemon. It has a spicy feel to it, giving it a soft, rounded texture. Ready to drink.
title: Barros 2011 White (Douro)

description: A medium-sweet sparkling wine, this bursts with a ripe apple flavor on the palate. The wine is crisp, deliciously clean and refreshing. Think of it like Moscato.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: The second label of Quinta de la Rosa is a ripe and smoothly fruity wine. Soft tannins and ample acidity harmonize well with the exuberant black fruits. It is big, rich and not needing aging; drink this rounded wine from 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 douROSA Red (Douro)

description: Bottled in 2015, this ripe LBV from the great 2011 vintage achieves a fine balance between firm, dry tannins that promise some aging and sweet black-cherry fruits that are attractive now. Just a touch of pepper gives a bite to the wine, although with the finish there is a fresher feel of acidity. Drink now or age until 2018.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Bottled in 2015, this ripe LBV from the great 2011 vintage achieves a fine balance between firm, dry tannins that promise some aging and sweet black-cherry fruits that are attractive now. Just a touch of pepper gives a bite to the wine, although with the finish there is a fresher feel of acidity. Drink now or age until 2018.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Made only in the best years, this wine is a full and generous expression of Alicante Bouschet. It is structured while also ripe in blackberry fruit and dark plum-skin tannins. Rich and juicy, this is an opulent wine that can be drunk from 2016.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)

description: Made only in the best years, this wine is a full and generous expression of Alicante Bouschet. It is structured while also ripe in blackberry fruit and dark plum-skin tannins. Rich and juicy, this is an opulent wine that can be drunk from 2016.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2010 Comporta Alicante Bouschet (Península de Setúbal)

description: From the home of Touriga Nacional, this is a seriously structured wine. Packed with tannins as well as initially austere fruit, it is still young. It will develop its perfumed black fruits and acidity as it ages to fill out the dense texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Ribeiro Santo Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: From the home of Touriga Nacional, this is a seriously structured wine. Packed with tannins as well as initially austere fruit, it is still young. It will develop its perfumed black fruits and acidity as it ages to fill out the dense texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Ribeiro Santo Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Touriga Nacional's home is believed to be the Dão and this 100% variety wine gives a very fine, ripe and textured red. Still young with dense tannins and a rich and concentrated structure, it is powerful and needs several years to reveal its real, rich self. Drink from 2018.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2012 Munda Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Touriga Nacional's home is believed to be the Dão and this 100% variety wine gives a very fine, ripe and textured red. Still young with dense tannins and a rich and concentrated structure, it is powerful and needs several years to reveal its real, rich self. Drink from 2018.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2012 Munda Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: This wine is rich and dense, with dusty tannins suspended in the powerful texture. Firm at the core, this is a black-plum driven wine that has fine acidity and a juicy aftertaste. It is concentrated and likely to remain so with its dark, brooding finish. Drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Herdade da Farizoa Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A blend of Aragonez and Syrah, this ripe wine offers red fruits and a soft texture, with just enough acidity to keep it crisp at the end. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Defesa do Esporão Rosé (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Aragonez and Syrah, this ripe wine offers red fruits and a soft texture, with just enough acidity to keep it crisp at the end. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Defesa do Esporão Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Ripe with red-berry flavors, this wine is fresh and crisp with acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine is soft and creamy. It has a touch of spice as well as lively lemon and orange-zest flavors, with a crisp tang of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine is soft and creamy. It has a touch of spice as well as lively lemon and orange-zest flavors, with a crisp tang of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A full and ripe wine, this is softly rich. It seems to miss out on the typical minerality of the Dão region, instead offering citrus and apricot flavors along with a touch of spice. The aftertaste continues the rounded character. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Encruzado (Dão)

description: Piled with tannins, this is still a dry wine. The weight of ripe black fruit gives it potential. Wait to drink this concentrated wine until 2019.
title: Frederico Meireles & Familia 2011 Grambeira Tinto Red (Douro)

description: While this wine shows plenty of wood at this young stage, it also has good fruit and tannins. It needs some time to develop and to integrate the wood. Drink from 2020.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This wine is firm although with plenty of attractive red fruits. It is perfumed with structure and tight tannins along with a streak of minerality. The wine should be ready to drink soon.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2012 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A superbly ripe wine that is selected from old vines, this is very rich and solidly structured. It has weight and ripe black-fruit notes that are laced with fresh acidity and a jammy plum flavor. It's dark, dense, full of great depth of flavor and worthy of serious aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 O Oenólgo Vinhas Velhas Red (Dão)

description: Made in open lagars, this is a full, ripe and very fruity wine. To balance this opulence, there is a strong element of wood aging, spice, dark tannins and a dense texture. This impressive wine has weight, concentration and aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Poeira 2010 Red (Douro)

description: Big, ripe and bold, this powerful wine is dense with acidity and black fruits in equal measure. With its dark, tannic aftertaste, it's a wine to age further. Drink from 2015.
title: Campolargo 2010 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: This wine, with its black color, barely escapes being too much. Initially, it seems too rich, too concentrated. But slowly its more elegant character, ripe and smooth, comes through. The acidity gives surprising freshness considering the weight and density. It does need time, so drink from 2017.
title: Muxagat 2011 Mux Tinto Red (Douro)

description: From selected grapes, this is a powerful, complex wine. It has huge richness, tasting of the Alentejo sun. At the same time, the fruit is firm and structured, slowly revealing its fresher berry character to balance the density. The delicious juicy aftertaste promises a fine future for this wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2008 Esporão Private Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: The natural acidity of Arinto is well known for sparkling wines in Bucelas close to Lisbon. Here it has the same fresh, crisp, tight character and vibrant texture. It's light, creamy and fruity, a fine apéritif style.
title: Quinta da Lapa NV Reserva Bruto Nature Arinto (Tejo)

description: A lively mousse characterizes this fresh and fruity wine. It's light, frothy in flavor as well as texture, an attractive concoction of apples and pink grapefruit. The final taste brings out acidity.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV Espumante Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A lively mousse characterizes this fresh and fruity wine. It's light, frothy in flavor as well as texture, an attractive concoction of apples and pink grapefruit. The final taste brings out acidity.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima NV Espumante Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This is a half-and-half blend of Touriga Nacional from northern Portugal and Castelão from the south. It's a wine that has plenty of fruit although the two grapes lie uneasily together. The juicy flavors and red berries are contrasted with a metallic acidity that isn't pleasant. Hopefully, the wine will fill out.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Red (Tejo)

description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is ripe, soft and with attractive red berry fruits over acidity. Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon make a happy blend of fruit and gentle structure. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Catty and grassy this is a very Sauvignon style of Sauvignon. It is tight, herbal and intense with a cool climate character that comes from the proximity of the Atlantic Ocean to the vineyards. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

description: Oak aging in large barrels has served to give this wine an immediate appeal. It's balanced, lightly structured and full of juicy fruits. Black currants, spice and red berry flavors enhance the fruitiness of the wine. Drink from mid-2016.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a dark wine, with an intense, dry structure and seemingly sweet fruit. It has a dense herb flavor, with notes of black plum, spice and bitter chocolate. Keep for a year.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Samora Red (Tejo)

description: This is a dark wine, with an intense, dry structure and seemingly sweet fruit. It has a dense herb flavor, with notes of black plum, spice and bitter chocolate. Keep for a year.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Samora Red (Tejo)

description: This soft wine is a blend of two local white grapes: Síria and Fonte Cal. Intense acidity and a cool-climate feel from the high- altitude vineyards make this crisp, with grapefruit and lemon flavors. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Beyra Branco White (Beira Interior)

description: This is one in a series of wines that blends Syrah with a major Douro grape, The wine has a severe, austere character, as much structure as fruit. Wood aging has helped to soften the wine and give density. It needs more time, so drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Touriga Franca-Syrah Red (Duriense)

description: This is the second wine from this showpiece quinta. The wine is a classic Douro blend dominated by Touriga Franca, giving a rich, soft and juicy character that is ready to drink. It has great fruit, spice and integrated tannins.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Sino da Romaneira Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, spicy wine offers strong wood flavors as well as bold red fruits, accompanied by acidity and rich tannins. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This blend of Fernão Pires, Arinto, Sauvignon Blanc and, unusually, Marsanne is ripe, with a deliciously perfumed character. Acidity and bright fruit give crispness that contrasts with the rich texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Vinho Branco White (Tejo)

description: Partially aged in oak, this wine is crisp, juicy and bright with citrus and acidity. Apples and pears come through strongly in this attractive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quanta Terra 2014 Terra a Terra Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Avesso is the hallmark white grape from the south of the Vinho Verde region. This wine is deliciously crisp, with a touch of oak to add spice. It is full of ripe apples, with an aftertaste that brims with acidity.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso Superior Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: Avesso is the hallmark white grape from the south of the Vinho Verde region. This wine is deliciously crisp, with a touch of oak to add spice. It is full of ripe apples, with an aftertaste that brims with acidity.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso Superior Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a ripe, juicy and accessible wine. Full of blackberries, soft tannins and with balanced acidity, the wine is more about fruit than structure. It is ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2013 Os Corvos Red (Bairrada)

description: This super-ripe wine is laced with powerful black fruits and spice from wood aging. It is forward and bold, not holding back in flavors and richness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, generous wine. The structure typical of Touriga Nacional is submerged in the perfumed blackberry and ripe plum flavors. It's a big wine, with tannins softly cushioned in the rich fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Named after the family that owns Rocim, this wine is ripe with soft tannins and juicy black-currant fruits. A core of dryness is surrounded by the attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Alves Vieira Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This medium-sweet rosé is a familiar style of local Portuguese wine. Fruity with raspberry flavor, it gives a slight a prickle on the tongue and has lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This soft, light wine boasts crisp fruit and acidity. It has a touch of bitterness, with almond and tight citrus flavors, and is ready to drink.
title: Casal do Conde 2015 Galileu White (Tejo)

description: This blend of Bical and Cercial is toasty and dominated by its wood aging. Wood-derived spice notes cover its crisper green fruits.
title: Vadio Wines 2015 Vadio Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A light wine with attractive berry flavors, this has a touch of caramel to go with its fruitiness and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2015 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This soft, yeasty and sweet blend of Fernão Pires and Bical is fruity with apple and pear flavors. It has just enough acidity to keep it crisp on the finish and makes an easy apéritif.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Branco Sparkling (Tejo)

description: If you like your Sauvignon Blanc herbal, then this is the wine for you. It's very fruity and New World in style, has tight acidity and is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: Produced in eastern Alentejo, near Spain, this light and soft wine is easy and drinkable. It has a smooth texture, just hinting at lemony acidity. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, warm, rounded wine. Yellow fruit flavors are cut with white fruit and acidity. It has a smooth, creamy texture that gives it extra richness. Drink now.
title: Valle da Fonte 2015 White (Douro)

description: Ripe apricot and pear flavors give this wine a rich character. It is packed with fruits with a creamy texture and balanced acidity at the end. This crisp wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Aluado Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This wine is spicy with ripe tannins and juicy berry fruits. It is soft and ready to drink with its balanced fruitiness and acidity.
title: Quinta Foz Torto 2013 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This simple, fruity, red-berry-flavored wine has bright acidity along with soft tannins. It's a great barbecue style of wine, fruity and ready to go with grilled meat.
title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)

description: With some fermentation in barrel, this wood-touched wine is rounded as well as fruity. Citrus and pineapple flavors give liveliness, with acidity cutting through the spice. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from vines aged between 25 and 30 years old, this is a ripe yellow and citrus-flavored wine. It has a strongly mineral edge as well as crisp, tight fruitiness. With its structure and tension, it is likely to age further. Drink from late 2017.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2015 Branco White (Douro)

description: Mint and eucalyptus aromas set the scene for a wine that is polished and sophisticated. It has firm tannins and balanced acidity that are well integrated into the flavors of berry fruit and wood. The wine is impressive, likely to age for 2–3 years or more.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2009 Muge Vingas Velhas Red (Tejo)

description: A serious, dense wine that impresses with its elegant structure and rich fruit. The wine has an austere mineral feel that contrasts with its black-currant flavors, and its ripe, juicy character.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2008 Falcoaria Classico Red (Tejo)

description: Structured and perfumed, this is a great expression of Touriga Nacional. It brings out a mineral character, with a severe edge to go with the dry tannins and black currant flavors. For aging over 4–5 years.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2009 TN Grand Reserva Touriga Nacional (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: An impressive wood-aged wine that offers a rich, complex series of ripe yellow-fruit flavors, a steely texture and layers of wood toast. It is finely balanced, a wine with great style, spice and final acidity.
title: Niepoort 2010 Redoma Branco White (Douro)

description: From old Alvarinho vines, this wine was fermented in wood to round it out and give extra richness. The wine certainly is full-bodied, intensely fruity, packed with apricot as well as citrus flavors. The toast element is as much a presence as a taste, giving the wine the possibility of aging. It's too fresh now; drink from 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Nostalgia 10 Barricas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, with eight months in barrel, this is a fruit and dark chocolate-flavored wine. It has a firm character and a touch of bitter extraction that is in the process of blowing away to give richness. At its base, this is a concentrated wine with a solid, dark structure and perfumed berry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Fiuza 2012 Ikon Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Mainly Touriga Nacional with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine. The perfumes of the Touriga are balanced by the tannins of the Cabernet to give a wine that's dense and firmly full in the mouth. Wood-aged, it has stylishness and a good promise for aging. Drink from 2018.
designation: Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma
title: Aveleda 2011 Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Bairrada)

description: This wine has a dry, firm and dark character. It also offers acidity to go with the tannins, ripe black fruits and a dense, concentrated structure. The wine should be aged longer, so drink from 2016.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2011 Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: One of the two estates in the Douro still in the hands of descendants of Dona Antonia Ferreira, who created so many Douro quintas, Vallado is able to produce great white wines as well as reds and Ports. This wood-aged Reserva is smooth, lightly toasty with freshness and citrus as well as pineapple and spice. It will age for several years and will be best from 2016.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: One of the two estates in the Douro still in the hands of descendants of Dona Antonia Ferreira, who created so many Douro quintas, Vallado is able to produce great white wines as well as reds and Ports. This wood-aged Reserva is smooth, lightly toasty with freshness and citrus as well as pineapple and spice. It will age for several years and will be best from 2016.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is the reserve wine from Chocapalha, a powerful expression of mainly Douro grapes in the Lisbon region. It has dense tannins at this young stage, with layers of firm plums and a solid texture. For balance, refreshing acidity lightens up the whole edifice. It does need to age however, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 Vinha Mãe Red (Lisboa)

description: A mix of grapes from southern Portugal and the north along with a hint of Syrah, this is a stylish wine, feeling fresher and lighter than its alcohol would suggest. It has that cool feel of Lisboa wines, a touch saline, and balances firm, impressive fruit and tannins with juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2010 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a powerful, dense and richly fruity wine, a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. With spice, sumptuous blackberry fruits and generous tannins, it's just reaching maturity. Offering great structure and immediate appeal, it is juicy, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2008 Quinta do Alqueve Red (Tejo)

description: Proudly boasting that there were no added sulphites in the winemaking process, this is a structured wine, firm with tannins that are backed with some juicy berry fruits. It is made to be drunk young although, in fact, it will be better with another six months of bottle aging, so wait until mid- 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Zero SO2 Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: This is a fine rich balanced wine. It has ripe fruits that suggest black currants, blackberries and a tight, stalky, mineral element. At the same time, it's generous, full of juicy acidity to contrast with the dusty tannin layer that keeps it all together. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Vila Santa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A darkly tannic wine, this is very firm and dense. Its red-berry fruit palate shows some of the perfume of Touriga Nacional, and its a concentrated wine that needs at least three-years aging.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2010 Cardal Red (Tejo)

description: A very herbal wine, with vegetal flavors of celery and asparagus. Citrusy acidity comes through at the end.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 Cister da Ribeira Branco White (Douro)

description: A year after harvest, this ripe wine is showing the creamy side of Alvarinho. It hasn't lost its bright fruit, giving lemon as well as light toast from wood aging. Drink this wine now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A year after harvest, this ripe wine is showing the creamy side of Alvarinho. It hasn't lost its bright fruit, giving lemon as well as light toast from wood aging. Drink this wine now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This attractive, fruity blend includes perfumed Syrah and juicy Alicante Bouschet. Touches of wood aging add spice and light tannins to this wine that is young but ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Premium Red (Lisboa)

description: Fruity and juicy, this wine has light tannins and red-berry flavors. It is an accessible wine, softly textured, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Manzwine 2014 Platónico Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is ripe and very full in the mouth. With tannins that are enveloped by rich black fruit, it is already drinkable. Dense plum and strawberry flavors are generous, with a touch of pepper. It is ready to drink.
title: Sobredos 2011 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a smooth, light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has red berry fruit tones, with a sweet, lightly tannic character and a juicy, mature aftertaste. It's soft and fruity, with bright acidity at the end.
title: Roquevale 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a smooth, light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has red berry fruit tones, with a sweet, lightly tannic character and a juicy, mature aftertaste. It's soft and fruity, with bright acidity at the end.
title: Roquevale 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: On the lean side, this is a dry, tannic wine with more structure than flesh. It's firm, with a strong sense of wood aging followed by some acidity. It could soften in 3–4 years.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Topázio Red (Douro)

description: A soft, fruity and lightweight wine. It has red fruits, light acidity and a simple attractive touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Caiado Red (Alentejano)

description: Chardonnay offers the roundness while Fernão Pires offers perfume in this attractive, ready-to-drink wine. It has bright, crisp lemon and green-apple acidity that is immediately appealing. Screwcap.
designation: Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: Named after the pheasant (Faisão), the wine is crisp enough to be refreshing. It is medium sweet and lightly textured with orange zest. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2016 Faisão White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, this is a smoothly ripe wine. Its cherry and spice flavors are given just a hint of structure built by a tannic edge. This soft juicy wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)

description: The wine, named after a typical mustache from the 19th century, is all fruit: ripe blackberries with balancing acidity. This is an easy ripe wine that will be great with barbecues this summer thanks to its soft tannins and drinkability.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Loureiro, Arinto and Avesso, this light and fruity wine has an edge of prickle along with great acidity and citrus flavors. It is a great summer food wine. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines NV Cascas White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Loureiro, Arinto and Avesso, this light and fruity wine has an edge of prickle along with great acidity and citrus flavors. It is a great summer food wine. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines NV Cascas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine. With its soft texture, perfumed white fruits and balanced acidity, it is the sort of wine that is ready for a warm day. Drink now.
title: Adega Mãe 2016 Pinta Negra White (Lisboa)

description: The wine is all tangy zesty fruit. With plenty of apple and grapefruit acidity, it is lively, textured and bright. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: Part of a range of wines that showcases the different styles of Portugal's regions, This wine is smooth, creamily textured and with a warm ripe character. It has pineapple and mango as well as crisper lemon flavors to give a rich wine that is still poised and finely balanced. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: Light, bright and fruity this is an easy-to-drink off-dry wine for the summer. It is clean and crisp, apples and pears set off by floral aromas. Drink now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Caiua a Noite White (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend of Trajadura and Alvarinho comes from the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is cool and perfumed with apricot as well as creamed pear flavors. Drink the wine now.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: There is a slight prickle that gives a surprise lift to this dry wine. Along with that is crisp fruit (lemon and apple flavors) and a refreshing amount of acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: Wonderfully balanced and structured, this is a wine that gives a complete series of flavors from chocolate, black stone fruits, layers of wood and finally the essential acidity. Its texture is grainy, dusty, firm and ready to age for several years.
title: Poeira 2008 Red (Douro)

description: This wine shows shows characters of berry fruits and soft tannins, matched by juicy acidity. Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives the structure while Trincadeira and Aragonez provide the smooth fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Valle Zangão Red (Tejo)

description: This wine shows juicy, ripe fruit without much structure. Full of red fruit, smoke tones and considerable acidity, this is a drink-now sipper.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2010 Vila Jardim Red (Tejo)

description: From a single vineyard in Estremoz, this structured and dense wine houses notes of bitter chocolate and tart berry. It's full of tannins and needs time to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Dom Martinho Red (Alentejano)

description: From a single vineyard in Estremoz, this structured and dense wine houses notes of bitter chocolate and tart berry. It's full of tannins and needs time to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Dom Martinho Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm and ripe, this is a richly juicy wine full of berries. Sweet tannins dominate the firmer structure at the back. There is some concentration and the wine is still young, so it's best to drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do Perdigão 2009 Terras de Monforte Escolha Red (Alentejo)

description: Firmly tannic, it's based entirely on the rich structure of Alicante Bouschet. It has an interplay of dark fruits, spicy wood-aging and acidity. They are combining well to give a well-structured wine that's ripe and juicy. Drink from 2017.
title: Fiuza 2012 Premium Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: A smooth, rounded wine, with depth of black berry, dark plum and licorice flavors. It is solid, chunky, powerfully ripe, full of pepper, spice as well as sweet acidity. Very enticing and rich.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2007 Fitapreta Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Although this wine was wood-aged, the toast is subtle, smoothing into the creaminess of the ripe yellow fruits. A blend of Chardonnay and Viosinho, this is beautifully textured wine, suggesting aging potential.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2008 Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Although this wine was wood-aged, the toast is subtle, smoothing into the creaminess of the ripe yellow fruits. A blend of Chardonnay and Viosinho, this is beautifully textured wine, suggesting aging potential.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2008 Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Fermented in an open stone lagar, giving great depth of color as well as rich, plummy concentration. The wine is ripe and bold, a plethora of licorice and bitter coffee to go with the rich red fruit. The tannins and acidity are finely in balance.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2007 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Fermented in an open stone lagar, giving great depth of color as well as rich, plummy concentration. The wine is ripe and bold, a plethora of licorice and bitter coffee to go with the rich red fruit. The tannins and acidity are finely in balance.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2007 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This grouping of top growers makes some of the best value wines from the Douro. Tres Bagos is their introductory bottling, a ripe, tarry firmly structured wine that is ready to drink, the juicy, black currant fruit delicious now.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2005 Tres Bagos Red (Douro)

description: With its ripe tannins and soft, juicy black fruit, this is an immediately drinkable wine. It has a crisp layer of acidity, giving it a light touch. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Vinha Maria Premium Red (Dão)

description: With its ripe tannins and soft, juicy black fruit, this is an immediately drinkable wine. It has a crisp layer of acidity, giving it a light touch. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Vinha Maria Premium Red (Dão)

description: This family-owned estate has produced an immediately attractive entry-level wine. Lightly spiced with wood, it blends Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca to show black fruit, ripe tannins and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Muros de Vinha Red (Douro)

description: Sometimes it seems the Portuguese winemakers make random blends. This 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional is a case in point. Yet, the first grape softens the second to make a wine that is easy, ripe and ready to drink. The finish, with its touches of toast, is well balanced by acidity. So the random works. Drink from 2018.
designation: Terra de Touros Pinot Noir-Touriga Nacional
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Pinot Noir-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)

description: Young Touriga Nacional vines produced this crisp, refreshing wine. With red currant flavor and a light touch of caramel, it's both fruity and full in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior Rosé (Douro)

description: Young Touriga Nacional vines produced this crisp, refreshing wine. With red currant flavor and a light touch of caramel, it's both fruity and full in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior Rosé (Douro)

description: Fine acidity on this crisp, raspberry-flavored wine. With an extra year aging it demands to be drunk, offering a pleasurable food-friendly style.
title: Fiuza 2009 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Fine acidity on this crisp, raspberry-flavored wine. With an extra year aging it demands to be drunk, offering a pleasurable food-friendly style.
title: Fiuza 2009 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Earthy wine that has rich, chewy fruit, its tannins a serious element. There is weight as well, the wine ripe, full, with juicy plum flavors.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2008 Pactus Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: All white fruit, lemon and grapefruit, soft and with a hint of softness. It's a fine apéritif wine, right up front and friendly. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 What's for Dinner? Branco White (Tejo)

description: Aged for a year in wood, this concentrated, structured wine is seriously rich and concentrated. It has a dark texture and smoky flavors of licorice as well as black plum fruit. It is complex and powerful and would benefit from more aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Aged for a year in wood, this concentrated, structured wine is seriously rich and concentrated. It has a dark texture and smoky flavors of licorice as well as black plum fruit. It is complex and powerful and would benefit from more aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Romaneira's position on the north bank of the Douro above Pinhao always delivers rich, smooth and powerful wine. Its tannins, beautifully integrated into the ripe black fruits, are rounded, offering a dry core and a rich future. The wine, the top offering from this estate, is almost ready to drink. Just wait until at least 2018.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Romaneira's position on the north bank of the Douro above Pinhao always delivers rich, smooth and powerful wine. Its tannins, beautifully integrated into the ripe black fruits, are rounded, offering a dry core and a rich future. The wine, the top offering from this estate, is almost ready to drink. Just wait until at least 2018.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Soft-textured wine, with an edge of minerality, this is deliciously rich, while presenting plenty of fresh acidity. It is ripe, full in the mouth, an explosion of white and yellow fruits, with a great burst of acidity.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2009 Guadalupe Selection Branco Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: This is a bright, fruity wine, full of acidity and generous red fruit flavors with a soft texture. This will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2012 Chão das Rolas Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Bical produces delicious pear and apple flavored wines. This bright, fruity wine is a fine example of this creamy freshness. It is a wine for drinking now, while fresh and crisp at the end.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: This is a very perfumed wine, with the addition of Moscatel in the blend, adding the lychee flavor. It's textured with a crisp edge that allows the wine to retain its fresh character. This is a wine to be drunk young.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2012 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Blending Castelão and Arinto from the high elevation Quinta dos Loridos, this is a tight, bright wine, with an edge of almond bitterness, as well as citrus fruits. It's a crisp, bone-dry wine with no dosage.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Loridos Vintage Extra-Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: One of the most popular Vinho Verdes, this is in a light, medium-sweet style. Very fresh and crisp, with some attractive citrus acidity, and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2012 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Aragonez, aka Tempranillo, here produces a ripe, juicy, red-fruit laden wine. Hedgerow fruits add a more stalky character to the palate. The whole wine is generously suffused with fresh acidity. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 Ciconia Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: Only the second garrafeira (the name means special selection) made by the Borba cooperative, this is a serious, complex wine that wears its tannins and rich fruits lightly. The dried fruits, chocolate and edge of bitterness all promise aging potential. There's a fresh, juicy feel to the aftertaste, before the spice from wood aging kicks back in.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2002 Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: Only the second garrafeira (the name means special selection) made by the Borba cooperative, this is a serious, complex wine that wears its tannins and rich fruits lightly. The dried fruits, chocolate and edge of bitterness all promise aging potential. There's a fresh, juicy feel to the aftertaste, before the spice from wood aging kicks back in.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2002 Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: Although there is some Trincadeira in the blend, this legendary wine is really a paean to Alicante Bouschet. Produced in traditional open stone fermenters, it exudes power and density. Black plum and berry fruit contends with concentrated tannins that are still very much in evidence. Determinedly old style in approach, it will age for many years. Drink from 2021.
title: Mouchão 2011 Red (Alentejo)

description: A curiously spicy, herbal wine that seems to have lost its fruit. There is a bitter edge that may soften over the next few months.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2016 Herdade dos Templários Touriga Nacional Rosé (Tejo)

description: A juicy, spicy wine, packed with open, generous black fruits. The blend of Castelão and Trincadeira gives blackberries, some raisins and a smooth chocolate underlay.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 Falcoaria Red (Ribatejo)

description: A juicy, spicy wine, packed with open, generous black fruits. The blend of Castelão and Trincadeira gives blackberries, some raisins and a smooth chocolate underlay.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 Falcoaria Red (Ribatejo)

description: Made from the Arinto grape, this wine has a lively, vibrant, lifted green fruit character, very crisp like apple skins, deliciously fresh, with just some caramel edges to round it out. To finish, it shows some structure from the crisp acidity.
title: Quinta do Avelar 2004 Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This wine is flavorful, with plenty of blackberry fruit, as well as a dense, tannic heart. The fruit's edges are smoothed by the wood aging, but it is still fruit that dominates, ripe, hearty and packed with acidity to finish.
title: Messias 2004 Quinta do Cachão Touriga Franca (Douro)

description: A firm, ripe wine, with great red fruit flavors, dark tannins and an edge of coffee. There is some toast element here in this still young wine. Hopefully the just overripe fruit edge will disappear as it develops.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2004 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Bright pink in color, a caramel flavor resting on taut strawberries and a fresh berry character. There is a touch of apple to go with the light, bright style. Drink this year.
title: Casa do Valle 2009 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh, with considerable acidity, this is as crisp as it gets. Apple and lemon juice dominate the flavors, with just a light touch of softness to calm the acidity.
title: Borges NV Fita Azul Attitude Reserva Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Although this wine is rich and laden with wood-aging flavors, it certainly does not need such a heavy bottle. Spice, tobacco, new wood and red fruits are well combined in a wine that ripe and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2010 Vale de Mata Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Deep, black-colored wine, firm, serious and still young. It has power and concentration, dark berry fruits, herbal and spice flavors and a core of wood. This is a wine for long-term aging to soften the tannins.
title: Luis Soares Duarte 2006 Momentos Red (Douro)

description: Named after family members called Maria, this is a limited-edition wine, very smooth and rich, offering its character slowly. It has complex acidity, smoky tannins and a hugely dense extracted texture. It needs aging over 5–6 years.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2007 Marias da Malhadinha Red (Alentejano)

description: Want dense tannins? Then this your wine. Of course, it has much more than that. It has mineral-driven stone fruit flavors, a sense of terroir, of restrained power. It also has a serious side, and definite aging potential.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Escada Red (Douro)

description: Mining a rich vein of sweet black plum fruits, this is big and powerful while held together with firm tannins, very ripe fruit, a smoky wood character and a ripe, juicy finish. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Quinta de Cabriz Four C Red (Dão)

description: Mining a rich vein of sweet black plum fruits, this is big and powerful while held together with firm tannins, very ripe fruit, a smoky wood character and a ripe, juicy finish. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Quinta de Cabriz Four C Red (Dão)

description: Dense, dusty tannins are the hallmark of this powerful and impressive wine. It has great rich black fruit, spiced with wood, layered with bitter chocolate, plum skins and a dry core that promises good aging.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2007 Tres Bagos Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: Dense, dusty tannins are the hallmark of this powerful and impressive wine. It has great rich black fruit, spiced with wood, layered with bitter chocolate, plum skins and a dry core that promises good aging.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2007 Tres Bagos Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: Selected fruit and longer barrel aging are the hallmarks of this Reserva. With its bright mint flavors, well integrated into the firm tannins and plum skin fruits, this is a wine ready to age.
title: Casa Cadaval 2007 Padre Pedro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Selected fruit and longer barrel aging are the hallmarks of this Reserva. With its bright mint flavors, well integrated into the firm tannins and plum skin fruits, this is a wine ready to age.
title: Casa Cadaval 2007 Padre Pedro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Dominated by Touriga Nacional, this impressive and concentrated wine has a powerful structure, dark tannins, black stone fruit and layered wood. With its dense character, it is made for aging, and should be cellared for 4–5 years.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2008 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Like other wines in the Fronteira range, this is certainly powerful. It is also ripely smooth, its dark tannins wrapped in a velvet, dusty texture and ripe plum juice fruits. Important, complex wine.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Quinta da Fronteira Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: Like other wines in the Fronteira range, this is certainly powerful. It is also ripely smooth, its dark tannins wrapped in a velvet, dusty texture and ripe plum juice fruits. Important, complex wine.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Quinta da Fronteira Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: A fascinating blend of five varieties, this solid, black wine shows structure, dense tannins, an enticing perfume and big, ripe fruits. The finish has acidity, but also those powerful tannins. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Campolargo 2008 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: A fascinating blend of five varieties, this solid, black wine shows structure, dense tannins, an enticing perfume and big, ripe fruits. The finish has acidity, but also those powerful tannins. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Campolargo 2008 Rol de Coisas Antigas Red (Bairrada)

description: The second wine produced by the Roquette family of Quinta do Crasto and the Cazes of Château Lynch-Bages. It is rich, hugely spiced, with violet aromas and black currant fruits, a leathery edge to the texture. The alcohol leaves a slight burn, which blows off.
title: Roquette e Cazes 2006 Red (Douro)

description: Wood-aged wine, smooth and rich. Spice and toast combine with elegant soft tannins, sweet stone fruits and tight acidity. It feels rich, not heavy, its velvet texture gliding over the palate.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2007 Vinha Grande Red (Douro)

description: Wood-aged wine, smooth and rich. Spice and toast combine with elegant soft tannins, sweet stone fruits and tight acidity. It feels rich, not heavy, its velvet texture gliding over the palate.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2007 Vinha Grande Red (Douro)

description: A lightly wood aged wine, deliciously fresh and creamy, hinting at smooth Chardonnay-like textures. A light perfume from Malvasia adds piquancy to this attractive, textured wine.
title: Quinta do Filoco 2008 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A wood-aged wine, with ripe yellow fruits, spice and a smooth, creamy character, kept firmly in place by apple skin texture and a flinty edge.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2009 Branco White (Douro)

description: Normally found in the Dão region further north, the Alfrocheiro in Alentejo produces a soft wine with light tannins and juicy acidity. Flavors of cherries and red plums give it a fruity aspect. It is warm, rich and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: The wine is structured, flavored with the wood aging as much as the fruit. It has a spicy burnt character that contrasts with the more juicy black currant flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Terra Silvestre 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: The wine is structured, flavored with the wood aging as much as the fruit. It has a spicy burnt character that contrasts with the more juicy black currant flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Terra Silvestre 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: This caramel-flavored wine has a light red fruit character. It is off dry and needs to be severely chilled.
title: Calamares 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This caramel-flavored wine has a light red fruit character. It is off dry and needs to be severely chilled.
title: Calamares 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Darkly rich, this is a smooth, sophisticated wine that packs a punch of tannin under all its opulent black fruit. From a single parcel of the La Rosa vineyard named for the intense heat there in summer, it's concentrated and dense, with a great future ahead of it. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Vale do Inferno Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Darkly rich, this is a smooth, sophisticated wine that packs a punch of tannin under all its opulent black fruit. From a single parcel of the La Rosa vineyard named for the intense heat there in summer, it's concentrated and dense, with a great future ahead of it. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Vale do Inferno Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Dark gold in color, this Port relishes its age. Like an aged tawny, it has lost its fruit at this mature stage, while gaining the rich, intense character that comes from long wood aging. It has concentrated acidity and a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Kopke NV 30 Years Old White  (Port)

description: Dark gold in color, this Port relishes its age. Like an aged tawny, it has lost its fruit at this mature stage, while gaining the rich, intense character that comes from long wood aging. It has concentrated acidity and a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Kopke NV 30 Years Old White  (Port)

description: The flagship wine of the São Miguel estate, this impresses with its dense tannins and opulent black fruits. It's fermented in open lagares and aged 18 months in wood. While its concentration and power are obvious, its elegance is surprising. Structured to age, this will be best from 2020.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: From vineyards in the upper Douro Superior, this single estate Vintage Port is dense and richly sweet. It has the right tannic structure, perfumed black fruits as well as a dense, concentrated character. It is just setting out on its aging, and will be best from 2025.
title: Duorum 2013 Vinha de Castelo Melhor Vintage  (Port)

description: With just the right black currant character, this is a rich, structured wine. It has weight and richness of course, but it is the solid tannins and tight texture that distinguish it. The wine is not quite ready to drink, so wait until 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alentejano)

description: From an estate in the far west of the Cima Corgo region, close to Regua, this wine is structured and deliciously ripe in black fruits. It has a solid base of tannins that is allied to perfumed acidity and a hint of wood aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Rich and smooth, this is a ripe and fruity wine. It has hints of wood aging as well as dried fruit to bring out a tawny character. The wine is nicely poised between freshness and some maturity.
title: Quinta do Portal NV Portal 6 Barrels Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of fruit and equally full of dense tannins. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid, powerful and spicy from wood aging. The structure is still young in this impressive wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Perescuma Red (Tejo)

description: Produced from young vines, this attractive, ready-to-drink wine is soft and ripe. There are just enough tannins to give this fruity wine its shape. The acidity and the spice add another element to this rich wine.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Dona Santana Red (Dão)

description: Tangy and showing some good aging, this is a ripe wine that has a bite of spirit and acidity making it dry, with touches of the old wood used in the aging. It's a well-made wine, classic tawny in character.
title: Messias NV Special Reserve  (Port)

description: Green plums and attractive spice combine in this easygoing wine. Its acidity and bright aftertaste emphasize its dry character and its place at the table. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Casas White (Douro)

description: The wine, a blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Siria, comes from Vidigueira, one of the cooler regions of the Alentejo. That gives the wine its crispness while also allowing it to have a ripe yellow-fruit character. With its spice and final crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2016 Pato Frio Selecção White (Alentejano)

description: This is a deliciously creamy wine with light white fruits and refreshing acidity. With its cool texture and minerality, it is crisp and zesty and ready to drink.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: This smooth, rich wine shows both ripe fruit and wood aging flavors. It has a mineral texture, plenty of citrus as well as pear and peach flavors, the whole gathered into toastiness. It would benefit from another year, so drink from 2015.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Poento Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Mainly from Castelão with a little Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a ripe, full-bodied and complex wine. Tannins shoot through the solid black fruits, while acidity laces the texture. Flavors of chocolate, spice and final freshness promising short-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Capoeira Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Mainly from Castelão with a little Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a ripe, full-bodied and complex wine. Tannins shoot through the solid black fruits, while acidity laces the texture. Flavors of chocolate, spice and final freshness promising short-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Capoeira Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A smooth and rich wine that has a good mix between wood aging and ripe plum flavors. Tannins present a judicious support for the full fruits. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Fiuza 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Dão Sul's venture in the Alentejo has produced a wine that is soft, rich, all ripe berry fruits and gentle tannins. It's a warm, fruit-driven wine that has a rounded feel, with the acidity at the end giving some freshness. Drink now.
title: Dão Sul 2009 Monte de Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Although there was no wood aging, a toasty character gives the wine richness and smooth fruits. Apricot, peach and pear flavors have intensity and ripeness. Drink this wine now and until 2018.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Celebrating the beaches and waters around Lisbon in name, this ripe and fruity wine is forward with black fruits and soft tannins. It's an easy, rich wine, finishing with bright acidity.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2009 Mar da Palha Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe and smooth wine is fragrant, spicy and delicious in apricot and peach flavors. There is a crisp texture to the wine, with streaks of freshness and minerality. The finish has refreshing acidity and a salty kick, making this ideal for pairing with food.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Parus Branco Antão Vaz (Península de Setúbal)

description: This ripe and smooth wine is fragrant, spicy and delicious in apricot and peach flavors. There is a crisp texture to the wine, with streaks of freshness and minerality. The finish has refreshing acidity and a salty kick, making this ideal for pairing with food.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Parus Branco Antão Vaz (Península de Setúbal)

description: Still holding its deep red color, this is otherwise a wine that is now mature and ready to drink, hailing from the first vintage of the Vadio Project. It has earthy flavors of bramble and undergrowth, and a dry character that will become more pronounced over the next years. Luis Patrão started the organic Vadio Project to preserve the native Baga grape grown nine miles from the Atlantic Ocean in central Portugal.
title: Vadio Wines 2005 Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: Still holding its deep red color, this is otherwise a wine that is now mature and ready to drink, hailing from the first vintage of the Vadio Project. It has earthy flavors of bramble and undergrowth, and a dry character that will become more pronounced over the next years. Luis Patrão started the organic Vadio Project to preserve the native Baga grape grown nine miles from the Atlantic Ocean in central Portugal.
title: Vadio Wines 2005 Vadio Baga (Bairrada)

description: The mineral structure gives this wine an initially austere character. There is a balance between acidity and textured black-plum skin and berry fruit flavors. There are also firm, dry tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Palestra Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a dense wine, packed with tannins as well as rich dark-plum flavor. It tastes warm and ripe, with a juicy fruitiness that also has a firm, solid structure. Spice and acidity complete this wine that should be aged, so drink from 2017.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2013 Adega de Pegões Red (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: This is a ripe and warm wine, with generous fruits and a structure that is cushioned by the rich black and red fruit flavors. It has light hints of wood aging, shown in the notes of spice and vanilla that have smoothed the tannins and tamed the acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe and warm wine, with generous fruits and a structure that is cushioned by the rich black and red fruit flavors. It has light hints of wood aging, shown in the notes of spice and vanilla that have smoothed the tannins and tamed the acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: A finely structured wine that brings forward its firm tannins, but also keeps black berry and red plum fruit flavors. It has an edge of leanness, minerality perhaps, its tannins emphasizing dryness. The balance between the structure and the fruit produces a good value wine that is on a knife edge of exciting tension.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2005 Domini Red (Douro)

description: The elegance of the grape shines through this wine, which wears its alcohol level easily and effortlessly. The richness is transmuted into soft red fruits, spice from wood and a smooth texture. To finish, the wine is fresh, giving a burst of juiciness.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2005 Trincadeira (Alentejano)

description: A deep pink colored wine, this is soft, fruity and ripe. It has just enough acidity while also having an edge of tannins that leave a bitter aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Quinta do Mondego Rosé (Dão)

description: This is a soft fruity wine. It has attractive red-fruit flavors, very ripe fruit and light acidity at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Xairel Red (Tejo)

description: This is a soft, easy wine with the lightest texture and crisp apple and pear flavors. It is gentle and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine full of wild strawberry fruit. It is soft although with fine acidity and a crisp aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine full of wild strawberry fruit. It is soft although with fine acidity and a crisp aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is spicy, with a dry, dusty character that's laid over the blackberry fruit. It is full on the palate, almost sweet in character, showing a soft, warm finish.
title: Monte Seis Reis 2010 Boa Memória Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe red fruits dominate this warm, round wine. The light touch of acidity makes the fruit seem forward and bright, yet the core remains rich and smooth. Its soft tannins make this ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Winemaker's Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: Fruity, juicy and packed with red berry fruit, this is an attractive, easy-drinking wine. It is rich, with good dense flavors that are balanced by raspberry-like acidity on the finish.
title: Caves Bonifacio 2009 Aragonez (Lisboa)

description: This is perfumed, soft, warm and ripe, with smooth peach and mulberry flavors that are offset by a citrusy tang. It's a fine apéritif.
title: Herdade Grande 2011 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: Smooth and oily in texture, this is round and full of pear juice flavor. There is just a touch of green legume, adding piquancy to this ripe wine. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Perfumed, with a soft, smooth texture, this has flavors of tropical fruit, peach and a hint of lemongrass that make for a rich wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Perfumed, with a soft, smooth texture, this has flavors of tropical fruit, peach and a hint of lemongrass that make for a rich wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Oscar Quevedo is one member of a new generation of winemakers bringing a breath of fresh air to the Douro. His everyday wines, like this one, are friendly, fruity and delicious when consumed young. This is a great wine for barbecue.
title: Quevedo 2010 Oscar's Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Spicy and ripe, this is a wine that is soft, full in the mouth and with generous tannins. It does have a mineral edge that adds shape to the wine and crispens the black-plum flavor. Drink the wine now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Spicy and ripe, this is a wine that is soft, full in the mouth and with generous tannins. It does have a mineral edge that adds shape to the wine and crispens the black-plum flavor. Drink the wine now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: There is much of the perfumed character of Touriga Nacional in this wine that goes with the ripe, juicy black fruits and acidity. At this stage, there is a strong spice from the wood aging and this needs to soften before the wine will be ready to drink. Wait until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This ripe wine comes from the wide range of private collection wines by winemaker Domingos Soares Franco. It has acidity while also showing fine perfumes and a tangy texture. The wine is full in the mouth with a warm, rich aftertaste. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Colecção Privada Verdelho (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, the wine is light, bright and attractively perfumed. It has juicy, tangy character, enhanced by the lemon zest and made richer with the melon fruits. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2015 Private Selection White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This wine comes from the heart of the Dão region. It is firm and dark with tannins and a concentrated texture. Fine acidity cuts through the black-fruit character. The wine is ready to drink.
