title: J. & F. Lurton 2005 Pilheiros Red (Douro)

description: Floral, crisp, this wine hints at spice, showing green and yellow fruit acidity, cut grass aromas, and dried apricot sweetness. It is relatively full, but this doesn't detract from the apéritif-like freshness.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2007 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: A lively, juicy wine, with pepper, cinnamon and green herbs. The fruits are red berry and rhubarb, giving a wine that is both fruity and edged with rawness. The acidity is prominent, layering over the dry tannin core.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Cortello Red (Estremadura)

description: Named after the Pombal, or dovecote at Vesúvio, this is a soft, ready-to-drink wine. It has attractive acidity and black currant flavors. Layers of tannins offer support while not suggesting any long-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2010 Pombal do Vesúvio Red (Douro)

description: There are signs of juiciness in this young wine although for now, it is firm and dry. With a hard edge and bitterness it will need aging to show roundness. Drink from 2018.
title: Messias 2010 Quinta do Penedo Red (Dão)

description: Swathes of fruit come across this ripe wine. To balance, it has a gritty structure that is firm in its tannins. It's a ripe, lightly perfumed wine that will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2011 Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: Swathes of fruit come across this ripe wine. To balance, it has a gritty structure that is firm in its tannins. It's a ripe, lightly perfumed wine that will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2011 Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: The white and red Pêra-Manca are cult wines in Portugal, only released in the best years. The white has partial barrel fermentation, giving great richness and depth of flavor, as well as smooth toastiness. With its high proportion of Antâo Vaz, it is very white Burgundy in its richness and sense of mineral terroir. Delicious acidity rounds the wine out.
title: Cartuxa 2005 Pêra-Manca White (Alentejo)

description: With winemakers Anselmo Mendes and Diogo Lopes, there is a good pedigree to this wine. It shows in the dark tannins, the rich fruit and the concentrated structure. The wine is rich with great power although that is mitigated by the acidity and fresh aftertaste. The wine is, of course, still young and should be drunk from 2020.
title: Adega Mãe 2012 Dory Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: With winemakers Anselmo Mendes and Diogo Lopes, there is a good pedigree to this wine. It shows in the dark tannins, the rich fruit and the concentrated structure. The wine is rich with great power although that is mitigated by the acidity and fresh aftertaste. The wine is, of course, still young and should be drunk from 2020.
title: Adega Mãe 2012 Dory Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of four grapes, including Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, the white Chaminé has a full feel to it. An open oily texture also preserves herbaceous crispness and a final burst of acidity.
title: Cortes de Cima 2010 Chaminé White (Alentejano)

description: With short wood aging, the wine has preserved its primary attractive blackberry juice flavor. It is solid and chunky, while keeping freshness. For drinking now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2009 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is all about fruit. It is dry and so fresh and crisp with apple and green pear flavors. There is a light prickle there that adds a dancing lightness to this refreshing wine.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is all about fruit. It is dry and so fresh and crisp with apple and green pear flavors. There is a light prickle there that adds a dancing lightness to this refreshing wine.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine has plenty of fruit, the right layers of tannin. And yet it seems one-dimensional—something that can happen with Touriga Nacional. The depth and complexity found in previous vintages of this wine are missing. So you get bold black fruits and a stylish structure in a wine that is almost ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passadouro Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: The wine has plenty of fruit, the right layers of tannin. And yet it seems one-dimensional—something that can happen with Touriga Nacional. The depth and complexity found in previous vintages of this wine are missing. So you get bold black fruits and a stylish structure in a wine that is almost ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passadouro Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is a clever blend with the natural ripeness of Pinot Noir in Portugal smoothing out the firmer tannins of Touriga Nacional. The result is a rich, soft wine, just lifted by acidity and anchored by a background of cherry fruits and black currant. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: The Arinto is a local grape as far as Lisboa is concerned, and this wine seems right at home here. Made from old vines, it is fresh, tangy and destined to be drunk young with locally-caught Atlantic Ocean fish. The wine has a pure, clean, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: The blend of Bical and Arinto is typical of the sparkling wines from the Bairrada region. Together they give a crisp style of wine, bright with acidity and tangy with citrus and orange peel. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal Spumante Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Casteão and Syrah—the four grapes in this blend are gently wood aged. That has smoothed out the already gentle tannins, giving the wine a creamy ripe texture enhanced by red fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Conde 2015 Quinta Vista Red (Lisboa)

description: Syrah and Trincadeira, both known to be spicy, fit comfortably together in this generous, soft and fruity wine. Juicy black fruits and acidity come together with the tangy texture to produce a wine with an attractive pepper bite as well as great fruitiness. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Smart Dog Syrah-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a spicy wood-laden wine. Considering it is three-years-old, it seems likely that the burnt-wood flavor will remain. That spoils what is otherwise a ripe and juicy wine with fine black fruits.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cabriz Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: The wine is full of the warmth of the Alentejo sun. While it does have a crisp and juicy side, it is the richness and concentration that makes it attractive. Black fruits and toast from the oak aging are balanced and cut through with acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is slightly off dry, with an attractively perfumed character from the Moscatel Roxo in the blend. Its acidity and ripe strawberry fruit are warm and smooth with just the lightest orange-peel zest at the end. Drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Serras de Azeitão Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: With a touch of wood aging, this is a bright yet toasty wine. Its fruitiness shows as citrus, pineapple and pear, with a tangy edge. There is aging potential here, to round out the wine and bring out its softer side. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Light in color, the wine from hand-picked Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Barroca grapes has strawberry flavors, light acidity and a fresh finish. It is, of course, sweet, hinting at the spirit added to halt fermentation. It's an attractive wine from the Sogrape family group, ready for chilling. Drink now.
title: Offley NV Rosé  (Port)

description: This wine is as rich as its dark color suggests. It has a sense of power, while it has also kept its fruitiness. There is good acidity with wood aging flavors, the spirit only showing at the end.
title: Sao Pedro NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The ripe, spicy strawberry and orange fruitiness of this wine is immediately attractive. It has lively acidity within a rich framework. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2016 Monte da Peceguina Rosé (Alentejano)

description: The three grapes (castas) are Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. The blend makes a satisfyingly structured wine with some firm tannins as well as ripe fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: The three grapes (castas) are Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. The blend makes a satisfyingly structured wine with some firm tannins as well as ripe fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: This delicious and refreshing wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley, giving it a cool character along with a mineral and spice texture. The wine is perfumed from the 20% Moscatel in the blend. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Porca de Murça Branco White (Douro)

description: A ripe, smooth wine made mainly from Viosinho and Gouveio, this is creamy-textured, rich with yellow fruits. It is cut by crisper acidity and a delicious, refreshing lemon-curd flavor. Drink now.
title: Quevedo 2016 Oscar's White White (Douro)

description: Soft and fruity, this has broad red-fruit flavors. Acidity, light tannins and a ripe, perfumed character from the blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional make it rich and warming.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bread & Cheese Red (Lisboa)

description: Winemaker Mario Pinheiro worked in South Africa and with the Chenin Blanc grape there. Bringing it to the Alentejo produces a surprisingly similar ripe, warm style of wine that's still fresh and citrusy while also having signs of bright pineapple and minerality. Drink from 2015.
title: Ribafreixo 2012 Connections Limited Edition Chenin Blanc (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This first aged tawny release from Wine & Soul is a dry wine that feels older than 10 years—the average age of its blend. Fine and rich, it's a serious blend with flavors of spice, raisins and prunes.
title: Wine & Soul NV 10 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a powerful wine with rich black fruits and strong new-wood flavors. Mint and ripe, juicy berry fruits are balanced by an edge of tannin. While not for long aging, this is still an impressive wine.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2009 Dona Isabel Juliana Red (Tejo)

description: An attractive rosé, made from 100% Castelão, the local grape of Setúbal peninsula. It is crisp with citrus and ripe with raspberry giving a fine balance and refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Pegos Claros Rosé (Palmela)

description: This is a highly perfumed, fruity wine with ripe melon and spiced apple flavors. It is crisp, tangy and attractively textured with fine acidity. Drink now.
title: Solar de Cambres 2015 Casa de Cambres Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A light and fruity wine that is deliciously crisp with raspberry flavors and is nicely cut with acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This producer, based in the Lisboa region, has branched out into the Alentejo to source this rich, generously ripe wine. With its full-bodied plum and spice flavors, it is soft with a light touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)

description: This producer, based in the Lisboa region, has branched out into the Alentejo to source this rich, generously ripe wine. With its full-bodied plum and spice flavors, it is soft with a light touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)

description: Lemon and raspberry flavored wine with crisp acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It has just a hint of tannin and a squeeze of lime at the end. Drink now.
title: Seacampo 2015 Casa Américo Rosé (Dão)

description: Named after the range of mountains close to the Roquevale winery, this wine is ripe, soft and offers an attractive series of red fruits and rich tannins. Drink this wine now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Spanish producer Vicente Gandia has made a foray into Portugal with this ripely fruity and soft wine. It is fresh, herbal and spicy with attractive red berry fruits. It's been made to be drunk young and it's ready now.
title: Vicente Gandia 2012 Boâbrisa Red (Alentejano)

description: With many characteristics of the granite-soil based Dão, this is a dense, mineral and dark fruited wine. It has blackberry and plum-skin fruits as well as a firm, tannic core. Even though it's tightly structured now, it is drinkable, but would benefit from another year's aging.
title: Caves Aliança 2010 Vista Reserva Touriga Nacional (Beiras)

description: The Aveleda estate is the source of the fruit for this dry, delicious Vinho Verde. It's a reference for the food-friendly, lemon and grapefruit style, adding minerality and a taut texture to the forward fruitiness. Drink this summer, or hold for up to six months.
title: Aveleda 2012 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled White (Vinho Verde)

description: The label made from cork adds a curiosity value to this big, firmly tannic wine. With its weight, considerable structure and chunky black fruits, it's definitely a wine to age. Give it 5–6 years.
title: Caves Aliança 2009 Quinta da Dôna Red (Bairrada)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon in the cool Lisboa region has a similarity to Bordeaux. It gives a structured, black currant flavored wine, with firm tannins, a mineral texture and serious acidity. The wine is tight and should age well. Drink from 2014.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta de Pancas Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: A big, generous wine that is full of rich berry and juicy black plum fruits. It has spice and solid tannins from both the fruit and wood aging, dense and with a good depth of flavor. The acidity and the tannins both promise aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Lighthouse Red (Douro)

description: The Vila Santa Reserva boasts wood aging as well as lush, rich fruitiness. The touch of woody spice emphasizes the green- and white-fruits that give this rounded wine a full texture. There is a plush feel that promises some aging, although the wine can be enjoyed now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Vila Santa Branco Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine that is full of red fruit notes and gentle tannins. It is open and accessible, its fruit juiciness already a pleasure to taste. There is fresh acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine that is full of red fruit notes and gentle tannins. It is open and accessible, its fruit juiciness already a pleasure to taste. There is fresh acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: While this wine is dry, its warm strawberry fruit rounds out its character with a softness. Lemon sherbet acidity gives another touch of almost sweetness. Drink now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft wine just lightly fruity and with a spicy texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Batoreu 2015 Arinto (Tejo)

description: The wine has structured fruit along with red berry flavors. It is otherwise soft, easy, and ready to drink with a crisp finish.
title: Quinta Monteiro de Matos 2014 Terras de Paul Red (Tejo)

description: This is a light wine that has crisp, perfumed red fruits and layers of acidity. It is juicy and spicy and finishes with good acidity and a mineral texture. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Smart Dog Syrah-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rustic wine with very ripe fruit that gives a red jelly flavor. It is simple, with a dry edge and acidity, ready to drink now.
title: Solar de Cambres 2014 Casa de Cambres Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This young, citrus flavored wine is crisp and still with its yeasty and fruity flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e Falcão (Wolf and Falcon) White (Tejo)

description: This young, citrus flavored wine is crisp and still with its yeasty and fruity flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e Falcão (Wolf and Falcon) White (Tejo)

description: Named after the Portuguese word for the sommelier's tastevin, the wine is rich with juicy red fruits. It has a firm structure that emphasizes the wine's youth showing that it should develop. Densely textured at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, smooth blend of Alvarinho and Chardonnay. The two complement each other well with yellow fruits touched by a more citrus edge and a rich character. It is fruity, full-bodied and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: This oak-aged wine is rich and intense. It is a ripe blend of Arinto and Viognier, with a pinch of Chardonnay. Together they give the wine its perfumed character, spiced and with a beautiful streak of acidity. Although ready to drink, the wine is young and will be better from 2018.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2015 Maladinha Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Mature and with swathes of ripe fruit, this is a concentrated wine. Tannins give a firm core to the velvet-textured blackberry fruits. Richness and a sense of power are aided by the spice, pepper and dry aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
designation: Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Old Vines
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)

description: Wood-aged and ripe, this is a full, generous blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Full of rounded black fruits and firm tannins, it needs further aging to bring out the full suppleness and richness. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Monte dos Amigos Premium Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the impressive 10-mile long Vasco da Gama bridge that spans the Tagus estuary, this wine is soft, rounded and fruity. It has delicious, ready-to-drink flavors of ripe cherries and juicy plums. The fruit is sustained by the dry tannins and fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 10 Mile Bridge Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: Named after the impressive 10-mile long Vasco da Gama bridge that spans the Tagus estuary, this wine is soft, rounded and fruity. It has delicious, ready-to-drink flavors of ripe cherries and juicy plums. The fruit is sustained by the dry tannins and fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 10 Mile Bridge Castelão (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: This wine is young but ripe, with spice and blackberry fruits. It has a core of mineral tannins that are a reminder of the hard schist rocks of the Douro. With this dry structure, it needs to be aged, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: This wine is young but ripe, with spice and blackberry fruits. It has a core of mineral tannins that are a reminder of the hard schist rocks of the Douro. With this dry structure, it needs to be aged, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: Fast becoming one of the hallmark blends of Portugal, this 50-50 mix of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional is a seriously structured wine, with great wild fruit and mushroom flavors alongside dark, dry tannins. The acidity is very definite. A good food wine.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Aragonez and Touriga Nacional Red (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine offers great citric flavors, a lively crispness rare in white wines from central Portugal. Pear and some yellow fruits give roundness.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 White (Ribatejo)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine offers great citric flavors, a lively crispness rare in white wines from central Portugal. Pear and some yellow fruits give roundness.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 White (Ribatejo)

description: Well balanced wine, the entry level of the Conceito range. It has lively acidity and red cherry and strawberry fruits packed with underlying tannins. It is a fresh wine, showing the lighter side of the Douro, while retaining great minerality.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2008 Contraste Red (Douro)

description: Soft, ripe fruit, already accessible. This has a generous feel and flavors of berries and red plums. Not a wine for aging, but very attractive.
title: CARM 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Soft, ripe fruit, already accessible. This has a generous feel and flavors of berries and red plums. Not a wine for aging, but very attractive.
title: CARM 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: The acidity gives an almost citric tang to this closed, austere wine. There are attractive floral hints that give a softer edge. Dry, pushed by acidity and needing long-term aging.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Initially lean, but that's partly due to its youth. There is also fine, juicy fruit, pierced through with acidity, but offering tense tannins and some dark plum aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Côtto 2005 Red (Douro)

description: This is a concentrated wine that is packed with black fruits. The tannins are a support to the rich juicy flavor and the fine acidity. Coming from vineyards on the plateau to the north of the Douro river, the wine has a cool edge of freshness at the end.
designation: Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend
title: Secret Spot Wines 2013 Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: While not a generally declared year, 2012 has produced some excellent single-quinta wines. This full, ripe wine was fermented in open stone tanks and then kept in old wood for 12 months. It is richly structured with fine black fruit and a powerful aftertaste. Age this until 2024.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2012  Port

description: Known in Spain as Mencia and found in Galicia, here in Portugal it forms a part of the mix in the mountainous Dão. It is red fruit flavors that are sustained by tannins. Despite its nine years of age, it is still firmly structured, still packed with fine fruit. It is only just now ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2007 Jaen (Dão)

description: Perfumed, soft, easy wine, showing the juicy, fresh side of the two grapes. The fruits are more red than black, open and ripe, but still with youthful exuberance and great freshness.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Touriga Nacional e Touriga Franca Red (Estremadura)

description: This wine that includes 65% Antão Vaz conjures up a warm, ripe character from the Alentejo. With its yellow fruits and almond flavors, it's soft although finished with some attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is earthy, with a yeasty edge. It offers plenty of Touriga Nacional's perfumed fruit although this is masked by a barnyard character that needs to blow away. The wine requires another year to show its full potential, so drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon is soft and ripe, with a good sense of structure and fruitiness. Rounded and with acidity as a counterweight, the wine is ready. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 Babu Red (Tejo)

description: Made from 100% Castelâo, the local grape of Setúbal, this wine is attractively fruity, with a crisp texture. Warmer, ripe red-berry fruits contrast with the acidity, leaving a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: A crisp and fruity blend of Douro grapes, this is packed with raspberry fruitiness, offering delicious acidity at the end. The wine is dry and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: The short lees aging has allowed this wine to ripen and fill out. Along with the citrus acidity, it has plenty of fresh apple fruit and a zesty texture. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a soft, fruity blend of Roupeiro, Rabo de Ovelha and Fernão Pires. It is ripe, full of apple and crisp green fruits, shot through with acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Convento da Vila White (Alentejano)

description: A full-bodied wine, with acidity and ripe white fruits. It is soft, lightly sweetened and easy to drink.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2006 Periquita White (Terras do Sado)

description: On paper, this is an interesting blend of Aragonez and Cabernet; however, this fruity wine is much simpler than that. There is a spice element that adds some complexity, but the palate concentrates mainly on red fruits and layered acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Adegaborba.pt Red (Alentejo)

description: A classic Portuguese blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca, this is a medium-bodied wine with good structure and presence of tannin. Bright fruit flavors of red currant, cherry and strawberry abound on the palate, finishing fresh and clean.
title: Casa da Corça 2005 Reserva Kosher Red (Douro)

description: This wine is delicious with its fresh, concentrated blueberry and raspberry flavors, and the ripest tannins. The wine has a dark and tannic element, although this is well integrated into its beautiful layers of fruit.
title: Alvaro Castro 2009 Red (Dão)

description: A big, bruising wine that is bursting with sweet tannins and juicy blackberry flavors. All of its acidity and attractive flavors of up-front fruit, spice and wood are clamoring for attention. Ready to drink with strong flavored food.
title: Alente 2006 Alicante Bouschet+Aragonez+Trincadeira Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Hovering easily between red-fruit flavors and a more mature wood-aged taste, this is a smooth Port. It is dominated by a rich texture, both juicy and spicy with a smoky hint.
title: Niepoort 2001 Colheita  (Port)

description: Mint and red-fruit aromas dominate this classic Dão wine, with its firm tannins and mineral structure. Spice, toast and dark-berry flavors give a feeling of weight to a wine that demands to be paired with rich red meats.
title: Caves Velhas 2008 Catedral Reserva Red (Dão)

description: An impressive Pinot Noir that brings out plenty of the varietal's characteristics: the strawberry fruit flavors, the structure and the acidity. It is from the region north of Lisbon, which has a cool maritime climate, giving the wine its depth of flavor. Age for two years.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2009 Q de Sant'Ana Pinot Noir (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A fine and impressively complex wine, rich, packed with sultanas and dark chocolate. Very firm, this is worth aging but drinkable now.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A full wine, balanced with an attractive citrus character and some creamy texture. There is also an edge of tannin that makes it a good, fresh, food wine.
title: Poças 2006 Coroa D'ouro Reserva White (Douro)

description: Crisp apples, touched with some sweetness, but finely clean and fresh, this is a great apéritif style of Vinho Verde, finishing with just a sparkle. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2006 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Normally grown in the Dão region, this grape needs poor soil to flourish. On its own, it makes a powerfully fruity wine packed with red fruits and some flavors of dark chocolate. The acidity is intense, and needs another few months to settle down.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: With its apricot and ripe pear aromas, this is a full and rounded wine. It has a good balance between acidity and ripe fruit. It is floral, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Vinha Padre Pedro White (Tejo)

description: With its apricot and ripe pear aromas, this is a full and rounded wine. It has a good balance between acidity and ripe fruit. It is floral, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Vinha Padre Pedro White (Tejo)

description: This soft and fruity wine is crisp, fragrant and fresh. It has light acidity that balances with the forward apple flavor, as well as a dry lime edginess and nervy texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This is a gravel- and mineral-textured wine that has a very structured feel, with red berry flavors and firm tannins. Still young, it is a wine that should soften, so wait until 2016.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2010 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: The maturity of this wine gives it velvetine richness, spice and leather texture. The fruit on this smooth, ripe wine is mellow and offers acidity and red cherries. It's a delight to drink now.
title: Quinta do Mouro 2007 Red (Alentejano)

description: This hugely structured wine is solid with tannins. It has a dark, dry texture that is still masking the potential of the fruits. It is developing those blackberry flavors slowly and will need some time. Drink from 2019.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Red (Alentejano)

description: Full of blackberry fruits and ripe tannins, this wine is spicy and with a perfumed character. It does have a dry core of structure to it along with rich fruits and the smoothing effect of wood aging. This is still developing and likely to be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2013 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This is an immense wine, seriously ageworthy and still very young. It is powered by the dark tannins and concentrated fruits that come from the old vines at this iconic quinta. Dark, brooding, still with its wood aging up front, this needs to age for many years. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2011 Red (Douro)

description: One of the strengths of cool Beira Interior is that it produces powerful wines without the attendant alcohol of warmer climates. That's apparent with this intense, dark wine. Blending Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz, the dense and brooding wine with its rich blackberry fruitiness alongside dry, mineral tannins is a study in concentration and needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta do Cardo Grande Escolha Red (Beira Interior)

description: This is a lean wine with considerable structure and acidity but perhaps not enough fruit. There is a green edge to the fruit although the tannins are ripe enough. It is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This crisp blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires is light and fruity. Acidity and a lively mousse make for an attractive bright wine, with toast and almonds at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2016 Oculto Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This is made from the most widely planted red grape in Vinho Verde, Vinhão. It is soft and juicy with a ripe character and almond and caramel flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a smooth wine, soft with just a hint of tannins and with plenty of juicy acidity. Black-currant fruitiness dominates this crisp, clean and ready to drink wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This soft, rather rustic wine has tannins, red fruits and a dry core. It is simple, juicy while rough round the edges. Drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 Serras de Azeitão Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Fresh, crisp and fruity, this is a citrus and apple-flavored medium-dry wine. With plenty of acidity, bright and packed with easy fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: The perfumes are the central theme of this wine, aromas of roses and flavors of spice, cinnamon, going through the ripe fruit and suggestions of wood. It is a superripe wine, but one which manages to keep in balance.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 Vila Santa Syrah (Alentejano)

description: The perfumes are the central theme of this wine, aromas of roses and flavors of spice, cinnamon, going through the ripe fruit and suggestions of wood. It is a superripe wine, but one which manages to keep in balance.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 Vila Santa Syrah (Alentejano)

description: From a winery that only started operations in 2001, one of the new wave in the Alentejo. This Reserva is in a modern, smooth style, big and powerful. But there's one welcome wrinkle in all this smooth fruit, and that is a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon which gives just the right amount of tannins and interestingly fresh acidity.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2005 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft, but spicy wine made from the Portuguese version of Tempranillo, giving rounded, silky tannins, balanced with fresh red berry fruits. With its acid highlights, it needs time to calm down, but it should be attractively ripe in one year.
title: Cortes de Cima 2004 Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: It's called Assemblage because the wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. This big wine, with its dense structure, texture and superripe fruit, is certainly rich. The tannins and the acidity do hold everything in check. But it's not a wine for aging.
title: Quinta de Pancas 2003 Assemblage Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Estremadura)

description: Freshly aromatic, this is a Portuguese equivalent of a Gewürztraminer. It has all the lychees and spice as well as a thick, almost viscous texture. Good acidity helps the balance. Delicious, as an apéritif or with Asian food.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2006 Fernão Pires Fernão Pires (Estremadura)

description: Freshly aromatic, this is a Portuguese equivalent of a Gewürztraminer. It has all the lychees and spice as well as a thick, almost viscous texture. Good acidity helps the balance. Delicious, as an apéritif or with Asian food.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2006 Fernão Pires Fernão Pires (Estremadura)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine with tropical fruit tones, a light mineral texture and fine, crisp acidity. From vines planted at 1500 feet above the river, it is fresh, cool and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine with tropical fruit tones, a light mineral texture and fine, crisp acidity. From vines planted at 1500 feet above the river, it is fresh, cool and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Branco White (Douro)

description: Big, dry and tannic wine, this is a dense and structured wine. Black chocolate and coffee flavors suggest extraction shows strongly in the tough texture. The wine will be filled out as the black fruits develop, so wait until 2018.
title: Espaço Rural 2011 Poento Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Dominated by juicy Castelão, this lightly structured wine has fine tannins to propel the berry fruits up to the front. It is rich and full-bodied with a touch of pepper from the alcohol. The aftertaste brings out fresh acidity and softness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Red (Tejo)

description: Crisp and fresh, the wine is bright and fruity. It has strong green and white fruit flavors that are given a boost by the touch of vanilla. It's a food wine, dry, fragrant and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Terra D'Alter Siria (Alentejano)

description: Refreshing and crisp, this is a light, citrus-flavored wine. Great shots of acidity course through the wine to give an intensely fresh and fragrant aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2013 White (Tejo)

description: Refreshing and crisp, this is a light, citrus-flavored wine. Great shots of acidity course through the wine to give an intensely fresh and fragrant aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2013 White (Tejo)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine, crisp as can be, and finely textured. Drink now for its bright, fresh character.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva White (Tejo)

description: A well-balanced wine, bringing both rich fruit and sweet tannins to go with dense concentration. There is ripeness from black jam and sweet jelly, followed by a good core of dryness.
title: Fonseca 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: There are big tannins here on this rich, powerful wine, warm and ripe. There is a dry core, giving a dark, youthful herbal character, and the tannins along with final acidity. Although it is ready to drink, it also promises many years of aging.
title: Poças 2003 Director's Choice Vintage  (Port)

description: Bright pink in color, this 100% Touriga Nacional rosé is ripe with caramel and red berry flavors. It misses out on acidity, leaving the wine flat at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Rosé (Tejo)

description: It is the Fernão Pires that gives this wine its class and freshness. The Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, with its herbaceous character, seems to clash. The wine is crisp with lemon flavors and brings an intense final acidity.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: It is the Fernão Pires that gives this wine its class and freshness. The Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, with its herbaceous character, seems to clash. The wine is crisp with lemon flavors and brings an intense final acidity.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: An upfront, strawberry-flavored wine, this is ripe and immediately fruity. There are enough tannins to hold the palate together, but it is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2009 Vale de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: A fruity, fresh and crisp wine, this is given some weight by the inclusion of Chardonnay in the blend. It has an attractive texture, and the lemon and grapefruit flavors dominate.
title: Herdade dos Templários 2011 Vale das Donas Branco White (Tejo)

description: Smooth, soft wine, very accessible and up-front. The stewed fruit flavors and fresh acidity give an attractive lift to this open wine.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Evel Red (Douro)

description: Firm, earthy and fruity, this is a chunky wine, with a core of tannins to go with the fruit. It is not for aging, its black berry juice demanding attention now. A great barbecue wine.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2009 Châo das Rocas Red (Setubal)

description: A firmly tannic wine, with a woody core. It shows stalky black currant fruit along with tense acidity. At this stage, it is rough round the edges and could use  another year.
title: Casca Wines 2008 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Produced from selected parcels of fruit in top vintages, this is the flagship wine from this Jorgensen family estate. Aragonez and Syrah dominate this ripe still-young wine. It is rich and concentrated with powerful tannins and layers of acidity, dark chocolate flavors and generous black-plum flavors. It will certainly age further and this fine wine will be best drunk from 2019.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Densely tannic, this is a dark, rich, intense wine. The mature dusty tannins are balanced by acidity, black currant fruitiness and finished with a dry core. It's ready to drink.
title: Ideal Drinks 2008 Colinas Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: Densely tannic, this is a dark, rich, intense wine. The mature dusty tannins are balanced by acidity, black currant fruitiness and finished with a dry core. It's ready to drink.
title: Ideal Drinks 2008 Colinas Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: A ripe, spicy and juicy wine that has good acidity and balanced tannins. It's a blend: the smooth character of the Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) combines with the more tannic firmness of Cabernet Sauvignon. Together, they produce a fruity, structured wine that is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Rich and bold, it's a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz, both giving a floral character as well as some concentrated tannins. The dry structure and the intense acidity at the end suggest some aging. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: Still young and closed up, this wine is all about the future. It has rich fruits contrasted with ripe acidity, and is given a push by the wood-aging flavor. It will need some time, so don't drink this generous wine until 2017.
title: Herdade do Perdigão 2011 Herdade Perdigão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A rare, maybe unique, blend of Arinto and Sauvignon Blanc, which imparts a curiously mineral character. The fresh character of both grape varieties seem lost in the rounded character of the wine.
designation: Casa de Santar Terras do Dão
title: Dão Sul 2010 Casa de Santar Terras do Dão White (Dão)

description: A soft, open wine with only light tannins. The fruit is just as light, with strawberry and some spice. For drinking now.
title: Finisterra 2010 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft, open wine with only light tannins. The fruit is just as light, with strawberry and some spice. For drinking now.
title: Finisterra 2010 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: An impressive wine that shrugs off the alcohol in favor of superrich fruit, intense and integrated tannins and an excellent aging potential. The wine is solid, packed with juicy black fruits. It needs at least four years.
title: Terra d'Alter 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Orange peel aromas emerge on this delectable fortified Moscatel. Aging in barrel for at least three years has given it roundness and some old toast character that adds to the dried raisin and apricot flavors. Not for aging, drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2007  Moscatel de Setúbal

description: Named as commemoration of the Knights Templar whose Portuguese headquarters were in nearby Tomar, this is a seriously rich, opulent wine, full of red berry fruits and dark spices. Flavors of damson, strawberry jelly as well fine acidity all come through. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2006 Templários Grande Escolha Red (Ribatejo)

description: This is full of ripe plum and black cherry flavors that are richly textured and spiced. It has an elegant side, which makes for a round, full-bodied finish, and it has the potential to age well.
title: Campolargo 2008 Diga? Tinto Red (Bairrada)

description: This producer, firmly established in Vinho Verde and the Douro, also has vineyards at Quinta da Aguieira in the central coastal region of Bairrada. A blend of local white grapes along with some Chardonnay, this wine is ripe, with a touch of saltiness and minerality, plus plenty of concentration from old vines. With its rich texture and crisp aftertaste, this is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda 2015 Reserva da Familia Branco White (Bairrada)

description: Touriga Nacional is the principal component of this rich blend from the lower Douro vineyards of Valle da Fonte. It is a concentrated wine with black plum and spice flavors. They are underlined by the dark tannins and black chocolate. This makes for a wine that needs further aging. Drink from at least 2019.
title: Valle da Fonte 2014 Vinhas Velhas Old Vines Red (Douro)

description: This is classic Petit Verdot in Portugal: dark red, structured and firmly tannic with great fruits. The grape, normally found in Bordeaux, seems to be very much at home in this schist soil and hot climate of the Douro. Its tannins are there, but the blackberry fruit and acidity are just as important. Drink this from 2018.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Petit Verdot (Duriense)

description: Fermented in open granite lagars, this rich wine with its violet aromas is generous and has considerable power. It comes from a great vintage and shows that in its dark fruits and still-firm tannins. This is a serious wine, showing the grapes from the hard soils of the Dão at their best. Drink from 2019.
title: Julia Kemper Wines 2011 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: This is a satisfying, ripe and rich wine. It has big layers of red fruits, attractive spice from partial wood aging and fresh acidity. Still young, it will be even better from early 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A smooth and ripe wine, packed with black fruits and some firm tannins that lend support. It is structured, juicy and full of strong spice, with dense texture. It should age a while longer, so drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: Initially it seems very dry, but there is freshness as well. The wine has a sweet, jelly core, with soft tannins, well balanced. Raisins and black figs dominate, with the aftertaste bringing a firming of tannins and structure. Powerful and impressive.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Delicious sweet raisin and mulled wine fruit, full of herbs and nutmeg spice. This is a ripe wine, but too heavy, showing some austerity, but no sign of tiring.
title: Smith Woodhouse 1999 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: With its dense color and sweet fruits, this is wine that works well, with a great rich, soft texture. There is a concentrated juicy and jammy character, with final approachable spice and acidity.
title: W. & J. Graham's 2005 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a fruity, soft wine with a light texture and plenty of citrus fruits. It is crisp, clean with a hint of perfumes and a herbal edge that comes from the Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 TalhãoI White (Tejo)

description: This is a fruity, soft wine with a light texture and plenty of citrus fruits. It is crisp, clean with a hint of perfumes and a herbal edge that comes from the Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 TalhãoI White (Tejo)

description: A soft wine that has ripe red fruits and gentle tannins. Ready to drink immediately, it is fruity with spice, black cherry and acidity all in balance.
title: Enoport 2014 Penina Red (Tejo)

description: The wine has a rustic, barnyard character that will maybe blow off. For now, the fruit is subdued and layered with dry tannins and acidity. It could develop, so wait until 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2014 Chaminé Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe, fruit-forward wine. It has black currant and some attractive acidity. It seems to miss out on the structure and firm texture that would be expected from a Douro wine, so it is possible to drink now.
title: Enoport 2014 Novo Mondo Red (Douro)

description: Alvarinho with a prickle is unusual, as is a Vinho Verde that has been aged an extra year before release. The wine doesn't quite work because it has lost its fruit and developed a strong pepper and spice character. The acidity at the end is the most characteristic part of the wine.
title: Conde Villar 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Alvarinho with a prickle is unusual, as is a Vinho Verde that has been aged an extra year before release. The wine doesn't quite work because it has lost its fruit and developed a strong pepper and spice character. The acidity at the end is the most characteristic part of the wine.
title: Conde Villar 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a wine that's ready to consume, with its ripe red fruits and spicy tannins. It is smooth with just a bite of structure along with considerable acidity. The wine is balanced and attractive in a summer barbecue style.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Serradayres Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a wine that's ready to consume, with its ripe red fruits and spicy tannins. It is smooth with just a bite of structure along with considerable acidity. The wine is balanced and attractive in a summer barbecue style.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Serradayres Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas give a wine that is tight with tannins and tough to handle. It is concentrated, very dry with only hints of rich black fruits. It will probably remain dense and tannic.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas give a wine that is tight with tannins and tough to handle. It is concentrated, very dry with only hints of rich black fruits. It will probably remain dense and tannic.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe and soft blend of Portuguese grapes with a touch of Viognier, this is a smooth, creamy textured wine. The acidity is just right to give the wine its tight, steely aftertaste. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Marquês de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: A ripe and soft blend of Portuguese grapes with a touch of Viognier, this is a smooth, creamy textured wine. The acidity is just right to give the wine its tight, steely aftertaste. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Marquês de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: This is a soft, tropical-fruit flavored wine. It has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts through the riper fruitiness to give a wine that is easy and very drinkable now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Loios White (Alentejano)

description: Fruity and crisp, this wine hails from an estate owned by the Amorim family of cork fame, Red-berry flavors come through strongly along with spice and wood-aging flavors. The wine also has acidity, lightly toasty and with a core of tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This producer focuses on Rhône Valley varietals, and this wine continues the theme. Its apricot and very fine mineral texture are impressive and rich. Touched by spice from wood aging, the wine is generous, with the potential of a creamy, smooth texture as it ages. For now, it is fruity and rich. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2015 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

description: This wine is both fruity and structured, full of black fruits and firm tannins. Drink this solid wine from 2020.
title: Quinta de São José 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Still structured and with its tannins, this wine has the potential to develop well. Black currant and plum fruits bestow a dense, fruity character. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 La Rosa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From the mountainous far east of Portugal, the dense, granite feel of this wine is palpable and potent. It has weight, balanced by intense acidity, stalky black currant fruits and a core of dark, firm tannins. Age this concentrated wine for at least 3–4 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta do Cardo Grande Escolha Red (Beira Interior)

description: From the mountainous far east of Portugal, the dense, granite feel of this wine is palpable and potent. It has weight, balanced by intense acidity, stalky black currant fruits and a core of dark, firm tannins. Age this concentrated wine for at least 3–4 years.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta do Cardo Grande Escolha Red (Beira Interior)

description: The top wine from Sogrape's Dão flagship quinta, this is a selection of the best parcels. It's a powerful, serious wine, showing great regional characters of dark, mineral tannins and rich black fruits. There's a fine line of juicy acidity that cuts through the firm structure. Age this major wine for at least six years.
title: Sogrape 2009 Quinta dos Carvalhais Unico Red (Dão)

description: Mint aromas and flavors lead to an intense wine that is powered at this young stage by firm, serious tannins. It has great richness from the black plum fruits, and a spicy, herbal character that adds complexity. From consultant Luis Duarte, this is a wine for long-term aging; hold for 6–7 years or more.
title: Luis Duarte 2010 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)

description: Mint aromas and flavors lead to an intense wine that is powered at this young stage by firm, serious tannins. It has great richness from the black plum fruits, and a spicy, herbal character that adds complexity. From consultant Luis Duarte, this is a wine for long-term aging; hold for 6–7 years or more.
title: Luis Duarte 2010 Rubrica Red (Alentejano)

description: This light, bright and very fruity wine almost dances on the palate. Peach and apple skin flavors bring out a crisp, green acidity. A touch of minerality and texture give the wine character. Drink now.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2012 Aphros Ten Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: This light, bright and very fruity wine almost dances on the palate. Peach and apple skin flavors bring out a crisp, green acidity. A touch of minerality and texture give the wine character. Drink now.
title: Casal Paço Padreiro 2012 Aphros Ten Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Structured and firm, this dense wine shows strong tannins, dark black fruits and very ripe flavors. With weight, concentration, it is now mature.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2009 Vale de Mata Red (Lisboa)

description: Structured, this oozes blackberry fruitiness as well as a balanced layer of dry tannins. The wine is fruity and rich while keeping its elegance. A core of tannins and fresh acidity in the fruit promise that this wine will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Confidencial Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Large French oak barrels were used to ferment this toasty, ripe wine, which boasts notes of stone fruit and citrus. A mix of cool-climate Portuguese grapes and Chardonnay, it will smooth out and become rich and complex with time; drink after 2016.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Dory Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: Hand-selected bunches from the Porto Franco estate of DFJ Vinhos went into this complex wine. It has solid tannins and a firm black-fruit character. The wood aging shows well and is already balanced, melding the fruit and structure together. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Francos Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Hand-selected bunches from the Porto Franco estate of DFJ Vinhos went into this complex wine. It has solid tannins and a firm black-fruit character. The wood aging shows well and is already balanced, melding the fruit and structure together. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Francos Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This balances dried fruits and rich red berries with toast and a layers of dryness from the wood aging. It is opulent, generous and well balanced. As with all aged tawnies, drink now.
title: Ramos-Pinto NV RP 20 Tawny 20 Years Old  (Port)

description: This is a powerful, ripe and generously fruity wine. With red berry and rich spice from wood aging, it is dense, complex and aromatic. Minerality and dark, dry tannins show the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2012 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This dense wine full of dusty tannins and serious fruit is ripe and full while structured and elegant. It comes from the heart of the hills north of Lisbon, allowing room for a big, full-powered character as well as a fresher, blackberry fruitiness. The wood aging is still showing even after four years, so the wine still needs more time. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2010 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A classic Dão blend, which includes Alfrocheiro and Jaen grapes, this is produced by top winemaker Alvaro Castro. A year in oak has given it richness and a smooth, almost velvety character. Underneath this surface, the tannins are all there, balancing the ripe fruit flavors. It will develop well; drink from 2017.
title: Obrigado 2012 DAC Red (Dão)

description: A classic Dão blend, which includes Alfrocheiro and Jaen grapes, this is produced by top winemaker Alvaro Castro. A year in oak has given it richness and a smooth, almost velvety character. Underneath this surface, the tannins are all there, balancing the ripe fruit flavors. It will develop well; drink from 2017.
title: Obrigado 2012 DAC Red (Dão)

description: This wine is deliciously fruity and crisp, with perfumed red fruit and lively acidity. Bone dry, and full of bright fruitiness, it makes a classic, easy to drink apéritif wine.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2015 São Matias Rosé (Dão)

description: This wine is deliciously fruity and crisp, with perfumed red fruit and lively acidity. Bone dry, and full of bright fruitiness, it makes a classic, easy to drink apéritif wine.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2015 São Matias Rosé (Dão)

description: A blend that includes Merlot, this wine is ripe while also structured. The tannins go along with the black fruits and acidity. It has a crisp, juicy finish that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Campolargo 2013 Vinha do Putto Red (Bairrada)

description: This blend of Arinto and Chardonnay is crisp and fresh, showing the cool, ocean climate of the Lisboa region in its light, bright texture. It is juicy with peach and pineapple flavors cut by lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Quinta de Pancas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: From vineyards at 2000 feet elevation, this is a rich and spicy wine that has a pure streak of fruit freshness and a firmly tannic core. It is perfumed from Touriga Nacional in the blend, with red berry and black plum flavors coming through strongly along, balanced by acidity. It will be better from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Barão de Figueira Reserva Red (Beira Interior)

description: This is a concentrated blend of local grapes. The Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon give it a rich texture. It is a complex balance of tannins, spice and ripe blackberry fruits. The acidity and tight aftertaste suggest it is still young. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Quatro Castas Red (Alentejano)

description: Lightly wood aged, this pure Touriga Nacional wine brings out the structure of the grape and the minerality of the region. It is rich, firmly textured with dark tannins as well as black currant fruits. The wine is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Seacampo 2012 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: With Anselmo Mendes, the Vinho Verde master, as consultant, this is a coastal Lisboa wine that has plenty of the crisp texture that comes from the Alvarinho in the blend. There is a perfumed touch from Viognier, giving the wine crispness as well as a rich background. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Adega Mãe 2016 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: Pure Alicante Bouschet, this wine is rich and generously ripe. At this young stage it does seem to have surfeit of toasty wood and hopefully this will integrate. It's certainly not shy, with its bold black currant flavors and balanced acidity. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Somebody obviously went to Alsace to come up with this blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. It does have some botrytis which gives a honeyed character to the wine. It also has wonderful freshness that gives it such a lift and brings out the apricot fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

description: Somebody obviously went to Alsace to come up with this blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. It does have some botrytis which gives a honeyed character to the wine. It also has wonderful freshness that gives it such a lift and brings out the apricot fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

description: This dark, structured wine, with its balanced blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, is firm with tannins and dense berry fruits. Full in the mouth, it is a concentrated wine that brings out a strongly chalky texture. The wine is still moving towards a rich future. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: This dark, structured wine, with its balanced blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, is firm with tannins and dense berry fruits. Full in the mouth, it is a concentrated wine that brings out a strongly chalky texture. The wine is still moving towards a rich future. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: This dark wine is still packed with tannins that give a dense, solid character. The acidity brings out the natural juiciness of the fruit but it does need a few more months to soften and round out. Wait until 2015.
designation: Quinta de S João Batista Reserva
title: Caves Dom Teodosio 2010 Quinta de S João Batista Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: This dark wine is still packed with tannins that give a dense, solid character. The acidity brings out the natural juiciness of the fruit but it does need a few more months to soften and round out. Wait until 2015.
designation: Quinta de S João Batista Reserva
title: Caves Dom Teodosio 2010 Quinta de S João Batista Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Wood aging gives this ripe wine its toasty character. This texture is balanced by rich peach and apricot fruits, rounded and fruity. Old vines bring an extra concentration to this full, generous wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Wood aging gives this ripe wine its toasty character. This texture is balanced by rich peach and apricot fruits, rounded and fruity. Old vines bring an extra concentration to this full, generous wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Named after the Knights Templar who were headquartered in the Tejo region of Portugal in the Middle Ages, this estate has produced a fruity, soft and rounded white wine. It has an attractively aromatic character from the inclusion of Riesling and Moscatel in the blend. Wait until the end of 2015 before drinking.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Herdade dos Templários Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a wood-aged Touriga Nacional that is smooth and rich. It shows some extraction offering dark chocolate flavors that cover the fruit, yet happen to provide a ripe, rounded feel. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This is a wood-aged Touriga Nacional that is smooth and rich. It shows some extraction offering dark chocolate flavors that cover the fruit, yet happen to provide a ripe, rounded feel. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This is a rich, smooth wine that has ripe fruit and plenty of smooth plum flavors. It has some spice, balanced acidity and a fine dense texture. The wine, with its fresh aftertaste is ready to drink.
title: Quarles Harris 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a rich, smooth wine that has ripe fruit and plenty of smooth plum flavors. It has some spice, balanced acidity and a fine dense texture. The wine, with its fresh aftertaste is ready to drink.
title: Quarles Harris 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: The combination of acidity, dark fruits and a minerality give this wine both great density and a fine potential. It is firm, showing the terroir of the Douro well in its grainy texture while also bringing acidity into play. It is young, concentrated and needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Quinta da Fronteira Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: While there is plenty of fruit here, there is also a rustic, barnyard edge that is less attractive. The wood aging has produced some spicy flavors and tannins to give the wine structure.
title: Parras Vinhos 2013 Montaria Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: While there is plenty of fruit here, there is also a rustic, barnyard edge that is less attractive. The wood aging has produced some spicy flavors and tannins to give the wine structure.
title: Parras Vinhos 2013 Montaria Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Winemaker Leonor Freitas runs her vineyard just south of Lisbon. This soft, fruity blend is light in both tannins and acidity. It's fresh in character, giving a ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monte de Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Fine ripe fruit pushes through the young tannic structure in this fresh wine. It still has an edge of tannin which balances well with the red berry fruits. Acidity cuts through everything to leave a crisp, blueberry flavored aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Muros de Vinha Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine that has both tannins and generous of black fruits. The combination has produced a rounded, fruity wine that is sustained by its structure although it is very ready to drink now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a tight, structured wine that shows more tannin than fruit. It has a lean austere character that needs to soften. Acidity at the end does show evidence of red currant and berry fruits. It will certainly be better if drunk after 2017.
title: Falua 2012 Tercius Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is attractive, citrus-driven and light. It has a zesty character that zings through the palate. Drink now.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Pinta Negra Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A fruity tawny, with cherry-jelly flavors plus attractive acidity that balances the sweet, simple, forward flavors. Perhaps drink it as an apéritif, easy and fragrant.
title: Messias NV Pátria Tawny  (Port)

description: New wood aromas give minty character to this wine. The palate is dominated by that wood, which covers the fruit and just leaves structure. Considering that the wine is now five years old, this imbalance will probably remain.
title: Quinta de Arcossó 2008 Superior Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: New wood aromas give minty character to this wine. The palate is dominated by that wood, which covers the fruit and just leaves structure. Considering that the wine is now five years old, this imbalance will probably remain.
title: Quinta de Arcossó 2008 Superior Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: A perfumed, spicy and ripe wine, wood flavors balanced by great wafts of black fruit. It is elegant, with a significant wood element. It will develop over 3–4 years, bringing more of the fine berry fruits.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2008 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is pure fruitiness, a wine packed with spice, berry fruits and soft, open tannins. It is a great barbecue-style wine, ripe, with good acidity and a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Quinta Essência Red (Tejo)

description: This is pure fruitiness, a wine packed with spice, berry fruits and soft, open tannins. It is a great barbecue-style wine, ripe, with good acidity and a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Quinta Essência Red (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, lemon and orange zest-driven wine. It has a lightly mineral texture that gives structure as well as a cool feel. It's a delicious wine already but will be better by late 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This is a rich wine, full of dark fruits and generous tannins. It has swathes of spice as well as the firm black-plum-skin and blackberry flavors. The dense texture and the acidity suggest a few more months aging, so drink from early 2018.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of local Douro white grapes with, unusually, Chenin Blanc, is delicious. With its wood-aged touch and rich creamy texture, the wine is generous and full. It has attractive acidity as well, emphasizing the apple and grapefruit fruit. The wine will be even better from 2018.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a richly structured wine. With its juicy red fruits and generous structure, it is delicious now. Berry flavors and acidity go with the mineral edge of the texture to create a wine that is packed with acidity, tannins and fruit. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2014 Tinto Red (Dão)

description: This wine has geranium aromas and a fruity character. Its tannins are dry and disjointed from the fruit. Unbalanced at this stage, it needs time to balance.
title: Quevedo 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a blend of local white grapes with Sauvignon Blanc is light-bodied and crisp. Full of citrus and herbal flavors, this is an easy wine to enjoy. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Forgotten Field White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from high altitude vineyards to retain acidity, this is a fruity, crisp and bright wine. It has an herbal character along with lively lemon and quince flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine has strongly catty aromas that seems to dissipate on the palate. A tense, mineral-driven acidity carries gooseberry flavors and a herbal aftertaste. Drink now.
title: João Teodosio Matos Barbosa 2013 Ninfa Escolha White (Tejo)

description: A serious and dense wine, this is rich and full of dark juicy fruit. It has plenty of structure of course, with its rich tannins and wood aging flavors right up front. The acidity is perfumed, underlining the ripe fruit. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Vinhas Velhas Reserva Castelão (Palmela)

description: A serious and dense wine, this is rich and full of dark juicy fruit. It has plenty of structure of course, with its rich tannins and wood aging flavors right up front. The acidity is perfumed, underlining the ripe fruit. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Vinhas Velhas Reserva Castelão (Palmela)

description: The 170 acre Rocim estate has produced a serious, dense and powerful wine. It is rich, powered by blackberry and dark plum and damson flavors. The acidity that's there is enough to contrast with the ripe fruitiness while the tannins and layers of wood flavors both promise considerable aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend based on Alicante Bouschet, this ripe and rich wine is appropriately dark in color. It is a firm wine, full of juicy black plum fruits and dense tannins. With weight and considerable richness, it is a complex wine that is developing slowly but surely. Drink from 2018.
title: Mouchão 2011 Ponte das Canas Red (Alentejo)

description: A blend based on Alicante Bouschet, this ripe and rich wine is appropriately dark in color. It is a firm wine, full of juicy black plum fruits and dense tannins. With weight and considerable richness, it is a complex wine that is developing slowly but surely. Drink from 2018.
title: Mouchão 2011 Ponte das Canas Red (Alentejo)

description: Powerful, dusty tannins dominate this ripe wine. With its great blackberry fruits, currants and juicy acidity, it is already balanced. The power comes from the dry tannins and the rich, concentrated fruits. Drink from 2026.
title: C. da Silva 2015 Dalva Vintage  (Port)

description: Six grapes are in the blend of this generous, opulent wine. It has fine, velvet-smooth tannins, with a background dryness that gives structure. Black fruits shine through, enhanced by the spice and toast of the wood aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Luis Duarte 2014 Rubrica Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is ripe with tannins and powerful with ripe fruit. A solid character gives it density. The tannins and the richness of the wine are ripe and concentrated with fruit. Drink from 2026.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2015 Quinta da Vargellas Vintage  (Port)

description: Beautifully perfumed, this is a ripe and structured wine. It has fine dusty tannins, intense blackberry fruits and a dark-licorice aftertaste. Acidity keeps the wine fruity and fresh although with those firm tannins, it will need time. Drink from 2027.
title: Croft 2015 Quinta da Roeda  (Port)

description: This is a superb blend of aged tawny Ports, blended to celebrate the company's 325th anniversary. Filled with rich fruit, it has great depth and spicy richness although it is also impressively fresh. Dried fruits and red plums are lifted with a hint of smoky wood and good acidity. Like any tawny Port, it is ready to drink.
title: Taylor Fladgate NV 325 Anniversary  (Port)

description: This is a superb blend of aged tawny Ports, blended to celebrate the company's 325th anniversary. Filled with rich fruit, it has great depth and spicy richness although it is also impressively fresh. Dried fruits and red plums are lifted with a hint of smoky wood and good acidity. Like any tawny Port, it is ready to drink.
title: Taylor Fladgate NV 325 Anniversary  (Port)

description: This 1967 is part of Taylor Fladgate's regular releases of aged Colheita. It is showing a perfect moment in which the fruit finally passes into old gold maturity. The wine still has hints of sultanas, but now it's the fine wood and spice character that is equally important. The wine, of course, is ready to drink and will not age further.
title: Taylor Fladgate 1967 Single Harvest  (Port)

description: From vines planted in 2004, this wine celebrates daughter Francesca's 18th birthday and is a ripe impressive wine that is rich and smoothly textured. A blend of classic Douro grapes, especially Tinta Francisca, the wine is full of black fruits and ripe tannins. It will be ready from 2019.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Vinha da Francesca Red (Douro)

description: From vines planted in 2004, this wine celebrates daughter Francesca's 18th birthday and is a ripe impressive wine that is rich and smoothly textured. A blend of classic Douro grapes, especially Tinta Francisca, the wine is full of black fruits and ripe tannins. It will be ready from 2019.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Vinha da Francesca Red (Douro)

description: The liquorous old gold color of this wine indicates the long barrel aging. It is rich with spice, dried fruits and old wood flavors all finely interwoven. The wine, which originated in a field blend of old vines, has a final shot of acidity to bring it to life.
title: Churchill's NV 30 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Produced from a field blend of 41 different varieties of 60-year-old vines, this estate wine from Cristiano van Zeller is powerful and dense while having such style. Smoothly polished, rich and concentrated. The wine is perfumed, full of black plum skins and with light acidity at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 Red (Douro)

description: High-altitude vines yielded this full while also crisp wine. It is fruity, touched by caramel and spice and some toast flavors from wood aging. This is a rosé style that goes with food.
title: Muxagat 2013 Rosé (Douro)

description: High-altitude vines yielded this full while also crisp wine. It is fruity, touched by caramel and spice and some toast flavors from wood aging. This is a rosé style that goes with food.
title: Muxagat 2013 Rosé (Douro)

description: This limited production wine comes in a fancy bottle with wax seal. It is a rich blend of Touriga Nacional along with Merlot, which smooths out the structure and gives the wine its intensity and dense texture. It is a ripe smoky wine, packed with juicy black fruits and flavors of the wood aging. Drink now.
title: Adega Mãe 2012 Terroir Red (Lisboa)

description: This fine low-production wood-aged wine is almost Burgundian in its creamy richness. The toast is nicely judged giving a wine that has just enough acidity and has plenty of textured apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is named after the year of the creation of the Companhia das Lezirias.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias 1836 Grande Reserva Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias 1836 Grande Reserva Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This fine low-production wood-aged wine is almost Burgundian in its creamy richness. The toast is nicely judged giving a wine that has just enough acidity and has plenty of textured apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is named after the year of the creation of the Companhia das Lezirias.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias 1836 Grande Reserva Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias 1836 Grande Reserva Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This 100% Touriga Nacional comes from the government-owned estate in the north of Tejo. Named after the barn owl that is found in the woods, the wine is structured with dense tannins as well as concentrated black fruits. It is balanced with its fruit and structure already working well together, but it will need time. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This 100% Touriga Nacional comes from the government-owned estate in the north of Tejo. Named after the barn owl that is found in the woods, the wine is structured with dense tannins as well as concentrated black fruits. It is balanced with its fruit and structure already working well together, but it will need time. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Ripe and fruity, with some sweetness that does not seem to be fully integrated. So the green plum flavors are attractive, as is the acidity, but there is an intrusive sugary edge.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Ripe and fruity, with some sweetness that does not seem to be fully integrated. So the green plum flavors are attractive, as is the acidity, but there is an intrusive sugary edge.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Pink in color, a smooth wine, layered in caramel, missing real fruit.
title: Borges 2010 Lello Rosé (Douro)

description: An earthy wine, softly fruity, with cantaloupe melon and pear flavors. It's simple, attractive, light.
title: Caves Aliança 2010 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: Smooth, rounded wine, with vanilla, ripe pear and a bitter herbal finish. The wine feels fat, unfocused.
title: Borges 2010 Lello Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an easy-drinking, smooth and generous wine. With its light tannins and red berry fruit, it is ready to drink young. The aftertaste adds some acidity to give a lift.
title: Lobo 2014 Lobocellar Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is an easy-drinking, smooth and generous wine. With its light tannins and red berry fruit, it is ready to drink young. The aftertaste adds some acidity to give a lift.
title: Lobo 2014 Lobocellar Red (Península de Setúbal)
