description: This is a rich and perfumed wine. Packed with tarry tannins, dark black fruits and hints of truffles, it is firm and full. The structure is still important in this wine, pushing forward around the fruit. Wait a while to drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich and perfumed wine. Packed with tarry tannins, dark black fruits and hints of truffles, it is firm and full. The structure is still important in this wine, pushing forward around the fruit. Wait a while to drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Wood aged, this is still dominated by its toast character, but shows potential in its rich black fruits and powerful tannins. Complex and ageworthy, give it at least four years.
title: Caves Aliança 2009 Vista Reserva Touriga Nacional (Beiras)

description: This is rich, with an old wood feel and a sweet, still-fruity character. With its acid balance, this is fresh, round and perfumed.
title: Barros NV 20-Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This is rich, with an old wood feel and a sweet, still-fruity character. With its acid balance, this is fresh, round and perfumed.
title: Barros NV 20-Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This attractive wine is full of ripe fruit, with soft tannins and only light acidity. It is developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Rozes 2013 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, creamy wine contains the rare Vital in the blend. That grape gives crisp, tight acidity while the Chardonnay brings out the smoother, richer side of this balanced and fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Chardonnay-Arinto-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: This ripe, juicy wine offers immediately attractive red-berry fruits. With deep color from the red-juice Alicante Bouschet, the wine is perfumed and generous. Acidity gives a final lift.
title: Caves Bonifacio 2012 Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: An unusual 100% Tinta Roriz, this wine is ripe with well-integrated tannins and good acidity. Blackberry fruits give crispness and a full body. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2012 Pôpa Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: This fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, perfumed blackberry fruit and just enough acidity. Smoothly textured, it's a great barbecue-style of red. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of “scantily dressed.” Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Full-bodied and smoky, this is a ripely fruity wine. The berry fruit is dominant, providing structure as well as richness. Strong spice and dark wood characters bring out the fruitiness of the wine, while the tannins come later.
title: Andresen 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Full-bodied and smoky, this is a ripely fruity wine. The berry fruit is dominant, providing structure as well as richness. Strong spice and dark wood characters bring out the fruitiness of the wine, while the tannins come later.
title: Andresen 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A firmly structured wine that boasts firm, dry tannins, rich black berry and plum fruits, and a hint of wood. This is deliciously ripe, juicy, packed with warm fruit flavors, sweet and rich.
title: Burmester 2006 Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this is an impressively structured and concentrated wine. Ripe and flowery, with flavors of mango and yellow fruit. The smooth yet tangy structure gives pleasure now, but also promises aging. Drink until 2019.
title: Mouchão 2012 Dom Rafael Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this is an impressively structured and concentrated wine. Ripe and flowery, with flavors of mango and yellow fruit. The smooth yet tangy structure gives pleasure now, but also promises aging. Drink until 2019.
title: Mouchão 2012 Dom Rafael Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Rich, but structured and balanced, this is a wine that has delicious swathes of ripe blackberry and black plum. There is a touch of bitter extract, but this will integrate as the wine ages. The acidity goes well with the solid tannins. Drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2011 Monsaraz Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This Cabernet-based wine is supremely elegant. It brings together new wood flavors, firm and dry Cabernet tannins and powerful concentration. It has great depth of flavor; very complex, the acidity promising good aging.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Quinta da Bacalhôa Cabernet Sauvignon (Península de Setúbal)

description: His skills show in this rich, powerful, finely balanced wine. It has layers of black berry fruits, damsons, bitter chocolate and a good core of acidity. Give this impressive wine 3–4 years.
title: Luis Duarte 2008 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: His skills show in this rich, powerful, finely balanced wine. It has layers of black berry fruits, damsons, bitter chocolate and a good core of acidity. Give this impressive wine 3–4 years.
title: Luis Duarte 2008 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Rui Reguinga, named Portugal's Winemaker of the Year in 2009, produces this sumptuous wine. The fruit is rich, with jammy berries and plums, balanced with spice from wood aging. The core of tannins suggests a powerful wine that will age well.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A selection from the Quinta da Bacalhôa vineyard, this sumptuous wine layers the darkest fruit flavors with a structure that is solid, dense and powerful. Juicy plums, licorice and a firm, stalky edge go with wood aging and bone-dry tannins. Age for 5–6 years.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2007 Palácio da Bacalhôa Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A wonderful, rich wine, fermented in open stone lagars, giving a concentrated, beautifully soft wine. The texture is dense and velvety; ripe black fruits are given further complexity by wood aging. A superb wine, powerful and elegant.
title: Vinha Paz 2007 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A subtle pink color, worthy of Provence, marks this wine with its attractive acidity and soft texture. There is only a hint of tannin to remind that this raspberry-flavored wine comes from Syrah. It is crisp and ready to drink.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2016 JP Azeitão Syrah Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is called sweet and that's what it is. The candied sweetness is balanced by some acidity to keep the wine crisp and fruity. It will be fine as an apéritif. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sweet White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is called sweet and that's what it is. The candied sweetness is balanced by some acidity to keep the wine crisp and fruity. It will be fine as an apéritif. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sweet White (Vinho Verde)

description: This oak-aged blend of Malvasia, Fernão Pires and Viosinho is soft with light green and citrus fruits. There is a creamy texture as well as a touch of spice from the wood. Drink this now.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Reserva White (Douro)

description: This bright, fruity wine is crisp with acidity from the red-currant flavors. A blend of Aragones and Touriga Nacional, it is light with just a touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2016 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This bright, fruity wine is crisp with acidity from the red-currant flavors. A blend of Aragones and Touriga Nacional, it is light with just a touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2016 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is an off-dry wine, soft with strawberry flavors that are balanced by crisp acidity. It is light and fruity—a fine wine to drink as an apéritif.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is an off-dry wine, soft with strawberry flavors that are balanced by crisp acidity. It is light and fruity—a fine wine to drink as an apéritif.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Viosinho, more often found in the Douro, dominates this ripe and full-bodied wine. Lemon acidity is integrated into the rich yellow fruit flavors to give smoothness and roundness. The intense fruit needs to soften a little, so wait until 2016 to drink.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Firm and structured, this has dense tannins as well as fruity character. Both the texture and the black plum fruits are concentrated. Flavors of wood aging have smoothed out the naturally stalky character of the fruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Cape Roca Lighthouse Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This intensely fruity wine is full of crisp acidity, lemon and lime flavors and a tangy, tight, steely texture. The wine is mineral and structured, while remaining fresh and attractively juicy. It's tempting to drink it now because of the freshness, but better wait until 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Colheita Branco White (Dão)

description: A wood-aged blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this is a rich, dense wine. Ripe creamed apples and pears have intense acidity while a toasty note gives the palate a rich, full character. Drink this finely balanced wine from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Lagoalva Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This is big, ripe, chocolate and dark-fruit flavored wine that shows concentrated tannins and dense wood. Blackberry tones are starting to push through to give this impressive wine balance and a serious future. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Romeira Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: An attractively perfumed wine that shows a fine balance between fresh acidity and soft, sweet fruits. It is light in texture, open rather than concentrated. There is a rich black cherry final character.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Poised between sweetness and acidity, there is a good jammy character here, edged by tannins and layered with herbs and spice. A fine wine, with some aging potential.
title: Quinta da Gaivosa 2008 Vintage  (Port)

description: Fine grain tannins, with an aroma of light smoke and tobacco over juicy, soft fruit. It has great structure, with a firm core, round and fruity. Well balanced, it suggests aging possibilities.
title: Niepoort 2008 Quinta da Pisca Vintage  (Port)

description: One of the star grapes of the Alentejo, this is a ripe, full-bodied and deliciously juicy wine. Almost black in color, it is packed with tannins, spice, intense acidity and a fine structure. It could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Time in oak has given this wine great depth and richness. Its tannins are finely integrated into the spice and black fruit flavors. Solid and concentrated, it is going to develop into a serious pour. Drink from 2017.
title: Evel 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fairly full, rich and creamy version of Vinho Verde, with floral and anise aromas. Big and yet refreshing, sparked by some lively spritz. The finish echoes the anise and blends in some bright lime notes as well.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 1998 Couto de Frades Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A fairly full, rich and creamy version of Vinho Verde, with floral and anise aromas. Big and yet refreshing, sparked by some lively spritz. The finish echoes the anise and blends in some bright lime notes as well.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 1998 Couto de Frades Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Some slightly sappy elements mingle with cinnamon and blackberries in the aromas of this complex red. Anise and cherry flavors appear on the palate, along with mild bitter chocolate on the finish. Lots of interesting things here in this medium-weight, food-friendly wine.
title: Calços do Tanha 1996 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Some slightly sappy elements mingle with cinnamon and blackberries in the aromas of this complex red. Anise and cherry flavors appear on the palate, along with mild bitter chocolate on the finish. Lots of interesting things here in this medium-weight, food-friendly wine.
title: Calços do Tanha 1996 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: From the Setúbal Peninsula, this 100% Periquita is bright and cherry-laden. Soft and velvety in texture, yet with sufficient acidity to accompany food. Be forewarned: There are some nasty bottle stinks that warrant decanting prior to serving. Best Buy.
title: Quinta da Romeira 1999 Tradicão Red (Palmela)

description: A classic Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz makes a harmonious wine that has ripe berry fruits and a soft structure. It is a stylish wine with a fresh fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja Red (Douro)

description: The wine has a fat fruity texture along with acidity and plenty of tannins. It is austere in character, very dry and dense and with a serious intent. There is a juicy aftertaste that is more attractive and has promise for the future.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Still with its firm tannins in place and with layers of wood aging flavors, this is obviously a young wine. It has a background of ripe berry fruits and acidity that will develop over the next two years. It is potentially rich and full. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Colheita Castelão (Palmela)

description: Attractive, soft raspberry fruit is evident, along with some toast. Flavors have light spice and balanced acidity, finishing with a yeasty character.
title: Murganheira 2005 Rosé Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: The lightest wine from Cartuxa, EA stands for Eugénio de Almeida, the creator of the charity that owns the winery. It's simple and fruity, with attractive tannins and red cherry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2010 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The lightest wine from Cartuxa, EA stands for Eugénio de Almeida, the creator of the charity that owns the winery. It's simple and fruity, with attractive tannins and red cherry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2010 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: From old vines trained on high trellises, this fruity wine is bright with citrusy acidity and lemon zest-like texture. Its creamier side emerges as the wine develops in the glass. Best to wait until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Nostalgia Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: The Sousão grape, normally only used in rare blends, has produced here a dark-colored wine packed with smoky tannins. Its fruit and intense acidity are dwarfed by its impressive structure. Age the wine at least until 2019.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2014 Sousão (Douro)

description: This is a strongly mineral wine, textured and rich at the same time, with fine acidity. Blackberry fruit dominates the palate, with rich tannins and cool freshness. It tastes of terroir, a true Dão from the granite soils. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 Somontes Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Solid tannins lead into a wine that balances very dry, dark fruits with dense wood textures. It's a solid, chunky, bold wine, richly fruity and still young. Drink this firm, ageworthy wine from 2016.
title: Poças 2011 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: A ripe and fruity wine that boasts yellow fruits and fresh citrus characteristics. It's lush and ripe, with just a touch of minerality to give the wine structure. There's a delicious tangy aftertaste to this full, impressive wine.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 O Oenólgo Encruzado (Dão)

description: A bold, powerful wine, showing smooth, mature black-fruit flavors and rich tannins. It is soft, solid and powerfully built. Wood aging has given extra roundness and a touch of spice to the palate. Drink this wine now and until 2018.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Grown at 1,800 feet in the dry upper Douro, this wine is full while retaining a cool, mineral edge. It was made entirely in tanks, giving primacy to the berry fruits and acidity. The tannins suggest it could age,  although it is very drinkable now.
title: Muxagat 2013 Tinta Barroca (Douro)

description: Spicy and juicy, this is obviously a wood-aged wine. It offers tannins, red fruits, coffee and a warm, rich character balanced by acidity that cuts through the structure. It needs some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Atlântico Gold Label Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Spicy and juicy, this is obviously a wood-aged wine. It offers tannins, red fruits, coffee and a warm, rich character balanced by acidity that cuts through the structure. It needs some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Atlântico Gold Label Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The Síria grape—a relative of Malvasia and Roupeiro—is only found under this name in the mountainous eastern Beira region. This rendition is aromatic, with a tight, cool texture, tangy acidity and lime zest and apple flavors that give a crisp, fruity aftertaste.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta do Cardo Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: The Síria grape—a relative of Malvasia and Roupeiro—is only found under this name in the mountainous eastern Beira region. This rendition is aromatic, with a tight, cool texture, tangy acidity and lime zest and apple flavors that give a crisp, fruity aftertaste.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta do Cardo Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: The wine comes from the Guedes family's showpiece estate for Casa Ferreirinha in the Alto Douro. It is dark, dense and still very young. With a strong mineral element and dry tannins, it has concentration as well as potential. The black plum fruits are still developing, still youthful. So give this impressive wine until 2020 before drinking.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2013 Quinta da Leda Red (Douro)

description: This super-rich wood-aged wine is ripe with tropical fruits and packed with toast flavors. It is already mature with an attractive oxidative edge from the new barrels that adds complexity to the fruitiness. It is impressive—maybe too powerful—but certainly a serious expression of what the Douro can do with white wines. Drink now.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2012 Antónia Adelaide Ferreira White (Douro)

description: Long barrel-aging of many old native varieties gives this field blend a rich, ripe taste. There is an attractive touch of oxidation from the wood, giving concentrated toast and spice as well as fruit acidity. This unusual, impressive wine from the Guedes family is ready to drink now.
title: Sogrape NV Branco Especial White (Dão)

description: This wood-aged wine is a product of the new venture Sogrape has launched in Alentejo. It is powerful, dark in color and seriously concentrated. Dense tannins and a solid structure are rich with black plum and berry fruits as well as acidity. The wine is still young and needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Sogrape 2013 Herdade do Peso Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Fermented in new barrels, this is a ripe, yellow fruit- and spice-flavored wine. It blends Fernão Pires, Roupeiro and Arinto, resulting in rich fruit, bright acidity and a fine, toasty character. Ready to drink.
title: Roquevale 2014 Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Produced from the vines that surround the family house at Quinta da Aveleda, this is an exemplary Vinho Verde. Dry and crisp, with richness as well as freshness, it is a bright, tight and lightly mineral wine to drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled White (Vinho Verde)

description: With aromas of superripe fruit, this wood aged wine has a rich, toasty and lightly oxidized character, which in this case adds complexity. It is tangy and aromatic, with pear and citrus flavors that harmonize with the spicy wood accents. It is ready to drink.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2011 Vinhas Velhas Branco White (Douro)

description: This Alvarinho comes from vines grown outside the classic Vinho Verde appellation in the larger Minhao region of northern Portugal, but you'd never know it. It has all the intensity and richness of the grape, with a rich texture and apricot and pineapple flavors. It's a fine wine that could age, so drink from 2016.
title: Quinta de Lourosa 2014 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A big, ripe wine that is full of tannins as well as rich black plum fruit flavors. It is dark with bitter chocolate, smoky bacon flavors as well as a concentrated structure that promises aging. This 100% Touriga Nacional is still so young, still tough, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Casaboa 2011 Casaboa Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: A big, ripe wine that is full of tannins as well as rich black plum fruit flavors. It is dark with bitter chocolate, smoky bacon flavors as well as a concentrated structure that promises aging. This 100% Touriga Nacional is still so young, still tough, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Casaboa 2011 Casaboa Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: From limestone and granite soils, this is a structured, mineral, textured wine. It already has a fine balance between berry fruits and their acidity and a dense, dry tannic core that gives the wine a solid character and considerable potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 Red (Alentejano)

description: Going for structure as much as fruit, this is a cool wine with black currant flavors giving high acidity. It feels light, fresh, although there are tannins and spice to give some final weight.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2007 Bridão Classico Red (Ribatejo)

description: A lean style bringing out acidity from the juicy black currant fruits. It has definite tannins supporting the fruit, while it finishes with fresh, perhaps too fresh, acidity.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2008 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: Despite its richness, this is a stylish wine that exudes freshness as much as dense fruit and structure. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon, all structured varieties, it still yields a generous full-bodied and rounded wine. It does need to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Maria Mora Enamorada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a finely integrated, rich wine that shows impeccable balance between dusty tannins and juicy dark berry tones. The wood aging shows through in a smooth texture that gives a sense of richness to the ripe fruit. This is an elegant wine that can be drunk now although it will benefit from some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a finely integrated, rich wine that shows impeccable balance between dusty tannins and juicy dark berry tones. The wood aging shows through in a smooth texture that gives a sense of richness to the ripe fruit. This is an elegant wine that can be drunk now although it will benefit from some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a wine that reveals the younger side of Moscatel in Setúbal. It shows honey, spice and perfumed fruitiness that contrast with the richness of the texture and its fresh peach and apricot flavors. Drink now for immediate enjoyment.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 Alambre  (Moscatel de Setúbal)

description: A strongly wood aged wine, powered by tannins and dense fruits, it is concentrated and still young enough for the wood to show through although the fruit is developing well. This is a structured wine that will need plenty of time to age so drink from 2018.
title: Adega de Favaios 2012 Casa Velha Colheita Seleccionada Red (Douro)

description: A strongly wood aged wine, powered by tannins and dense fruits, it is concentrated and still young enough for the wood to show through although the fruit is developing well. This is a structured wine that will need plenty of time to age so drink from 2018.
title: Adega de Favaios 2012 Casa Velha Colheita Seleccionada Red (Douro)

description: This fragrant wine has perfumed aromas and a light candy-flavored palate. It's crisp with apples, tangy with citrus, finishing with bright acidity and a fragrant aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Dona Maria White (Alentejano)

description: This fragrant wine has perfumed aromas and a light candy-flavored palate. It's crisp with apples, tangy with citrus, finishing with bright acidity and a fragrant aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Dona Maria White (Alentejano)

description: This lightly perfumed wine is crisp and clear. Apple and pear flavors are attractively packaged in fresh acidity and an orange-peel tang. The wine is still young, with its tight aftertaste, so wait until later in 2015 to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas White (Lisboa)

description: Quinta do Carmo, formerly owned by the Rothschild family of Château Lafite, is now part of the Bacalhâo group. Perfumed and fruity, this leaps from the glass with fresh, crisp lemon and pear flavors and light minerality. Drink now.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Quinta do Carmo Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Crisp, not quite dry, this incorporates lively, fruity Loureiro grapes with a touch of Trajadura and Arinto culled from Lima Valley vineyards. With its light squeeze of lemon and sliced apple and grapefruit flavors, it's all about freshness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2013 Ponte White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine has a dark, still-young color. Freshness brings out bright red and dried fruits as well as acidity. It's attractive, soft and fruity, a young-tasting 10-Years-Old.
title: Offley NV Barão de Forrester 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Soft and light, this is attractively fruity although it lacks great depth of flavor. It is balanced, ripe and sweet, with touches of the wood aging and acidity coming through more strongly at the end.
title: Niepoort NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The freshest fruit is balanced with vanilla and spice flavors. Crisp apples have light, bright acidity, freshened further with lemon and lime fruitiness that leaves an open, full and generous aftertaste. The wine will be better in 2016.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 White (Alentejano)

description: Blending Douro's native Viosinho and Verdelho grapes, this is ripe, wood aged and smooth. It has layers of citrus, grapefruit and white fruits, apple juice and pears. It is fruity, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: Blending Douro's native Viosinho and Verdelho grapes, this is ripe, wood aged and smooth. It has layers of citrus, grapefruit and white fruits, apple juice and pears. It is fruity, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: Strong sweet raisin flavors give fruitiness. It is bright, with a streak of acidity that brings out red fruits as well as soft tannins. The aftertaste has a burnt quality, with intense acidity right at the end.
title: Quinta da Romaneira NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: In the increasingly important Dão region, Sobral's top-of-the-range is an impressively rich dense wine. With its great tannins and generous black fruits, it is full of potential. Produced by winemaker Carlos Lucas from a selection of grapes as well as parcels, the wine is concentrated, dark and firm. The acidity gives it great life as well as a juicy character that emphasizes the ripe fruit. The wine is still young, drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Sobral 2014 Vinha da Neta Red (Dão)

description: Rich, generous and packed with fruit, this is a field-blend wine that just bursts from the glass. With a fine balance between tannins and the rich blackberry fruits, the wine is ripe, warm and structured. It is a wine to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2015 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: Structured and firm, this is a dry wine with the potential of fine fruit in the future. Acidity cuts through the texture promising the freshness of black currants and berries. It's a perfumed wine that can still age. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A ripe, soft wine that has touches of wood from its four months aging in barrel. There is a spicy, perfumed character with apricot and ripe pear flavors. The acidity is well in balance. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2014 Terras do Pó Chardonnay-Viognier (Península de Setúbal)

description: With soft tannins and ripe berry fruits, this is an immediately accessible wine. It has a fresh character, with a smoky edge and a ripe, smooth aftertaste. This would make a great barbecue wine for the summer.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: A soft apple-tinged wine, with bright acidity that cuts right through. The wine is rounded, with just enough crispness. Ready to drink.
title: Falua 2010 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada White (Tejo)

description: A soft apple-tinged wine, with bright acidity that cuts right through. The wine is rounded, with just enough crispness. Ready to drink.
title: Falua 2010 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada White (Tejo)

description: This earthy wine has black-currant acidity, awkward dry tannins and a tough texture. The aftertaste is medicinal and herbal.
title: Valle Pradinhos 2010 Porta Velha Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: This is a powerful wood-aged wine that is currently exhibiting dark chocolate and coffee flavors from new, smoky oak. It's the weight of the juicy fruit underneath that reveals the promise of aging. There is a mineral texture that shows the schist soil of the vineyard, all part of the dense mix. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2010 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: A bold, rich wine fringed with tannins, at a young age it already shows a solid structure of ripe and juicy berry tones. With well-balanced oak aging, slightly toasty notes show restraint on this dark and complex wine that has potential to age. Drink after 2016.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: There is a rich blend of Aragonez, Touriga Nacional, Trincadeira and Syrah in this full, ripe, black-fruit tinged wine. It is already open and generous, with wood spice tones and a smooth texture. Drink now through 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Mariana Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A Vinho Verde with some weight from the ripe pear and grapefruit-flavored fruit. It is bone dry, very fresh, the intensity of flavors turning this into a fine food wine.A Vinho Verde with some weight from the ripe pear and grapefruit-flavored fruit. It is bone dry, very fresh, the intensity of flavors turning this into a fine food wine.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2009 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A fresh and rich wine, its tannins soft and smooth. There is a firm edge, while the main flavors are ripe, juicy black plum and damsons, pushed by final acidity.
title: Douro Family Estates 2007 DFE Premium Red (Douro)

description: From vineyards in the Douro Superior, the high Douro close to Spain, this powerful wine reflects the dry climate with its dense tannins and concentration. A juicy element brings fresh black plums and acidity to the mix. The wine is an impressive work in progress. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2011 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a full-bodied, intense wine. It has citrus acidity as well as more tropical fruits, laden with wood. The whole is much more than the sum of the parts, giving a full, ripe and complex wine that will age.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2011 Munda Encruzado (Dão)

description: Big, rich and fruity, this wine has a powerful future. It delivers structure and dense tannins, but it's the generous fruitiness that promises much. The tannins will soften by 2016–2017 to give a ripe, full-bodied wine, packed with fruit.
title: Terras de Alter 2011 Terra D'Alter Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm and dry, this LBV from a fine Port year is structured, showing dry tannins as well as ripe, dry fruits. That means the richness is restrained, giving elegance, perfumes of violets and finishing with some tight acidity.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Firm and dry, this LBV from a fine Port year is structured, showing dry tannins as well as ripe, dry fruits. That means the richness is restrained, giving elegance, perfumes of violets and finishing with some tight acidity.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2003 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A big-hearted, fruity wine. With its ripe tannins and red berry fruits, this red is certainly powerful, but it manages to keep its balance, finishing ripe and sweet. This is a wine that could be enjoyed now, but would certainly age over the next 4–5 years.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2005 Red (Douro)

description: Always impressive, this wine is structured and powerful, with firm tannins that are still coming together. Packed with black fruits and tannins, it conveys a rich, almost Port-like quality, perhaps because the grapes are foot-trodden as in Port. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Vinha da Francisca Red (Douro)

description: The estate is owned by the Olazabal family, descendants of Antonia Ferreira who created this and many other estates in the 19th century. This is a major wine, ripe and full of rich tannins and concentrated fruit. It is always one of the longest-lived wines from the Douro and this vintage has the structure and the fruit weight to develop well. An attractive spicy, smoky character adds extra interest. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Red (Douro)

description: Crisp and green, this has a ripe, rounded apple flavor that lends the wine richness. There is a yeasty character to go with the fruitiness, while the refreshing acidity lasts through the finish.
title: Vera 2011 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: While there is an initial barnyard edge, once that blows off, it reveals a dense and solid wine, packed with ripe black fruit and sweet tannins. The acidity brings out spice and edgy, mineral characters.
title: Kopke 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Full, rounded and rich, this wine shows some wood flavors as well as complex tannins and acidity. There's a funky edge to it that suggests a rustic character. At the end, though, the acidity of the vintage dominates.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Full, rounded and rich, this wine shows some wood flavors as well as complex tannins and acidity. There's a funky edge to it that suggests a rustic character. At the end, though, the acidity of the vintage dominates.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This dry rosé is made, as are most of the wines from this producer, from Merlot. It gives a soft, smooth and lightly caramel flavored wine though with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. Drink this wine now.
title: Nelson Neves 2016 Neves Colheita Merlot Rosé (Bairrada)

description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)

description: Alvarinho from the northern Vinho Verde region lends itself to bubbles with its naturally crisp character. It gives a wine that has a tight mineral texture that lifts the citrus and green-apple fruits. The wine, packed with acidity, is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Reserva Bruto Natural Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Alvarinho from the northern Vinho Verde region lends itself to bubbles with its naturally crisp character. It gives a wine that has a tight mineral texture that lifts the citrus and green-apple fruits. The wine, packed with acidity, is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Reserva Bruto Natural Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Away from its native vineyard in the north of Portugal, the Alvarinho becomes extra rich and ripe in the hot center. That's the case here with a soft wine that has apple and pear flavors. It is light on the acidity, always fruity and easy to drink with food. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This soft ripe wine is smooth and velvet textured. Its black fruits and ripe tannins are well integrated with the acidity and juicy aftertaste. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet is eclectic but certainly works. Ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This soft ripe wine is smooth and velvet textured. Its black fruits and ripe tannins are well integrated with the acidity and juicy aftertaste. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet is eclectic but certainly works. Ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This youthful crisp blend of Chardonnay and Fernão Pires comes from the Lisboa region. With a light texture, plenty of acidity and a fruity aftertaste, it is a great apéritif style.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Bruto Sparkling (Lisboa)

description: This youthful crisp blend of Chardonnay and Fernão Pires comes from the Lisboa region. With a light texture, plenty of acidity and a fruity aftertaste, it is a great apéritif style.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Bruto Sparkling (Lisboa)

description: This new range of wines from Lagoalva features typical Portuguese tiles (azulejos) on the label. Inside the bottle, this wine is fruity with soft tannins, spice and red-berry flavors. It has a juicy aftertaste that blends with the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This new range of wines from Lagoalva features typical Portuguese tiles (azulejos) on the label. Inside the bottle, this wine is fruity with soft tannins, spice and red-berry flavors. It has a juicy aftertaste that blends with the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a soft wine with open fruits and gentle tannins. A blend of local varieties along with Syrah, the wine is smoothly textured, generous and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2016 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Opta 2016 Red (Dão)

description: The minerality that seems to come from this quinta makes for a wine that needs time, and this wine is defiantly young. However, its chocolate flavors, bitter toast and dense structure all promise well.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Coa Red (Douro)

description: Fresh, despite the dense tannin, this is a ripe, juicy wine, full of black currant flavors and vibrant acidity. Wood treatment shows more cassis just at the end to round the wine out.
title: Cálem 2006 Curva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Very dark in color, this is an impressive wine with power and dense tannins. The fruit is solid, packed with blackberry and dark plum flavors, and wild, almost savage, ripeness.
title: Calços do Tanha 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Delicious fresh citrus flavored wine, bright as a button, lively and crisp. Made from Alvarinho, there is a creamy texture with a mineral element, finishing with green plums and banana flavors.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Quinta dos Loridos Branco Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Earthy aromas are a hallmark of the Baga grape, a component of this full-bodied, tannic blend. With weight and richness, a mint note and new wood flavors, it is a serious wine that still should develop over three years.
title: Caves Aliança 2007 Quinta das Baceladas Red (Bairrada)

description: This ripe and fruity wine is as reliable as always. With soft tannins and generous red-berry flavors, it is an attractive blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah which have been infused with Alentejo warmth. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Defesa do Esporão Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an open, soft, ripe and fruity wine. With a finely integrated tannic structure and plenty of red fruits and acidity, it is a generous full wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an open, soft, ripe and fruity wine. With a finely integrated tannic structure and plenty of red fruits and acidity, it is a generous full wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: DFJ Vinhos manages this 16th century property which has produced a now mature wine. It has great balance, the berry fruits moving to secondary flavors of spice, smokiness, sweet tannins and hints of toast. It's ready to drink, but will continue to develop through 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Quinta do Rocio Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a big, ripe and fruity wine. It is now maturing well into a rich, solid, complex wine. This second wine from the Mouchão estate in Alentejo is gorgeous, opulent and rich. The black fruit character is powerful, with delicious acidity and a darkly tannic character. It is still very young, so drink from 2017.
title: Mouchão 2009 Ponte das Canas Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: In praise in the Loureiro grape, this dry wine has lively acidity while also having a ripe full texture of apples and pink grapefruit. The wine is crisp and intensely fruity. Drink now and until early 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Maria Bonita Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: For a Vinho Verde, this is smooth. With the a creamy texture along with bread fruit and lime flavors, the wine is soft. There is acidity to give a lift perfectly judged to keep this attractively crisp at the end. Drink now.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: For a Vinho Verde, this is smooth. With the a creamy texture along with bread fruit and lime flavors, the wine is soft. There is acidity to give a lift perfectly judged to keep this attractively crisp at the end. Drink now.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Merlot and Syrah join Tinta Roriz in this impressive wine. A fermentation in open lagars as well as time in oak give this blend richness and a deliciously juicy. Ripe and full bodied, it is ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2008 Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)

description: From a blend of grapes that includes Touriga Nacional, this wine is serious and dense. It has a solid texture along with concentrated dark-plum flavors. It's a powerhouse of firm tannins, juicy fruits and a fine layer of spice from wood aging. Drink after 2015.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Ramos Premium Red (Alentejano)

description: This is firm and solid wine is a blend dominated by tannic Touriga Nacional. Ripe berry fruits on the palate offer juicy acidity for balance, and a perfumed hue gives character and nuance. This impressive wine needs to age, so wait until 2016.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2009 Aurius Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a smooth and generous wine. It is rich, full-bodied and packed with dark plum flavor, but it's the ripe, velvet character that is so appealing. It's almost ready to drink, although the firm tannins and minerality at the end suggest it will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Red (Douro)

description: Rounded and smooth, this generous blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, is rich and perfumed. It has an immediately appealing ripe and fruity character, with plenty of black fruit and dark cherry tones supported by juicy acidity. Solid and chunky, this wine needs to age and would be best after 2016.
title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Pear and tangerine notes give this wine an immediately fruity character. It has bright acidity, with a fresh and crisp palate. The fruit is right up front, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza Códega do Larinho White (Douro)

description: This is a spicy wine that is full of juicy red-berry fruit notes. It is soft and gentle, with a core of dry tannins that gives the wine structure. Young and fruity, it is ready to drink, but will also age. Drink until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Here's a ripe, earthy wine that is softly tannic and richly fruity. It has a fine balance between the warm blackberry fruits and solid structure. Made to be drunk young, it is already delicious. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto, this is a deliciously fresh wine, lighted by acidity and with a tight texture. Drink now for summer pleasure.
title: Alente 2009 White (Alentejano)

description: Powerful tannins push the wine forward to a more fruity, spicy hinterland, where the red cherry acidity prevails.
title: Sanguinhal 2008 Quinta de São Francisco Red (Obidos)

description: This second wine from Dão Sul's Douro quinta shows the bright fruity side of the region. It's a lively, fresh, red fruit flavored wine, with soft tannins and a ready to drink feel.
designation: Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras
title: Dão Sul 2008 Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras Red (Douro)

description: Ripe and juicy, full of blueberry fruit flavors, very smooth and velvet while also shot through with acidity. A delicious, ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Casa de Santa Vitoria 2008 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This ripe and structured wine is poised between rich berry fruits and a solid, dark tannic core. It has great fruitiness that envelops the dry center, showing wood and spice flavors that are coming together well. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A dark, almost black color is a reminder of Petit Verdot's traditional use to give color in the Bordeaux blend. The wine also has a stylish, aromatic character that brings out black fruits and generous tannins. It's rich and still young. Drink from 2017.
title: Azamor 2011 Petite Verdot (Alentejano)

description: Made from a selection of premium parcels, this wood-aged wine still shows evidence of its toast and firm extract. So although there is plenty of fruit there, it's the dry core that is evident. It could still soften, so wait until 2017 to drink.
title: Azamor 2010 Selected Vines Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine has all the freshness of the grape, along with ripe, full lemon and red apple flavors. There is a strongly tangy character, a mineral texture from the granite soil and refreshing final acidity. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2014 Muros de Melgaço Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine has all the freshness of the grape, along with ripe, full lemon and red apple flavors. There is a strongly tangy character, a mineral texture from the granite soil and refreshing final acidity. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2014 Muros de Melgaço Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A sweet Vinho Verde, it is light, fruity and perfect for the summer. With crisp acidity, a lively, frothy texture and a clean apple aftertaste, it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2013 Arca Nova White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is a smooth and clean wine. It has yellow fruit, pineapple and white currant flavors that give a perfumed edge. It's not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Bojador Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine tastes full of ripe fruits as well as acidity. A touch of bitter almond gives a hard edge to the otherwise fruity, apple and pear flavored wine. Drink from 2015 to give the wine some bottle age.
title: Dão Sul 2010 Encontro Special Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This crisp and fresh wine suggests citrus and green apple fruits. It is light, fragrant and ready to drink with its bright final acidity.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: Ripe lemon and lime flavors cut right through this crisp, fruity wine. Acidity and hints of pineapple and peach are part of the mix. It is still young and should be held until late 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Quartilho Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: A delicious citric-dominated wine, very fresh, with a great apple skin texture, bright aciidty and crisp white fruits. It dances easily, lightly, ready to drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta do Cardo White (Beira Interior)

description: A delicious citric-dominated wine, very fresh, with a great apple skin texture, bright aciidty and crisp white fruits. It dances easily, lightly, ready to drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta do Cardo White (Beira Interior)

description: This is a solidly tannic wine. A dry edge comes from the Baga grape in the blend. At the same time, the wine has plenty of ripe black fruits that give a rounder character. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2017.
title: Messias 2012 Quinta do Valdoeiro Colheita Red (Bairrada)

description: While this wine is dry, it offers good fruit weight that will fill out as it matures. It has a smoky character with juicy red-berry fruits in the background. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Reserva Unoaked Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: While this wine is dry, it offers good fruit weight that will fill out as it matures. It has a smoky character with juicy red-berry fruits in the background. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Reserva Unoaked Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This wine is ripe with acidity and red-berry fruits, with firm tannins that will soften. Drink this attractive, fruity wine from 2019.
title: Quevedo 2014 Claudia's Red (Douro)

description: A barrel-fermented wine, this is richly perfumed both from the wood and from the nature of the Cercial grape. The wine has strong minerality, lime and lemon flavors, and layers of spice. Already mature, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2014 Campolargo Branco White (Bairrada)

description: The perfumes of Malvasia Fina shine in this attractive dry sparkling wine. It is fruity, although with a yeasty edge, creating a fine apéritif style.
title: Murganheira 2005 Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: A light spritz gives this wine some of the character of club soda and lime, with a slight brinyness to add interest.
title: Quinta da Aveleda NV Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light and simple, with green apple and citrus aromas and flavors. Use it to wash down steamed shellfish at the beach.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2001 Estate Bottled Arinto (Bucelas)

description: A great, concentrated wine, rich, with a burnt almond character and delicious acidity. It keeps some freshness while showing a fine sense of maturity.
title: Borges NV Roncão 20-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: From the far north of the Vinho Verde region, the rich and creamy wine balances acidity, green plum and crisp minerality. Aromatic, elegant, fresh.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2009 Touquinheiras White (Vinho Verde)

description: Rich, smooth, with great wafts of creaminess to go with a judicious amount of toast. White plum and pear flavors precede a finish with impressive concentration and delicious acidity.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Catarina White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is an initially smooth wood-aged wine that is intense, concentrated and packed with power and tannins. It is rich and full of brooding dark plum and dense with structure. Dominated by Touriga Nacional, it has that variety's perfumed character which is balanced by the smoother Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. It is obviously a wine to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: For a wine at this price, this is an impressive performance. It is rich, finely structured, the juicy blackberry flavors filling the mouth. It may lack complexity, but the spice, tobacco and berry flavors are enjoyably drinkable.
title: Dão Sul 2006 Cortello Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: A blended style of Madeira, this is rich, soft, without the ineffable bite of a wine made from the classic varieties, but certainly with acidity and wood as well as a full, caramel-flavored aftertaste.
title: Blandy's NV Duke of Clarence Rich Madeira (Madeira)

description: Rich, soft and spicy, this is a warm, ripe wine. With its flavors of figs, black plums and herbs, it certainly sums up the heat of the Douro, leaving some good fresh acidity to finish.
title: Sogevinus 2006 Curva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Rich, soft and spicy, this is a warm, ripe wine. With its flavors of figs, black plums and herbs, it certainly sums up the heat of the Douro, leaving some good fresh acidity to finish.
title: Sogevinus 2006 Curva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The familiar rosé Lancers is all about crushed strawberries with a touch of sugar. There is a light structure, but the attractive light pink color and the fresh fruit all work together. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca NV Lancers Rosé Red (Table wine)

description: Somewhat lean, this has a tart, grapefruit character that sits awkwardly with the otherwise fresh, green fruit character. Hard-edged.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2006 Terra de Lobos White (Ribatejano)

description: The wine has a jammy character that gives it concentration. It is sweet although with enough acidity. The blackberry jelly flavors are firmed out with some fine tannins, certainly plenty to promise good aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: Viognier and Alvarinho are not native to the Alentejo but the region's heat adds warmth and richness. This refreshing wine's acidity and citrus flavors are balanced by the ripe yellow fruit and pineapple. Partially aged in wood, it needs a few more months. Drink from 2018.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2015 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This firm and generous blend of Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet is powerful, with great black fruits and layers of firm tannins. Its structure and concentration are made for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Fiuza 2016 Babu Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This firm and generous blend of Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet is powerful, with great black fruits and layers of firm tannins. Its structure and concentration are made for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Fiuza 2016 Babu Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: While Alicante Bouschet is probably more at home in the Alentejo, this wine from the coastal Lisboa region still has much of the dark color, solid, dry tannins and intensely juicy wild-berry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: This wine has acidity and juicy black-currant fruits. It is relatively light in structure, giving a delicious wine with attractive fruits that's ready to drink from 2024.
title: Cockburn's 2015 Bicentenary Vintage  (Port)

description: In the hands of master blender Dirk Niepoort, even a straight tawny style has depth of flavor and intensity. The wine has red fruit, layered with concentrated acidity, a hint of wood aging, and remains fresh and fruity.
title: Niepoort NV Tawny  (Port)

description: In the hands of master blender Dirk Niepoort, even a straight tawny style has depth of flavor and intensity. The wine has red fruit, layered with concentrated acidity, a hint of wood aging, and remains fresh and fruity.
title: Niepoort NV Tawny  (Port)

description: A blend of typical Alentejo grapes, this is a firm effort, with the fruit laced inbetween the complex tannic structure. The acidity gives the wine a final lift.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 4 Quatro Castas Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is bright, fruity and packed with berries and juicy black cherries. The acidity gives a fresh character that balances the sweetly ripe fruits. Ready to drink, this is a deliciously fruity wine.
title: Poças 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Hints of oak smooth out the inherent herbal character of the grape, yielding ripe tones of apricot and pineapple. This wine is ripe and fruity and ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2014 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine has fine acidity along with bright berry flavors. The freshness suggests it is still young and needs to broaden out with its juicy, black currant aftertaste. In style it is dry, balance by a bright final acidity.
title: Cockburn's 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine has fine acidity along with bright berry flavors. The freshness suggests it is still young and needs to broaden out with its juicy, black currant aftertaste. In style it is dry, balance by a bright final acidity.
title: Cockburn's 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: With some earthy, rustic flavors the wine seems to have missed out on some of its fruit. It is more about structure and firm tannins with only hints of juicy fruit behind.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Monta da Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a rich style of rosé. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, it is full of ripe raspberry and red plum flavors that are soft and generous, although lacking acidity. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This wine shows the tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc with pineapple and mango flavors. The acidity is there, floral and ripe. The wine is ready to drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: A tropical fruit flavored wine with yellow fruits, pineapple and mango. It is soft and very ripe although still showing some of the fresher acidity that should be in an Alvarinho wine. It's a long way from the cool north of Portugal.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Senses Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: A sweet rosé that is light and fresh from the crisp raspberry acidity. It is bright and fruity, ready to drink.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2014 Lagar Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a fruity red berry flavored wine. It has a bright crisp edge to its fruit as well as light tannins and acidity. It is quite ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2014 Vinea Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a fruity red berry flavored wine. It has a bright crisp edge to its fruit as well as light tannins and acidity. It is quite ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2014 Vinea Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With a light prickle on the tongue, this is a fresh and fruity wine that has sweetness balanced by a citric edge. It's crisp and ready to drink.
title: Campelo 2014 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dark and richly dense wine, this is packed with black fruit notes and concentrated tannins. Aged in French and American oak, it has a strongly spicy character, with bright acid and a solid tannic structure. Drink after 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Alabastro Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A dark and richly dense wine, this is packed with black fruit notes and concentrated tannins. Aged in French and American oak, it has a strongly spicy character, with bright acid and a solid tannic structure. Drink after 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Alabastro Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is packed with flavor from the ripe blend of Shiraz, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. Its berry fruits and balanced acidity give the wine an easy, juicy character. The gentle tannins are easily integrated with the fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: While the familiar white version of this wine is from Vinho Verde, the producers have gone a little further south to the Douro for the red. That gives a soft wine but with weight and attractive layers of red-berry fruits and a touch of warmth. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Red (Douro)

description: While the familiar white version of this wine is from Vinho Verde, the producers have gone a little further south to the Douro for the red. That gives a soft wine but with weight and attractive layers of red-berry fruits and a touch of warmth. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Red (Douro)

description: This ripe wine is full of apple and pear fruit with a touch of citrus. It is full, the acidity just pointing up the richness. There are almond flavors as well as spice from the wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Premium White (Douro)

description: This blend is dominated by one of the two grapes of Vinho Verde: the Loureiro. That gives both a crisp texture and ripe apple and green-plum fruits. It is a ripe wine, juicy and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Alicante Bouschet, a grape that has red juice as well as skins, produces rich and darkly colored wines. This wood-aged Reserva is a concentrated and tannic example. It's also ripe and full-bodied, a bold wine that packs a big punch. The wood aging shows well, reinforcing the fresher black juiciness of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade das Servas 2011 Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Alicante Bouschet, a grape that has red juice as well as skins, produces rich and darkly colored wines. This wood-aged Reserva is a concentrated and tannic example. It's also ripe and full-bodied, a bold wine that packs a big punch. The wood aging shows well, reinforcing the fresher black juiciness of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade das Servas 2011 Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: This is the second wine from the Pintas vineyard in the heart of the Pinhão valley. It's powered by mint, dark plums and new wood flavors to give a richly concentrated, juicy wine. It's still young, showing all its initial fruitiness, and those tannins and acidity will need several years. Drink from 2017.
title: Wine & Soul 2012 Pintas Character Red (Douro)

description: This is the second wine from the Pintas vineyard in the heart of the Pinhão valley. It's powered by mint, dark plums and new wood flavors to give a richly concentrated, juicy wine. It's still young, showing all its initial fruitiness, and those tannins and acidity will need several years. Drink from 2017.
title: Wine & Soul 2012 Pintas Character Red (Douro)

description: Quinta Nova has produced two Grand Reservas in 2012. This is leaner than the other, a more structured wine with dry tannins and great concentration. It will need several years to soften and bring out its natural mineral richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2012 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: French oak aging has given this still-young wine a firmly structured character, with dark tannins and a firm texture. It's still very dry, structured and dark and needs a good few years to age and round out. For now, the ripe fruit and acidity are both showing great promise. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: French oak aging has given this still-young wine a firmly structured character, with dark tannins and a firm texture. It's still very dry, structured and dark and needs a good few years to age and round out. For now, the ripe fruit and acidity are both showing great promise. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: With 12 months wood aging, this powerful wine has managed to keep a great sense of balance. Solid tannins are tempered by a more dusty texture, smooth black plum fruits, rich, concentrated acidity and juicy final fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: From the coastal plain of the Beiras, this cool and structured blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional has a fine poise between acidity and sweet berry fruits. It's a complex, textured wine. Fresh and fruity on the one hand and dark and brooding on the other, it needs time, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2011 Red (Beira Atlantico)

description: A fascinating blend of the local grape Maria Gomes and Chardonnay, this spicy, fragrant wine is full of ripe fruit notes and vibrant acidity. It remains light at heart despite all the complexity. It could be drunk now, but will be better from 2016.
title: Aveleda 2013 Reserva da Familia White (Bairrada)

description: A fascinating blend of the local grape Maria Gomes and Chardonnay, this spicy, fragrant wine is full of ripe fruit notes and vibrant acidity. It remains light at heart despite all the complexity. It could be drunk now, but will be better from 2016.
title: Aveleda 2013 Reserva da Familia White (Bairrada)

description: Named after the barn owl (Tyto alba) that nests in the woods of the Lezirias estate, this has great tannins that give shape to the dense black fruits. With a powerful structure and so much of the Touriga Nacional perfumes, this is a wine for aging. Drink from 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Grown on granite soil that is shot through with quartz, this is the epitome of a mineral, structured wine. On top of that texture, the wine has ripe lemon and green plum fruits that are full of juicy flavor. The wine is so fresh it could do with a few months aging. Drink from late 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Reserva Quartz White (Beira Interior)

description: Grown on granite soil that is shot through with quartz, this is the epitome of a mineral, structured wine. On top of that texture, the wine has ripe lemon and green plum fruits that are full of juicy flavor. The wine is so fresh it could do with a few months aging. Drink from late 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Reserva Quartz White (Beira Interior)

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine, this is packed with woody notes as well as powerful fruit. It has solid tannins and dark flavors of bitter chocolate and black cherries. It's rich and concentrated, with good aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Poças 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Antão Vaz and Verdelho is rich and creamy with spice and green plum flavors given a boost by vanilla and ginger flavors. There's a fine perfumed aftertaste from the Verdelho.
title: Luis Duarte 2012 Rapariga da Quinta Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is perfumed with geranium aromas and rhubarb flavors. It is strange and not likely to improve.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is perfumed with geranium aromas and rhubarb flavors. It is strange and not likely to improve.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is woody, showing concentrated toast and vanilla flavors. It seems to be missing its fruit.
title: Roncão 2012 Quinta da Levandeira Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine has a geranium aroma and a strangely perfumed character. It is light and fruity although not likely to develop much.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2011 Red (Douro)

description: This wine has too much wood, with high toast and spice. The fruit is dominated by this wood that is not likely to soften.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2014 Meruge Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft, bland wine, with light fruit flavors, a creamy texture and a final tang of lemon zest. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2014 Terra Grande Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The local Baga grape, better known for producing structured red wines, also lends itself to fruity sparkling rosé. Bright acidity gives this crisp wine its tangy, red currant character. Drink now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Marquês de Marialva Rosé Bruto Baga (Beira Atlantico)

description: This broad, fruity wine brings out ripe berry flavors in spades. It has generous fruit, soft tannins and a smooth, open texture. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is full of red berry flavor and soft tannins. With its forward fruit and smooth texture, it's made to be drunk young, so drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is an attractive, soft blend of Arinto, Viosinho and Antão Vaz. With white fruit flavors and a warm, ripe texture, it's crisp, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2015 White (Alentejano)

description: This wine from the mountain vineyards of eastern Portugal is rich, fruity and made to be drunk young. With soft tannins and juicy red berry fruit, it's open and ripe. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Barão de Figueira Red (Beira Interior)

description: This wine is produced from two of the quintas owned by Ramos-Pinto. It's fruity and crisp, packed with bright fruit and lively acidity, and finishes on tangy citrus with a riper, creamy texture. Drink from late 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2015 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: This wine is produced from two of the quintas owned by Ramos-Pinto. It's fruity and crisp, packed with bright fruit and lively acidity, and finishes on tangy citrus with a riper, creamy texture. Drink from late 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2015 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: The second wine from Duorum, the brand created by João Portugal Ramos and José Soares Franco in 2007, this is ripe with tannin, black fruit and juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Duorum 2015 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)

description: Now golden in color, this intense wine is very fine indeed. Acidity, concentration and wood from the long aging all come together to give a Port that is dry while very rich, with just a hint of orange marmalade flavor. Drink now.
title: Quevedo NV 30 Year Old White  (Port)

description: Now golden in color, this intense wine is very fine indeed. Acidity, concentration and wood from the long aging all come together to give a Port that is dry while very rich, with just a hint of orange marmalade flavor. Drink now.
title: Quevedo NV 30 Year Old White  (Port)

description: This is a dry style of white Port, with an aromatic character that goes through to the palate. The spirit and wine don't taste properly integrated, giving a fiery feel without much fruit. The aftertaste is bitter.
title: Quinta da Maritávora NV White  (Port)

description: This is a dry style of white Port, with an aromatic character that goes through to the palate. The spirit and wine don't taste properly integrated, giving a fiery feel without much fruit. The aftertaste is bitter.
title: Quinta da Maritávora NV White  (Port)

description: An earthy wine that has red berry fruits and acidity alongside a rustic barnyard character. There is a mineral edge to the wine as well, so maybe giving it a year will help.
title: Tiago Teles 2012 Gilda Red (Bairrada)

description: A smoky wine with black currant flavors that bring together spice and fruitiness. The wine has a light touch, licorice and stalky tannins ending with attractive juiciness. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Rich and structured, this is concentrated with tannins as well as generous sweet black fruits. The tannins and the accompanying acidity mean the wine should age. Drink now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta do Portal 2009 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Viognier in Portugal brings out the grape's ripe side along with layers of rich spice. This wine is full, layered with toast and almonds as well as superripe intense fruit. Powerful, complex and dense, the wine is still very young and should be aged. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2013 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

description: Viognier in Portugal brings out the grape's ripe side along with layers of rich spice. This wine is full, layered with toast and almonds as well as superripe intense fruit. Powerful, complex and dense, the wine is still very young and should be aged. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2013 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine with a juicy character that comes as much from the French oak flavors as the fruit. It has weight and richness, with hints of the yellow fruits to come. The wine is ripe, full-bodied and needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Marquesa da Alorna Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This mature wine is beginning to dry out with its dark tannins and leather texture. A complex wine, it's on the point of losing its fruitiness, giving a firm structure along with juicy acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Perescuma 2007 Orquestra Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a bold and ripely fruity wine. Fine tannins and blackberry fruits are already well combined in a big and juicy whole. The wine does have a structure and layers of wood aging that suggest it will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Abreu Callado Reserva  Red (Alentejano)

description: One of the Dão's local grapes, Alfrocheiro gives this ripe, smooth and juicy fruit. The essential mineral tannins of the region are ameliorated by the rich berry flavors and great acidity. This wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Enxertia Alfrocheiro (Dão)

description: Spicy and light at heart, this is a perfumed wine that the winemaker reckons will go with Asian food. Apples, a touch of green herbs and peaches abound in this refreshing, drinkable wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Produced from Touriga Nacional, this fresh wine keeps the acidity of the grape while losing any tough tannins. The result is an attractive, crisp wine, with final strawberry flavors.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Adding Syrah (Shiraz as the producer calls it) to the blend with Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional gives a strongly perfumed character to this firm, still structured wine. It also has a fresh element from the black currant acidity that cuts through the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine is definitely woody, with tough toast over the fruit flavors and mineral texture, yielding a bitter, extracted character that will always feel dry. However, give it until 2016 and the fruit may get a chance to shine.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: A ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc with no barrel aging, this shows apple and apricot flavors along with just a squeeze of lemon acidity. It is rich, softly textured and ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: Light, fruity and off dry, this is a fresh and crisp wine. It has sweetened lemon juice flavors that are cut by intense, young acidity. Balanced and ready to drink now.
designation: Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an off-dry and lightly structured wine that has a crisp, mineral texture. It is bright, with citrus and apple notes that are cut by tangy lemon peel. The finish is tight and direct; drink now.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma White (Vinho Verde)

description: Expanding the Casal Garcia range into the Douro, this light and fruity wine is an easy drink. It has some toast to balance the soft tannins and black currant fruits.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is an intensely perfumed wine, with typical Syrah earthiness and acidity. It is soft, fruity, full of black plum flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Reserva Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Named after the city of Evora, capital of Alentejo and close to the winery, this is a finely made impressive wine. While it is rich, it's ripe, smooth and packed with berry fruits as well as balanced tannins. It is still developing and although it can be drunk soon, it will be better aged for several more years. Ideally, wait until 2018.
title: Cartuxa 2011 Foral de Evora Tinto Colheita Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine that is full of red berries and balanced acidity. It has some tannins, while wood aging has given extra richness. The finish is fresh, bright and juicy. Drink from 2016.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This blend of Chardonnay and Touring Nacional works well, producing a sparkling wine that is fresh and crisp like a sliced apple. There is just a hint of the wood aging, giving it a light toastiness. It is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
