description: The wine is all structure and tannin. It has a severe character with a dense, chewy texture. The wood aging has left a wine that has extracted licorice and black plum-skin flavors amid a dry core. To come around, it will need several years and will still be firmly structured; drink from 2018.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2012 Adega de Pegões Touriga Nacional (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: The wine is all structure and tannin. It has a severe character with a dense, chewy texture. The wood aging has left a wine that has extracted licorice and black plum-skin flavors amid a dry core. To come around, it will need several years and will still be firmly structured; drink from 2018.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2012 Adega de Pegões Touriga Nacional (Península de Setúbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: This is a fragrant, lemon flavored wine, with a fine balance between acidity and rich apple and pear flavors. It's young, although certainly drinkable now, while it will be better from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Douro)

description: This wine is tight and mineral textured. Still young, taut and nervy, orange zest flavors are blended with apple and grapefruit acidity. There is a juicy concentration that develops in the glass and will become more dominant as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Monte Cascas Branco White (Douro)

description: This wine is tight and mineral textured. Still young, taut and nervy, orange zest flavors are blended with apple and grapefruit acidity. There is a juicy concentration that develops in the glass and will become more dominant as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Monte Cascas Branco White (Douro)

description: This wine is soft, fruity, rounded and red fruit flavored. Soft tannins and black plum skins give the wine a light structure. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: Grown in the southern part of the Minho, close to the Douro, this Alvarinho is a ripe while still textured and tangy wine. It has fine, fresh lemon acidity that's rounded out by apricot and pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A blend of the two major grapes of the region, Alvarinho and Loureiro, and grown at the home estate of the producer, this is delicious Vinho Verde. It is dry, crisp, light and piercingly bright, perfect either as an apéritif or with seafood. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2016 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This Port was bottled unfiltered which means there are the right conditions for it to age. It is rich and dense with jammy black fruits and ripe tannins. Dried black plums and dates are backed up by a dry core and by fine acidity. Drink this rich wine now, but it will be much better from 2019.
title: Sandeman 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This Port was bottled unfiltered which means there are the right conditions for it to age. It is rich and dense with jammy black fruits and ripe tannins. Dried black plums and dates are backed up by a dry core and by fine acidity. Drink this rich wine now, but it will be much better from 2019.
title: Sandeman 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: The wine is rich, exuding ripe black fruits as well as dried prune. It balances the fruit with some firm tannins that will allow the wine to age for a few years. For now, it is opulent, finely balanced, and leaves a fine perfumed aftertaste from the Touriga Nacional in the blend.
title: Offley 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Vegetal, green flavors appear on a wine that doesn't balance the fruit and structure. Considering its age, it needs to be drunk now.
title: Além 2006 Red (Alentejano)

description: Light wood aging over six months has given this wine a polished character. Along with the rich black-plum fruits and acidity, it is a full-bodied wine—a very Portuguese blend of five varieties. The tannins keep the wine in shape and add to its ripe structure. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas Red (Lisboa)

description: Aged for two years in wood, this ripe wine is rich and structured. It has the firm tannins and minerality typical of the Dão while also having balanced fruit and acidity. It is firm, although ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Borges 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (Dão)

description: A short wood-aging has given this rich wine a creamy smooth character. That balances with the ripe yellow and tropical fruits that are cut with acidity. It is still a young wine and will certainly be better from 2018.
title: Boas Quintas 2016 Fonte do Ouro Encruzado (Dão)

description: The wine is juicy and rich. Its soft texture comes from fermentation in tanks that recycle CO2 to give a gentle extraction. The result is rounded, smooth, full of black fruits and with plenty of crisp acidity to finish.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2015 Contos da Terra Red (Douro)

description: Grown in high-elevation vineyards at 1,800 feet, this crisp white is a blend of five of the familiar Douro varieties, emphasizing brightness as well as soft fruitiness. Its acidity and white stone-fruit flavors are already well integrated, giving a balanced, lightly mineral wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Sete Vales Branco White (Douro)

description: Grown in high-elevation vineyards at 1,800 feet, this crisp white is a blend of five of the familiar Douro varieties, emphasizing brightness as well as soft fruitiness. Its acidity and white stone-fruit flavors are already well integrated, giving a balanced, lightly mineral wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Sete Vales Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a ripe yellow fruit and mango-flavored wine. It is all fruit, rich and deliciously refreshing. The 10% of Moscatel in the blend has had an enormous effect on the perfumed character of the wine. At the end, the acidity keeps it fruity and crisp.
title: Poças 2016 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A crisp and strongly lemon-flavored wine, this is light and bright with an herbaceous hint and a softer aftertaste that has melon and a rounder texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2013 Vila Jardim Siria (Tejo)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a rounded, apple and pear flavored wine. With a streak of lemon acidity at the end, it has just the right amount of freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Alabastro Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a rounded, apple and pear flavored wine. With a streak of lemon acidity at the end, it has just the right amount of freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Alabastro Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Lively, light and easy on the palate, this is a celebratory sparkling wine. Apples give the fruity element of this medium-dry wine that has a lively prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Meio Seco Sparkling White Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: There is a curious petrol aroma to this wine. It follows through to toast, spice and flavors that only hint at fruit but that do bring out very fresh acidity. The aftertaste is the freshest part of the wine.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2010 Vértice Cuvée Reserva Brut Sparkling (Douro)

description: The wine shows considerable wood aging flavors as well as the sweet toffee and fruit flavors. The wood spice is too dominant and throws the rest of the wine out of balance.
title: Quinta do Portal NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The wine shows considerable wood aging flavors as well as the sweet toffee and fruit flavors. The wood spice is too dominant and throws the rest of the wine out of balance.
title: Quinta do Portal NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Earthy, youthful aromas lead to a wine that's ripe while still finding its fruity character. The potential for the citrus and apricot flavors is there and should develop by mid-2015.
title: Quevedo 2013 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: Apricots and peaches dominate this fresh and lively wine. It is ripe and crisp with a herbal texture. Full of up-front fruit, it can be drunk now, with its lightly perfumed aftertaste.
title: Borges 2013 Quinta da Soalheira Branco White (Douro)

description: A wine that is so soft, its texture only just brushes the palate. White fruits and lemon juice give a gentle, balanced character that is light and quite ready to drink.
designation: Serras de Azeitão Seleção do Enólogo Branco
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Serras de Azeitão Seleção do Enólogo Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: A wine that is so soft, its texture only just brushes the palate. White fruits and lemon juice give a gentle, balanced character that is light and quite ready to drink.
designation: Serras de Azeitão Seleção do Enólogo Branco
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Serras de Azeitão Seleção do Enólogo Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a bright pink-colored wine, with caramel as much as fruit flavors. It has a light touch of acidity that gives the wine a lift at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Herdade dos Templários Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a bright pink-colored wine, with caramel as much as fruit flavors. It has a light touch of acidity that gives the wine a lift at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Herdade dos Templários Rosé (Tejo)

description: A soft and indistinct wine that is fat and has only the merest hint of fruit. It is round with some fresh acidity at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Vale das Donas White (Tejo)

description: A dry wine, firmly tannic, although also with acidity and black currant fruit. Spices and licorice add interest, while the tannins finish this attractive wine.
title: W. & J. Graham's NV Six Grapes Reserve  (Port)

description: An attractively ripe wine, although with its fair share of tannins and stalky fruit. It has a good richness as well as aromatic spice and violets. The final balance is ripe and structured.
title: Vista Alegre NV Reserve Ruby  (Port)

description: Full, rich and fruity wine, enticingly aromatic, with strawberry fruits and an easy, just tannic edge. The wine is soft, ripe, the fruits finely balanced with acidity.
title: Fonseca NV Bin 27 Finest Reserve  (Port)

description: This is an attractive wine, dominated by the typical Baga grape from Bairrada. Its tannins are tamed and rounded out producing rich black fruits and fine balanced acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)

description: Viosinho and Gouveio, two classic Douro white grapes are blended in this ripe wood-aged wine. It has spice as well as rounded fruit, giving the wine a ripe character that is balanced with final citrus acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Viosinho and Gouveio, two classic Douro white grapes are blended in this ripe wood-aged wine. It has spice as well as rounded fruit, giving the wine a ripe character that is balanced with final citrus acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Reserva White (Douro)

description: Vineyards just across the hills from the Douro have produced this ripe wine. It has fine acidity that gives freshness to the apple, peach and ripe pear fruits. The aftertaste is bright, tight with minerality and citrus. Drink now.
title: Casa do Valle 2015 Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe Alvarinho gives a wine that is rich as well as crisp and dry. This wine, with its hints of apricot as well as citrus fruits has a piercing line of acidity along with the tangy texture and ripe aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A powerful and concentrated blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez. Solid blackberry flavors give the wine strength, while tannins and hot pepper bring out bitterness and spice. It's not a wine for the faint-hearted.
title: Herdade da Gâmbia 2011 Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A caramel- and vanilla-flavored wine that has a light fruity character. There are wild strawberry flavors and a soft structure that just gives the wine some texture. Drink now.
title: Rovisco Garcia 2012 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Although this is a soft wine without great definition, it conveys a pleasant, refreshing mix of melon and lime flavors. It's a young wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2012 Verdelho (Lisboa)

description: Almost black in color, this is a big, bold and rich ruby. Dark berry fruits are sustained by a sweet, jammy character. The tannins do give the wine structure, but the rich sweetness dominates. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

description: Almost black in color, this is a big, bold and rich ruby. Dark berry fruits are sustained by a sweet, jammy character. The tannins do give the wine structure, but the rich sweetness dominates. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

description: Light and bright, this is a totally approachable wine, crisp and lemon scented. With a lively texture, it dances out of the glass, a wine to drink now.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2012 Rufo Branco White (Douro)

description: The second vintage of this wine comes from a great Douro year. It gives structure, dark fruits and a serious tannic structure that has been rounded by wood aging. Spice, berries and mint flavors all contribute to this powerful, ageworthy wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Muxagat 2011 Cisne Red (Douro)

description: A wood-aged wine, with the wood flavors well balanced with crisp acidity. Lemon, peach and melon flavors mellifluously combine to give a rounded wine with a tang. It shows a strong mineral-textured aftertaste, a product of the granite soil of the vineyard. Drink this richly flavored wine now.
title: Quinta de Arcossó 2011 Branco Reserva White (Trás-os-Montes)

description: There is a strong barnyard aroma here, although the palate is cleaner and more modern. With rich tannins and a dark plum character, it's ripe and structured. There is a strong mineral element, giving the wine power and density. Drink from 2016.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Red (Douro)

description: An instantly enjoyable, balanced rosé. It's fresh, clean and full of red berry fruits, with a crisp finish. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Quite why Smart Dog is a good name for a wine is a mystery. The wine itself a rich, soft Syrah with attractive ripe blackberry and plum flavors and soft, finely integrated tannins. It's an enjoyable wine that's ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Smart Dog Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This wine is a fine exposition of the structure and density of a serious Douro wine. A field blend, it is packed with dark berry fruits and sweet tannins, with a strong mineral element that reflects the tough schist of the vineyards. It's drinkable now, but the wine will be better in 2016.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 VT '08 Red (Douro)

description: The Reserva version of Mural makes a powerful statement. Dark in color and packed with concentrated fruit, it is full of tannins as well as brooding black-plum flavors. Spice and juicy acidity complete the ensemble. It's a solid wine that needs to age to soften the tannic structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This Syrah-based wine is dense, concentrated and seriously ageworthy. It is weighted by concentrated black fruit, with solid tannic structure and fine acidity on the finish. Drink after 2016.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Incógnito Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Fresh, juicy wine, with soft tannins and taut red cherry fruit. The tannins provide a discreet backbone. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 JP Azeitão Tinto Red (Setubal)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and black plum flavors. It is round, while still having a core of attractive tannins. The fruit dominates, giving a friendly, accessible wine.
title: Alente 2007 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and black plum flavors. It is round, while still having a core of attractive tannins. The fruit dominates, giving a friendly, accessible wine.
title: Alente 2007 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: A particularly clean, fresh and dry rosé, full of currant fruit, a taut, refreshing texture and a final burst of acidity.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2010 Rosé (Lisboa)

description: A blend of six varieties, this is a perfumed wine, with flavors of wood aging to go with the yellow fruits. and a soft, rounded mouthfeel.
title: Quinta das Maias 2010 Branco White (Dão)

description: The second white wine of Poeira, this is all fruit. It has crisp acidity, citrus and green plum flavors along with a brilliant, steely texture. It is much too young to drink with its structure and tight character, so enjoy from late 2016.
title: Poeira 2014 Pó de Poeira White (Douro)

description: This delicious blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura comes from the northern part of the Vinho Verde region. The flavors are ripe yet crisp, with notes of apple and pink grapefruit. The acidity is prominent, yet well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Provam 2014 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: This delicious blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura comes from the northern part of the Vinho Verde region. The flavors are ripe yet crisp, with notes of apple and pink grapefruit. The acidity is prominent, yet well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Provam 2014 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: Straw yellow in color, this now mature wine is made from 100-year old vines, planted in sandy soils above the Tejo (Tagus) river. It has richness, touches of toast and yeast and smooth flavors of vanilla and spice. Yellow fruits and light acidity shine at the end.
title: Casca Wines 2010 Monte Cascas Reserva Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: Still firm in tannins, this has developed into an austere and dark wine. It is serious and solid, with a firm, brooding character and layers of acidity as well as black currant fruits. It is probably ready to drink now.
title: Azamor 2010 Red (Alentejano)

description: From the Vinho Verde subregion of Monção and Melgaço, this intense, bone-dry wine captures the richness of Alvarinho while not losing sight of its fresh lemon and crisp apple side. It has a tight texture that suggests the wine is still young, so drink from late 2016.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2014 Muros Antigos Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: From the Vinho Verde subregion of Monção and Melgaço, this intense, bone-dry wine captures the richness of Alvarinho while not losing sight of its fresh lemon and crisp apple side. It has a tight texture that suggests the wine is still young, so drink from late 2016.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2014 Muros Antigos Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Wood aged for a year, this wine is now rich and smooth. It has the lightest touch of toast to balance the apple fresh acidity and squeezed lemon juice. The wine has a mineral, taut texture that will allow it to age longer. Drink from late 2016.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2013 Palpite Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Wood aged for a year, this wine is now rich and smooth. It has the lightest touch of toast to balance the apple fresh acidity and squeezed lemon juice. The wine has a mineral, taut texture that will allow it to age longer. Drink from late 2016.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2013 Palpite Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Named after a mistress of King João V of Portugal, this beautiful, ripe wine is packed with apricot and juicy mango flavors as well as just the right amount of acidity. It's a rich wine, full in the mouth and generous. The finish has some freshness, although it is the broad flavors that stand out. Drink from 2016.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

description: Named after a mistress of King João V of Portugal, this beautiful, ripe wine is packed with apricot and juicy mango flavors as well as just the right amount of acidity. It's a rich wine, full in the mouth and generous. The finish has some freshness, although it is the broad flavors that stand out. Drink from 2016.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

description: This is, as always, a delicious wine. With intense green and yellow fruits that are both fresh and perfumed, it is ripe and rich. Refreshing acidity is balanced by rounded fruit flavors that carry through to the finish. Drink now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Made from one of the great white grapes of Portugal (perhaps in the world), this rich wine, with its floral character, ripe yellow fruits and touches of wood and toast, is impressive and opulent. It has intense fruit flavors and light acidity to give them freshness. The wine is still young now, so enjoy from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Ribeiro Santo Encruzado (Dão)

description: This is a hard, edgy and tannic wine that has a bitter edge overlaying the fruit. It seems tough, although there are hints of ripe berry fruits that are hiding away. Some softening over the next year will offer integration. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Made to be consumed young, this is fresh and fruity. It has a layer of tannins that support the red berry and plum fruit tones. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity. Drink now.
title: Evel 2012 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, ripe and full-bodied blend that includes Alicante Bouschet to give the dark color. It has structure and juicy blackberry fruits. The tannins, integrated with the fruitiness, are supple and generous. This is a wine to drink soon, from late 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The style of this wine is fruity with blackberry flavors giving a bright and lively character. Black currant acidity joins in the fruitiness while allowing room for some structured tannins. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: The style of this wine is fruity with blackberry flavors giving a bright and lively character. Black currant acidity joins in the fruitiness while allowing room for some structured tannins. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: Towards the western end of the Douro vineyards, Avidagos is a fine place for table wines. This young, ripe and rounded wine is made to be drunk young. It has great black fruits and acidity that are linked by the firm tannin background. The wine will be ready from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2014 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: Towards the western end of the Douro vineyards, Avidagos is a fine place for table wines. This young, ripe and rounded wine is made to be drunk young. It has great black fruits and acidity that are linked by the firm tannin background. The wine will be ready from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2014 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: This is fresh, fruity and with an attractive creamy texture. The crisp apple comes from the high-acid Rabigato grape that's softened by Viosinho and Gouveio. That makes for a balanced, light wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Crasto White (Douro)

description: This is a sweet, soft Port, with plenty of fruit. Sultana and orange jelly flavors are cut with some spirit. The wine leans much more towards fruit than wood, unusual for a 20-year old. The wine, like all aged tawnies, is ready to drink.
title: Messias NV 20 Anos Tawny  (Port)

description: The wine is young, still more structure than fruit. It has firm tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional, it is likely to age for a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2014 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of Síria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of Síria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: A surprisingly fresh wine for an Alvarinho from the hot Alentejo. It shows crisp acidity, with lime and apricot flavors and a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This is a solid mineral and tannin dominated wine. It has black currant fruits which are still buried by the tense tannins and stalky texture. It therefore needs some time to develop and broaden out. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2011 Pomares Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: A full ripe and refreshingly fruity wine, this is full of grapefruit, apricot and ripe pear flavors. It has a touch of spice and a firmly mineral character. Drink now.
title: Campolargo 2013 Vinha do Putto Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This is very dense, with concentrated, dusty tannins and powerful blackberry flavors. It is rich and full of blackberry fruits along with acidity and a beautiful perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2027.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a mature, single-vineyard wine. Beautifully perfumed, it includes, unusually, a small percentage of white grapes (historically a field blend) that soften the tannins of the 90% Baga. The wine is spicy, concentrated, dense with black fruits and tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Vinha das Cardosas Red (Bairrada)

description: Portugal's native Touriga Nacional originally comes from the Dão and this wine shows it in its glory. Planted around an ornate 16th-century palace, the vines have produced a richly structured wine, still showing some signs of wood aging. It is concentrated, with ripe red-cherry and blackberry fruits, solid tannins and acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Casa Anadia 2013 Palácio Anadia Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Portugal's native Touriga Nacional originally comes from the Dão and this wine shows it in its glory. Planted around an ornate 16th-century palace, the vines have produced a richly structured wine, still showing some signs of wood aging. It is concentrated, with ripe red-cherry and blackberry fruits, solid tannins and acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Casa Anadia 2013 Palácio Anadia Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: This ripe blend holds 80% Baga, with the rest Merlot. The Merlot softens the firmer tannins of the Baga, giving the wine its red-fruit character with a juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Bairrada)

description: Made from Castelão grapes, this crisp wine has red fruits that burst out of the glass and give a lively aftertaste, with tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Manzwine 2015 Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This soft, wine is full of ripe black-currant flavors. It is smooth and rounded, with a touch of wood and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Sanguinhal 2013 Casabel Red (Lisboa)

description: This soft, wine is full of ripe black-currant flavors. It is smooth and rounded, with a touch of wood and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Sanguinhal 2013 Casabel Red (Lisboa)

description: The tannins dominate this wine, giving a hard-edged character. It is firm but without the fruit weight to support it.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Strong tannins dominate this wine. It comes from a good vintage, but it is quite extracted. It could soften, although it may remain a tough wine.
title: Quinta do Filoco 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: This softly perfumed wine has red-fruit flavors and plenty of acidity. It is jammy and juicy with succulent red berries. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: This is a typically perfumed Gewürztraminer with the twist of a cool ocean climate. That coolness allows plenty of acidity to come into this dry, fruity wine and adds a floral character. With its crispness, it is bright as well as aromatic. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Gewurztraminer (Lisboa)

description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)

description: This is a wood-fermented wine, spicy and lightly perfumed. The wood aging does dominate the yellow fruits and acidity that still need time. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Viognier (Lisboa)

description: This is a wood-fermented wine, spicy and lightly perfumed. The wood aging does dominate the yellow fruits and acidity that still need time. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Viognier (Lisboa)

description: With light wood-aging flavors, this creamy wine is still young, with tangy orange and lemon zest as well as touches of vanilla. Let it develop further and drink from late 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This soft wine has muted red fruits and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Kopke 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This soft wine has muted red fruits and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Kopke 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: This wine offers very ripe fruit that gives an almost-sweet character to what should be a dry wine. There is acidity that helps. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Quinta Dona Mafalda Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This wine offers very ripe fruit that gives an almost-sweet character to what should be a dry wine. There is acidity that helps. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Quinta Dona Mafalda Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: There is a light prickle to this freshly crisp and dry rosé. It bursts with raspberry and red currant flavors, tangy acidity and a lively finish.
title: Adega de Monção 2011 Muralhas de Monção Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Inspired by the two halves of the Douro (the other being Ribera del Duero in Spain), this Portuguese wine has minty, ripe, velvet textures, smooth and full-bodied. Very polished and classy, with soft acidity, tarry tannins, new wood and plum juice flavors.
title: Sogevinus 2006 D + D Red (Douro)

description: An elegant Port, its fruit and firm tannins blending effortlessly with blackberry jelly and spice flavors. It is halfway between a sweet and dry style, the sweetness coming from prunes, the dryness from firm tannins. This could probably age a few years in the bottle.
title: Poças 2001 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A 10-year-old that tastes older than its indicated age. There is a strong wood-aged feel to it, the toast and vanilla from wood coming through well. It is also on the dry side, giving it spice rather than molasses. The finish is dense, concentrated.
title: Gilberts NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is surprisingly soft and ripe, considering the tannic nature of the grapes. Instead it has fruity black currant flavors and plenty of forward acidity. Ready to drink now, its tannins just form the background.
title: Fiuza 2015 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: This crisply fruity wine is primarily composed of the local Loureiro grape. It is light, bright, dry and full of citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2016 Animus Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a dark- colored, smoothly ripe wine. With wood spice and with plenty of blackberry fruitiness, it's both structured and generous. The acidity it gets from the Touriga Nacional in the blend gives it a crisp aftertaste and the possibility of further aging. Drink now or from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Touriga Nacional-Merlot-Syrah Red (Tejo)

description: Arinto—the signature white grape of Lisboa —makes this crisp wine that's tangy, zesty and alive with citrus fruitiness. It is a delicious white to drink young.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Arinto—the signature white grape of Lisboa —makes this crisp wine that's tangy, zesty and alive with citrus fruitiness. It is a delicious white to drink young.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: A soft and ripe wine with gentle tannins and spicy black currant fruit, this tastes dry and has fine acidity and a juicy aftertaste. The name is a reminder that the vineyards are close to the Atlantic Ocean.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: From 24 different varieties of old vines, this wine is rich, bold and ripe. Without any wood aging, it is solid with tannins and dense structure. There is a juicy background coming from the blackberry and damson fruits. Drink this serious, ageworthy wine from 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Oenólogo Vinhas Velhas Red (Dão)

description: Now deliciously mature, this rich wine is smooth and dense. Produced by the Cálem family, one of the great names of the Douro, the wine is laden with big black fruits and tarry tannins. The wine is very ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Now deliciously mature, this rich wine is smooth and dense. Produced by the Cálem family, one of the great names of the Douro, the wine is laden with big black fruits and tarry tannins. The wine is very ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Reserva Red (Douro)

description: One of the top wines from this producer, this blend of at least 10 grape varieties comes from its estate. The wood aging has added sophistication to this already concentrated wine. With black fruits to the fore and firm tannins, it will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Confidencial Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Delaforce is a long-established brand that first appeared in the US in the 1930s though it came on the European market in 1878. The wine is sweet with that fascinating old wood character of an aged tawny. Toffee, spice and dried fruits give it a wide range of flavors. The wine, ripe and balanced, is ready to drink.
title: Delaforce NV Curious & Ancient 20 Years  (Port)

description: Produced from a field blend of Douro varieties, and foot trodden in open granite fermenters, this is a wine that has an excellent future. It also has such delicious juicy black fruits that it could be drunk soon. Ideally, though, keep this ripe sweet wine until 2026.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Vintage  (Port)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this wood-aged wine is rich and packed with both toast and fruit flavors. Vanilla and apple and citrus acidity are generously pulled together by the mineral texture and ripe structure. The wine will be best from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this wood-aged wine is rich and packed with both toast and fruit flavors. Vanilla and apple and citrus acidity are generously pulled together by the mineral texture and ripe structure. The wine will be best from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: Lemon and freshly squeezed lime give this attractive wine a crisp, bright texture that is rounded out at the end with perfumed flavors from the Moscatel in the blend. This fruity, textured wine needs a few more months before drinking. Drink from late 2015.
title: Duorum 2014 Tons de Duorum White (Douro)

description: This huge, fruity wine is packed with tannins and superripe fruits. It's a big wine in all senses, from its massive structure to its bold red berry flavors. There's a ripe, juicy end to this powerful wine.
title: Campolargo 2011 Valdazar Red (Bairrada)

description: Always an easy, light and fruity wine, this is full of peach and apple flavors. It is lightly textured with tangy orange zest and full of fresh, crisp acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires gives a citrus-flavored wine that is fruity and ready to drink. There's an attractive texture of orange zest as well as pepper and spice.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Casaleiro Reserva White (Tejo)

description: Blackberry jam aromas lead to a fruity wine, soft and juicy. Fresh and rounded, it has balanced acidity and an open, generous character. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2013 Santos da Casa Red (Alentejano)

description: Named for the 14th-century English princess who married the Portuguese king, this is a soft and rounded style of Vinho Verde. It has yellow fruits, melon and pear flavors and a full texture. Drink this food-friendly wine now.
title: Casa de Vila Nova 2013 Filipa de Lencastre White (Vinho Verde)

description: On the dry side, with caramel and strawberry flavors, this is an attractive, bright rosé, as fresh as they come.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2010 Escolha Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, sweet raspberry fruit-flavored wine. It has a line of acidity while its main character is the light, sweet aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Coreto Rosé (Lisboa)

description: A soft Vinho Verde, with white fruit flavors, only light acidity and some final sweetness. An attractive apéritif.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light red wine, with a stalky black currant character. It is very fruity, showing herbs and soft tannins. Almost an apéritif red, certainly one for lightly flavored dishes.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A juicy, fruity wine that is named after the Knights Templar who built a magnificent castle and convent in the local city of Tomar. It is fresh with red berry acidity and some perfumed tannins. It should be ready to drink soon, but wait until the end of 2016 for the best results.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Arinto is the real local grape of the small city of Bucelas where this quinta is located. This fresh wine shows its light mineral and citrus character very well. It also brings out riper fruit flavors that fill it out and give it a rich character. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova Régia Arinto (Lisboa)

description: A fresh-faced wine, bright with berry fruits, a light layer of tannins and a soft, easy texture. There is some stalkiness but this is great as a delicious, easy wine.
title: Cortes de Cima 2009 Chaminé Red (Alentejano)

description: Great nutty aromas come from the glass and follow into the palate of this sweeter style of white Port. It is rich, packed with almonds and a tangy orange zest edge.
title: Ramos-Pinto NV White Reserva  (Port)

description: Great nutty aromas come from the glass and follow into the palate of this sweeter style of white Port. It is rich, packed with almonds and a tangy orange zest edge.
title: Ramos-Pinto NV White Reserva  (Port)

description: This is a smooth, impressively rich wine powered by silky tannins and ripe black fruits. The palate is intensely concentrated with a big, bold structure and a solid feel. It does need some aging, so drink from 2016.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2009 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Ikon refers to Touriga Nacional's position as Portugal's iconic grape. It is almost black in color, and profoundly dense and dry with wood tannins at this early stage of development. Yet it promises a palate that's rich and smooth with fruit in time. It's intended for long-term aging so drink from 2017.
title: Fiuza 2011 Ikon Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: VV refers to the old vines that are at the heart of this impressive wine. It has great concentration both from the richly structured fruit and tannins. New wood comes through richly on this powerhouse of texture and density. Give the wine at least six years to mature.
title: Wine & Soul 2010 Quinta da Manoella VV Red (Douro)

description: This is a strong, firm wine with an initially earthy aroma that fills out with the scent of dark black fruits. The structure of the wine is taut, dark and brooding, offering serious potential for aging. Its bold acidity and young tannins further suggest aging, so drink between 2016–2024. Langdon Shiverick, Comète Wines.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2010 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Made by the winemaking team of Quinta de la Rosa, this powerful and bold wine comes from vineyards up river in Douro Superior. It is full of dark, dense black fruits and concentrated tannins with brisk acidity on the finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2010 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Made by the winemaking team of Quinta de la Rosa, this powerful and bold wine comes from vineyards up river in Douro Superior. It is full of dark, dense black fruits and concentrated tannins with brisk acidity on the finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2010 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This blend of this wine is popular in Alentejo with Syrah now part of the repertoire. The wine is warm, with a ripe character and a sunny feel. Its structure and acidity keep the wine balanced. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe wine from the Real Companhia Velha, this shows a rich character, its tannins ripe and generous. It's not a huge wine, but it does show a fine, full-bodied flavor of sweet plum. The final feeling is smooth and opulent.
title: Royal Oporto 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: Beautifully perfumed, this has ripe blackberry flavors and a relatively dry character. The spirit is now well balanced, giving a backbone to the violet aromas and spicy character of this still-young LBV. It is good to drink now for its fruit, but it will improve and show more complex flavors after 2017–2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2009 RPLBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Beautifully perfumed, this has ripe blackberry flavors and a relatively dry character. The spirit is now well balanced, giving a backbone to the violet aromas and spicy character of this still-young LBV. It is good to drink now for its fruit, but it will improve and show more complex flavors after 2017–2018.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2009 RPLBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Kopke has an impressive quantity of old tawnies, some of which will have ended up in this wine. It certainly seems older than its 20 years with strong wood flavors, smoky toast and beautiful mature acidity. It is very ready to drink, a fine mature tawny.
title: Kopke NV 20-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Kopke has an impressive quantity of old tawnies, some of which will have ended up in this wine. It certainly seems older than its 20 years with strong wood flavors, smoky toast and beautiful mature acidity. It is very ready to drink, a fine mature tawny.
title: Kopke NV 20-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Aromas of strawberry sherbet are followed by sweet candy-shop flavors on the palate. Chill it thoroughly before drinking. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Aromas of strawberry sherbet are followed by sweet candy-shop flavors on the palate. Chill it thoroughly before drinking. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A perfumed wine with wood aging flavors over citrus. From the Vinho Verde region, it's a curious hybrid of a wine, neither crisp enough nor rich enough.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Reserva Branco White (Minho)

description: A perfumed wine with wood aging flavors over citrus. From the Vinho Verde region, it's a curious hybrid of a wine, neither crisp enough nor rich enough.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Reserva Branco White (Minho)

description: A ripe and juicy wine, the wood flavors giving considerable spice character. Acidity and blackberry fruits work into a wine that has an attractive, if rough-at-the-edges, character.
title: Terra d'Alter 2009 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Dark, burly wine, rich with dusty tannins and plump black plum fruits. The texture is soft, Porty in its sweetness, although the acidity retains freshness. With its juicy aftertaste, the wine could age for 1–2 years.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2009 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: An herbal wine, crisp and green with an attractive citrus edge. Some yellow fruits show while it is the acidity and taut mineral character that is dominant.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2010 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: This wood-aged white is richly endowed with yellow and crisp apple fruits. Balanced with the toast and spice, they give a ripe, opulent wine that is ready to drink.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2014 Vertice Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: The perfumes of Touriga Nacional dominate this soft, smooth wine. A layer of tannins gives structure, and the ripeness of the fruit creates a delicious, full-bodied wine.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: Bold and fruity, this wine shows the richness of the black fruits. It has fruit tannins, a lush texture and a dry core. With its density and its ripe fruit, it could age further. Drink from 2018.
designation: Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked Red (Alentejano)

description: Bold and fruity, this wine shows the richness of the black fruits. It has fruit tannins, a lush texture and a dry core. With its density and its ripe fruit, it could age further. Drink from 2018.
designation: Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked Red (Alentejano)

description: This LBV Port is powered by jammy damson and plum fruits along with dried figs and a juicy aftertaste. The palate is dry, with tannins just in evidence, although the balance is just right. Drink now.
title: Delaforce 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: A firm, solidly tannic wine that is balanced easily between tight fruit tannins, elegant plum fruits and taut acidity. The aftertaste is smoky from the wood, but with the fruit always present.
title: Churchill's 2007 Churchill Estates Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: A fresh, juicy wine with berry fruits, ripe but intense tannins and a black cherry flavor. There is a delicious, final burst of acidity.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Porca de Murça Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A broad, welcoming wine, the second label from Malhadinha Nova. It has spiced acidity, flavors of plums, licorice, with cranberry juice tannins. The flavors are big and bold, nothing held back.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2008 Monte da Peceguina Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Spice from wood aging is the initial character of this wine. Then the fruit comes through more strongly to give the wine richness and structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Spice from wood aging is the initial character of this wine. Then the fruit comes through more strongly to give the wine richness and structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Red-berry fruits and soft tannins give a wine with some juicy acidity and spice. The firm aftertaste shows that it is still needs time. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2013 Dona Matilde Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The second wine of Vale Meão, this is rich and fruity. It has enough structure to allow it to develop while also having plenty of red-berry fruits and soft tannins. Give this wine until 2019.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Meandro do Vale Meão Red (Douro)

description: This structured wine has a strong mineral element. With black-currant and berry flavors, it is firm and still young. Swathes of rich fruit are sustained by solid tannins. Drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Red (Dão)

description: Both mineral and herbaceous, this is a crisp, taut and textured wine. It shows a tangy character, lemon zest and bright acidity. It's still too young, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Rede Branco White (Douro)

description: In this blend of Shiraz and Trincadeira, both grapes contribute red fruits, soft tannins and fresh-faced acidity. With no complications—just bright, juicy fruit—the wine is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2013 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: In this blend of Shiraz and Trincadeira, both grapes contribute red fruits, soft tannins and fresh-faced acidity. With no complications—just bright, juicy fruit—the wine is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2013 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This light, bright wine comes from the north of the Vinho Verde region. It has freshly squeezed lemon juice with a touch of lime zest as well as spice. The lightest prickle on the tongue gives the wine a final lift.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2014 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Rustic aromas are followed by rough-edged fruitiness in this young wine. It has ripe berry fruits as well as some firm tannins in the background. It is not yet integrated and needs to develop much more. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Rustic aromas are followed by rough-edged fruitiness in this young wine. It has ripe berry fruits as well as some firm tannins in the background. It is not yet integrated and needs to develop much more. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Moscatel and Arinto, this is light and thin with only the vaguest hint of citrus fruit acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Moscatel and Arinto, this is light and thin with only the vaguest hint of citrus fruit acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita White (Lisboa)

description: The wine is fruity, although with a yeasty character that leaves a bready taste. It has acidity, ripe yellow fruits and the fruitiness may come to dominate although that is not certain.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Branco White (Alentejo)

description: The wine is fruity, although with a yeasty character that leaves a bready taste. It has acidity, ripe yellow fruits and the fruitiness may come to dominate although that is not certain.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Branco White (Alentejo)

description: There is an attractive, light prickle on the tongue of this fresh, crisp and fruity wine. It is dry, tensely tangy with a green, zesty character. Drink now.
title: Wine with Spirit 2014 Seafood & Co White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is fresh with red berry flavors and a stalky tannic core. It's lightly perfumed, light in texture and ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bastardo! Black Edition Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The wine is fresh with red berry flavors and a stalky tannic core. It's lightly perfumed, light in texture and ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bastardo! Black Edition Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)

description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)

description: This is a gentle, ripe wine that has pineapple and peach flavors and fresh fruitiness. It is smooth with balanced acidity and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a rich, full wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. With balanced acidity, only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The Reserve version of this brand, this young wine is ripe and firm, with great potential. The Duas Quintas (two estates) are Ervamoira and Bons Ares, both in the Douro Superior. With attractive smoky flavors and ripe red-berry fruits it will become a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Reserve version of this brand, this young wine is ripe and firm, with great potential. The Duas Quintas (two estates) are Ervamoira and Bons Ares, both in the Douro Superior. With attractive smoky flavors and ripe red-berry fruits it will become a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Produced in the Douro Superior region in the far east of the Douro Valley, this wine is dense with tarry tannins and black fruits. Wood aging and the concentration of old vines make it impressive. Drink now until 2022.
title: Quinta da Zaralhôa 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Produced in the Douro Superior region in the far east of the Douro Valley, this wine is dense with tarry tannins and black fruits. Wood aging and the concentration of old vines make it impressive. Drink now until 2022.
title: Quinta da Zaralhôa 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A blend from two vineyards, this wine is rich and full bodied, with fine tannins and a dark concentration. With its perfumed character and tight structure, it is impressive, full of black fruits with a strong mineral streak. Drink this still-young wine from 2019.
title: Bulas 2010 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine has fine tannins, ripe berry fruits and well-integrated acidity. Rich and juicy, it offers blackberry flavors and a crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine, part of a range of wines from across Portugal, from 2018.
title: Santos & Seixo 2013 Santos da Casa Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: One of the principle grapes of the Alentejo, Antão Vaz blends easily with the Arinto of neighboring Ribatejo. There is an attractive citrus element to this wood-aged wine, soft, open, but remaining fresh, the tropical fruit flavors well under control.
title: Alentex 2006 Antão Vaz-Arinto White (Alentejo)

description: Fresh green-apple aromas and some ripe, mango flavors, this is well rounded, showing some acidity, but more of open, fresh fruits. This is a wine that will be perfect to drink over the next few months.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2006 Monte Alentejano White (Alentejano)

description: An unexpected combination perhaps, but it works to give a fresh, flavorful wine, with soft tannins, juicy fruit and flavors of red cherries and vanilla. Not complex, and ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2004 Tinta Roriz and Merlot Red (Estremadura)

description: An unexpected combination perhaps, but it works to give a fresh, flavorful wine, with soft tannins, juicy fruit and flavors of red cherries and vanilla. Not complex, and ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2004 Tinta Roriz and Merlot Red (Estremadura)

description: The second wine from Malhadinha Nova is lively and fruity, packed with red fruits, sweet strawberry flavors and easy, ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2006 Monte da Peceguina Red (Alentejano)

description: Portugal's popular brand is a lively, fresh, spice- and dried fruit-flavored wine. There are flavors of pound cake and nutmeg surrounding a core of solid, firm tannins. Great with food, this is not for aging.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: An attractive salmon pink-colored wine, very fresh, with bright red currant acidity, fleshed out with some caramel, raspberry and a dash of red apple skins texture.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Casa do Lago Rosé Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: Not many wines come from Bucelas today, as its vineyards get eaten up by the northern Lisbon suburbs. This Arinto-based wine suggests there should be some more of this ultra-crisp white, which bears a passing resemblance to a Vinho Verde in its super-fresh apple and grapefruit flavors.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2007 Prova Régia Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Not many wines come from Bucelas today, as its vineyards get eaten up by the northern Lisbon suburbs. This Arinto-based wine suggests there should be some more of this ultra-crisp white, which bears a passing resemblance to a Vinho Verde in its super-fresh apple and grapefruit flavors.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2007 Prova Régia Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This fruity, jammy and ripe wine is full of black-plum flavors. It has solid tannins and a dense structure along with layers of wood aging and fruitier acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Sanguinhal 2010 Aragonez (Lisboa)

description: This fruity, jammy and ripe wine is full of black-plum flavors. It has solid tannins and a dense structure along with layers of wood aging and fruitier acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Sanguinhal 2010 Aragonez (Lisboa)

description: Named after a local volcanic rock formation, this wine is a delicious blend of Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) and Touriga Nacional. It is rich and smooth with black fruits, soft tannins and an aftertaste that is lively with acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Manzwine 2014 Penedo do Lexim Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine with wood and bright red fruits in equal balance. The entry-level wine made by a grouping of 19 growers, it has concentration along with minerality and acidity. It needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2014 Très Bagos Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This mature wine, has lost youthful fruitiness and gained a more nutty, smooth and rich quality. There are touches of toastiness and almonds, with an aromatic aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2013 Quinta da Murta Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Light and bright, this has a crisp prickle on the tongue, along with canned grapefruit and tight apple-skin flavors. It is almost dry, which gives the wine a mineral texture that adds a bite. Drink now.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2013 QM Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: The pink hue is a little flat. That also applies to the palate, with the fruit showing some maturity and hinting at wood aging. It's a rounded style, full in the mouth, with ripe caramel flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Poças NV Poças Pink  (Port)

description: Soft and ripe, this has strawberry fruit flavors, a soft texture and a warm, rich feel. There is just enough acidity to balance this really food-friendly rosé.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Olho de Mocho Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Made principally from Touriga Nacional, this is a rich wine with attractive acidity and strawberry fruitiness. It is ripe, touched with caramel and finished with wild raspberry flavors.
title: Quinta de Covela 2013 Covela Rosé (Minho)

description: Yellow fruits and apple juice combine in this fresh, mineral-driven wine. It's tangy, tight with acidity while allowing room for pineapple and tropical flavors at the end. It's ready to drink but will be better in 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: Yellow fruits and apple juice combine in this fresh, mineral-driven wine. It's tangy, tight with acidity while allowing room for pineapple and tropical flavors at the end. It's ready to drink but will be better in 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

description: The fresh acidity typical of Fernão Pires is broadened by wood aging to yield a wine that has peach, apricot and green-fruit flavors, enhanced by floral aromas. There is a final, mineral texture.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2011 Falcoaria Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This is a lively, off-dry wine with intense acidity to accompany its crisp apple and citrus flavors. Very fruity, it's ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Trevo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightweight, with smooth red fruit and acidity, this is soft and round. The berry fruit neatly merges with the gentle tannins.
title: Caves Aliança 2009 Vista Tinta Roriz (Beiras)

description: Light and stalky, this has black currant fruit and considerable acidity. With its soft tannins and fruity character, it is ready to drink now.
title: Aveleda 2011 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Light and stalky, this has black currant fruit and considerable acidity. With its soft tannins and fruity character, it is ready to drink now.
title: Aveleda 2011 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Soft, round and gentle, this has a creamed apple flavor. It has a full, ripe character, with just an edge of green herb and spice.
title: Monte Seis Reis 2010 Boa Memória Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft, round and gentle, this has a creamed apple flavor. It has a full, ripe character, with just an edge of green herb and spice.
title: Monte Seis Reis 2010 Boa Memória Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a fresh and fragrant rosé from the Vinho Verde region. It has light acidity and a red fruit flavor. The lightest prickle gives just that extra lift.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Espadeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a fresh and fragrant rosé from the Vinho Verde region. It has light acidity and a red fruit flavor. The lightest prickle gives just that extra lift.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Espadeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This feels very ripe, perhaps overripe, with its seemingly sweet flavor of black fruit juice and its soft structure. It's appealing and does have some tannins, but it is not for aging.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2009 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: A wine that starts out all tannins. The fruit takes a while to show through and then produces juicy red cherry flavors and considerable acidity, the wood aging rounding the corners. This is for medium-term aging.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do Grifo Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The aroma shines with Syrah perfumes, while the palate brings together great ripe perfumed and spiced fruit, smooth, rich and dense. There is just an earthy element that needs to soften over the next two years.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2009 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: A wild, herbal, wood-aged wine, its acidity a fine foil to the richly perfumed fruit. Pears and sweet melon come together with the toast of the wood. At this stage, the wood dominates and needs a year to soften—then the result will be impressively food-friendly.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2009 Branco Cerceal (Beiras)

description: Although known in the Douro as an increasingly essential component of Port and table wines, the Touriga Nacional is equally at home in the Dão. As here, it produces linear wines, very mineral, full of acidity with a perfumed elegance. This is a wine for aging over 4–5 years.
title: Borges 2009 Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: This ripe, full-bodied rosé is made from 100% rich, perfumed Touriga Nacional. Good balance between ripe strawberry fruits and the crisp acidity make it both fruity and warm. Drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2016 Vale da Poupa Rosé (Douro)

description: From vines grown in the upper Douro Superior, this is crisp while also having ripe apple and apricot fruitiness. It is a lively wine, tangy with orange zest and a touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Castello d'Alba Branco White (Douro)

description: This simple, open and fruity wine has gentle tannins. It is all about ripe berries and acidity. Made to be drunk young for its fruitiness, it is ready now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Colheita Red (Beira Interior)

description: This full-bodied wine conveys Douro warmth. A light touch of tannin gives it shape. Pepper and red-berry fruits complete a generous wine that will be best with food. Drink now.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Rosé (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This full-bodied wine conveys Douro warmth. A light touch of tannin gives it shape. Pepper and red-berry fruits complete a generous wine that will be best with food. Drink now.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Rosé (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This wine is light in body but heavily perfumed. Clean fruit shows on the palate, with an addition of geranium aromas.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from vineyards outside the boundaries of the Dão region but has the same typical blend. It shows minerality as well as rich fruit and soft tannins. The wine is balanced, stylish and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 D. Fuas Reserva Red (Terras do Dão)

description: This densely tannic wine is bold and linear, with concentrated chocolate and spice flavors. Rich black fruits are layered with acidity and a tight, mineral texture. Still firm, the wine is not likely to soften more, so drink now.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Smooth red-berry fruits give this wine a glow of ripeness. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet is dense and full of dark berries, with a touch of wood aging to smooth everything out. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Fortissimo Red (Alentejano)

description: This is the lightest in a series of wines featuring the Avesso grape. Herbal, crisp and with plenty of acidity, it's also fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso & Azal White (Vinho Verde)

description: Crisp. dry and fruity, this wine has a light touch of citrus and fresh acidity. Fruity with a slight sparkle, it's an ideal apéritif.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is ripe with red fruits and soft tannins. It is smooth, packed with red-berry flavors lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: The tannins are firm, still controlling the black fruits in this wine. It is concentrated, with considerable extraction giving a dry wine with a hard edge. The red-berry flavors are lost.
title: Quinta da Padrela 2013 Premium Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, smooth, just veering toward rustic, but also showing a fine balance of tannins and sweet fruit. It is certainly rich, while the spicy character, with the dried fruits, is generous. The acidity is understated.
title: Cortes de Cima 2005 Aragonez Aragonês (Alentejano)

description: A fine, crisp wine, with delicious green apple flavors and a tang of lime, a touch of yeast, and a dry, fresh aftertaste. There's a delicious bite to this fragrant wine.
title: Quinta de Serrade 2006 Solar de Serrade Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after local nobility in the city of Borba, this is a popular brand in Portugal. In its white manifestation, the wine is soft, very clean, with pear and cinnamon flavors, the texture just moving toward fat, but working well as a food wine.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 Marquês de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Still young, it is full of spice from wood aging along with juicy black fruits. It is soft, dominated by black currant and acidity. Not for aging, it will be ready by the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Still young, it is full of spice from wood aging along with juicy black fruits. It is soft, dominated by black currant and acidity. Not for aging, it will be ready by the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Very Douro in its mineral texture and dry core, it also has a surround of ripe black fruits. It's concentrated and has some aging potential, although it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Very Douro in its mineral texture and dry core, it also has a surround of ripe black fruits. It's concentrated and has some aging potential, although it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: This attractive blend of Chardonnay, Arinto and Vital is fresh, fruity, packed with apple and lemon flavors and totally ready to drink. There's a great line in acidity, a crisp texture and a green, lively aftertaste.
title: Fiuza 2013 3 Castas White (Tejo)

description: Made from Castelão, the local grape of the Setúbal region, this wine is as bright and clean as possible. The light texture makes it ideal for summer drinking.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Made from Castelão, the local grape of the Setúbal region, this wine is as bright and clean as possible. The light texture makes it ideal for summer drinking.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This wine looks and tastes bright pink. It is creamy, not quite dry and soft, although the aftertaste shows some fresh acidity. Crushed strawberry flavors suggest that it will pair well with fruit salad.
title: Wine with Spirit NV Basta Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: A rich wine, full of dark plums, big and dusty tannins and a powerful core of dryness. The wood aging has brought out mint as well as spice, smoothing the rough edges to give an impressive and elegant finish. Keep for 4–5 years.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2007 Vinhas Velhas de Santa Maria Baga (Beiras)

description: A rich wine, full of dark plums, big and dusty tannins and a powerful core of dryness. The wood aging has brought out mint as well as spice, smoothing the rough edges to give an impressive and elegant finish. Keep for 4–5 years.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2007 Vinhas Velhas de Santa Maria Baga (Beiras)

description: Pitch-black wine, very dense. It is spicy with concentrated black fruits, layered with equally intense acidity. Wood, fruit and sweet berries are all there. Tannins surround this firm wine, promising aging over 5–6 years.
title: Castro Pena Alba 2007 Picos de Couto Grande Escolha Red (Dão)

description: Pitch-black wine, very dense. It is spicy with concentrated black fruits, layered with equally intense acidity. Wood, fruit and sweet berries are all there. Tannins surround this firm wine, promising aging over 5–6 years.
title: Castro Pena Alba 2007 Picos de Couto Grande Escolha Red (Dão)

description: Grassy, green aromas give this a herbal, crisp taste. It is tight and tangy, with green fruit aromas and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Espaço Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Branco White (Alentejano)

description: While more herbal in character, this wine also carries grapefruit, lemon and quince flavors. It is fresh with a steely mineral character that adds some interest. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta de Cidrô Sauvignon Blanc (Duriense)

description: A blend of Arinto and Tamarez, this wine is light and fruity, with attractive acidity and flavors of apricots sprayed with lemons. It has a light texture and a fresh, lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: It seems perverse to plant Gewürztraminer in the Douro and this wine is as much a curiosity as it is attractively perfumed. Showing all the hallmarks of the grape, the palate carries flavors of lychee and rosewater, although it all seems muted. The acidity does give a final lift.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Gewurztraminer (Duriense)

description: The local grape Castelão is blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in this soft, spicy and fruity wine. Red fruits and balanced acidity are given a shove by a lightly tannic structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The local grape Castelão is blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in this soft, spicy and fruity wine. Red fruits and balanced acidity are given a shove by a lightly tannic structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A soft, lightly sweet style of rosé, flavored with strawberries and a touch of caramel. Fresh, and flavorful, with balancing acidity, this is a good apéritif wine.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 Touriga Nacional (Ribatejano)

description: A soft, lightly sweet style of rosé, flavored with strawberries and a touch of caramel. Fresh, and flavorful, with balancing acidity, this is a good apéritif wine.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 Touriga Nacional (Ribatejano)

description: A firm wine, with dark chocolate and coffee flavors. The fruit flavors are  dark fig and stewed plums; there is a bitter edge to the tannins.
title: Quinta do Grifo 2004 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Rounded but also fruity, this soft wine is perfumed, hinting at white flowers and tropical fruits. While the acidity is low, the fruit is easy, ripe and lightly structured.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: Rounded but also fruity, this soft wine is perfumed, hinting at white flowers and tropical fruits. While the acidity is low, the fruit is easy, ripe and lightly structured.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: This wine is smooth and soft, with an attractive creamy texture and light acidity. Yellow fruits and stewed pears are lifted by a mineral texture. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of “scantily dressed.” Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is light in tannins and ripe in fruit, with a delicious red-berry character. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Lote 138 Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has a cool, flavorful character topped off by berry fruits. It's ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)

description: Mula Velha, “the old donkey,” is a younger wine than its name suggests. Brisk and fruity, it offers firm tannins and layers of blackberry fruit. With a touch of oak aging, the wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Lisboa, with its cool climate, lends itself to crisp rosés like this. This lively fruity wine is touched by hints of vanilla and layers of red-fruit flavors. It is light and ready to drink.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Lisboa, with its cool climate, lends itself to crisp rosés like this. This lively fruity wine is touched by hints of vanilla and layers of red-fruit flavors. It is light and ready to drink.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Tinta Miúda, known as the rare Graciano grape in Spain, is not often found in Portugal. Here it makes a ripe, juicy and jammy wine that's soft, with only a minimum of tannins to keep it together. It has a typically warm character and is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Tinta Miúda Red (Tejo)

description: Tinta Miúda, known as the rare Graciano grape in Spain, is not often found in Portugal. Here it makes a ripe, juicy and jammy wine that's soft, with only a minimum of tannins to keep it together. It has a typically warm character and is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Tinta Miúda Red (Tejo)

description: There are firm and dusty tannins in this spicy wine. It has firm fruit, a solid texture and a juicy, nutmeg-flavored aftertaste. Drink from 2018 when some of the tannins have softened.
title: Enoport 2014 Topázio Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Structured and with solid tannins, this is a wood- and spice-laden wine. Its fruit lies somewhere behind all this structure and is likely to remain there.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)
