description: Structured and with solid tannins, this is a wood- and spice-laden wine. Its fruit lies somewhere behind all this structure and is likely to remain there.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Young and fruity, this is a bright and wine for immediate drinking. It has hints of tannins, plenty of red fruits and no wood.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the poppy that blooms in May in the Alentejo, this wine is juicy and fruity, with a light touch of tannins. It is all red berries, with an easygoing juicy character, Drink now.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Flor de Maio Mayflower Red (Alentejano)

description: The very local Tamarez grapes make an appearance in this lemon-colored and flavored wine. It is fruity, soft and bright with acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Crisp, bright and fruity, this is a refreshing and ripe wine. With attractive citrus acidity and a bright aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Adega de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A light, crisp blend of Merlot and Syrah, this is soft and gently fruity. Raspberry and red-currant flavors shine easily through this simple wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a soft wine with its creamy fruits assimilated into the tangy texture. There is plenty of acidity to give this wine its cool character as well as its citrus and green-apple flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a soft wine with its creamy fruits assimilated into the tangy texture. There is plenty of acidity to give this wine its cool character as well as its citrus and green-apple flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)

description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)

description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is a classic for the region. It gives a light and perfumed wine with a creamy texture and plenty of balancing acidity. Bright and fruity, the wine has just a final tang to add crispness. Drink now.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This simple and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. And with its red fruits, light acidity and crisp texture, it succeeds. Drink the wine with summer barbecues.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a delicious and ripe-fruited wine. Dominated by Fernão Pires, it has an apple-puree texture: smooth and creamy. The wine has an edge of light acidity at the end to give it a lift. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a delicious and ripe-fruited wine. Dominated by Fernão Pires, it has an apple-puree texture: smooth and creamy. The wine has an edge of light acidity at the end to give it a lift. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a crisp, clean and refreshing wine. There is just the lightest sense of tannin giving the wine a zingy edge. Other than that, it is red-berry fruits all the way. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a crisp, clean and refreshing wine. There is just the lightest sense of tannin giving the wine a zingy edge. Other than that, it is red-berry fruits all the way. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a really refreshing style of rosé. Its fruity raspberry and red-currant flavors are shot through with fine acidity and a lively crisp aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Rosé (Alentejano)

description: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: From the historic Herdade do Mouchão in northern Alentejo, this is a powerful wine, full of dense tannins and impressively ripe, juicy black fruits. Syrah and Alicante Bouschet bring southern richness to Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink this wine now.
title: Mouchão 2012 Ponte das Canas Red (Alentejo)

description: This deeply impressive blend of 20 different varieties comes from a vineyard at the top of the Gaivosa estate that was oddly ignored for many years. With black plum fruit, dense tannins and intense acidity, it's built for longterm aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Alves de Sousa 2013 Abandonado Red (Douro)

description: The balance between wood aging and fruit is at its best in this wine. It shows plenty of red fruits filled out with raisins and nutmeg. As a contrast the wood aging has brought out a spicy, almond character. It is fresh, on the dry side for an aged tawny and, of course, ready to drink.
title: Quinta dos Murças NV 10 Anos Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The dark color and high acidity of this wine are both typical of the Sousão grape which is normally found only in Douro blends. It is ripe, fruity and juicy although with tight acidity and black currant fruits. The wine's tannins suggest it needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Sousão (Douro)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that has a dry tanninc core. That gives a mineral texture to the otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Full of black currant fruit flavors, shot through with acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This LBV from the Bulas family vineyards, downriver from Pinhão is all ready to drink. It is fruity with just the right amount of structure. Fresh berry fruits are lifted by fine acidity and well integrated into the smooth, just tannic structure. Drink now.
title: Bulas 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Ripe, fruity wine with quince and pineapple flavors, layered through with apple skin tannins. It could do with six months aging, but it will certainly be ready to drink by the fall.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2007 Cister da Ribeira White (Douro)

description: This blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura is initially crisp and fresh. Gradually, it broadens out into a rich wine with a blend between lemon and yellow fruits that is delicious and concentrated. This tangy wine is developing well, and is ready to drink now although it will age.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2014 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A just off-dry Vinho Verde, fresh and spritzy. Acidity, sweet apples and a breezy citrus edge combine easily and lightly. Ready to drink.
title: Aveleda 2010 Praia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This producer specializes in seeking out parcels of old vines. In this case, the vines, planted at high density, have unusually crooked trunks. The wine itself, richly tannic and dense, has new wood flavors, ripe black-plum fruits and a dark firm character. It is still young and will develop into an impressively rich wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Crooked Vines Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This producer specializes in seeking out parcels of old vines. In this case, the vines, planted at high density, have unusually crooked trunks. The wine itself, richly tannic and dense, has new wood flavors, ripe black-plum fruits and a dark firm character. It is still young and will develop into an impressively rich wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Crooked Vines Colheita Red (Douro)

description: The Reserva version of the popular Borba brand in Portugal is a dense, powerfully tannic wine. Its juicy black currant and blackberry fruits are suffused with tannins—its dry core surrounded by richness. Hints of dark chocolate and pepper come from the alcohol but certainly don't take away from the great fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Marquês de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This estate whose name means four winds is in the Douro Superior, the easternmost part of the Douro region. It is intensely rich and solid—a classic blend for the region with a dominance of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, aged in wood and with plenty more aging ability. This black-fruit-flavored wine will be best from 2020.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2014 Quinta dos Quatros Ventos Red (Douro)

description: Old vines, many up to 80-years-old, supply the grapes that were fermented in traditional granite lagars for a ripe jammy character in this powerful wine. It has solid tannins and great acidity, both of which will allow the wine to age. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta da Foz 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Old vines, many up to 80-years-old, supply the grapes that were fermented in traditional granite lagars for a ripe jammy character in this powerful wine. It has solid tannins and great acidity, both of which will allow the wine to age. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta da Foz 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez go into the blend of this rich juicy wine. It is so soft and ripe, just hinting at tannins and with red-berry fruit. The wine is round and smooth, ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: A rich full wine that has swathes of black fruits. It has a dry core around which there are generous fruits and the right amount of acidity. Perfumed, ripe and concentrated, this is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2012 Herdade dos Machados Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A rich full wine that has swathes of black fruits. It has a dry core around which there are generous fruits and the right amount of acidity. Perfumed, ripe and concentrated, this is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2012 Herdade dos Machados Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Made from old vines, this rich rosé is full of fruit. It has fine acidity as well as wild-strawberry flavors. The texture, lightly mineral, gives the wine a crisp, tight shape. With a fresh aftertaste, the wine will be just right for food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Rosé (Douro)

description: Made from old vines, this rich rosé is full of fruit. It has fine acidity as well as wild-strawberry flavors. The texture, lightly mineral, gives the wine a crisp, tight shape. With a fresh aftertaste, the wine will be just right for food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Rosé (Douro)

description: Ripe, fruity and balanced, this has the potential to be a delicious, not-too-concentrated wine. Acidity and some dry tannins give the wine a firm character that is balanced by the fragrant berry fruits. Drink from 2026.
title: Churchill's 2015 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)

description: Full of ripe fruit, this wine is rich while also having a delicately perfumed character. With its spice, generous fruits and sense of poise, it will age well. Drink from 2027.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a major Douro wine from the Poças family-owned Port and wine producer. Dusty tannins already give it class as well as richness. Packed with black-plum fruits and with good concentration, the wine is still maturing. It needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Poças 2014 Símbolo Red (Douro)

description: This is a major Douro wine from the Poças family-owned Port and wine producer. Dusty tannins already give it class as well as richness. Packed with black-plum fruits and with good concentration, the wine is still maturing. It needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Poças 2014 Símbolo Red (Douro)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is already delicious, but that doesn't detract from the firm tannins and density of a wine that will age well. It has all the elements, with the fruit, solid tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2025.
title: Sandeman 2015 Quinta do Seixo Vintage  (Port)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is already delicious, but that doesn't detract from the firm tannins and density of a wine that will age well. It has all the elements, with the fruit, solid tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2025.
title: Sandeman 2015 Quinta do Seixo Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a sweet, rich Port. Its aromas are of soft berry jelly, with a ripe herbal character. To taste, it is concentrated, but the sweetness of the fruit masks its density. Berry and dried fruits make an attractive blend, leaving a firmer structure in the aftertaste.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2004 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: It is the 30% Alicante Bouschet in the blend that gives the dense color to this ripe wine. Concentrate and rich, the generous berry flavors are balanced by a more restrained acidity and smoky flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2014 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Just lightly touched by wood this is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink. Spice and red-berry fruits dominate, lifted by balanced tannins. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Evel Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is crisp and fresh medium-sweet wine. It is bright with red-currant acidity and ripe with a strawberry and cream flavor. The wine is clean, lively and, of course, ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Rosé Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)

description: A fresh lemon-flavored wine with crisp acidity balanced by warmer white-stone fruit. It is fruity, showing a touch of toast and almonds. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Bruto Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: A wood-aged white, spicy and ripe. It has just the right balance of acidity to go with the ripe green plum and melon fruits. With a great bite of acidity to finish, this is a wine that will age for 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Aromas of fresh-cut hay lead to a wine that has considerable concentration and good balance from wood aging. Very citrus with pineapple touches, it finishes with an herbaceous feel. The wine comes from a vineyard planted at the end of the 19th century.
title: Maritávora 2009 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: The latest release from the partnership between the Roquette family of Quinta do Crasto in the Douro and the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages in Bordeaux. The wine brings out considerable minerality, a herbal edge along with forward black currant fruit. It is austerely structured at this stage and needs aging for several years.
title: Roquette e Cazes 2007 Red (Douro)

description: Sousão gives intense color and that, along with its attractive perfume, makes a dense, intensely fruity wine. It is rich and weighty, the tannins well integrated with a ripe, juicy aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2009 Sousão (Douro)

description: A ripe and structured wine, this has bold black fruits and balanced tannins that still need to soften. It has good potential with rich fruits and a tight mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Sobredos 2012 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A ripe and structured wine, this has bold black fruits and balanced tannins that still need to soften. It has good potential with rich fruits and a tight mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Sobredos 2012 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This mature wine has a soft, smooth character and ripe fruit. With its red-berry flavors and gentle tannins, it's very ready to drink. The blend is dominated by Touriga Nacional from an estate at the heart of the Douro vineyards in Pinhão.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 VT '08 Red (Douro)

description: Powerful and concentrated, this is just at its peak. Ripe, rich fruit and tarry tannins give it freshness and a dry core. It's solid and serious, a dense wine that calls for equally rich food. Drink it now while it's at its prime.
title: Monte da Penha 2005 Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: The grape is local to the Vidigueira region of the southern Alentejo. Coming from cool vineyards, the wine has a fresh character that is balanced by the ripe melon and juicy pear fruits. It has a crisper end and is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)

description: This raspberry-flavored wine is soft and ripe. While it is fruity, it also has a nutty character that gives it a rich taste. It's dry and in a style that will make it better with food than by itself.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: The wine is ripe with apple and creamed pear flavors. It is warm, rich and missing acidity. There is an attractive almond and spice character to this ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is ripe with apple and creamed pear flavors. It is warm, rich and missing acidity. There is an attractive almond and spice character to this ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A rose pink colored wine that is dry and with ripe fruit. Its acidity contrasts with the warm red-berry fruit and the edge of tannin. There is a peppery, crisp aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Paços 2015 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: In a medium sweet style, the wine has a light prickle and fine citrus acidity to balance the soft freshness. It is a refreshing wine, totally drinkable immediately.
title: Messias 2015 Santola White (Vinho Verde)

description: In a medium sweet style, the wine has a light prickle and fine citrus acidity to balance the soft freshness. It is a refreshing wine, totally drinkable immediately.
title: Messias 2015 Santola White (Vinho Verde)

description: Onion skin orange in color, this is a full and fat wine. It has attractive red-berry fruit and just the right amount of acidity to keep it fresh and crisp. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Onion skin orange in color, this is a full and fat wine. It has attractive red-berry fruit and just the right amount of acidity to keep it fresh and crisp. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Heading nicely in the crisp and aromatic direction, this is a light and bright wine. It has a citrus flavor that is balanced by richer pear and plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Chardonnay-Fernão Pires-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: Heading nicely in the crisp and aromatic direction, this is a light and bright wine. It has a citrus flavor that is balanced by richer pear and plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Chardonnay-Fernão Pires-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: This is an impressive, powerful wine. It speaks of the hard landscape of the Douro Superior, with its structure and dark tannins. At the same time, ripe dark fruits push through the still-young tannins giving the potential for a rich, black fruit dominated wine. Predominantly Touriga Nacional (60 percent), this wine is a new venture created by João Nicolau d'Almeida (who has run Ramos-Pinto for many years) and his family. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte Xisto 2013 Red (Douro)

description: This is an impressive, powerful wine. It speaks of the hard landscape of the Douro Superior, with its structure and dark tannins. At the same time, ripe dark fruits push through the still-young tannins giving the potential for a rich, black fruit dominated wine. Predominantly Touriga Nacional (60 percent), this wine is a new venture created by João Nicolau d'Almeida (who has run Ramos-Pinto for many years) and his family. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte Xisto 2013 Red (Douro)

description: As its name suggests this is a selection of barrels of Syrah and Touriga Nacional. It is rich, smooth and full of ripe fruit. The dusty tannins are in suspension, backing up the black plum and blueberry fruit flavors. Along with the juicy acidity, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: As its name suggests this is a selection of barrels of Syrah and Touriga Nacional. It is rich, smooth and full of ripe fruit. The dusty tannins are in suspension, backing up the black plum and blueberry fruit flavors. Along with the juicy acidity, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a new wine from the hands of master winemaker Luis Duarte. With its rich black fruits and dense tannins, it's also a wine that is firmly structured. Wood aging has added a layer of complexity and broadened out the fruits and dark tannins. Drink from 2017.
designation: Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Luis Duarte 2013 Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a new wine from the hands of master winemaker Luis Duarte. With its rich black fruits and dense tannins, it's also a wine that is firmly structured. Wood aging has added a layer of complexity and broadened out the fruits and dark tannins. Drink from 2017.
designation: Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Luis Duarte 2013 Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue, this is as fresh as possible. It's clean, packed with green and citrus fruits, and boosted with some textured richness. Drink at once.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2012 Paço de São Lourenço White (Vinho Verde)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue, this is as fresh as possible. It's clean, packed with green and citrus fruits, and boosted with some textured richness. Drink at once.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2012 Paço de São Lourenço White (Vinho Verde)

description: Verdelho and Sauvignon Blanc hangs together easily on this herb-dominant wine. The texture has a creamy character, showing green fruits, lively acidity and a bright orange-zest aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Verdelho and Sauvignon Blanc White (Douro)

description: A powerful wine, richly structured and full of ripe fruits. It has a solid feel to it, firmly anchored to its dark tannins as well as lightened by the juicy berry flavors. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, it needs serious aging, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Herdade Grande 2010 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Wood aging gives this ripe blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional its richness and density. It's full of black fruit, toast and a touch of pepper. With ripe tannins and crisp acidity, it can easily age another year. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2013 Red (Beira Atlantico)

description: A year in wood and 30 months in bottle before release have allowed this attractive wine to fully develop its solid yet smooth texture. It has concentration, layers of bright black currant fruit and vibrant acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Montes Claros Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: A year in wood and 30 months in bottle before release have allowed this attractive wine to fully develop its solid yet smooth texture. It has concentration, layers of bright black currant fruit and vibrant acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Montes Claros Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: From an estate in the south of the Alentejo, this is a rich, hot-country wine. It is firm, densely structured and with solid, dark tannins. There is a juicy black fruit background to this dense wine that gives a lift. Still young, this dark and very concentrated wine will be better from 2018.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: From an estate in the south of the Alentejo, this is a rich, hot-country wine. It is firm, densely structured and with solid, dark tannins. There is a juicy black fruit background to this dense wine that gives a lift. Still young, this dark and very concentrated wine will be better from 2018.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This bottling shows a rich, wood-aged wine, full of ripe yellow and tropical fruits as well as rich toasty flavors. The wine is warm, rounded, spicy and with its impressive structure still developing, it has the potential to age well. The wine is named to celebrate the second Lança generation in charge at the estate. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Grown on the sandy soil of Tejo, the wine is typically soft and open. It is very accessible—with black fruits and light tannins for this grape. It is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Bridão Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This is ripe and fruity, a wine that is smooth while still structured. Firm tannins are filled out with juicy red berry fruits and freshened with acidity. It's  already drinkable, although it will certainly be better from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2011 Avidagos Red (Douro)
